title: Worst hotel in the world.
text:
WORST HOTEL IN THE WORLD! 
If I could give less than 1 star I would have given -100.
The worst hotel I stayed in. Very rude staff, very bad service, disgusting rooms, and thiefs. I stayed in this hotel because it was the closest to where I had work, but it was my worst experience.
My rooms was smelling weed and cigarettes, and I don’t smoke. When I complained about the smell they wanted to charge me with smoking fees . Ironic. And the staff member who spoke to me was the most disrespectful person I’ve seen in my life.

title: Great property in downtown NYC
text: This is a great location in downtown NYC. Close to multiple subway lines and a few blocks from the 9/11 memorial. Lashanda provided wonderful experience upon check in. She has such a lovely, bright personality I felt instantly at ease and welcomed upon arrival when greeted by her at the front desk.

title: Huge disappointment
text: The swimming pool is CLOSED. And not going to be reopened. I picked this hotel for the swimming pool as I am here for a week. And even though I have paid for my room I had to pay a further $600 deposit for the facility fee. The lift is very scary and hall are from a horror movie but to be fair even though the furniture is a little dated the room is clean and I have a great view of 9/11 and the Oculus.

title: Great Customer Service
text: I stay here each time I can when visiting NYC for work,  The hotel is in a great location and the staff are very professional.  The Executive Lounge is worth coming for!  The food they put out for breakfast and dinner is amazing.  I don't need dinner after eating in the lounge.  The two women staffing the Exec Lounge are amazing.  They are so friendly and ask if they can help in any way.  I have never had anyone staffing an Exec Lounge be so friendly!  Would definitely recommend staying here!

title: Rude staff & hidden fee
text: Booked my reservation through my employers online booking agency.  There was no reference to the bogus “destination charge” while booking.  Checked-in and was told about the $75 fee for the first time.  I kindly explained that I will not be using any of the services like the bike they provide for use in downtown Manhattan.  Instead of accommodating me, the front desk was extremely rude and essentially told me I was dumb.  I have status with Marriott and frequently pay the destination fee, especially when I’m traveling for personal reasons and when I know in advance there is a fee associated with the stay.  This place really rubbed me the wrong way.  Rude staff at the front desk.

title: Functional
text:
A large room in a location convenient for walking to the office.

No bottled water in the room, though you could purchase at the “mini bar” in the foyer.
While the rooms look like they’ve had a recent makeover, the doors on the bathrooms look like they’ve been there forever - they’re sliding doors with the tiniest little catch to grip on to - I didn’t dare pull it all the way closed as I worried I might not get out again. One day housekeeping pushed it all the way back into its slot and I had to get engineering up to release it. Housekeeping also seemed to be good at flicking the alarm clock (which I wasn’t using)on. Fortunately it has been set for a time after I got up but before I left for the day else it would have annoyed my neighbours.
I was  given an interconnecting room which as a lone traveller I hate, but they were full.
Breakfast is available in the bar downstairs but only from 7am.
I would not choose to stay here for a non business trip.

title: One night stay, will be back!!
text: Loved the property! Lashanda Brunson was awesome at check-in., helpful and friendly, exactly what you would want when checking in. The view was great. Thank you for your hospitality. We will be back!!

title: Comfortable business hotel
text: I stayed at this property for 3 nights for a work event. The room was extremely spacious for NYC and was very comfortable, including a great bed and black-out curtains.  While the property wasn't chic, it had everything I needed and the location was next to my office so very convenient. I would recommend for a comfortable NYC business stay downtown.

title: Da consigliare per qualità e posizione
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato la settimana tra Natale e Capodanno e siamo rimasti molto soddisfatti della struttura.
Hotel di qualità situato a Downtown, praticamente di fronte al World Trade Center a pochi passi dall’accesso alla metro.
Personale gentile e disponibile, camera ampia con ottima vista, ottima la pulizia.
Dall’interno dell’hotel si accede direttamente ad un pub/ristorante che offre ottimi hamburger a prezzi nella norma, e ad un piccolo Starbucks.
Sicuramente da consigliare!!

title: Adequate hotel for business travelers, but rather bland
text:
I visited the Marriott Downtown for a business conference. The location is central for the WTC district, although slightly out of the hubub of the main tourist streets. 

My room was very large although I found the decor rather unenticing and minimal. And views were directly into apartments across the way. 

The bed was comfortable and the room had all the items required for a business traveler i.e. safe, iron/ironing board etc. 

The conference room was also adequate. 

Overall the hotel is rather uninspiring and given other options in the area, which generally come in at a much lower price, this would not be a top choice.

title: Uninspiring and Underwhelming
text: This hotel was a swing and a miss. There’s really nothing that stands out here. It’s dated, and the junior suite isn’t really worth the SNA because you might end up on a lower floor (I was on the 16th, out of 38 I think) with an obstructed view instead of the WTC view. The destination fee was a joke and gave me nothing of value… I spent the $25 on 3 overpriced drinks and a tiny $3.75 candy bar at the hotel store. The concierge lounge is closed on the weekends- lousy and disappointing given New York City hotel rates that suggest high demand on the weekends. A disappointment overall.

title: The lounge made it!
text: We normally don't stay in the Financial District, but we wanted to try out this Marriott, and we're glad we did. Pleasant welcome at the front desk - and we had everything explained to us about their destination fee. We took advantage of the hop on/hop off pass on a gorgeous fall day. The lounge on the 38th floor (if you are eligible) was outstanding. Extremely friendly and helpful staff. Very good appetizers at night and breakfast in the morning [note: not open Friday night or Saturday]. Transportation and sights very close by. Beautiful views of the water, including the Statue of Liberty. We very much enjoyed our stay!

title: Hotel okay
text: Ok place to stay. Problem with safe right away and took a long time to fix the problem which took away time for us seeing things in our short trip. Restaurant on site was not very good. Bad service and cold food.

title: Great stay and location
text: Great location for a family sightseeing trip to NYC. Just a couple minute walk away from the World Trade Center and Oculus subway stop. Our room had a view of the Statue of Liberty which was pretty cool. The lounge on the top floor also has an amazing view of lower Manhattan. Also close to Wall St financial district and battery park. Good quality Marriott service. The lobby has a Starbuck coffee shop and a restaurant with good food. Good breakfast options, and kind of a burger sports bar pub for lunch and dinner. Good burgers, sweet potato waffle fries, and epic milk shakes.

title: Check The Alarm Clock As Soon As You Get In The Room
text: Nice stay in a beautiful room, easy to control the room temp and the window shades. Not so nice was having to call down to the front desk for a hair dryer that was missing from the closet, and being awakened at 5 a.m. by the alarm clock (that we didn't check beforehand. Who is supposed to do that nowadays - the traveler or the staff?) We weren't the only ones in our group who experienced that; others were awakened, too, because they also did not think to check the alarm clock when they got in the room. Use your room fee to get a meal down in the restaurant. We were there during the big Flood of Sept '23 and the hotel kindly provided us with free umbrellas as we left to walk to our office and it was raining cats and dogs.

title: Good location but some major issues
text: Quite nice location very close to WTC, with subway within walking distance. As titanium status member i received better room and lounge upgrade. It means breakfast (quite poor) and non alcoholic drinks. Evening alcoholic drinks has to be purchased anyway and was not free. Strange policy. And no evening buffet except come cake. Room was well maintained and clean. The worst experience was at the end of our 7 day stay. It appeared that we were charged for something called “destination fee” over 70$ a day without any warning!!! For some additional services like tickets to NYC attractions, city bike credit or dry cleaning!! And we never used any of it!! Maybe if we knew about this additional charge we would. Beware, because they will place additional charges on your account without any warning.

title: Fabulous hote, lovely stay
text: What a fantastic time we had at this hotel. The view from our room was fabulous with a grand sweeping view of the Hudson. The beds, as always in a Marriott, were so comfortable. The hotel staff were lovely, very friendly but professional. It was a perfect location for us, close to good food, WTC, financial area and battery park. All in all, a perfect stay and we will definitely return. :)

title: Reliable & Professional Hotel
text: Arrived at the premises, Titanium Elite Membership Status has been recognized, early check-in and late checkout was offered without hesitation, destination fee, and additional benefits made the stay even more pleasant. Room, with Hudson View was stunning, especially after a long haul flight (over 16 hrs non stop), absolutely necessary to having a quiet atmosphere, and cosy, comfortable room. Gym and grounds have been exceeding expectations, however, 2 treadmills have been out of order. Will definitely stay again and liked the stay

title: Great hotel- service at reception needs to improve!
text:
I stayed here 6 nights and all in all it was a good stay.
The property is well maintained , the room clean, the location perfect.
The lounge on the 38 floor offers amazing view with super friendly staff.

BUT there were a few things that bothered me and kept me from giving this hotel 5 *:
 Reception : the reception staff doesn’t even smile. They do their job “ by the book” ( sometimes even less….). There is no welcome feeling or any sense of appreciation to the fact that we are loyal Marriott Platinum members. On our last day we were lucky to meet James the manager who helped improve our feeling.
Lounge: closed -shut from Friday ( after breakfast ) until Sunday afternoon. You can’t even go in to get water or coffee. If you are entitled to breakfast you are given a voucher to the restaurant located inside the hotel ( but not part of the hotel) where they offer a buffet that was not too attractive ( to say the least) and poor unfriendly service so we simply went out for breakfast .

title: A new favorite!
text: This is a great hotel.  Very clean. Rooms are updated. Electrical outlets next to both sides of the bed.  Room is very large, especially for NYC.  Good location.  We didn't feel like there were any comprises like we have experienced at other hotels after the pandemic.  Concierge lounge was classic and so nice to look out at the Statue of Liberty while enjoying breakfast.

title: Hotel medio viejo pero de lujo
text: Excelente servicio, las camas súper cómodas, con caja fuerte y frigorífico. El desayuno excelente. El wifi un poco engorroso, no andaba del todo bien en el lobby ni en los pasillos u otras habitaciones.

title: Hôtel très bien situé
text:
Hôtel très bien situé juste à côté du one world trade center. 
Personnel agréable. 
Les chambres ne sont pas très grandes ( comme dans la
Plupart des hôtels à NYC) , mais bien équipées et super vue sur Downtown. 
Le starbuck dans l’hôtel est un vrai plus.
Le restaurant est st sympa également, mais dommage qu’il n’y parait st pas de petit déjeuner proposé au sein de l’hôtel même.

title: Unprofessional front desk at New York Marriott Downtown
text:
I booked New York Marriott Downtown with high expectations based on good reviews at TripAdvisor generally, especially about the Concierge Lounge.

Unfortunately, I was treated badly after asking the Front Desk about certain details of the Destination Fees. A young lady at the Front Desk became unfriendly and uncooperative. I later found out she also deliberately gave me incorrect and harmful information. I could not remember her name but the experience was not good and reflected badly on Marriott. Her male “supervisor/manager” should know the name of this young lady because he was around and came to the Front Desk when I asked questions in the evening of 6 or 7 August 2023. He gave me some feeble excuses about the hotel’s shortcomings.

Breakfast at Concierge Lounge was reasonable, except that hot items were not consistently hot. I would avoid the tasteless, rubbery and sometimes cold scramble egg and bacon in the morning. Evening hors d’oeuvres was so bad that I didn’t not return after the first evening.

Overall, New York Marriott Downtown let me down and I do not see any good reason to return.

title: Hotel Business a DownTown
text:
Siamo a DOwnTown, nel centro degli affari di Manhattan. Perfetto quando ci si trova per lavoro (come nel mio caso), meno per turismo perchè la sera questa zona è meno viva.
Hotel molto bello, pulito e accogliente. 
Nella hall, tra l’altro sempre super profumata vi sono un Pub e starbucks.. inoltre è presente anche una palestra. Le camere sono pulite e confortevoli, letti ampi e comodi, il bagno è ovviamente sprovvisto di bidet e la doccia è con tenda e non con vetrata... la seconda il Wi-Fi libero solo nella hall, funziona a pagamento nell'hotel (come la maggior parte degli hotel business in USA. Un hotel perfetto per non avere sorprese e stare comodi.

title: Great stay in lower Manhattan
text: We travelled as family with a friend, and I picked this location due to its laidback environment - not chaotic like Times Square. The place is clean, rooms are clean and smelling fresh and it is so close to everything. Will be staying here again!

title: Nice Marriott in Lower Manhattan
text:
It's been 30 years since I've stayed downtown and I chose this hotel based on rate and its proximity to a hotel where friends from Canada were staying.  

As a Marriott Titanium Elite member, I'd asked for an early check in and once I arrived at the hotel around 10 AM I was pleased that the desk associate was able to find me a room.  Side note:  while walking to the taxi line at Penn Station, an oblivious 20something, with her face buried in her phone, managed to trip me, causing a fall. Of course she never bothered to turn around but some random stranger helped me up.

Anyway, when I told the associate about my fall, she found me a room on the same floor as an ice machine and gave me some ice bags so I could ice my knee but I digress.  

The first room was a nice king on the 24th floor with a view of the river, Jersey City (I used to work there and could see my old office building) and in the distance, Cape Liberty, NJ.  The room had been nicely redone and featured a fridge, coffee maker and two bottles of water (complimentary).

I noticed a bit of a musty/stale smell and asked the housekeeper if she could spray a bit of air freshener but it didn't help.  I called the desk and a few minutes later, the bellman arrived with new keys and assisted me in moving up to the same room on the 30th floor, with no smell!  Hooray!

The room was very comfortable and clean.  The bathroom is nice, and I liked the shower; however, it's rather dark and it probably would have been smart to install additional lighting near the shower.  The lights around the mirror aren't bright enough.

The hotel charges a $25 amenity fee which includes a few things, one of which is a $25 food & beverage credit.  That's easy to eat or drink though in the restaurant or lounge.  I chose another credit as my welcome amenity and since the concierge lounge is closed on weekends, I was able to have breakfast in the morning.  

The buffet was a typical Marriott buffet, though on the small side, much like what you'd find in the concierge lounge, as opposed to the usual breakfast buffet served in many hotels.  The eggs were lukewarm as were the potatoes.  You had to ask for toast, and the server never did bring my coffee.  I asked 2 other people before it arrived.   Also, I was not offered juice and honestly, the entire meal was a huge disappointment.  I would suggest NOT dining there.

I liked that the hotel is only about 2 blocks from the 9/11 Memorial and also from Oculus and the shopping area that houses Eataly where I had dinner.  It is about a 20 minute or more cab ride (depending on traffic) from Penn Station but the hotel is in a nice area and I felt safe walking a bit in the evening. 

There are several restaurants around and some shops but since this is a more business area, many things were closed on weekends.  The hotel does have an actual Starbucks so you can place a mobile order from your room, and then head down in the elevator to pick it up!

I'd stay again if I wanted to be in the financial district again.  Much quieter than Times Square.  The staff were all very nice except in the restaurant (though the bartender in the lounge was very nice) and the room was clean and comfortable.  Yes, this is a basic cookie cutter Marriott and it's nothing really special but I did enjoy my stay and will be back sooner than 30 years next time!

title: Top Notch NYC hotel
text: We have stayed in many NYC hotels, This one is the best. Great front desk staff, clean rooms and the views are amazing. Irene in the M club is fabulous. She is helpful, kind and had a warm welcoming smile for us first thing in the morning!

title: Dee Dee was amazing!!
text: Dee Dee from the upstairs lounge was amazing! She was so helpful and kind to me. She went out of her way to come in early and make me a parfait before I checked out at 4am. She is what makes Marriot my favorite place to stay!!

title: Enjoyed stay
text: This hotel is modern, clean and comfortable and well located.  It is just a few steps from the 911 Memorial and walking distance to Battery park and the waterfront. The room was attractive and the service excellent.  The do require a $25 per day fee that you can get back with services or in the restaurant.

title: Spacious
text: I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to NYC.   It was conveniently located downtown.  Walking distance to subway stations, Staten Island Ferry, 7/11 etc.  the staff was friendly, the hotel was clean, and the rooms were spacious. Our room had a view of the Statue of Liberty and it was very quiet.

title: Marriott in Quiet Location
text:
The New York Marriott Downtown is located near Battery Park and provides decent accommodations for business travelers.  We recently stayed in this property to celebrate nine years of being together, but after my experience, it may not be the best choice.  This is a business hotel, and certain things may have changed recently after the general manager transitioned to another property in NYC. 

Even though the previous GM forwarded my request and acknowledgment of a special occasion, the respective NY Marriott Downtown location member overlooked the email. When I arrived at the hotel, no recognition of this event in any form was given other than the same king guest room with a particular view was presented.  Being a Titanium elite member, it felt a bit inconsiderate on their part. In addition, the lounge seemed a bit crowded and hectic during breakfast, and the restaurant below had highs and lows in terms of service and delivery.  

Regardless of this bittersweet experience, the bed was comfortable. The location is quiet and near the 9/11 memorial. There is also a five to 10-minute walk to the nearest train station.  There are a few people that I would like to recognize - Geraldine at the front desk for assisting with availability and trying to find a decent-view room, and Patricia in Housekeeping for taking care of our room.  Geraldine and Patricia helped to troubleshoot a housekeeping issue and were helpful during our stay. 

Finally, please remember that they charge you $25 per night to use on the property, and you must use it daily, or you will lose it.  Please use it either in the restaurant for a drink or the mini market next to the front desk.  I am not sure if I might return to this location, but perhaps things will change as a new manager is appointed soon.

title: A great property, well managed
text: I checked in for a 6-night stay in June.  I found that Marriott recognized my Platinum status with club lounge access and a room upgrade.  The lounge (on the 38th) is fantastic - great views of the Statute of Liberty, a good selection of hot and cold hors d'oeuvres  plus salads in the evening and excellent breakfast options. My room was large and comfortable. The fitness area (on the 5th) was 24 h and well equipped.  The best news?  The property is easily reach by public transit (1 train to Rectory), right next to the World Trade Center.  I enjoyed my extended stay and recommend this property - esp for visiting Lower Manhattan.

title: Great stay
text:
Excellent place. A little unhappy about the $100 charge, but the give it back to you in $25 daily at the bar/restaurant. Great views. From the room; from the lounge you can have breakfast looking at the Eiffel Tower.
3 blocks from subway. We will come back again.

title: Access to WTC and PATH
text:
Close to World Trade Center and PATH to New Jersey - our primary reason to stay here so suited our purposes.
Room was average; view from 23rd floor was nice; no wait for elevators.
Appreciated that at check-in (recognizing my Bonvoy status) staff asked if we would like a late check-out, instead of asking me to call to check in the morning.

title: Stay at this hotel if you plan on walking to WTC area or Battery Park
text: Awesome location for the WTC and Statue of Liberty/Ellis Island.  Within walking distance of both Battery Park and WTC.  We had an awesome stay.   We stayed in a Junior corner suite which was larger than most NYC hotel rooms and had great views.  You can see the Statue of Liberty from the Concierge Lounge.  Concierge lounge was nice.  I would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Another Great Stay in NYC
text:
This is our second stay and enjoyed it both visits.   The location is great - next to World Trade Center - and an easy subway ride to our kids living in Brooklyn.   The views are spectacular, the rooms are modern and comfortable, good staff and pleasant all around. 

Had breakfast and lunch at Bill's Bar & Burger which is connected and affiliated with the hotel.   As usual had other great meals at Cataldo's Restaurant & Pizzeria (Brooklyn), Ferrara Bakery (dessert in Little Italy), Brooklyn Pizza Crew, Jongro BBQ (excellent Korean bbq in Koreatown), drinks at Jack Demsey's bar (midtown missing the P for the fighter), Milk Bar (expensive dessert) and Juniors (original in Brooklyn and great sandwiches and cakes).  

Plan to be back.

title: Nice Stay Downtown
text:
We stayed at the New York Marriott Downtown for four nights over a long weekend in April. This hotel was approximately a $55 Uber/Lyft ride from the LGA airport and is within a few blocks walking distance to several subway stops and lines. This hotel is also within walking distance of Wall Street, Stock Exchange, World Trade Center buildings and memorials, and Oculus.  The lounge breakfast was plentiful and the same buffet set up is available in the restaurant on days when the lounge is not open.

Hits - hotel's location away from the hustle and bustle of mid-town and a large room with a view

Misses - $25 fee that you have to pay daily and noise from an adjoining room

title: Large Rooms, Nice Hotel
text: Great location if your business is in this area.  I was shocked by the size of the room.  Very large.  Had great views.  The concierge lounge had views of the river and Statue of Liberty.  But very basic food in the lounge.  If you want a great lounge stay at the Marriott near TImes Square.  Best I've seen other than Copenhagen.  Staff was friendly.  Would stay here again in this area.

title: Wonderful stay
text:
Stayed here for a week of work and enjoyed my stay.  The rooms are spacious and very clean.  All the hotel employees I spoke to were attentive and friendly.

The hotel lobby restaurant, Bill's Bar & Burger, is a great place to get a bite to eat.  Location is very close to lots of activities and sites.

Access to the concierge lounge was a nice treat, serving breakfast in the morning and hot appetizers and desserts in the evenings during the week.

Highly recommend.

title: Luz Osbina was extremely unhelpful and unprofessional.
text:
Luz Osbina was extremely unhelpful and unprofessional. 

I am a Marriott Titanium Elite Member and stay over 100 nights a year at Marriott hotels and I have never had a worse customer service experience with this “supervisor”.

title: Excellent hotel in a great location, staff friendly and efficient
text:
I'm at a loss to understand some reviewers, particularly those complaining about location. This hotel is in the financial district, which presumably people realize isn't going to be the same vibe as a hotel off Central Park but apparently not.

This is an excellent hotel of the Marriott brand and, once again, being elite Bonvoy members really helps with the experience, landing us this time with a top floor room on which also sits the executive lounge where there is an excellent breakfast, free printing (boarding passes etc.) and spectacular views across the water. 

The rooms are extremely comfortable and the Marriott beds have a deservedly high reputation. We slept very well and the hotel is quiet - no noise bleed that I noticed from other rooms. I love that Marriott have moved to walk in showers seemingly in all their brands. Such an improvement over unusable tubs with a shower over. Our shower was good although lacking a little in water pressure for the duration of the stay, but nothing to really complain about.

About that location. It's very close to WTC 1 and the memorial pools as well as the Oculus which is a great location I think as the WTC subway will whisk you uptown in no time, as we did several times during our stay. There are places to eat around this location and it is very safe. There is also a nice looking bar restaurant in the hotel itself but we didn't partake on this trip. It is an easy walk to Wall St, Brooklyn Bridge etc. I think the location is pretty good. 

The staff helping us from check in through the concierge were great, friendly and efficient. The breakfast we had was more than adequate and I love that the club provides hor d'oeuvres as well so again, get yourself elite status if you can.

I would definitely stay here again, very much enjoyed the experience.

title: Good property- boring area
text: The property is nice - relatively recently updated though you can tell the renovations were cheap and fully cosmetic. The real downside is the neighborhood - unless you're here for business and your meetings/offices are down that way, it is a ghost town in the evening. Being close to the WTC/Oculus is absolutely not worth being so far away from the rest of Manhattan.

title: Think Twice
text:
Location was great, walking distance to restaurants and shops. The rooms are okay, nothing special, typical small rooms!
Upon check in the front desk clerk was cold and didn’t want to repeat anything. She was wearing a mask so it was hard to understand her. She wore a rhinestone headband daily and acted like she was the owner.

This hotel has the worst lounge of any hotels we stayed at! The staff was literally walking around eating and watching television, seriously I’ve never heard employees complain so much considering they weren’t even working! Dee was so glad it was Friday she couldn’t wait for the day to be over. Nothing was restocked, if you weren’t there early you missed out on fruit even yogurt, NOTHING WAS RESTOCKED! The front desk employee’s came up to the lounge to FaceTime their family to talk to the lounge employees!!
Beware the lounge closes over the weekend, no water, coffee etc.
The worst was listening to Dee complaining about her job!!

title: Pleasantly surprised
text: Really enjoyed my stay here. Check in was fast and friendly. I asked for and was given a late checkout at 1PM. Rooms are a good size and very comfortable. Loved the view from the room. Bed was very comfortable and provided a good nights sleep. Coffee machine was provided in the room. Bathroom was a decent size with a walk in shower. Wifi was fast and free. No bottled water was provided in the room. Breakfast was pretty good, and I enjoyed a few beers and some food at the restaurant. Thought the location was pretty decent too. All the staff that I interacted with were fantastic. Would definitely consider this hotel again when I am next in New York.

title: A large hotel in a somewhat deserted part of town
text:
We recently spent a Friday night in New York, staying at the Marriott Downtown, near the World Trade Center.  The hotel is big and well maintained, pretty new looking.  It has an on-site restaurant, a pub run by a third party.  The room was fine.

Are there negatives?  Downtown Manhattan is pretty empty, especially on weekends.  The hotel is clean and well maintained, but felt cold in terms of personality.

title: Great hotel downtown
text:
One of the best Marriott-brand picks in Downtown Manhattan. Really modern, upscale feel for a Marriott. Starbucks on the ground floor. Nice restaurant / bar with good quality pub food. Staff professional and friendly. 

Had absolutely no complaints at all. Lots of downtown hotels you can choose from, but being right on the west side highway is also convenient if you’re going north or to have to get to Newark by car.

title: A Safe and Transactional Hotel
text: NY Marriott Downtown is a decent hotel in a safe precinct. With the 911 Memorial right next to it, police presence is hard to miss, making this possibly one the safest parts of New York to stay in. The hotel itself is nice - public areas are simple, pleasant and practical. My room is clean, spacious and  functional, with plenty of natural light and a view of the city and bay in the distance. It’s definitely a decent hotel - safe, clean and comfortable. The staff, however… every interaction with them feels very transactional. As Lifetime Platinum, I wasn’t offered an upgrade to a corner room that so many other reviewers were given. I stayed 5 nights and was denied an upgrade throughout the entire stay. When I asked if they had an international socket adaptor, I was told matter-of-factly that I should have brought my own. Isn’t this an establishment that caters to the needs of international travellers? In most other hotels, rooms are equipped with international sockets or the hotels have spares they loan to guests. Don’t expect any of the little extras here, that will make your stay more memorable. Finally, the Concierge Lounge: it’s a nice space with a fabulous view! Food (both breakfast and evening snacks) exceeded expectations. The ladies who work here… they offered the only warm and sincere interaction I had with anyone in this hotel. In particular, I would like to commend Irene for her warmth and kindness. I have enjoyed chatting with her while I had my breakfasts here. Like many executive lounges in the US, this one doesn’t operate on weekends.

title: Stunning view, comfortable stay
text:
Stayed here for a couple of nights on a business trip. 
Had a really comfortable stay, with a stunning & breathtaking view from my room. 
The location is great, within walking distance from the WTC memorial, and the subway, with some good eating joints nearby & easy access to cabs.

title: AMAZING!
text: Got lucky enough to stay here last weekend and I will say there is absolutely nothing my family and I didn’t love about this hotel! We have religiously stayed at Marriotts for the last 20 years and are always exploring new locations. Before our trip we contacted management about some questions about our trip and were so pleased with how great our exchange with them went before and all the way thru our trip! Upon pulling up to the hotel we were quickly greeted by someone to help us with our luggage, we were able to then check in and the staff was very helpful and kind. The location of this hotel was great, within walking distance to world trade and a block away from many necessary subway stations. We were upgraded to a suite for one of our rooms which they connected to our other room so it was basically a whole condo style to ourselves with views of the statue of liberty on one side and the city on the other! We were given access to concierge level which had a starbucks coffee maker, a great breakfast and plenty of drinks. On the weekends they don’t do breakfast so they gave us vouchers to get breakfast at the restaurant which had a full menu or a breakfast buffet, the manager at the restaurant was there every morning chatting with us and was super kind and helpful. Every morning when we would leave to head out for the day the housekeepers were in the hall and would ask if there was anything we needed, it was so sweet. Every need we could have possibly had was met, even before we knew what we needed sometimes also lol. We will be back ASAP, we are already missing this atmosphere so so much so thank you! (also most of these pics are after we had already moved in and gotten comfortable, sorry)

title: Horrible Stay
text: Horrible. I checked in the hotel, the front desk lady made a weird face. The vibe of the hotel is so negative. The staff service is terrible. I was checked in in a room with wet paint and when I came down to change room, she moved me to lower floor. The room was very unhygienic. Hairs in the shower, stains on toilet seat and finding used empty water bottles in the room. I requested if my room can be cleaned again to which no answer was provided. They said the manager will check your room. I came back after 2 hours but it was still dirty. The alarm in the room start 4 in the morning. Anyways during checkout the conversation was so limited. “Checking out?” “Room No” I asked to store my luggage to which that lady said go over there and talk to bell desk guy. In the evening when I came back to take my luggage as I was leaving for airport and my Uber was waiting outside, the bell desk guy took so long. He took ticket from me and stopped at front desk, talking and giving fist bumps to his colleagues. I was surprised with the level of service. Staff doesn’t even apologize rather they look at you like they are doing a favour on you. I would never ever recommend this hotel to anyone.   And I have stayed from four points to Ritz, and I can definitely say this was one of the worst experience. Highly disappointed with the brand.

title: Excellent Stay
text: I had an excellent stay at the New York Marriott Downtown. The staff was exceptionally acccommodating-providing both an early and late checkout. Everyone encountered was friendly and helpful. Location is great. Room was nice and comfortable. Restaurant was good and convenient, and a Starbucks in the building too. It was really just a great stay and can’t thank them enough.

title: Dirty rooms, overburdened facilities, inhospitable staff.
text:
I am a 400+ night Marriott member. This is, without question, the worst Marriott property I have stayed at. How? Let's count the ways.

Rooms: this room felt dirtier than one in a Motel 6. Stains on bedsheets. Roaches literally crawling onto you while you're lounging on the bed (this we saw with our own eyes). Bedbugs, as inferred from the telltale linear bite marks. When we reported these issues to the hotel after the stay, they claimed to have done an inspection that revealed no pest issues. That is an amusing finding given that we literally had to kill and flush a roach down the toilet during our stay.

Breakfast: the breakfast venue, in "Bill's Bar and Burgers," had a 20 minute wait on day 1 of our stay and a 45+ minute wait on day 2 of our stay. This for a breakfast buffet that I would rate as Residence Inn quality (not a ding on Residence Inn; in fact, there you can get the same breakfast without waiting in line a single minute).

Staff: the rudest Marriott staff I have seen anywhere in the world across 400+ nights. Every interaction with the front desk staff was brusque and dismissive. You would not want these people staffing a McDonald's, let alone a full-service Marriott. The only noticeable exceptions were the restaurant waiters, who were impressively courteous for being as overworked and understaffed as they were.

Overall: So many Marriott properties in NYC: whatever you do, just don't choose this one.

title: Like being at any Marriott in Middle America - both good and bad
text:
For me, choosing to book this Marriott for five nights was I guess growing up in a way - I really would have liked to book something more exciting/trendier, even closer to great places to go out, with more personality....but with a young child, larger spaces, reliability, and amenities won out. And it worked out pretty well in the end.

Location right next to WTC site, close to #1 & countless other subway lines...Wall Street, Battery Park City, etc works pretty well as a tourist. Yes, you're not on the LES or in Williamsburg, but you're also away from the congestion of Times Square, Midtown. There are countless places to walk to for decent dinners.

Room was as expected quite spacious - was (slightly) upgraded to a view corner room. Nice windows looking west to Jersey City and south downtown. Other than that - it was very standard Marriott. You can tell it wasn't new and a tiny bit rough around the edges, but comfortable and clean.  

On some levels I'm not sure how I feel about a lounge in the/one of the greatest restaurant, bar cities in the world...but it was good for kid's food? Seriously, food quality was better than other domestic Marriotts, Sheraton - multiple hot choices in evening, decent fruit for breakfast, a solid Starbucks coffee machine. And similar views to our room.

I know amenity fees are the norm now in NYC & elsewhere, but really...why? You can tell me Bill's Burgers earned some awards in 2013, but if I really wanted to go there - couldn't I go myself anyways? The $25 daily non-accumulating credit seems designed to annoy; usable at Bill's, the 20-SKU mini-mart next to the lobby (think only snacks & beverages that were available 1980 or earlier...M&Ms, Skittles, Snickers, Dorritos + Coke, Sprite, Water + a handful of medication), or the lounge for alcohol. The other inclusions 1x/stay - laundry ($15, eg, not 2 pieces of clothing), Citi Bike (have to request a code), tour of some sort - all seem somewhat hard to use. Honestly - just raise the rates $25, and I'd be less annoyed.  

Beyond that, service was a question mark overall. Hotel's main entrance had a set of ~4 stairs, and hotel staff seemed committed to ignoring me carrying up a stroller each time. Lounge staff was extremely talkative and trying to help. Room was still cleaned daily, and did a good job with a heavily occupied room.  

Overall, don't stay here if you want exciting, to be in the beating heart of Manhattan....stay here if you need an easy place to rest within the city with decent amenities. It's kind of like a Marriott anywhere...

title: Great views of lower Manhattan
text:
Quick one-night stay visiting our son in Brooklyn.  The location is great – at the foot of the somber but striking 9/11 Memorial.  Was able to run along the Hudson on paths just a few blocks from the hotel.  Took a bit of a long walk to Little Italy for dinner at Da Nico Ristorante.  

Room was fabulous.  Great view of World Trade Center and lower Manhattan.  Clean, comfortable.  

Breakfast and drinks at the hotel’s Bill’s Bar & Burger.

Recommended for trips to this part of NYC.

title: Less chaotic and amazing views
text:
The New York Marriott Downtown is a great choice if you’re looking for something a little less chaotic than you find in most of NYC. The location is great for Ground Zero, Wall St, and Statue of Liberty and even waking the Brooklyn Bridge.

As an Ambassador Elite, I was upgraded to a corner room with panoramic views of the Statue of Liberty and the Hudson River. It’s probably the best city view I’ve ever had. Everything was recently redone, so no complaints with the room. I was there on the weekend so the lounge was closed and had to eat breakfast in the restaurant attached to the hotel, which was just okay. The gym was great and well equipped for anyone looking to get a solid workout in. I’d definitely stay there again.

title: The absolute best Hotel and location for luxury, stressfree, and safe  NYC visit
text: If you desire a luxury, peaceful and safe visit to NYC, stay at Marriott Downtown.  Phil the helpful valet offered to park our car, or save some money by self parking at a nearby garage.   Lobby was quiet and modern.  Starbucks and Bills Burger Pub in lobby area.  Mortonś directly accross street.  All the staff were kind and accomadating.  We asked for connecting rooms as we had our 16 and 20 yr old son.  We prefer low floor in the event of emergency, fast, quick climb down stairs (it happens in nyc folks!) We were placed in rms. 608/609.  Gorgeous, renovated huge corner room with large windows and modern finishes.  Our adjoining room was equally modern and serene.  It was like a little private oasis.  Never heard a peep on our floor the entire 3 nights And our housekeeper was so friendly and attentive! The location to Battery Park, Ferries to Statue of Libery/Ellis Island, Wall street and the 911 Memorial were literlly steps from the front door.  Perfect family getaway for diserning traveler not interested in touristy times square or midtown area.  Although uber can get you to midtown very quickly.  All around perfect stay.  Would not stay anywhere else in NYC!

title: Perfect stay
text: I wrote the GM directly about my stay, but I'll say it again here.  Everything was PERFECT.  This is incredibly rare, but I have no complaints.  This hotel really gets the guest experience and how to take care of their elites.  I was upgraded to the best room type available (junior suite) with amazing views of the Freedom Tower.  I was asked if I wanted a late checkout without having to inquire, I was told of all of the amenities in great detail too.  Every staff member I encountered was very pleasant and I felt like they went above and beyond to make sure my stay was perfect.  I cannot say enough good things.  My wife and I did a staycation here and will not hesitate to do another again.  HIGHLY recommend this hotel.

title: Really feel comfortable at the downtown Marriott!
text: We always stay at the Marriott Downtown when we visit NYC. Sometimes I come solo and always feel safe, comfortable and happy at this hotel. I typically have a “knock your socks off” view of the Hudson. We are using car share services to get around these days due to safety concerns with the subway. Getting to the theaters and museums is about $35 each way. Small price to pay for being in such a safe place. Don’t expect ultra-luxury but a very clean, nice, quiet, comfortable room near the site of the World Trade Center with good restaurants nearby (especially in TriBeca). Lots of families were here on our stay this July 2022z

title: Best location in town!
text: This was our best experience in NY and we would come again for sure! The building is old but is clean and very convenient. We stayed on 37th floor with great view and no noise from outside. The location is perfect! We enjoyed walking around, the promenade, the surrounding area and we felt very safe. The breakfast at the lounge is much better than in the Bill’s restaurant. The hotel surprised us with free tickets to big bus tours ride, resort voucher of  25 USD. The staff is really pleasant and nice but Zhming was the best! He was most helpful of all the receptionists and always willing to help and meet our needs. We would be back for sure!

title: It took me over 40 years to find the best Hotel in NYC
text:
I have travelled to the greatest city in the world to attend the Belmont Stakes for more than 40 years, having witnessed greatness in the form of Sectretariat and American Pharaoh.
I am a starwood/marriott guy having earned lifetime platinum status separately in both programs.
I've stayed JW Marriott/ W/ Westin/Le Meridian/Autograph and this year finally found my "PERFECT" hotel - the Lower Manhattan Marriott.
2 blocks to the subway.
Restaurant Bill's Bar attached is sensational - thank you Scott!!
Quiet - try saying that from Times Sq.
A housekeeper we wanted to adopt

AND THE STAFF - DING DING!!! Winner Winner Chicken Dinner...........Led by the venerable (i think he sleeps there) James Hatzidoukas at the front desk, was passionate in their attentiveness to my permanently disabled wife and her needs in the form of accessible accomodations.

TIP - Accessible accomodations typically have a double headed shower system that we much prefer.

We were offered a corner room with wonderful views.

Convenient to a blend of local artisans/craftsmen and traditional shopping, best wishes for a safe adventure.  For me, i've found my future home.

respectfully.

title: Great Location and service
text: We usually stay at another Marriott group, this was by far the best. Maria at check in a warm friendly smile and professional. Same for Eli on the club floor. Probably one of the best gyms we have seen too, Walking distance to so many great spots

title: Nice Rooms with Poor Breakfast
text: Stayed here for one night as a Bonvoy Plat on a last minute points redemption. Booked a double room which was all the app had and requested for a king via the in-app chat. This was not pre-arranged despite acknowledgement on the app, and the front desk staff had not been apprised. I was accommodated in a very nice corner double room, which was appreciated. While there's a US$25 destination fee, I was able to use this at Bills for a burger upon my late arrival. Breakfast at Bills, however, was dismal. They were unable to accommodate a single take-away coffee and insisted I wait an hour to be seated if I wanted a drink. I went back to the front desk and sought points instead. Overall will return again and recommend.

title: Train your staff to be nice!
text: Went to Downtown @Marriott NYC to visit my brother, who’s on a trip. Got stuck in the elevator for 40 mins with my wife, 2 kids and my brother. I missed my Uber and it all ended up delaying us by more than an hour. The saddest part was how @Marriott handled the situation after that. I understand that I was not the guest but I was visiting a guest (who was also there in the elevator) and there were two little kids who were really scared. Their manager (I won’t name) comes and (without any courtesy or asking how we’re doing or offering even cup of water or even apologizing for the situation) tells me that “he understands that I missed my Uber but I can always get another one. He doesn’t have any way to make it right for us.” The tone he talked to us was so rude! I know me or my family is nothing for a company like Marriott but the manager behavior costed Marriott a customer for the lifetime.

title: Horrible dated hotel w front desk staff issues
text: Checked in and was treated poorly. Checked into room and it had a horrible smell. Staff could care less but concierge staff was amazing. They should teach Geraldine at the front how to treat guests. Won’t be back. So many choices down there in that area. Look elsewhere.

title: Great stay! Large room and super clean.
text: Great hotel. Not once did I visit the front desk as I used mobile check in.  Was upgraded to a river front view room.  The room was huge for a nyc hotel. Very fresh and new. Super clean and comfortable.  I had business downtown so the location was perfect.  I’d def stay again.

title: Good Choice in Financial District
text:
I spent one evening in the Marriott while in New York on business.  The hotel was in the heart of the Financial District, convenient to the Path Train, World Trade Center, shops and restaurants.  Highly recommended.

Check-in was smooth with the assistance of Adnan, who helped get my reservation connected to my Bonvoy account.

The room was clean, comfortable and quiet.  I had a nice view of the Hudson River, though the windows could have certainly used a cleaning.

There is a bike path directly across the street; according to the map, it goes from Battery Park up to the Canadian border.  There is a Citibike station around the corner from the hotel so I was able to take an early morning ride before a day of meetings.  Felt safe and a nice break from a cramped hotel gym.

Overall, a pleasant stay.

title: NOT SAFE
text:
If you want to be safe, DON’T go to Marriott Downtown Hotel in New York City.

In March, I was attending a conference held on the third floor of the hotel. I left my laptop unattended for less than 10 minutes in the main conference room while there were still employees from the hotel in that room. When I came back, my laptop was stolen, along with 5 other computers. We have footage of the person stealing the computers, opening personal bags and then leaving using a service door. I assume the person had to have inside knowledge of the hotel to know and have access to the service door.

I obviously was very unhappy loosing my laptop. But what shocked me is that anyone can come in and out of that hotel without security noticing. The hotel emphasized they cannot be responsible for people coming in and out of the hotel, then why would anyone want to stay at the hotel if they cannot feel safe walking in the corridors and leaving their belongings in their room? Despite me asking about security and actions the hotel will take to remediate security issues, nothing has been done and the hotel has been silent. In addition, they refused to compensate me for the loss of my laptop and were unfeeling about my situation (in retrospect, I acknowledge I should have taken my bag with me while going to the restrooms but felt safe given employees were present).

If you want you and your belongings to be safe, I DO NOT recommend staying at the hotel.

title: Better Options
text: This property lacks customer centricity.  They will charge you a bogus food fee credit, as if to say you have no choice for choosing your self.  It is simply an up charge that must make them feel creative.  Well their creativity has been noticed and it’s not welcomed.  Just add it to the room charge for full transparency?  As a loyal customer, I fortunately have access to their executive lounge, thus making this credit unusable.  When I brought it to their attention post stay and requested a reply, they decided to ghost me, with no reply.  They are telling the customer that they don’t care about you and they are telling Marriott that they don’t care about their most loyal customers.  There are too many other options in the area who authentically care about the customer.

title: Great stay!
text:
This hotel exceeded my expectations. Due to my status, I was upgraded to a corner view junior suite, with amazing views on a high floor. Everything was clean and comfortable. Unfortunately we had some drunk/loud neighbors, but that’s always a risk when you travel, and not the hotels fault, they passed out soon enough!

 I understand what others are saying about the $25 fee. I had breakfast in the executive lounge and had dinner reservations. I had no way to use the credit, so I bought $25 worth of snacks to take on the plane/bring home. Keep in mind that most hotels in NYC will be charging some extra fee, and at least this way you get some of it back! 

I did love the location. I originally had something booked in Times Square and switched to this hotel for a more quiet location. It’s still walkable to the WTC/oculus/seaport/ferries, etc. No complaints about anything here, and would recommend this hotel to others. 

Side note: It’s a far trek to the major NYC attractions like Times Square, Empire State Building, Central Park. Subways are really close though and Uber was very convenient and easy to get so not a major issue for me, but might be for some people.

title: GOOD STAY
text:
Stayed here over a busy weekend. Great view of the Hudson. Location is on a busy West street and loading unloading your baggages can be hectic. It is close to Financial District World Trade Center and Brookefield Place Mall Battery Park and other smaller parks. 
The check in and out was swift and friendly from the valet to the front desk staff. 
Rooms are clean Room service efficient. 
Definitely recommendable.

title: Great service, Quiet Atmosphere, Family Friendly
text: We loved this hotel.  The staff were VERY friendly and incredibly HELPFUL, from sharing their experiences during 9-11 to helping us navigate the subway system.  Room was clean and well maintained, and we even had a view of the Statue of Liberty from our room.  This hotel is in lower Manhattan in the financial district, so it is much quieter and slower paced than mid-town, which we appreciated after a long day of sightseeing.

title: Not Great
text:
Wouldn’t recommend ..we are Bonvoy Titanium members  and there was no recognition of status. Hotel restaurant was a burger joint which doesn’t allow drinks to be taken to room. $25 per day fee was unnecessary & frankly exorbitant  for what it included which was WiFi and not sure what else? We ended up buying expensive waters in lobby to spend it.
Club lounge was nice with great views but only open on weeknights.

title: Excellent Manhattan base for work and leisure
text: Well-located and well-maintained facility very near the WTC.  Quiet for a Manhattan hotel.  Clean, spacious, and pleasant room with nice view over the river.  2-3 blocks from subway.  Helpful staff.  Well equipped gym (with one nit: bikes require a Pelton subscription to use). Didn't use the bar/restaurant.

title: Excellent!
text: I was so tired after trying to ride the subway with luggage, after we landed. We took a taxi the rest of the way to the hotel.  We were greeted outside by Idris!  He would not allow us to touch our bags.  Right on time!  and each time we left the hotel we were greeted the same when we arrived. The customer service exceeded my expectations. Front desk was helpful as well. I had an early check in. I was still accommodated with a high floor room with an awesome view!  The room was luxury! The restaurant downstairs was good. although there's a destination fee i got it back with being able to charge $25.00 a day to the room. subway stops are not far or urber or taxi depending on where you're going.  I would definitely stay here again!

title: Not a Marriott quality
text:
I am a Titanium level and have stayed at a lot of hotels. This hotel charges a resort fee and is not so cheap. Stayed here with my family in two rooms. Lots of luggage. 
Guess what? No bellman in the hotel when we checked out and I had to bring down my own luggage. They think they are a Holiday Inn. 
When I asked they said you can wait for a bellman when he starts work. The manager on duty tells me “that is the way we do it here”. 
I guess they think I call call American Airlines and tell them to wait for me since my hotel did not have a bellman. 
Never seen anything like this before in a Marriott. 
Find a different hotel.

title: Good Location and Comfortable Stay
text:
We stayed here for almost a week.

We had a red eye flight into Newark Liberty so had requested a very early check in.  We did appreciate their flexibility and we were assigned a room with a view of New Jersey and the water.  The hotel seemed a little older but overall nicely maintained.

The lounge was open from Sunday dinner through Friday but only during breakfast or dinner hours.  This limited the amount of time we could use the space which was a bummer.  It had great views including the Statue of Liberty and was comfortable.  They had a good variety of breakfast foods and the fancy coffee machine was our favorite.   Lounge Staff every day were friendly and helpful.  I wish I remembered their names but they deserve kudos.

Our room had really comfortable beds which was one of the highlights.  A small closet but at least the bathroom was good size for all of us.  The coffee maker could be nicer.

The gym was expansive with lots of cardio equipment and weights.  Only two other people were working out in the morning so it was nice given that masking was optional now.

Location wise it was close to the 9/11 Museum, Freedom Tower and Oculus plus a number of subways stations.  We liked not seeing so many people compared to my last stay near Times Square.

The one major annoyance was the mandatory $25 daily fee.  It resulted in a credit that could be used in Bill’s burgers for a meal, drinks in the executive lounge or items from the small convenience “closet” by the front desk.  
 
Overall, I would come back and stay here in a future trip to NYC.

title: Solid stay for a way downtown spot in NYC
text: Was here on business during a very busy time of leisure travel.  Arrived late and went up to my room but couldn't get in b/c the key card didn't work.  Called down and they sent someone up to help me - the nice surprise was that they changed my room to a killer suite w/ great views - that was a good service remediation right there.  Had breakfast in the Executive Lounge - TBH, it was mediocre in terms of quantity, quality and diversity of food vs other Marriott lounges.  The fitness center was packed in peak morning hours but had all the necessary equipment - it was definitely stinky in there (w/ all the people, etc).  Location is great for World Trade Center - if you need to commute uptown, the taxis were limited, so I used Uber and they have to loop around to get to this property.  I don't often end up this far south in Manhattan but this was a fine spot to base myself for a couple of days.

title: PERFECT
text: We stayed at this hotel for two nights this week.   It truly was perfect!  Very clean,  well looked after.  Bellhops were very helpful,  especially Atrosi??? Sorry that is not spelled right,  but the older gentleman.   The desk staff were good.  Stacey in the concierge lounge was over the top fabulous!  Really!  So friendly and genuine,  she really cares about everyone and that you're getting everything you could want.  There was a really nice woman the first morning too, Mar 16th but only saw her once and can't remember her name.    All the food,  breakfast,  apps and deserts - all over the top delicious!  The lounge itself was amazing 👏 😍 we were away for a month and stayed at Marriotts the whole time from NB Canada to Florida and back and I have to say this propertyoutshines all the others by a long shot! Beds very comfortable.  View was amazing.   You can hear a bit from other rooms but it's not bothersome.  Location was great.   Wish I could live there!!!!  Thanks again Stacey.   We had a fun conversation with that gentleman from Albany who works for the government.  He warned me about the subway 🙂

title: Great location. Pity about the lounge
text:
Used this Marriott as our base for a weeks New York stay. It’s quiet and incredibly convenient for the subway (4 or 5 stations within a 5 minute walk)

The staff were all friendly and polite, and we really liked the fact that they would offset the compulsory $25 a night tax against food & beverage purchases. We made great use of Bills Burgers

As a Marriott Platinum member we also appreciated the check in/out flexibility and breakfast in the top floor lounge. But this also is what’s cost them a star on this review. The lounge is ONLY open Monday to Friday from breakfast until around noon. Not at all good enough. Even having the lounge available but unstaffed would have permitted a quiet relaxing space with great views and use of the computer facilities. But no

Otherwise we had a great stay and would use the hotel again for sure

title: This hotel is the best
text:
This is going to be my go-to hotel from now on. I just spent 3 days here on a business trip in a room with a king bed,  and the highlights are: ---

*QUIET, which is rare in NYC.
*Stylish, large room with roomy desk area and a lounge; 
*Only 5 or 10 minute walk to multiple subway lines, *PELOTONS in the large fitness room (!). This is also rare.
* Beautiful partial views of the Hudson.
*Efficient front desk
*scenic running route along the Hudson just a 5 minute jog away.

I have no negatives about this hotel. It was excellent. The room I had would be great for single traveler or couples

title: Great stay
text:
We stayed in the hotel for 5 nights. We had an accessible room on the 38th floor. 

The room was huge. Shower was ok but took ages to get hot water.  Probably because we were on the highest floor.

We had great views over the hudson river and harbour. 

There is a destination fee of $25 plus taxes. With this you can use it in the restaurant and giftshpp in the lobby.

Would be ideal to have prices on the drinks etc. Not sure how much things were.

Overall the hotel was comfortable. Staff friendly. 

Would highly recommend.

title: Friendly Staff!
text:
Stayed for one night recently for business and they cheerfully allowed me to check in early.  One of the nicest check in experiences I have had recently with the smiling gentleman at the front desk.
The bed was magnificent and the bathroom well appointed.  The room was on the darker side and smallish but this is Manhattan.  
I was relying on the ATM in the lobby to provide me some cash to tip appropriately but it was out of order.  I apologized profusely to the Valet for the small tip and he was  smiling and gracious.  He said that the ATM is down frequently and it hurts them.  Some of the nicest people I have encountered on my travels.

title: Service is inversely proportional to the room rate
text:
Not a good start. I arrived at 1, the room’s not ready, and the “Elite Members” check in lady was incredibly unhelpful - maybe you could offer to store the luggage I’m shlepping around-? 

I ate at the on-site restaurant, Bill’s Burgers. Worst burger sliders and chili-cheese fries I’ve ever had - stale buns, dried out, shriveled meat patties; the chili tasted like straight BBQ pork, and the whole thing was cold. 

When I checked on the room again at 2:45, the stone-faced lady at the “Elite” counter actually lectured me that the check-in time is 4:00. I asked about putting my luggage somewhere; she half-gestured towards the tree in the lobby & said I could leave it at the Bell Desk. I don’t see a Bell Desk, but I’m not going to risk further indifference by asking a question! 

…All this for the special rate of $420 per night - I can’t wait to see what’s next!

title: Highly Recommend
text:
Really impressed with this facility. Very clean, well layed out and accessible. I also consider it very central to many parts amd activities of the city.
The room(s) are slightly - but not by much - tighter than one anticipates -- it's NYC and real estate is valuable.
Beds are so comfortable. Another balanced mattress of stiffness. Top was soft that your body can mold to it and then the next layer would be more stiff. Pillows I will say were a bit too soft and fluffy for my liking - but here's the the - it's all good and I was able to fluff the pilllow how I wanted it. Linens, oh the linens. Soft, clean, crisp, fresh and plenty long to tuck my feet and arms.
Bathroom was decently sized that 3 people could easily be in there without hitting elbow.  Bathroom linens are what have this a 5 star. They are thick, heavy duty and scratchy. I like scratchy bath linens over soft and fluffy ones because I feel like I get cleaner and dryer. Shower water pressure is sufficient....but the hot water takes a long time to get heated up (if you're into hot showers).
T.V. is nice, clear clean picture. Plenty of channels to choose from. 
The gym is great. Cable machines, treadmills, free weights, Smith machine. 
Last but not least -
Staff is incredible. Very kind. Helpful. Patient. Highly recommend this for travelers.

title: Felt like a dank, dark and depressing submarine
text:
I was excited to spend two nights here in October 2021. As a Bonvoy Platinum member, my suite upgrade certificates were accepted and I was booked in a corner junior suite on the 31st floor - one of the nicest rooms on the property. 

This hotel is such a horrible disappointment. When stepping out of the elevator on the 31st floor, the hall is extremely dark and dank, reminiscent of a submarine. It was honestly creepy!
I had a large NW facing corner room with fabulous views of the Hudson River and One World Trade. Other than the fine view, the room was quite ugly. The windows do not open and the HVAC system is extremely loud. You can hear lots of noise from the hallway and the bathroom is not soundproof either. 

The bathroom must have been renovated recently and offered an excellent shower. 

Overall, this property is depressing and dated. There is no outside space to enjoy like so many other nyc hotels seem to offer now. The concierge lounge is closed on the weekends. No joy or light is found at this hotel. The staff were nice enough but don’t come across as joyful. 

There is a Starbucks in the lobby that opens at 6:30 am. 

I cannot recommend this hotel and I will never return to this property. The hotel across the street (to the north) is far superior and typically offers slightly lower room rates.

title: Not so great service. Decent facilities.
text:
Overall, the hotel has decent facilities and location. Close to subway and transportation.

I was disappointed that they closed the lounge during weekend (btw it’s also only open in the morning on weekdays). Even worse, they didn’t provide any other breakfast options included in my benefit. They said they gave me some coupons and points, but no they didn’t! I can tell from own experience that the service doesn’t live up to Marriott reputation.

title: Helpful staff
text: The desk staff was wonderful. At first we couldn’t find our reservation but with some perseverance and problem solving, we found it!  When we came in from the pouring rain soaked to the bone, they sent up towels. The woman who cleaned our room was courteous and the doorman friendly. Rooms were modern decor and very clean. We walked all over Manhattan due to the ease of access. Would definitely stay again.

title: Amie and Didi rock!
text:
(Ambassador Lifetime Titanium guest) 

I’ve been traveling to this hotel for nearly 15 years now and Amie at the front desk continues to be a standout employee who always handles my checkin and arrangements with great customer service and friendliness.  

Did in the 38th floor club lounge has also been there for years, always smiling, always greeting, always working so darn hard….she makes sure the fridge is stocked with my soy and almond milk and I’ve never missed a day without it. 

Thank you both and the rest of the staff for so many years.

title: Nice stay downtown
text: Nice hotel in the fidi area.  If you need to be downtown this hotel is clean and in a good location.  The rooms are big for New York and clean and seem recently renovated.   Check in was fast and easy.   Hot water is slow to arrive but good once it go there.

title: Family Trip to NYC
text: This was a gem!  Close to 9/11 memorial and so many other attractions.   It’s very clean and our check-in process was very smooth.  I loved the shower design as well as the water pressure.   The bed was super comfortable.  Would definitely stay here again and again.

title: Cozy Room, No Complaints
text: Our room was smaller but it was large enough for a bathroom and two queen beds so I'm not upset. Breakfast was (during covid) a paper bag with some fruit, yogurt, and a granola bar. Not much for a hungry man but there is a Dunkin Donuts across the street. It is an easy walk to major landmarks so you won't need a taxi if you are going to Battery Park, the 9-11 Memorial, One World Trade Center, or other things in the area. There are plenty of taxis that drive around so if you need to get to the airport (like I did), just stick your hand out on the curb and a car will see you and pick you up.

title: Very good room, but some issues
text:
Stayed here for the holiday weekend.  Had used "Suite Night Upgrades" and got a high corner "Junior Suite" room.  It was larger than most rooms, but oddly laid out, but 3 huge windows: 2 facing North (and the One World Trade Center building" and 1 facing West, and the Hudson River and Jersey City.

No Platinum Breakfast as Bill's Bar and Burger isn't fully open yet (although Starbucks is) so a lousy 750 points instead, and no Concierge lounge yet, either.  They do offer daily housekeeping, which some places don't do, and our room was ready when we arrived at 11AM which was nice.  

We parked across West Street using Spot Hero for $33/night, a good price in NYC.

Room was comfortable, views of Ellis Island and West Street and One World Tower, and a great view of New Jersey fireworks on the Hudson River.  Room was nice and dark for sleeping, comfy bed, good HVAC, and quite except when people were in the hallway right outside our door.  Good shower, too.

title: Reopened - Modest Expectations
text:
At the open I am a Titanium Elite (Lifetime) and thankful that NYC is slowly reopening; so, let’s frame these comments in that context. 

We stayed at this property for several evenings over the 4th of July weekend.  It’s clear that this property is straining under the reopen and is thinly staffed.  Several items of concern:

- There is no valet despite what the property website states and upon check-in the front desk staff mumbles (literally) options on where you can park. C’mon - update the property listing and give us options on your site. The QR code that you provide doesn’t work and we’re now paying $65.00/night at your recommended garage. 

- Concierge Lounge is not open. Again, I am sure this is a staffing issue; but, again update the property listing and level set our expectations. Being delivered this news upon check-in is unacceptable. 

- I used Suite Upgrade awards for this stay and all I received was a room with a harbor view. No offense; but, as an Elite Member this should had been an automatic upgrade and a Suite Upgrade should had been a larger room (in addition to a view). A complete waste and more importantly the front desk staff was indifferent and simply don’t care. 

- Property restaurants have limited hours and minimally staffed - plan accordingly.

title: It's Okay!
text: The hotel and the room was fine, ample space for NYC. We were a family of four. The staff at registration was friendly and very patient with all the guests, even the unreasonable ones. The thing is, the parking garage across the street has partnered with Marriot, but it's not theirs. So they don't control the process or their hours of operation. I imagine it's probably very frustrating to explain the parking process and arrangement to all the guests over and over again. And despite the annoyance of having to get the ticket stamped for parking, it's still cheaper to park there with in and out privileges than elsewhere. So I appreciated that. However, I do find the entrance very unfriendly. There was no ramp to pull my luggage, and no doorman to help either. Plus, the two set of doors were super heavy, so getting into the hotel with all my stuff and up those stairs was quite difficult. So it's not very accessible. I definitely think the hotel can improve on that by adding a ramp, and maybe automatic doors?

title: Average hotel, nice view
text:
Room/Location:

I recently spent a few days here and my stay was mostly pleasant. The location has nice views from the top floors and lots of dining options in the area. It is very easy to walk or use the subway to get to other spots in the city. 

The room was fairly modern with my only issue being spots where paint was peeling in a corner.  There was a small refrigerator and coffee in the room. but not being a coffee drinker,  I wondered if Marriot would go bankrupt if they decided to  include 2 complimentary bottles of water.  Being thirsty and tired from  long drive, I had no choice but to purchase water from the hotel @ $3.50 for a 16 ounce bottle.  I also found a few strands of hair in the bathroom and on the bed. I assumed that it was from the cleaning person and put my travelling companion Lysol spray into use.

Parking & WIFI: I booked a package with free self parking and WIFI, but it does not seem like some of these details were transferred to the hotel. 

Upon checking in, I requested the parking location and received a reminder to validate upon checkout. The free WIFI signal was very reliable compared to other hotels, however upon checkout, I was told that I had quite a few internet charges. I mentioned that it should be free and the attendant immediately replied asking why was it free. Of course WIFI was free for Bonvoy members (which I am) and it was also part of my almost $200/night  package. I wonder why she did not ask if I was a Bonvoy member or why she did not check my reservation details. 

Staff: Housekeeping and desk staff were friendly.

title: Great place to stay!
text: My stay at the New York Marriott downtown was great!  The hotel is in a very convenient location near multiple train and bus stations so it is easy to get to wherever you need and it is especially convenient to the 9/11 Memorial and museum.   The building is well insulated and quiet at night which resulted in great rest.   Staff was friendly and on point and rooms were clean and welcoming.  Great job!

title: Overdelivered...
text: Stayed only one night as a last minute stay and wow!! We were really pleasantly surprised by this hotel.  We typically stay at the FS downtown and this was almost as good.  Obviously, this is not a Luxury property but the rooms were decorated nicely and very very clean.  Had a very nice short stay.  Only annoying thing is that there is still no valet.  You have to park in a garage across the way.  Its time for the Covid related items to return.

title: Nicely remold and excellent location
text:
We had a corner room with water view from both side.  I wish the bed were Queen instead of double. 
The area felt safe and easy to walk to many attractions, restaurants and trains.  Lot if things close early around. The room were clean and covid protocol were in-place.

title: Out in the rain...
text:
Do NOT book this hotel. The hotel might be beautiful but the customer service leaves much to be desired.    

This is a warning to my fellow travelers of the Courtyard  by Marriott at 133 Greenwich Street and of the New York Marriott Downtown at 85 West Street. 

Let me begin by saying that I travel often and am not the type of traveler who typically wastes time leaving reviews on the service I receive, no matter how horrible...The customer service in this case was, however, unconscionably poor and egregious

Long story short, I travelled internationally for my birthday. Made reservations to stay at the Courtyard by Marriott New York through Booking.com. Apparently the Courtyard by Marriott had been closed down since the beginning of COVID, and so the fact that I was able to make reservations in the first place is mind boggling. I only learned that my reservation had been cancelled when I showed up to the Courtyard after traveling for 10 hours (might I add in the pouring rain) and found the outside of the hotel shuttered up. A gentleman outside told me the hotel had been shut down, and pointed me in the direction of the New York Marriott Downtown instead. 

What ensued was passive aggressive and poor communication by the front desk staff at the New York Marriott Downtown, hours spent on the phone with Booking.com attempting to resolve the issue, and a bill three times what I had planned to pay. 

Take my word for it, from one frequent traveler to the next, avoid the Courtyard by Marriott and the New York Downtown Marriott. These hotels have no ethic and will leave you out in the rain.

title: Great Hotel and Location
text: Hotel was clean, staff was friendly, and rooms were spacious. Location is convenient and very safe. There is a parking garage next door and across the street. Room faced the river and the sunset was unbelievable.

title: Nice Hotel, But...
text:
Very nice hotel; as expected of a Marriott, fine spacious rooms, clean and in a great location. Parking is crazy (a NYC norm!) 
Selected for single night get-away because it was a great value (as hotels in business/financial districts on the weekends typically are)...
We were even able to easily get a late check out...

But, major “fail” by the staff makes us wonder...
About an hour after we checked we asked for an ice bucket...
...followed up on the ice bucket about 30-40 minutes later was told it was coming...
...got dressed to go out, stopped at the front desk on the way out and offered my sympathies for the hard times given the ice bucket shortage, was assured one would be left in our room...
...returned from an evening out, 
still no ice bucket...
...preparing to check out and depart, 
still no ice bucket.
Believe it or not, I was able to park our big SUV on the street for free the entire weekend and it was easier to find parking spaces than it was to get an ice bucket at the Marriott...

title: Nice Renovations
text: One night sat feb stay 2 pm check in, really cheap rate but still no hotel services they had just reopened restaurant to indoor dining.  Another TA reviewer mentioned bring your own ice and I am glad I did since it wasn’t available.  Renovations are great, room is big for NYC and everything was spotless.  Only issue was smell of pot on our floor when we got off elevators, and again in middle of the night the smell woke me up, seems to be a problem everywhere in NYC now.  I would definitely stay here again without the pot smoke.

title: Solid Place...Great Location
text:
My son and I wanted to visit Ellis Island and decided to spend a long weekend in NY.   Midtown no longer seems appealing given the state of the city so the Marriott Downtown was perfect.    Right across from Brookfield Place and Battery Park City there was plenty of stores and restaurants nearby that were open and serving.   I liked the redesigned Marriott app and the more reliable mobile key option.   Just one less person to interact with during the pandemic.   

We had a room on the 32nd floor with a view of the harbor and Statue of Liberty.   The room was clean-ish but not great.   Hotels are in a tough spot so I’ll cut them slack on my normal expectations.    Our room was at the end of the hall and pitch dark.  I asked someone at the desk to have the bulbs replaced but never happened.  I had to use my phone light to see the room number and key sensor.   Minor items in the big picture.   

Ate on sight at Bills Bar one night.   Food and staff were fantastic.
