Overall, a good property in a good location.   I’d recommend staying here and look forward to my next visit.

title: Upscale hotel in great location
text: I liked my stays. The location was very good. The staff were nice and friendly. The front desk staff were well compliant to the mask regulations to both staff and customers, and follow Covid testing requests to customers. The housekeeping staff responded quick to our needs. The room is nice and clean with gorgeous view. Thisworks products are used in bathroom. I would choose the hotel again.

title: Good hotel currently under construction
text: No breakfast or other perks of being a Platinum Elite member. Given COVID, My review has nothing to do with that. The hotel was half updated and half outdated. They were doing heavy construction and the night I checked in, the key card program wasn't working so I had to be escorted to my room by security who opened it up. The room itself is beautiful and lots of money was spent to revamp the rooms for a nice, spacious decorous room with a fantastic view of NYC/Hudson River. In the future, a breakfast credit at the Starbucks in the building would have been nice for Platinum members or to-go bags. Once they finish construction, I'm sure it will be a more pleasant stay for others.

title: #safecation :)
text: Stayed here over the weekend, the king room, harbor view is nice. No breakfast/gym due to pandemic. Regardless of your elite status, they don't make up for those things not even water. You just basically get a room for the price you pay. I can't help but compare the hotel to Holoday Inn that offers goodie breakfast bag every morning instead of breakfast buffet. The hotel is situated in nice area walkable to many good restaurants and shops. Also, the entrance revolving door is not working. And the door is not automatic so you have to pull or push the doors to enter the property.

title: Hell of a stay!
text:
The worse service in my life! I travel a lot for work and it’s not my first Marriott hotel. I had issues before, but at least managers of previous locations would gladly solve any problems. Well... in this case manager propose me and my boyfriend one free night. We moved 4 times to different rooms. Each room had multiple issues. Starting from enormous size cockroaches in two rooms running around my clothes and furniture. Moving to rooms with dirty floors with footprints and food crumbles. On top of that 3 rooms smelled like mold because of air conditioning leaks and wet carpets. I was very nice the first two night and ask very politely to switch our room. During our 3rd I just had to pack in the middle of night and move to the different room that also had issues! The best part is that manager told us that this hotel just reopened and this is their excuse for all problems. 

Oh and here is a picture of our roommate,who showed up next to our bed in the middle of the night! The size of our buddy is about 2 quarters

title: SUPER RECOMENDADO
text: Estuvimos desde el 31 de diciembre de 2019 al 6 de enero de 2020. El personal muy atento y agradable. La habitación cómoda e impecable al igual que el baño. La ubicación en el distrito financiero, a unas cuadras del metro y del world trade center. Excelente opción y precio. Super recomendado.

title: Great Hotel for what it is
text: This hotel provides everything a good hotel should. The standards I keep Marriott to is pretty high considering I travel to many other Marriott properties this hotel is no exception my one bedroom view displayed the world trade center, as this may be one side of the building this was an extra for me as I love traveling back to New York. There is no pool however this should not turn you away from staying here. The in hotel restaurant at the back is good with a good selection of choices and variety. I did not get to try the Bar/restaurant however I would expect this to keep to the Marriott standards as well. I would definitely recommend to stay here in attendance either for leisure or Business travel this hotel provides a fair and centrally located stay with a short walk to the amazon prime store or the 9/11 museum this hotel is a sensible choice for anyone traveling to New York

title: Pricey but good location close to the Statue of Liberty.
text: We stayed here for one night.  We ate in the hotel at Bill's Bar and Burger.  It was good.     Wifi was god.   There was a refrigerator in the room.  The location in very good.  We walked out at night and felt safe.   It was a beautiful night and the area around was well lit.  Walked down to the water and to a small park.    There is a $17.21 Resort fee but they give you a food and beverage credit that nearly covers it.

title: Good if you have allergies
text: We stayed at this Marriott for a day. Clean and no carpet. I have severe asthma and allergies so I was able to stay the night without problems. You have to let them know you want a hypoallergenic room.

title: Great views of Man and Jersey City
text:
Spacey affordable rooms with spectacular views. Sunset and sunrise color games are not to be missed
Good restaurant downstairs and friendly staff
The extra fifth bed was a bit small though
Have not tried breakfast

title: Incredible views of Downtown NYC
text:
Stayed at the downtown Marriott for two nights (weekend), very pleased.  Since we have a toddler, we try to reserve a suite whenever possible. The rate for a weekend in New York for an actual suite with a closed door living area was very reasonable here, so we selected the river view. The room was incredible - by any standards, but particularly New York standards, it was a absolutely massive. A comfortable king bedroom, attached full bath, extra half bath, full dining room and living room with optional pull out couch and doors to close off the room. TVs in each room. 180 degree views of Battery Park as well as the Hudson.  Our little one had so much space to run around, and we were just a few blocks walk from our reason for visiting.  We also really enjoyed the Bill’s restaurant in the lobby. 
Our only negatives were 1) the lack of water pressure in the shower, which didn’t change depending on time of day and 2) the painfully constant pixelating of the cable television. It was basically unwatchable. Thank goodness for the streaming options available.

title: Look elsewhere
text:
We did not have a terrible experience but MANY things left us regretting our stay, wishing we stayed elsewhere 

The location is very nice for seeing World Trade Center, shopping at Century 21, and walking around Battery Park. Enjoy the Sea Glass Carousel. 

Unfortunately...
There are STAIRS in lobby, right inside the door. And while there is a doorman or two, they are not eager to help you with your luggage, or stroller. There is a “handicap accessible” elevator - a tiny little thing over to the right, but it wasn’t working. 

The stairs are frustrating, and the lobby is just kind of small and depressing. Low ceilings. The lobby area is over full most of the time, with no where to sit or relax for a moment. If you are in the hotel, plan to be in your room. 

We reserved a room with two beds. If you’re traveling as a family or a group of friends, take notice that these are DOUBLE beds, not queen beds. They will not be big enough to fit two normal sized people. The room is only big enough for two. The beds are very soft. If you like or need a firm bed for sleeping, you won’t sleep well here. 

Inside the room, there is a bright light on the wall outside bathroom door, probably to indicate where the bathroom is and bathroom light is, but because of the light the room can not get dark. 

The bathroom light switch is outside the bathroom door which makes for an unpleasant room sharing experience if anyone has to use the toilet overnight. 

The shower door is on rollers and would not stay shut. It rolled open half a dozen times during my shower before I wet a washcloth and jammed it in behind the roller. 

There is no vent fan so your steamy bathroom remains steamy. Forget putting on makeup in there. And too bad for you if you get the second shower.

There is no vanity kit (sewing kit, emory board, shower cap, shoe mit) in the bathroom. If you need it you will have to bring it or buy it. I tore a nail on the way to the hotel and needed an Emory board. I looked in the bathroom and called guest services. They said that I might be able to buy one in the lobby. I went to the front desk where they gave me a “complimentary” sewing kit and told me I can buy the Emory board. Our first stop on our big NYC getaway was Duane Reade. Awesome.

Finally the $25 fee. Others have said enough about this. We got some hot cocoa and coffee, and a keepsake mug, at Starbucks. I haven’t been to Starbucks in several years, but hey, they $25 was gone one way or another.

title: remodeled successfully
text: the room was remodeled successfully with very comfortable beds and solid wood floor. No concierge lounge. In week days, Marriott platinum members and above can have free breakfast in restaurant (one side and one entree) plus 750 points. In weekend, the benefit is free breakfast or 750 points. next to rector street station of metro 1 line.

title: Tres bonne situation et confortable 👍🇱🇷
text:
Séjour en famille nouvel an 2020
Chambre très confortable, surtout la literie 
Très propre 
Très belle vue sur l’Hudson river 
Situation à 2 pas du WORLD TRADE CENTER et WALL STREET 
Quartier calme le soir 
Nombreux restos à proximité 
Personnel réception aimable et efficace 
A recommander 👍👍👍

title: Skip the Marriott Downtown
text: We are frequent visitors to NYC, particularly Battery Park, and decided to use Marriott points to try out the Downtown Marriott. We won’t be returning. As we entered the hotel, we encountered stairs rather than a ramp to carry up our suitcases. Taped across the stairs was a make-shift extension cord to light the Christmas trees on either side of the landing. This, combined with the “phoning it in” demeanor of the Front Desk staff quickly alerted us to the fact that this was not the 4 star hotel it claims to be. Despite our platinum status, we were given a room next to the ice machine, which unlike any other hotel at which we’ve stayed, was not housed in a separate room, but was free standing in the hallway. We not only heard its users all hours of the night, but the works of its machinery all day and night. If you’re traveling to NYC and/or Battery Park, stay at The Wagner. Its ambiance, accommodations and service are light years better than the Marriott Downtown. The room prices and offers are better as well.

title: Gutes Hotel im Financial District
text: Angenehmes Hotel direkt neben Ground Zero. Nur 3 Minuten zum Battery Park und somit zu Big Bus Tours und zur Fähre nach Ellis Island. Schöne Zimmer, leider wenig Schrank-Platz für Kleidung. Concierge Lounge am Wochenende geschlossen, sonst aber sehr gutes Essen für Platin+ Members.

title: Bien situé
text: Nous avons séjourné au Marriott Downtown au début de décembre. L'hôtel est bien situé, près de "Ground zero", et il y a plusieurs restaurants près de l'hôtel. Les chambres sont spacieuses et bien aménagées, propres. Nous avons pu prendre un verre de vin dans un petit salon au niveau de la mezzanine. Plusieurs connexions usb sont disponibles dans la chambre pour brancher les appareils.

title: New Year’s Trip to NYC
text: Room was clean and contemporary. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Good burger restaurant on property was very convenient. Only negative was that one elevator wasn’t working and the wait to get up and down was long sometimes.

title: Warm hospitality
text: We stayed as a family in adjoining rooms-excellent stay thankyou! All the staff including in Bill's Burger restaurant were welcoming and helpful. The rooms were comfortable and well equipped with stunning views. Would highly recommend staying here.

title: Best Xmas Ever!!
text:
If you want a place where the staff are exceptional, honest and hardworking... Do not look anywhere else. We had an issue with payment (not that we couldn't pay!) and the manager (Am 28th December) looked after us and made sure we didn't need to worry... Forgot time Square, you'll want to visit rather than stay. Perfect location - perfect place. I will really miss the hotel... I rarely say that (see previous posts)

Thank you again...

title: December 2019 early Christmas vacation
text: We stayed in a 2 double bed on 28th floor with views of The Statue of Liberty. The beds and pillows were very comfortable. The hotel staff was helpful and friendly. The hotel is a short walk to the 9-11 memorial and Battery Park. There is an additional fee per day to be aware of and there are no rollaway beds available. Overall we were pleased with our stay.

title: Beware of “destination fee”
text: We had a very unfortunate and unpleasant experience over the mandatory destination fee of $25 per day charged on top of the normal room rate. It is supposed to “compensate” expenses incurred at the hotel, but the options for spending $25 per day at the hotel are very limited and poor. When I went to ask if there are other options for the “credit”, I was told by a receptionist that the destination fee was mentioned in the reservation, which was not the case in my reservation. I didn’t appreciate the fact that they tried to blame me for not reading the non- existing clause in the reservation. It is a very upsetting episode of our family vacation when we are supposed to be happily celebrating Christmas, instead of arguing over non- existing clause with the hotel receptionist.

title: Enjoy holidays
text: It was excellent service and staff was really co operative he cleanness was way better that bother flights it was Amazing experience I will definitely recommend trip advisor because they are providing cheap flights as well

title: City Hotel
text: Downtown business like hotel. Comfortable double room and clean. Not much to say about it - as it was pretty standard. No complaints about it. Staff were really good and helpful though. You also pay a $25 charge which covers wifi and some other stuff but you also get to spend it at the inhouse Starbucks and the Bill's restaurant.

title: Girls weekend getaway
text: Stayed in a 2-double bed room with 4 ladies. It was surprisingly spacious, had a mini fridge (extremely tiny) and comfortable beds.  Queen beds would have been preferred but we made do.  We had a few needs which required multiple calls to housekeeping to bring extra items and they were answered promptly with no trouble at all.  There is a tourist tax that is payable each day but the hotel offered some complimentary bonuses to compensate for the tax.  This is a very nice touch.  I am not sure if other hotels do the same.  We enjoyed the bonus $25/day credit and either ordered food from the hotel restaurant or used the $ for coffee and a souvenirs from Starbucks.  We received the $25 credit even for the day we checked out which was nice.  We were offered the complimentary hop-on/hop-off bus tickets which we took but didn’t end up using because it started to rain.  Ubered instead as we didn’t want to wait for the bus to arrive. We were on one of the top floors so the view from the room was nice and was quiet.  The location was fine for us as we took the metro every where.  Quite convenient to many tourist places without living in the heart at Times Square.  All in all it was a great hotel - no complaints.  We would definitely stay here again.

title: Renovated floor 14
text: Stayed in a recently renovated room on 14th floor. Comfy bed and well appointed. Crazy number of outlets and chargers. Elevator is horribly slow. Hotel restaurant was nice option for business lunch. Good perks for Marriott members. $25 resort fee is nonsense.

title: Marriott is making it tough to stay
text: This is more of a complaint against the newer Bonvoy program and its effect on staying here.  Between work and privately I’ve stayed here well over 30 times.  However, things have changed.  The newer interior decor is cold and uninviting. (Rooms).  The 1/2 bare flooring in the rooms appears marked up and hence dirty (honestly I’d rather have it hidden in carpet).  The hotel itself charges you a “destination fee” that I’ve discussed with upper managers with Bonvoy.  It was $15/night just last year and now $25/night.  This is a scam to get you to spend that money at the hotel - as it’s effectively a credit you can spend against when billing charges from the restaurant/Starbucks to your room.  Regardless you are charged extra for it.  Again, I’ve taken it up with Bonvoy and they had to agree with me after I compared other Marriott charges in NYC and pointed out other chains don’t charge this.  So.......would I stay here again?   Yes as I love it’s location and full size hotel rooms.   The Bill’s Burger restaurant in the lobby is very good as well. The front staff don’t seem to really want to be there and handle you like a robot.  They thank you for being a gold member but then forget to give to your check in water etc.   The rooms are relatively quiet and some have nice views.  Lots of hot water and elevators take a reasonable time to summon.

title: Great spot for a weekend getaway
text:
Normally if we stay in the city we get a hotel in midtown. This time, since we planned to see the 9/11 memorial and battery park, we chose a downtown hotel. The Marriott was excellent. I selected one of the Harbor View rooms, which with a pre-pay rate was still pretty good for the city. The views of the Statue of Liberty, Governor’s Island, the harbor and the Hudson River were fantastic. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable with a nice couch along the window. The staff throughout the hotel are excellent. There is a Bills Burger restaurant and a Starbucks within the building. Both are tied to the hotel for room charges. 

The hotel is a two block walk north to the 9/11 Memorial and a three block walk south to Batter Park. 

The concierge room is on the top floor and has the same Harbor view. The concierge breakfast was very good and the Starbucks automated coffee machine is available all day.

title: Awesome location and phenomenal customer service
text: I have stayed at a number of Marriott hotels in NYC.  This is a hotel I regularly stay at on both business and personal with my family of four, for a couple of reasons.  The hotel is very clean, has spacious rooms, and very easy to jump on a train to get just about anywhere.  They also take elite members seriously, and I was upgraded to a room with a nice view and spacious for my family, on multiple occasions.  The service has been impeccable.  Many of the other hotels I've stayed at nearby are either very small or are dated, or have disinterested staff.  As a top tier elite member for many years I have experience with many many Marriott properties and this is at the top of the list.  Thank you Marriott NYC downtown!

title: Clean, comfortable and close to many things!
text: I stayed here for a business trip and was very satisfied with the property. It was extremely clean and very comfortable. Check in was very easy. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were a great size, considering it's NYC and rooms are typically small. I didn't eat at the hotel, with the exception of Starbucks. The hotel is within walking distance to the Freedom Tower and the WTC Memorial, as well as Battery Park and the Statue of Liberty ferry. My coworker and I even walked through the financial district where there was lots of night life.

title: Water Views and steps to Freedom Tower
text: This recently renovated Marriott property is extremely convenient for navigating Manhattan downtown and surrounding neighborhoods. The rooms are sleek and modern in style. Mine had excellent views of the Hudson. I'm guessing that there are some rooms that look out on the statue -- no such luck for me, but a great view nonetheless. Service was outstanding. Marriott club members receive $25 credit to spend on room service, starbucks or bar on property as well as a complimentary bottle of wine. West side highway access makes for quick transit to and from LaGuardia (if that existed) and the 9/11 memorial is literally steps from the hotel. Highly recommend.

title: Hotel tout confort avec vue à couper le souffle!
text:
Nous avons passé 4 nuits au Marriot, dans une des suites située au 37ème étage. L’intérieur est soigné et très propre, salle de bain agréable, petit frigo, grand écran de tv, literie ultra moelleuse mais c'est bel et bien la vue sur l'Hudson et surtout le One World Trade Center qui fut le plus impressionnant! Nous ne nous en sommes jamais lassé, purement incroyable!
Seul bémol, mais qui est valable pour la ville voir le pays: pas le moindre effort en francais, vraiment aucun....
Je lui donne malgré cela 5 étoiles, rien que pour la vue, un souvenir gravé à vie. ;-)

title: Excellent service
text: We stayed here for a wedding in New York. The service at the hotel was absolutely fantastic. The bellman were right on top of everything, from getting a taxi for us, to holding doors to bringing luggage to the room and down. There's a Starbucks in the hotel which was perfect for us. The rooms were really nice, and the bathroom was updated and beautiful. I would stay here again anytime. It's a block from the freedom tower too.

title: Hotel 4* très bonne prestation proche du World Trade Center . A recommander .
text: Nous avons séjourné au Marriott NY avec une prestation agence de voyage France Marathon . Rien à dire tout était impeccable . Très belle chambre spacieuse et lumineuse . Literie king size avec belle salle de bain avec toutes les commodités . Le petit déjeuner étant servis au bill's Burger attenant l' hôtel . Très belle prestation sur cet hôtel proche du World Trade Center . ( 400m ) . Personnel accueillant et disponible . Cette hôtel dispose d'une salle de sport avec appareils haut de gamme . La prestation est en rapport avec le prix journalier demandé . Parking à l'arrière de l'hôtel non utilisé .

title: Business trip stay - clean, updated and quiet
text: Here on a three day work trip and met all our needs.  Check in/check out was a breeze with an extremely helpful staff.  Room was clean and extremely quiet.  In many business hotels I frequent, the interior noise from the AC is quite loud trying to keep the room cool, but here it was unnoticeable.  It's a pretty small positive thing to mention, but sometimes it's the little things that make countless nights in hotels memorable.  Stayed in room 1011 overlooking the Hudson

title: Tres tres bien
text: L'hôtel est neuf, propre, très joli, situé dans un quartier sympa et à découvrir. Belle deco, superbe view...bref rien à dire. En plus, ils offrent de petits/grands plus comme par example un tout de la ville inclus (possible cheque jour). Je le conseille vraiment.

title: Stay was fine and worth the price
text: Location is quite convenient. Isaac was really helpful with the luggage. I would highly recommend this property if you are planning to explore midtown Manhattan. The hotel is quite old but well justified by its price.

title: Worst hotel ever visited
text:
As a Marriott bonvoy ambassador,  I travel weekly and see all levels of Marriott brands and the standard of service expected. This hotel is by far the worst I have ever experienced due to rude staff. We travel as part of a corporate flight crew, I had a reservation at this hotel for 4 nights. Due to an unexpected schedule change my colleague operated the flight to NYC and I sent her all the details for the hotel reservation. 

When she arrived, my colleague was told the room I booked she could not have and she had to make a completely new reservation (at double the cost) Not only did they cancel my whole reservation they charged me $623.00. Then my colleague a further $350 I assume for the exact same room. I was told the reception staff had a terrible attitude and were so rude to my colleagues. After several emails from their general account I have now hit a brick wall. I have never been so disappointed with the marriott brand. This hotel doesn't deserve the name above the door - its values and loyalty to its members mean nothing. Save your money and stay somewhere were you are valued.

title: Great Hotel!
text: Stayed here for one night during a business trip and would highly recommend this property.  It's a great hotel with updated, comfortable rooms.  The on site restaurant/bar is great.  It's also a great location in downtown Manhattan (near Ground Zero and the Statue of Liberty).  There is also a full serve Starbucks on site!  It's a great place.

title: hotel confortavel
text: hotel tem camas confortaveis, quartos novos predio bem pratico, otima localização perto do memorial do word trade center, apesar de nao ser na times square ele tem estação de metro bem proximo ao hotel que te levam em 15 minutos ao centro da times square, funcionarios atenciosos em lhe atender, recomendo.

title: Our stay there was fine.
text:
So the hotel looks quiet old, but the rooms are fresh and modern. 
Beds were soft and comfortable. 
The sunset view was just perfect!
5 mins walk to the battery park.
Breakfast was huuuge!) Got some omelette made of 6 or 8 eggs)

title: Solid and nice but...
text:
I started staying at this hotel for business trips to NY. After two stays, I can say that overall, the rooms are nice, spacious, clean, and updated.  There’s a Starbucks in the lobby as well which is convenient.  

My one complaint is that after checking in I went to my room and discovered two beds instead of a king (which I had booked). When I went back to the desk the lady was nice and moved me to a higher floor with a view but I was a bit perturbed that she didn’t let me know that my room did not have a king bed BEFORE I went up.  

Also, it’d be nice if the hotel included one free bottle of water in the room (like Westin properties do).

title: Great location to visit 9/11 Memorial and Museum
text: Nice modern, clean room on 28th floor with good view of the Hudson and Ellis Island. A block from WTC sites and Freedom Tower. Battery Park across the street with restaurants and shops along the river. Good breakfast in "Bill's" on site.

title: Very nice full service hotel!
text: We recently stayed here and the experience was excellent!  Rooms are clean and spacious, fitness center is really nice with lots of equipment, attached restaurant is great, modern amenities - great location is lower Manhatten near Freedom Tower.  Loved it!   hohohoh2o

title: Great location
text:
We had a Harborview room on the 37th floor. Being able to wake up and see the Statue of Liberty from your bed is pretty amazing. The view of one World Trade Center getting off the elevator is very impressive. 
Check in was quick and courteous. Bell staff was great with helping to store bags and get rides around town and to JFK. They have a Suburban to get you to JFK for $20 less than the Uber X price. 
Room was nice and very clean. Spacious for downtown new York. This is one of the few times where I can say the room looked exactly like the online pics. 
Good burger restaurant on property and anything else you would need is within a few 100 feet of the hotel.

title: Great accommodations - great bar
text: Had a lovely room with a view of the Hudson River.  The hotel was very clean and up to date.  Nice little restaurant bar connected.  Conference room accommodations were nice and the catering was very well done

title: Fabulous Stay
text:
We had a certificate for a 35,000 point hotel, so we chose the NY Marriott Downtown for a quick weekend getaway.  Upon check-in, the GM left us a bottle of wine and we were given a very nice corner room on the 38th floor (3802) with spectacular views of the WTC.  The room was large by NY standards.  We had a family of 4 in one room without any issues.  The hotel is modern and clean.  Nice sized bathroom with good water pressure and plenty of hot water.  

Unfortunately, the lounge was closed for the weekend.  However, they provided free breakfast for us in the restaurant which was tasty and the restaurant had good service.  

All in all, we had a great stay without any complaints and would not hesitate to return again.  Highly recommend for business travel or if you would like to visit Downtown.

title: Location not to be beat in WTC area
text:
Chose this hotel for a weekend trip to NYC with my girlfriend, who had never spent time there.  We were going to focus an entire day on the WTC site, and this hotel is directly across from the site, making access wonderful, as well as giving you access to the financial district and Battery Park City - a great little neighborhood on the Hudson tucked away in downtown with great restaurants and wonderful promenade along the river.

The new MBTA station is also 2 blocks from the hotel so getting there by mass transit is easy.

The hotel?  New and clean, although construction at ground level made finding the entrance a little challenging at first.  Rooms are small but well thought out in terms of efficient floor plans with great views (we were in a corner room on the 25th floor).  The king-sized bed was very comfortable as were the pillows.  Nice walk-in shower with great water pressure and plenty of hot water.

I'd skip the breakfast on the sixth floor in favor of any one of a number of places with better food for the same price.   Although go there for coffee and take in the view from the deck that overlooks the WTC site.

All in all a good value for a clean, comfortable hotel in the financial district.

title: 感謝萬豪大使團隊的協助，最棒的視野、交通便利最美好的位置。
text: 感謝萬豪大使團隊 Alan 的細心安排，安排的哈德遜河景的位置，感受到曼哈頓的美好氛圍，尤其是一下樓就可以看到令人讚嘆的高樓大廈，以及非常安全的小區，離華爾街金牛非常近，是個非常適合入住的飯店。尤其Lounge 的 happy hour 更是一級棒，是個下次再次入住的首選之地。

title: Hôtel assez bien
text:
Nous avons passé un séjour de 5 jours hôtel idéalement placé au cœur de manathan 
Les plus belle chambre bon petit déjeuner 
Les moins bruyant du aux climatiseurs new-yorkais 
Je recommande personnel à l’écoute et très agréable mais aucun effort pour les français

title: Avoid adjoining rooms!
text: Perfectly decent hotel but my 3 night stay was disturbed because I could hear very clearly everything going on in the adjoining room next to me.  The couple next to me on the first night seemed to be having an excellent time but I had a hard time sleeping though it.  The gentleman on his own for the following two nights was a little more peaceful but I didn’t really want to listen to his various phone calls at 6am.  Really don’t expect that these days in hotels whose main purpose is to give weary travellers decent rest.

title: NYC Marriott Downtown
text: Very nice hotel for our purposes as tourist seeing the various sites of NYC.  Very friendly and helpful staff.  The room was spacious, by NYC standards, clean and in good repair.  The location is also very good, near Wall Street and the 911 Memorial.  We would stay there again and recommend it to our friends.

title: Great location and staff
text: I used to stay at this hotel before 9/11 when it was called Marriott World Financial Center.  Now with the renovations this is a great spot if you want to be near Battery Park and Wall Street.  The lounge is small but the staff are excellent along with the food and beverage.  Try to get a room facing west so you can get better views!

title: Wonderful value and service.
text:
Wonderful check in staff.

Given an upgrade corner suite due to platinum elite status.

Lounge is decent with wonderful staff. Great breakfast options.

Very clean and family friendly.

Will gladly return.

title: Per visitare Downtown
text: Classico Marriott in ottima posizione a 100 metri dal WTC e dalla relativa fermata della metropolitana, consigliato per visitare la parte bassa della città fino al GREENWICH VILLAGE, restando in un ambiente meno caotico della zona di Times Square (raggiungibile in 20 minuti di metropolitana). Stanze recentemente rimodernate secondo i nuovi standard Marriott e pulite. Personale cortese e professionale. Lounge non in linea con gli standard per pulizia, scarsità di scelta e reintegro dei cibi mancanti. La colazione viene servita nel pub Bill' Bar & Burger ed è esclusivamente di tipo americano (con tempi di attesa da ristorante).

title: Great place to stay
text:
We love staying here 
Close to subway 
Battery Park is a  awesome place to visit 
Kids love it 
Great breakfast 
Rooms are an nice size for NY
Staff is amazing so helpful  
Beds are so comfy 
Great hairdryer not need to bring your own

title: Location!!!
text: Great location in close proximity to many attractions including the 9/11 memorial, Trinity Church, Wall St, NYSE and the water. The rooms were very clean, comfortable and the staff did everything possible to be accommodating. Some rooms have amazing views and others are slightly obstructed but still good.

title: Next to the World Trade Center
text: Very good hotel. If you are going to spend time in the south of Manhattan this hotel is a very good option. It is very close to the World Trade Center, 5 minutes walk. Wall Street and Brooklyn are also close. Rooms are nice and clean. Front desk was fast for checking in and checking out. Staff was friendly.

title: Business Trip to Beautiful Lower Manhattan and the Financial District!
text:
Phenomenal hotel right in the heart of Beautiful Lower Manhattan and the Financial District!  Close to the 9/11 Memorial and the areas wonderful shopping.  A short walk to Battery Park, excellent dining on the Pier and just around the corner from Wall Street and the iconic bull, the property offers qucik access to the local attractions.  

The Hotel itself offers great amenities from the newly desinged wrokout facility and the excellent dining options to the Fed-Ex and Starbucks locations located downstairs!  The hotel boasts a wonderful contemporary design and easy access to the wonders of the city, and comes highly recommended!

title: Very nice
text:
I don’t normally stay this far south, but this was a work trip and my business was at the World Trade Center. This hotel is very conveniently located. The hotel itself is very nice, and I appreciate that it has a Starbucks and a good - but not fancy – restaurant inside.  

The room is a good size, especially for New York. I ended up in a corner room that had a great view of the World Trade Center – as well as the Empire State Building off in the distance. The room was clean. The water pressure in the shower was decent. The water pressure in the sink could be better, but it was due to the faucet style. I also appreciated that the bathroom was good sized. There was no bathtub, which could be a problem for some people. For some reason, the room got very hot at night. We never did figure out why, But it happened to both nights.

I had lounge access, and had breakfast in the lounge one morning. It was very good, with a lot of options. I wish Marriott would carry both Coke and Pepsi products, however. 

The staff was very friendly and helpful. The bellman on duty when we arrived went above and beyond. He helped us bring the stroller up the stairs (there is an elevator, but it was locked). Then he went to find a box of cars, and allowed my son to pick one to keep. My son loves cars more than anything in the world, and this was probably the highlight of his trip!

title: Great location to Visit the 9/11 Memorial
text: We stayed here one night as a base for visiting the 9/11 Memorial and Museum, which is a short two block walk.  The room was modern, clean, and well equipped.  We had driven over 9 hours that day and were happy to valet the car and check in.  Valet is not cheap, even for NYC.  It was $75 dollars because we had a large SUV.  We took our bags through the front door and were confronted with an out of service elevator which would have saved us lugging heavy suitcases up 8 stairs to the lobby level.  As a senior with back issues, this created an unnecessary challenge.  The elevator was still out of service the next day when we checked out, again necessitating lugging the suitcases down the stairs.   We  were tired after the long drive and didn't want to eat dinner out. There is a restaurant at the hotel which is primarily a sports and burger bar.  The burger was among the best I've had but there is a limited menu if you're looking for a fine dining experience.  I'd recommend the hotel for its location and a very good price point for a weekend stay.

title: 4th of July visit
text:
It was our first time to NYC and we were there for the fireworks. We were advised to stay here because of the service and the location. It lived up to our expectations. The service was terrific and we lacked nothing during our stay. 

There are many places to eat within walking distance as well as Bills on the back of the hotel.  There are many attractions close...the World Trade Center memorial and museum....battery park to the south.

I would recommend staying at this facility.

title: Certification Course
text:
Hotel is nice, rooms are clean and modern. As a lifetime titanium elite status I received and upgrade.  Just a block to World Trade Center Memorial and nice places to eat.   Concierge loungers nice and staff was welcoming and kind.  Housekeeper left this cute card.  Small personal touches mean a lot.  Pictures are from lounge.

Thank you Marriott!

title: Great deal, and perfect location!
text:
This hotel is in the perfect Lower Manhattan location. You are so close to the World Trade Center and Liberty Park. Plenty of bars and restaurants within walking distance.

The hotel room was spotless. We had no issues or lines checking in or checking out. The staff was pleasant and helpful when needed. The bellhops will also store your bags for you after you check out so you don't have to take your suitcases with you after check out. The sheets on the beds were high quality. There were extra pillows in the room, but no extra blankets. There was a safe and an iron available in the room as well as a hairdryer provided in the bathroom. We didn't have a great view, but it's a hotel room in NYC - we weren't looking for a hotel view because we just used it for sleeping. The only thing that would be a negative is no fan/vent in the bathroom so your room gets steamy. For the price, this hotel was perfect, budget-friendly and exactly what my 2 friends and I were looking for.

Your destination fee gives you $25 drink/food credit per day. We ate at the hotel restaurant - Bill's Burger Bar as well. Decent food, but nothing gourmet. There is also a Starbucks on site, and a Dunkin right around the corner.

title: Très bel hôtel mais frais cachés
text:
Chambre spatieuse et très agréable, tout comme l'hôtel dans son ensemble, très bien situé par ailleurs. Mais il y a de nombreux frais cachés qui font que le prix payé n'est pas du tout celui calculé au moment de la réservation. Contrairement à ce qui nous était annoncé, le wifi était payant, même dans les parties communes. Ensuite, l'hôtel pratique un "daily destination fee" de 25 dollars par jours. Il s'agit d'un crédit de 25 dollars par jours qui incite à manger au moins une fois dans le restaurant de l'hôtel, mais en réalité, cette somme est débitée chaque jour. On croit économiser 25 dollars alors qu'on les paye.
Enfin, le personnel est peu attentif et peu désireux d'aider. Nos valises avaient été perdues par la compagnie aérienne. Personne n'a accepté de nous aider pour téléphoner alors que c'est extrêmement difficile dans une langue étrangère quand on tombe sur une boîte vocale. Par ailleurs, on ne nous a pas signalé non plus quand nos valises ont enfin été livrées l'hôtel.

title: Trato excelente y habitaciones muy cómodas
text:
Fui por trabajo a este hotel y la verdad es que no tengo queja alguna. El hotel está muy bien situado en la zona financiera, muy cerca de wallstreet , battery park y casi pegado al world trade center.

Especialmente destacaría 2 cuestiones: 1) habitaciones muy buenas con una cama con un colchón dd excelente calidad que te envolvía. 2) el personal, especialmente el trabajador de la República Dominicana que no podía ser más amable y más majo

Me faltaría saber el precio para poder comparar calidad/precio pero al menos calidad era elevada.

title: Love the location and the staff
text: The lower Manhattan location provides a tranquil, scenic and accessible neighborhood far from Time Square craziness. The proximity to the Hudson, parks, great views and walking trails makes the location and this hotel locations we'll surely revisit. Only think to avoid is the hamburger pub.

title: A downtown hotel you should consider
text: Stayed at the Marriott recently since I needed to be in the financial district for an early meeting. I used to stay at the Ritz Carlton battery park, however now it is closed I chose the Marriott. I was pleasantly surprised, some of the rooms are remodeled. The hotel is clean and the service is excellent. Definitely you should consider it.

title: Excellent location
text:
We just stayed at Marriott NYC downtown for 10 nights ad it was fantastic! This is the best location for any visit to NYC; it’s a quiet location, easy to get around via subway and close to many sites. Close to the 9/11 Memorial, Ground Zero, Battery Park, Wall Street (the famous bull), shopping at Century 21, and Hudson River plus much more. We walked to City Hall, across the Brooklyn Bridge and so much more but we are happy to walk everywhere.
I highly recommend eating in the Resturant onsite - best burgers! Bill’s Bar & Burgers is excellent!! They’re also a Starbucks right on site.
We would stay here again for sure and I highly recommend this hotel!

title: Comfortable stay during a heatwave!
text:
We checked in on Saturday, July 20th.  Rooms were not ready because we were very early.  We checked our bags and went for lunch.  Upon our return we were able to get to our rooms to dress for dinner and a show.  The staff knew we were a family group, booking 7 rooms  and were professional and understanding making our stay pleasant.  This is my fourth time at this property. I noticed that some bathrooms have been renovated with attractive walk in showers and wood-like flooring with area rugs.  Very pretty!
I chose this location because we were visiting the 9/11 Memorial early Sunday morning.  It is a 2 minute walk which was perfect as the weather was very hot. 
There is a comfortable bar that is open from 4-12 pm.  Beer, a good wine list and great cocktails are available. 
Bill's Bar and Burger serves breakfast, linch and dinner.  I did not eat in the restaurant. The menu appeared to be similar to a Red Robin. Starbucks is located next door.

title: Great hotel for it's price
text:
My company booked this hotel and i must say i was surprised that it was so good.
Good location for what I needed and the price was good as well.
One thing I would recommend to improve is the bill's bar, the food was bad.

title: Stay at the Conrad up the street for the same price
text: Ever since Hurricane Sandy wrecked this hotel it has been a poor Marriott.  They sort of upgraded rooms but never rebuilt a kitchen so no room  service.  My latest stay found the room lock batteries dead so I couldn’t get into the room.  TV didn’t work after two engineers tried to fix.  Couldn’t move rooms because they were booked.  Stay at the Conrad up the street instead of this tired old property.

title: Exceptional service
text: Eli and Stacy are by far the most outstanding and professional hostess I've ever encountered in any club lounge ever! They constantly greeted me by name and always remembered what I had the day before. They were thoughtful and always provided me with the best service every encounter.  I will stay here again because of them!

title: A very good location as a base camp to see Manhattan.
text: The New York Marriott is a very good hotel for the money,  It's in a tight footprint and has only one dining option (Bills Burgers) on site. Rooms a fresh and modern. Beds are excellent. Our view faced west, overlooking Battery City, Hudson River and Jersey City.

title: Avoid Adjoining Rooms
text:
I’ve stayed here before and it’s always been a great experience. Unfortunately, this time, it fell short. I was checked in by Rachel and headed up to my room. As a Bonvoy Platinum elite, I had access to a designed floor for members. After a long day, I headed back to my room for a good night sleep. 

At around 11 pm, I was woken by the sound of a loud TV blaring and the sounds of a conversation. It was then I realized I had been given an adjoining room, were the main function of the thin door seemed to be as a noise conductor.  

I also noticed that TV screen in my room (photo attached with the guest’s name partially obscured for privacy) had a welcome message with the name of the other guest who was staying in the adjoining room. I found that kind of creepy.

I always avoid adjoining rooms for security reasons, and to avoid disturbances such as these. Would recommend next time that check in clerks disclose to solo travelers that they are being assigned an adjoining room. If I had been so informed, I would have opted out and probably had a better night of sleep.

title: Nice room where the food...
text: I have mixed feelings on this one. Location is great. The staff is super. Front desk and bell staff are great. The new room design is nice. Like my experience in Charlotte the “wood” floor can amplify some hallway sounds. Other wise the room was quiet. Bath was clean but the room itself needed swept. Lots of dust and hair gathered on my socks. Maid got it on the next cleaning. Maybe a one time thing. Room had great views and was large for a New York room. Really large. Internet was very good. Netflix only but you will probably be out seeing the city. Which you should be doing. Can’t complain about room service in a box since the hotel outsourced food to Bill’s Burger Bar. Great burgers. But really limited menu. It’s like Marriott has given up on food service. Would consider this location again if needed to stay in this part of town.

title: Loved it for our family
text: We’d never stayed down in the financial district.  A huge surprise we loved it!   This hotel had beautiful renovated and very spacious rooms!  Great views , amazing front curb staff and doormen.  Restaurants on site a kids dream of milkshakes.  Beautiful views from our room.  Restaurants all in walking distance and easy to get subway and all forms of transportation.  Highly recommend for families.  Only reason I gave it a 4 star - they have a $25.00 per day must pay fee and use it in restaurants. Very confusing for staff and for billing at check out.

title: Terrible or interesting ?
text: The staff was absolutely not helpful. The room was full of dust. It was even irritating to the breath. After a complaint, the room was changed for another one, but in the latter bed sheets had not been changed. Fortunately, there was Mr. Trevor Thompson who arranged everything and changed everything. He was really very helpful. He is the only one who did something. Even the wifi they didn’t give it at the reception while I am a member of Marriott Bonov. Then always the first night around 2am an alarm rings in the room, several times. And the next day there is no explanation or excuse from the reception. All this seems incredible but that’s how things went. Otherwise the room is comfortable and the location perfect. So : terrible or interesting ?

title: Hidden Gem
text: We stay here whenever we attend the Summer Fancy Food Show in June.  The Staff is very accommodating.  There are so many restaurants in the vicinity.  The 9/11 Memorial and Brookfield Place are a short walk away.  Battery Park is also in walking distance. The view from the park and the restaurants inside is spectacular.  Bill's Bar and Burgers is located inside the Marriott and serves great Burgers and Apps.  The sleeping rooms are very big for Manhattan and Super Clean.  It is very easy to catch an Uber and shoot uptown for our event.  This hotel is an Excellent Choice.

title: Great Hotel Experience
text: We just returned from a weekend in NYC.  Our stay at the Marriott was outstanding.  The staff is professional and friendly, check in and check out was a breeze.  Our room was clean and had a nice view of the water.  Every person that we encountered was helpful and so nice!  Well run hotel and a fabulous location.  So close to the 9/11 museum, Brooklyn Bridge, less than a 1/2 hour walk to China Town.  We have stayed mid town before and will return to this hotel for sure.  The only complaint which has nothing to do with the hotel, is the Starbucks attached to the property. It is very unorganized, takes forever to get your order and everyday there was a long line.

title: Not Good Enough
text: Expensive business hotels need to have decent breakfast options. This has a greasy diner that has no soy milk, no fresh juice, dim lighting and a dirty feeling. Inconvenient to walk for blocks to look for something for breakfast because a 4* hotel doesn't have anything.

title: Excellence...
text: Simply an excellent hotel, lovely location, great staff, very inviting rooms. An excellent choice! The only problem, not related to the hotel was that our cab driver, both from and to LaGuardia airport, somehow did not know the directions to each location. Wow/?!?!?!?

title: Newly renovated rooms, excellent location
text:
We stayed in this hotel for a few days and were very satisfied. Here’s a summary of my review. 

Hotel room: clean and spacious rooms, well maintained, newly renovated. We were lucky enough to have a corner room with awesome views of the city. 

Staff: They were friendly and courteous. 

Location: Literally just a few steps away from 9/11 memorial fountains, One World Trade Center and the Oculus. You can also walk to the Battery Park, Wall Street, City Hall and the world famous Brooklyn Bridge.

title: Pleasantly surprised with location- would stay again
text: We would absolutely stay here again. Wonderful location and very close to multiple Metro stations connecting to Uptown. It was about a 3 minute walk to Rector Street (yellow line). I’ve never stayed Downtown before and was pleasantly surprised by how much I liked it, I’ve always stayed Uptown- Times Square or Upper East Side. Nice hotel, updated/spacious rooms, Starbucks inside hotel, comfortable bed, quiet, and a super legit blackout shade. I wouldn’t hesitate to book again.

title: Nicely renovated room with a few minor issues
text:
This was my first trip to the Downtown Marriott - I had avoided in past as it had not received the best reviews from colleagues.  However, I had noticed they have undergone renovations and had read very good reviews on TA so I decided to give it a try.

I called in advance to ask for a quiet room (high floor, away from elevators, away from the West side highway).  The staff were very accommodating and the room was ready early which was very nice!  The staff at the hotel are all very friendly, it was much appreciated.

The room was newly renovated and a very good size (not just by New York standards either).  The bed was very comfortable, the washroom was large with a very nice shower, lots of outlets and usb ports for charging, lots of towels, a good size closet with a safe.  

A few small issues - the alarm clock in the room went off Sunday morning at 6am - I didn't set it.  The thermostat didn't work, it was repaired quickly however but needed two trips.  The room also seemed a bit damp, maybe an issue with the air conditioner.

I had asked for a quiet room, and they were very accommodating with a high floor, away from the main street, and away from the elevator.  However, the room was right next to the staff elevators I believe and the housekeeping room - so those elevators were loud in terms of banging as they ran and doors slamming early Sunday morning from housekeeping going in and out (not slammed intentionally, just a big heavy door).  

This was a business trip and the proximity to the office was great.  They even had umbrellas which was nice as it rained a few days during the visit.

I think I will most likely return for another trip the next time I'm in town for business.

title: Friendly Staff and Great Rest
text: This hotel has a great location. Our room was a decent sized. The bed was very comfy. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly! They had a free breakfast buffet which was pretty good. Highly recommend this hotel.

title: Nice rooms and good lication
text: Well appointed room on 34th floor.  Good size bathroom, TV, space in general.  Toiletries and linens are above average. Overall, above brand expectations.  Cool location.  Stupid steps between lobby and street.  Attentive service.

title: Destination fee ?
text:
I was forced to pay a $25 a day “destination fee” I spent over 900 nights on the Marriot-SPG hotels and never ever was forced to pay a “destination fee” 
I definitely will never come again and it’s not the $25, it’s that you’re forced to pay it so the actual price of the night is not the one you see at the time you reserve. A trick to squeeze you ....

title: Just missing some finishing touches.
text:
Stayed in a suite with fantastic views of the harbor. Suite looks to have just been remodeled with a generous amount of space and a comfortable sofa. Room had many large windows providing plenty of light. I thought the location was perfect. Was very close to many shops, the subway, and restaurants. 
This hotel could have set itself apart by focusing on the little things and customer service could have been better. The lounge was closed on Friday when we checked in and all weekend. I enquired about water and was told by front desk that she would send some right up. It never came. No slippers or robes which any suite at a fulll service property should have. The main issue was noise. I have stayed in many big cities and know to expect some street noise, but this was absurd. I was 30 floors up and car radios and horns sounded as if they were in the room. I also don’t know if this goes for all the rooms or only the connecting ones, but we had a person in the room next to us who decided to have a very loud phone conversation at 3am both nights we were there. Second night had to call for security, which I have never done in over a 1000 nights in hotels. I can’t say for certain if this is a hotel soundproofing issue or a very loud guest, possibly a combination of both. Either way it is a black mark against the hotel because ultimately they are responsible for ensuring the comfort for all guests. The inability to get a comfortable nights rest due to the street and guest noise truly dampened a very well designed suite, and soured me a bit on this hotel.

title: Magical views from the top floors
text: I used to live in NYC and was looking forward to introducing the city to my family. I'm Titanium level and crossed my fingers that we'd get an upgrade; WOW, we certainly did get an upgrade. Felt very appreciated for my loyalty to Marriott. We landed a spacious suite on the 35th floor. The views of New York harbor, plus the beautiful skyscraper lights at night, were like a scene from a movie. Impeccable service, well-stocked penthouse-floor concierge lounge (closed on Saturdays) with clear view of the Statue, huge gym with a wide array of muscle-toning machines. Very close to the 1 Subway (red line) and within 15-minute walking distance of ferries, and about a 7-minute walk to the A train subway (Nassau Street entrance at John Street) to JFK airport. Excellent climate control in the room and thorough housekeeping. The $15 "resort fee" was clearly outlined in our reservation, and we recouped it with wine/food. Many chain hotels in big cities add this fee now, so I'm used to it, and it was spelled out clearly, so it was my decision to accept it. Just such a comfortable, well-maintained hotel that it was worth it. If I don't qualify for an upgrade next year, I'll definitely pay extra for the view. It really made the trip magical to wake up to that scenery, and to end the day with it. The gym is on the 5th floor, so I could see the interior of one of the rooms on that floor as I walked down the hall, and the low-floor rooms just look out onto brick walls or mechanical stuff. There's no traditional hotel lobby bar here. Access to the concierge lounge meant access to their automated  wine bar, where you scan your room key and a machine fills your glass with wine and charges it to the room. Wonderful, restful place to return to after a day of sightseeing. Trips to NYC can be tiring, but this was a restful vacation thanks to this great hotel.

title: Renovation is great!
text: Great to stay in the newly renovated rooms of this hotel. The smell of new paint, new carpet, new fixtures, even new ice machines. The grandeur of the architecture was a real mis-match with the rooms. Now, it's on par - thanks Marriott!

title: Nice hotel but a sneaky billing rip off
text:
The room was very clean, roomy and reasonably quiet.  The king bed was comfortable.  Could not figure out how to change the temperature settings. There is  a Starbucks and good burger restaurant on the ground floor. So not bad so far.
The reason for the low rating is the double rip off when you check in.  The first rip off: after giving you your room and key they tell you there is an additional $15 dollar a day "destination" charge.  You can apply this charge to anything you buy in the hotel BUT if you do not buy something each day worth $15 or more you lose it. The first day starts when you check in, so if you check in at 9pm you have three hours to spend $15 or lose it!.  I guess this fee started as a "resort charge" but clearly this hotel is no resort and people complained.  The second rip off is that you are charged $2.11 in state and city taxes on each daily "destination fee"  which is not refunded when the destination fee is taken off.  I am sure that Marriott does not pay this add on part of the fee as taxes.  This is the first time and last time I will stay at a hotel that does such sneaky things at check in to steal money from unsuspecting customers.  Shame on you Marriott!  My next step is to contact a consumer magazine to share my story.

title: Super Location
text: Needed a hotel close to Battery Park and this fit the bill. It’s within walking distance to Wall Street, the Financial District and Battery Park. Booked a suite on a high floor, was told it was newly renovated they forgot one or two things no place to put your clothes other than a night stand and some sort of cabinet that held next to nothing. Not sure what they were going for but as a woman who has been to many hotels this room was a nightmare. Cant imagine travelling in the winter with bulky clothes. Decent size bathroom and sitting area. Restaurant is downstairs and they have an ATM as well as a Fed Ex and Starbucks on the property. Staff very professional and courteous and accommodating.

title: Clean, close to everything
text: The room is clean, I like the organic tea bag provided in the room. Our room have a view of nothing. But it was ok. We didnt stay in the room much.Every morning around 8am, the construction noise woke us up (no alarm needed haha). Wasnt sure it the hotel construction or the next door construction. Was planned to ask front desk to change room to avoid noises but realized she wasnt friendly over the phone while I was asking for wifi instruction. So i decided to just stop "bothering" her. Didnt want to add up the madness to her day hahaha.... oh oh oh , dont buy hot dog from the truck in front of the hotel. The guy charged us $4 for 1 hotdog. Ridiculous. We made mistake, we didnt ask for price before order. Make sure ask for price before make any order on food stand truck.

title: Luxe hotel dat we hebben bezocht tijdens een evenement
text:
We verbleven hier niet, maar zijn twee dagen in dit hotel geweest om een evenement te bezoeken. Het hotel ziet er luxe uit. Het personeel is overal aanwezig.
Het ontbijt en de lunch zijn van stabiele Amerikaanse kwaliteit.
En de koffie is uitstekend. Een uitstekend hotel voor een evenement

title: Great Location
text: This updated hotel is located in the vibrant Battery Park district. Rooms are comfortable and quiet. The neighborhood has plenty of restaurants on and off the water. Close to the 9/11 Memorial and Museum and other downtown attractions and public spaces. Easy to get uptown via taxi or public transit. No grand lobby or fancy cocktail bar but you can find plenty of spots with great views, food and drinks just blocks away. Will stay again.

title: Comfortable and fit our needs
text:
Good move our conference made in choosing the downtown Marriott, just the right size and a good fit. Accomodations were ample, well-appointed without flourishes, clean, quiet. Elevators were fast. Staff were friendly and helpful. Location worked well. Pleasant to walk around outdoors. Stone's throw from 9/11 Museum. Varied architecture to note among other buildings.

Downsides: no room service or breakfast area. Only a Burger Bar for meal service and I didn't care for it at all. Sandwiches very large but  all choices were heavy and calorie-laden. I opted for chicken sandwich and my friend fish. Both were breaded and fried dry so no escape from fatty food. Not to mention that it is horribly loud so not a place for conversation at all.

The good news is there are a scattering of restaurants and a grocery-deli within two to three blocks.

title: Girls Getaway
text: I usually stay in the Times Square Area of NYC, however this time decided to stay downtown.  The New York Marriott Downtown was the perfect hotel.  Staff was very nice and helpful, the rooms were clean and a nice size.  The area wasn't as congested with people and the area seemed cleaner.  I will definitely return.

title: Marriott Does it Right
text:
The 6 of us were in town for the 5 Boro Bike Ride this past weekend.  Dragging 6 bikes and luggage from out of town is never a fun thing, but the staff at the Marriott went out of their way to make it easy and convenient for all of their guests, with many staff members at the curb ready to lend a hand - check-in at the curb too, with music and snacks - and we felt especially well treated.  The Sunday morning of our ride, they had breakfast snacks and drinks for us before our start - as early as 6:30 in the lobby.  And when we returned after 4 hours of riding in the rain, they had towels for us and our bikes.  The staff made this a great trip and probably the best of our 5 years doing the same ride.

Bill's Pub on site was welcoming and offered fast service for our group of 6.

Late checkout was offered, which allowed us to do a little Monday morning sightseeing.

We'll be back at the Marriott Downtown next year!

title: You have a great staff here!
text:
My friends and I spent the weekend at the hotel for the TD 5 boros bike ride.  Imagine a business hotel full of cyclists from all over the world and their not so hotel friendly, wet, muddy equipment.  The staff was READY.  From bike racks in front to doormen who knew to hold the door, employees who knew how to tell some rude cyclists to move their bike OUT of the lobby door nicely.  I’m originally a New Yorker and your front desk staff was so nice and accommodating I thought you must hire them from the Midwest.  We were so cold, wet and muddy after the ride that we needed extra bath towels (so did about 1000 other people).  They arrived within 15 minutes of the call.

Thank you!  You now have a new fan but I will be returning with my friends and bikes.

title: Very good place to stay downtown
text: Came for a conference at the NYSE and there is plenty to do down in this part of town within a few minutes walk from the hotel.  The hotel is nicely appointed.  The rooms are comfortable, very comfortable beds and nice design in the overall feeling.  The bathroom was clean and comfortable with good towels and toiletries.  Check in was easy and staff was welcoming and friendly.  Overall a very good stay - a few minutes walk to Battery Park, Wall Street, Trinity Church and the World Trade Center sights.  I would stay here again.

title: NEW YORK MARRIOTT DOWNTOWN - GREAT HOTEL. NO LATE NIGHT FOOD OPTIONS.
text:
The hotel itself is nice.  The staff was professional and courteous during our stay.  Bellman went out of their way to be helpful. 

A couple of things to be mindful of:  the $15 DAILY CHARGE that turns into a DAILY CREDIT that you MUST USE DAILY as it DOES NOT ROLLOVER.  

There are absolutely no good food options late night.  The restaurant inside the hotel is Bill's and closes nightly at 10:30 p.m.  No 24-hour room service and this is somewhat of a luxury property (check the room rates).  Note, you cannot pay for your charges at Bill's separate, they must be charged to the room.

Pomporando is a pizza place within walking distance and two small deli's after that nothing.  The suggestion then is to use GrubHub but since this is Manhattan....it will cost you dearly I am guessing.  We just made do with the pizza.

title: Very nice hotel
text: This hotel was right next to the the World Trade Center and wasn’t to far from much of the things we wanted to go to. I loved that the hotel was just renovated. The right amount of plugs and usb outlets and a somewhat good view. Parking is def hard if you plan to look for parking. I would definitely come back as the staff was very helpful as well. The only thing I would suggest is that the hotel install fans in the bathrooms as they have none like other hotels I’ve been too.

title: Great Valentine day.
text: Excellent service, perfect location. My wife and myself spent 2 nights with one of the best views we have ever had while staying in NYC. On site retaraunt and bar were easily acessible. Courteous staff. Would stay again, and will soon.

title: Newly refurbished Marriott in downtown NYC
text: Had the opportunity to visit for one evening to attend a venue at the NYAS; hotel is located in close proximity to the 9/11 Memorial. Check-in was efficient (with BonVoy), professional and friendly. Assigned room was newly refurbished (smells new) and of a good size. The renovations look great - it comes with all the amenities expected of the chain. I particularly appreciate the abundance of lights and power outlets. Obligatory destination fee encouraged a sojourn to the singular restaurant for breakfast - restaurant was well managed and the food was standard fare. Overall, a very positive experience and will consider a revisit if circumstances demand a venture to the locale.

title: Good service
text: We spent 3 nights here. The hotel staff is very helpful. The rooms are big and well equipped. The location is great for 9/11 memorial and for the excursion to the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island. It is a little bit far from upper town, but there are metro stations.

title: Can’t say enough great things about this Marriott.
text:
I was so glad that I selected this location.
Service was great,  very friendly staff, &  very reasonable restaurant.
It was in close proximity to the 911 Memorial,  Statue of Liberty, and Ellis Island and if you other museums that we did not get an opportunity to visit. Definitely for wall Street it’s great for business. I do want to complement Dee Dee in the concierge’s lounge who’s been there for 50 years,  she was such an exemplary employee with such a great personality that I could see why people would return.  The concierge’s lounge was very nice!!

title: Wonderful Service
text: We have nothing but good things to say about this hotel.  We arrived at 10:00 AM and they were able to get us in a room immediately, we never expected that.  Our room on the 33rd floor was beautiful with a great view of the Hudson River.  This room was recently renovated and the only hotel that we had been to that was nicer was the Trump Hotel in Las Vegas.  On check-in we were told about a $15.00 destination fee which was reimbursable if we ate in the restaurant, which we did.  See the review of Bill's Bar and Burgers.

title: New York Marriott downtown
text: Stayed at the New York Marriott downtown.  Overall a very nice hotel and have stayed there multiple times with good experiences.  This time there was a hotel renovation on multiple floors that caused multiple disturbances early morning and late at night. I was promised marriott reward points and have not received them.  Not good customer service on Marriott's part.  Good hotel but renovation disturbances made the stay not great and some discount or accommodation should have been made for the price we paid for this hotel.

title: Fantastic hotel and totally recommended
text: I arrived to a large foyer with friendly reception. The check in was quick and hassle free. The room was lovely, newly renovated, clean, large and spacious with the best and softest bed ever! This is a really good hotel, daily cleaned with different notes each day on your bed, like Follow your Dreams. The views were great and this is a great location close to the 9 11 memorial and Freedom Tower. I will always come back to this hotel. When I left early in the morning, the bell guy found me a taxi within 3 mins. Thank you to all staff for a fab stay. I'll be back.

title: Keep in mind the construction
text: Nice hotel in a nice area, with the Statue of Liberty and Brooklyn Bridge nearby. Keep in mind though that this hotel is under construction. During my stay there was active construction from 9-6, and the water was shut off between 10-3 (not a daily occurrence, but annoying if it happens during your stay).  I would recommend checking out this hotel when the renovations are complete.

title: Very good experience.
text: Clean, convenient, pleasant service. Would recommend. Decent views available (we were on 11th floor). Close to some good attractions (e.g., 9/11 Memorial and Museum). Restaurant a little tired and slow, but so many other places to eat nearby.

title: Great Hotel - Would Stay Again
text: We stayed for 3 nights in December 2018. There were 2 couples and we had 2 rooms. First of all, we arrived very early (7:00am) and they were immediately able to accomodate us with one room. This was great as we had flown all night from Seattle. We were able to freshen up and leave our bags before heading out into the city. There was a problem with the water one night, but they offered to move us to a different room if they could not fix the problem. It was fixed within hours so we didn't have to move, but the offer was appreciated. The rooms were big, clean, and comfortable. The beds were very comfortable. The location was convenient with the subway a few blocks away and the Freedom Tower could be seen from the elevator lobby. We had an awesome view of the Hudson River from our room. The bell hop was great and held our luggage so we could explore the city on our last day before a late flight out. For our first trip to NYC, we couldn't have asked for better.

title: Awesome staff. Good hotel.
text: Staff here are extremely helpful and friendly! Rooms are decent sized. The room I stayed in hadn't been renovated yet but was still in good condition although a bit dated. The beds was very comfy! Will come back for sure!

title: Noisy hotel and Bad customer service
text: we were woke up by a hammer drill noise in the morning. I understand they have to fix stuff some times, but when I called the reception they told me there was nothing they could do and that the noise will continue till 6 pm. They never gave us any advance notice and the front desk people got mad and rude when I asked them for an alternative. It’s sad to see the Marriott brand going down.

title: Friendly Staff
text: I spent a night at this hotel yesterday. The front desk staff is very warm and friendly. The room is big for Manhattan. We had some housekeeping issues, but the Assistant General Manager, Michael, handled the matter to my satisfaction. I believe it was an isolated issue, and Michael did an excellent job at empathizing and resolving the matter. They have a free breakfast buffet, which is pretty good. Good central downtown location very close to the World Trade Center.

title: Beautiful
text: The hotel had great rooms with good view. Good location with a short stoll to the hudson river. It's also loads of differt resturants nearby plus a short walk to the 9/11 memorial. I love new york and the beautiful places to see. Highly recommend this hotel.

title: 2-Night Post-Cruise Stay
text: We had a two-night stay at the New York Marriott Downtown.  We arrived early for an early check-in after our Disney cruise and was accommodated by the friendly staff at the front desk.  The room was large for Manhattan standard and had the largest TV I have ever seen in a hotel room.  The location of the hotel make it easy to get to the WTC and to use the subway.  It is also a short walk from a couple of small convenience stores.  The service at the restaurant is subpar but it is likely run by a different operator than the hotel.  However, Marriott should make sure that its guests are treated with the same high standard service at the restaurant as elsewhere on the premise.

title: Who is Watching the Store?
text:
This hotel has gone so far downhill that maybe Motel 6 should snap it up. There’s no room service, no Concierge Floor, the empty restaurant makes you wait for a table, and the little snack market sells Doritos and gummy bears.
It a category 5 Marriott! Not anymore

title: Happy people
text:
Friendly staff and all functioning well. The rooms are good size and works well for business. The location is great for downtown business. The restaurant and options however are not quite up to standards catering for an international clientele. But location is good for finding alternative places for dinner. 
Overall very good and good standard hotel.

title: Extraordinary Customer Service
text:
First off we didn't have the chance to stay here.  We were in Tampa waiting to board our flight into LaGuardia.  While there the govt shutdown caused our flight to be cancelled with no guarantee if we booked a different flight that we would get into NYC.  I had a prepaid reservation at this hotel.  I used the Marriott app and contacted them.b I explained the situation and they immediately refunded my money.  Not only that, my sister in law was coming in to meet us.  Upon hearing we weren't coming she called the hotel and explained.  Her reservation was also pre paid.  She said she would accept a credit for a future stay and they asked if she would rather have a refund.  That was what she took.

This is how you build brand loyalty.  I am a lifetime platinum Premier elite member but my sister in law isn't and yet they went out of their way for us.

Even though I didn't stay I would recommend this property based solely on the treatment we received.

Thank you to the hotel for making an upsetting and stressful situation more bearable.

title: Great location Downtown
text: I stay at this location every time I'm in NYC for work as my office is across the street. It is convenient if you need access to the Financial District. The rooms are spacious for NYC standards, the bed is comfortable and there is enough storage space. This particular visit, I came in over the weekend to enjoy the city before the work week and it was nice and quiet (as expected). Easy to grab a cab or take a walk to Brookfield Place for shopping/restaurants. If you are an elite Marriott member, the club offers a decent breakfast buffet and after dinner desserts.

title: Städtereise
text:
Wir waren als Paar da. Die Lage ist perfekt, man kann alles mit der U-Bahn erreichen. Da wir über Silvester da waren, war es richtig fein, wenn wir viele Leute wollten, sind wir zum Times Square gefahren, wenn wir es ruhiger wollten sind wir wieder nach Downtown.
Hotel ist sehr empfehlenswert. wir werden wieder kommen.

title: Unfortunate
text:
Stayed here for 12 hrs-ish and it was mostly OK stay with one big flaw. There was intermittent drilling/construction noise from the ceiling that getting a quality sleep was just not possible. Given the short stay, I chose to battle through it but still it sort of defeated my purpose (getting good sleep before the weekend).. 

other things: spacious room, fairly convenient location (for downtown tourists), TV was relatively big. mandatory city fee didn't hurt as much when you could get the equal credit in in-hotel Starbucks. Front desk people were professional. Power outlets for some reason either weren't working or sealed completely

title: Great location and staff
text:
This hotel has a great location. It is about one block away from the One World Trade Center. Everyone is friendly. There is a Starbucks located inside, and well as a bar and restaurant. All are very good and convenient to get to. It is also a quick walk to Battery Park, and close to subways.
The room had a great amount of space, and the bathrooms were great.
I would recommend this hotel for a nice chain in NYC if you are not looking for unique NYC hotels.

title: disappointing
text:
We stayed 6 nights the last week of the year.
We were four in a small room with no closets to place the luggage and no free wifi (that's incredible but is true). Free wifi is only in the lobby but the lobby is very small and has only 2 armchairs so guests sit on the floor and on the stairs to connect and it's very indecorous, especially for a 4 stars.
Hotel is clean, personnel is kind and helpful. but it's not a 4 stars.

title: Lovely visit
text:
I had a lovely time here with friends - celebrating a 30th birthday party. 

Good welcome and comfortable room - great visit. 

The receptionist was very friendly and the room service was delicious. 

We found the location very convenient too.

title: Not up to Marriott Standards
text:
While this is supposed to be a full service Marriott, it was only full service in price! Shortcomings:
-no Conceirge Lounge
-no Room service
-no bathrobes in your room
We were also served French toast in the morning which looked great, but wouldn’t cut. When flipped over, it was burnt to a crisp. It took over 10 minutes for the waitress to come back and she was not at all accommodating. She just asked if we wanted another order put in. No apology. 
Definitely would not do this one again. I am lifetime platinum elite and have never experienced a full service Marriott like this. Too many issues!

title: Weekend in NYC
text: Fantastic hotel. Really good location. 2 minutes walk from WTC station (with its new shopping mall) on the Path so easy to get to from Newark. Right near the ground zero. Short walk to Battery Park and Wall Street. 15 minutes subway to Central Park etc. Lovely clean rooms. Spacious bathrooms with good toiletries. You get $15 a night room credit for in room bottled water or to buy toward food from Bills. Bills is a little gem. Really friendly staff and fantastic food. Had both breakfast and dinner here. Would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Hospitalidad
text: Estuve de paseo con mi familia el 24 de diciembre en Manhattan, ya era de noche, no teníamos internet y estábamos perdidos, entramos al hotel y pedimos el favor que nos prestaran un teléfono,  amablemente el personal que se encontraba en recepción no solo nos prestó un teléfono,  llamaron a un funcionario que hablara español, se aseguraron de que resolvieramos nuestras inquietudes, nos dieron algunos dulces, y lo mejor: nos sentimos seguros, cómodos y acogidos por unas buenas personas, muy amables sin importar que no nos alojáramos en el hotel. Espero tener la oportunidad de apoyarme en este hotel porque definitivamente me cautivaron.  Gracias
