title: Great Friendly Hotel
text: On a week long family trip to New York this was our base. Great location close to the WTC, metro stations and eateries in the area. Hotel was very comfortable, nice sized rooms and the staff allways super friendly. (Andrea had our room spic and span every day thanks!) If we're ever back in New York this is where we will stay fullstop.

title: 아주 좋았어요
text: 위치가 진짜 좋아요. 일단 차를 뉴저지에 대고 지하철타고 들어오기도 아주 좋구요, 자유의 여신상, WTC, 브루클릿 브릿지까지 모두 걸어다닐 수 있어요.

title: Excellent hotel and service
text: We just stayed here to enjoy a little weekend getaway in the city. The great service started immediately when I walked in the door, the bellman saw I was struggling with suitcases since there is a couple steps up to the lobby (there is a wheelchair lift). He ran over and carried the suitcases up the steps and to the front desk so I could check in. I wish I remembered the young guys name that checked us in as he was extremely friendly and helpful. He upgraded us to a high floor room with a view of the Statue of Liberty and gave us the rollaway bed for free. We were on the 35th floor room 3507. Very few hotels in NYC will put a rollaway bed in a room with two beds and this is one of them. Yes the room was a tad tight but it worked for a family of four. The view from the window was absolutely breathtaking and the room was super quiet. I really liked the design of the room especially the all marble bathroom. There was a mini fridge In the room which was very helpful for storing water and ice. One thing I feel that Marriott hotels should offer free bottled water at least to Marriott Rewards members. I feel that $4 for a small bottle and $7 for a large bottle of water is very high. I had requested ahead of time that they bring me a dental kit and some extra soap and blankets. In addition to the rollaway. I think this was the first hotel I stayed in where I didn't have to call the front desk and ask repeatedly for them to bring the stuff up. They did it automatically and the guy even set up the rollaway for us. The Christmas Tree in the lobby is stunning.  There is also a really nice  and large fitness center  The hotel is in the perfect location 5 minute walk to Brookfield Place and the World Trade Center for shopping and access to the subway. I would definitely return here on another overnight trip to the city.

title: Quartier financier
text: Endroit calme pour dormir le temps d’un long week-end, quartier proche de Wall Street, Century21 et surtout proche des anciennes tours du World Trade Center. Très bon accueil du personnel et surtout merci à Jean pour sa gentillessse et ses supers conseils pour se diriger dans la ville !

title: First ttime in New York
text: We wanted to get a hotel near the 911 museum. It was a good choice. Very clean, good staff. The room was set up very nice. We actually had 3 rooms. Ours had a king size bed. There was a Dunkin Donuts shop around the corner which made my grandson and my husband very happy. There is a restaurant in the hotel also, this was very hand since we had a 2 year old with us. Short walk to the museum.

title: Perfect location for our weekend trip
text: Easy walk to the 9/11 Memorial which was number one on our list of things to do. Good value for its location. Friendly staff. Also, walkable to the Hudson promenade, shopping, and the dining we were hoping for. We used Uber to visit any uptown destinations.

title: Parfait
text:
Hôtel très bien placé, parfait pour les visites courte et parfait pour visiter les monuments à New York, à 7 minutes à pied jusqu’à station Liberty 🗽 même pas besoin de prendre le métro, hôtel confortable et très propre, personnel sympathique et très professionnel.
A 5 minutes de métro que demander de plus .

title: First visit to NYC
text: I’ve just returned to Scotland after spending a fantastic 6 days in NY, the hotel is lively but as stated in other reviews the colour scheme could be updated. The beds were super comfortable, I wouldn’t however pay $5 or $8 for a bottle of water!! And can I just point out that the carpet edges all around the room could do with hoovering also. Other than the points stated I enjoyed my visit.

title: Hotel excelente, nada a reclamar
text: O hotel é ótimo, o quarto é espaçoso, o banheiro é grande, a cama maravilhosa. O serviço de quarto era muito bom também. O aquecimento funcionou muito bem (importante, estava bem frio). A localização era ótima. É muito mais fácil se locomover em NY a pé e de metrô, tanto em questão de valores quanto de trânsito. O primeiro uber que calculamos já dava o valor do passe semanal do metrô e ia levar uma hora a mais para chegar no destino. Do hotel é possível chegar rapidamente a mais de uma estação, fomos a todo lado sem problemas. Também é possível chegar a pé ao local de onde partem as barcas para a Estátua da Liberdade, ao Charging Bull e ao WTC e falo isso com temperaturas negativas e já cansados, é perto mesmo. O hotel também conta com um Starbucks e uma lanchonete no térreo, ajuda bastante na hora do aperto.

title: The best location
text: Great location! Very clean hotel! Spacious Rooms! Nice amenities Polite stuff! Many metro station arround! Nice restaurant with delicious burger in the ground floor of the hotel! The only disadvantage is that they are charging you 14.95 usd for the wifi

title: Pick one: old, tired or antique
text:
I'm old enough to remember when Marriott hotels with this decor were new -- in the 80s. I've aged well; this property hasn't.

Something that gets as much use as a hotel building needs much more frequent updates than this place has had. WiFi access points are just tacked onto the hallway walls. The rooms are brown on brown with tan wallpaper. There are no USB chargers in the rooms. They have to use (too much) fragrance to cover up old, moldy smells. The bathroom grout is stained. They still charge $5 for a bottle of water in the room. The windows are sealed shut (a tough thing for claustrophobes like me).

Don't get me wrong -- the hotel is clean. The staff tries to overcome this by delivering hearty welcomes and small talk (they do a convincing job of sounding interested).

I'm told they are going to renovate the rooms in 2019. It can't come soon enough. This property is just too old to really be comfortable.

title: Shopping
text: We stayed here for just over a week. Good location near 911 memorial. Great surrounding areas with good restaurants. Hotel very good had a good restaurant. We had a deal where we had breakfast included but we shared them with other family members. Staff very helpful including Philip who sorted us out for car transfers . Cleaning staff great with a little card left on our bed every day. Nice touch hope to see you guys again thanks

title: Standard Marriott, good location
text:
Marriott is pretty standard but appreciated friendly staff, clean facilities and great housekeeping team.  Location in downtown area was exceptional. 

Concierge lounge was the highlight--food was great but the view!  Would absolutely stay here next time we are in the city.

title: Outstanding Location!
text: We spent 3 nights at this outstanding destination hotel. The service was impeccable, the rooms spacious and comfortable, and the food at the in-house restaurant, Bill’s Burgers, was an unexpected bonus.

title: Soiled bedding
text: Staying here for 4 nights for thanksgiving weekend. Check in fine, room good, no complimentary water.  Wasn't told at checked that they blocked 400 dollars on my credit card until I check out no real issue except that this wasn't explained to me.  On second morning accidently spilt tea on my bed so expected to have fresh bedding that night but no bed was remade with soiled bedding so had to sleep in a soiled bed very disappointing and for the prices they charge very shoddy service would think twice about staying here again.

title: Muy contentos con este hotel
text: Es un hotel ubicado como a dos cuadras del Memorial a las Torres Gemelas y el One World. A unas cuadras de Battery Park. Muy comodo, una muy buena vista. Los empleados muy amables. Fue una estancia de 3 dias.

title: عن المدينة
text: المدينة صاخبه. وجميله وعده فعاليات بشكل مستمر ولكن الازعاج بشكل مستمر تقريبا من الاشخاص بالشوارع واصوات سيارات الشرطه والاسعاف والاطفاء ... لا تصلح للاستجمام فقط للاشخاص الي يحبون السهر والتمشي وهناك مشكله ان القمامه منتشره بكل الشوارع والرائحه تفوووح بالمكان .

title: APPRECIATION
text:
We checked into the hotel on Wednesday 7th November, 2018 and out on Sunday 11th November, 2018. 

Excellent check in done by the receptionist with a warm welcome from the security staff, concierge, receptionists etc.  

We had booked two rooms and had requested for the same to be next to each other but this was not the case.   My wife and I were also given a room for special needs and upon realizing the same, we requested for change and the same was immediately done and we were changed to room no. 716 and my daughter 714.   

We greatly appreciate the kind hospitality accorded to us by the staff including the telephone operator, bar and restaurant staff and all the others especially Consuelo C. of Housekeeping department who did a marvelous job and deserves a reward or promotion.   Her care was greater than any we have seen in any of the Marriott Hotels.  Jose also did a wonderful job. 

Thanks to all the staff for making our stay enjoyable.   We shall always be loyal members to Marriott

MAYUR SHAH

title: Do yourself a favor and stay here!!!
text: It's a happening hotel in a historic part of Manhattan.  A great location for downtown activities. Walk to the water or walk to Wall St. Shop at the Occulous or stop by the Survivor Tree. Take a stroll through Trinity Church or tantalize your tastebuds at Bill's restaurant in the hotel lobby. The best hotel staff I've encountered from the doorman to the bellhop to the frontdesk team.  All above expectation. So do yourself a favor and stay here.

title: Expensive hotels
text: Very high price for very small room. Excellent location at lower Manhattan for World Trade Center activities.  That is the best feature, location. Service is also excellent but pricing is outrageous  room is brightly lit. Elevators are quick

title: Very good - very quiet!
text:
It's a very standard Marriott experience.  Good service and friendly.  Rooms are clean and beds were okay at best.  It was an all around good stay, but nothing spectacular.

This is very close to two train stations on various lines so that is great and it is VERY quiet at night because it is in more of a business zone.  

It's about a 10 minute walk to the 9/11 memorial.

title: Decent hotel, shame about the little things
text:
I arrived late on the first night and they had no complimentary water. No big deal, just drank the paid bottle.
Upon leaving the next morning, I requested a pair of slippers (do I really have to ask for this?), and for them to change my bed so it was feather free. 
I arrived back that night to a made up room, which still had feather pillows and there was no slippers. To add to that, my coffee hadn't been refilled nor had I got any additional water (paid or otherwise).
After raising this all with the front desk the next day, upon my return these issues were all resolved. 
But why did it have to take so long?

title: Great one!
text: Nice hotel! Spent several times here and we’ll always come again, we love the location ! Great value! Good service and nice staff, well done guys! Love to feel at home when you travel around the year.

title: Great city hotel
text: What a great city hotel. One of the best Marriott hotels I’ve stayed at. Right in the middle of everything in lower Manhattan. Very clean room! Great bar and restaurant plus exceptional staff. Will be back!

title: Nicely renovated room
text: Only stayed one night but we were on the 5th floor in a newly renovated room. Very comfortable. My only question is who hung the magnifying mirror in the bathroom...a giant? I am 5’1”. The only thing I could use that mirror for would be to see if I had split ends on top of my head. No adjustment available to lower it to a useful height. Location was good for 9/11 Memorial and Museum visit. My friends were staying over to attend a conference at the hotel but I was there for a theater visit only. Not a convenient location for what I normally do in NYC but nice if you need to be in that end of the city.

title: Poor service, rooms outdated, dingy
text: We are in town for a wedding and stayed at this appointed hotel. Including taxes, we paid $350+ per night for an outdated, small, and sorrt to say: dingy room. It has a very odd arrangement of furniture especially the bedside table; it is much too small for the need its meant to serve. The TV is huge which is the only plus. There seems to be a lack of Quality control; my sheet has a gaping hole in it, my bed’s duvet was put on sideways (?), there are body hairs stuck to the ceiling of the bathroom, the lack of bathroom fan has turned our room into a swamp, the AC unit is unresponsive to changes. The ceiling is super dirty, what happened in here?? All of that aside, the service is really lacking. We left our room at 10am to sightsee and came back at 2:30pm to get ready for the wedding. Despite seeing housekeeping cleaning other rooms when we left, ours still isn’t clean. We have no towels and I called to at least get those “immediately/ASAP” and 25 minutes later, two calls to the front desk, still waiting....so it’s review time. No refills on coffee or toiletries- what if we were counting on it? We have an event to get ready for! So disappointed in Marriott........you can do better than this, even factoring in “New York City” prices.

title: Cómodo pero con wifi de pago
text:
Nos alojamos en este hotel a lo largo de un viaje por USA. Está al sur de Manhattan, a nosotros nos vino bien para lo que hicimos esos días, pero si vas a hacer turismo puede resultarte mejor otro más céntrico.

Las habitaciones no están mal para lo que se puede encontrar en la ciudad, el gimnasio muy completo, y la ducha funcionaba perfectamente, lo que fue un agradable cambio con respecto a otros Marriott que hemos conocido.

La wifi es de pago, lo que me parece un atraso en estos tiempos.

Tuvimos una alarma de incendios una de las noches y tuvieron una actuación excepcional

title: A little bit dissapointed with this Marriott hotel on such a prime spot!
text:
We had to hop on a cruise leaving from New York to Quebec! So we decided to stay 2 days in New York to enjoy the WTC, Broadway etc.
So, we had this stay in Marriott Downtown. Being a member for life of the Marriott Club, you are accustomed to get pampered at least have a nice welcome and get if available a nice room upgrade. We had an upgrade but the view was horrible. The overall impression of the rooms and the facilities (restaurants) was really poor!

So, if you have the chance to move to a better Marriott in this area....take the Marquis. I know it is more expensive....but better paying a little bit more and enjoy your stay at a nice Marriott in New York!

title: Trip across Usa with my daughter
text:
The hotel is situated opposite WTC, just breathtaking at night we were on 34th floor, lights from WTC shone into our room, the site outside would move anybody, what a fantastic location & the memorial is just moving.
Billys restaurant was superb in the hotel, they are one of top 10 burgers in USA, good choice, staff ok but with the fairies at times, just happy & always smiling.
Starbucks at the back of the hotel was poor service, little choice & staff more interested in who saw what last night than giving effective service for what I feel is ridiculous prices for what they sell :(((
we had the fire alarm go off at 12.30am this was nerve wrecking especially for my 15 yr old daughter!!  it turned out to be a faulty smoke alarm but as we were getting a 5.00am flight it was a funny old night.
Overall would go back, staff helpful, next to WTC, S.O.liberty a stones throw & highly recommend Uber, saved a fortune

title: We were there to go on a VIP tour of the World Trade Center, it is very close to it.
text:
Our room was a bit small, but it was the room that the trip was included with. We won a VIP your of the WTC through a gala it was a silent auction item. I loved the fact that there was a Starbucks and a nice gym. The gym was big and open. 
The customer service was impeccable! I left some items in my room and they shipped to me immediately! Very nice place, I would stay here again but have a bigger room. Very comfortable bed as well.

title: Nice hotel in good location
text:
I recently stayed for 2 nights.  The hotel is located a couple of blocks away from the WTC and memorial as well as the Hudson River promenade area.  It's a $50-60 ride from LGA.

The property is nicely appointed an clean.  My room was small (probably not by Manhattan standards) but was comfortable and well maintained.  It was also fairly quiet with only limited traffic noise.  The gym has been recently updated.  It is large and has a large variety of equipment.

Check in and check out were very easy.

title: Poor service
text: I have to travel for business fairly often and service can make or break whether I stay for the long run. This time it’s a break. When I arrived at check in at 11pm after working late, they asked me for the usual information. Then they asked for my work id. I have never been asked for that any where in the world I have stayed. After I provided it, I was given my key. When I arrived to my room, it was handicap accessible. The front desk failed to mention this. When I called down, it was changed. Why did they put me here without asking...taking it away from someone who may need it...I don’t know. They said they would bring me the key to my new room...they never came. I had to walk downstairs to find the staff having a personal conversation while holding my key in his hand. By the time this was all done, it was now midnight and I have to go to work bright and early. Needless to say, I won’t be back...

title: Terrific short visit
text: My wife and daughter and I stayed her for 2 nights in Sept. We had a room with a king bed and brought in a rollaway bed four our girl. We asked for a quiet room and they gave it to us!! All slept well on comfortable beds. Service was solid. We'd return if we needed a room way downtown.

title: Mr Ron
text: Excellent location for visiting the Memorial at the World Trade Center. Lots of culinary options nearby. Clean hotel with good views of statue of liberty. Would return. Excellent for families and others visiting.

title: Simply Wonderful
text: Can't say enough good things about this hotel. It is a very easy walk from PATH/1 Train stops at the World Trade Center. Just two blocks south from the Trade Center Memorial, this hotel is perfectly situated in the Financial District. We arrived a little before Noon, not only were we given a room right away, and even a stuffed bear for our son. While the rooms are about average sized by Marriott standards, that is massive by New York standards! Nothing felt cramped, bathroom was ample, plenty of space in the main part of the room. Views of Lower Manhattan and the Hudson River are stunning. There is a $15/night fee on top of your room rate, but you can use this as a Food & Beverage credit in one of the restaurants and it will be offset on your bill. We used the credit for milkshakes in the hotel restaurant, and they were outstanding! Will definitely return to this hotel next time we're in the City.

title: Great location
text:
We stayed at the Marriott for 5 nights .  We were upgraded to a Harbor view room that included a great view Of the Statue of Liberty.  The rooms were spacious, beds comfortable.  Furnishings  were starting to look dated , but overall met expectations for a Marriott standard .  
The location was awesome.  It was close the to 911 memorial , numerous subway stations and within walking distance to the Brookland bridge and ferries to Governor island and Staten Island .  We enjoyed a number of great restaurants that were within walking distance of the hotel . The staff were efficient and helpful.  Overall we had an enjoyable stay .

title: Great downtown location, standard hotel experience.
text:
Stayed w/ family to enjoy NYC around a business trip. 

SERVICE: very good. We didn't have many special needs; had pre-requested extra towels, etc. Staff was helpful and friendly. 
FOOD: this may be a little lacking. there's a bar (fine), then a bar/grill (ok for a bite, ran out of beer) attached; a hotel Starbucks (didn't try). don't recall any room service, but then there's so much to eat around there, makes sense. 
ROOM: wonderful big TV, good size bathroom, plenty of space in the room; they could have easily had 2 queen beds vs doubles, make guests more comfortable. 
LOCATION: great. Perfect for the Wall Street business; and really good for exploring the city. Easy enough for us to take a subway uptown to those attractions, walking distance from many others. 

No real standout other than location; still, happily stay here again w/ right deal.

title: Real comfort with The Views
text: Very tall, views of the Statue of Liberty, the World Trade Center and out to Staten Island. The concierge lounge on the top floor is open all day long with superior service. Among the very best stays ever in New York City.

title: Top Lage
text: Das Hotel ist sehr zentral gelegen vor allem zum WTC zur Wall Street und auch zur Fähre nach Liberty Island. Wir hatten Frühstück includiert  allerdings gab es nur Kaffe und Rührei keinerlei Brot oder Müsli. Die Subway ist auch in unmittelbarer Nähe und wer gerne shoppen geht Century 21 ist um die Ecke:). Unser Zimmer war für 4 Personen wirklich groß. Wir würden wieder buchen.

title: Excellent
text: Everything was spotless.  The hotel staff is super friendly and helpful.  The location is perfect and convenient.  I stayed there for a college classmate reunion. I picked this hotel and everyone who stayed there were very satisfied!

title: Much better service
text: We have been staying here for years. The big change is this hotel has really upped their service. Front desk, bellcaps, concierge floor.  Everyone friendly helpful and nice. Great stay thank you ! Great location rooms are a nice size.

title: NEVER PLAN A MEETING HERE
text: Very nice meeting staff, but it ends there. If they could charge for air they would!  We will never book another meeting in NYC or at Marriott properties.  They have lost the meaning of guest--you are now in the land of 11 page "agreements" written by attorneys who have never planned a meeting!  I really don't want to wade through all of their legalese just to arrange a simple meeting.

title: Very noisy night
text: As a hotel it is very good one as room size ,Hudson river view is very nice,bathroom size very good and bed matris and pillows were very good the reception is excellent in chucking in and out but we had avery noisy next door neighbor who kept us awake sleepless the whole night till sun rise.abunch of guys having party so we called security to stop them but the effort was not good enough which made them continue there party so I had to speak up with them more than 3 times but without any results

title: Tudo Perfeito
text:
Quando me refiro a tudo perfeito está localização ,acomodação ,serviço  , conforto  .

Não fornecem café da manhã mais disponibilizam um credito diário de $15 para ser utilizado nos parceiros que ficam no próprio prédio .

Fica a 100 metro do World  trade center ,5 minutos a pé para estação de metro ,$17 de uber para Time square.

title: Good location, spacious rooms and wonderful staff
text: We recently stayed here for 3 nights on our first trip to the Big Apple. Since we wwere celebrating our Birthdays the manager upgraded us to an upper floor with a nice spacious room with a king bed and also sent up a bottle of wine :) The location was great as it was a 5 minute walk to the Subway station, right by the World Trade Centre and 9/11 Memorial. We were on the 30th floor with nice views and had a very clean room with a comfortable bed! The only negative was that our room was right next to the hallway ice machine & staff room (cleaning) so sometimes we were woken up by staff talking on their radio/phone and other cleaning noises. We did try Bill's Burger for breakfast on the 2nd day but while staff was amazing the food was just so so (especially at the ridiculous prices) and we were actually turned off when the waiter brought moldy bread (toast) to our table ... we sent it back right away ... he was very apologetic but we would still not recommend the restaurant to anyone :(  The hotel though we would definitely recommend!

title: Wonderful Location!
text: We enjoyed our stay and enjoyed the views of the Statten Island Ferry and Ellis Island. Reserved our room on a discount travel site prior to our trip to NYC so ended up with excellent room rates. The hotel does have a $15 per day per person destination fee, plus parking is expensive. Only a couple blocks to the subway meant that we could be anywhere really fast! Much faster than taking a bus or driving. The hotel is also right next to the World Trade Centre site and the memorial and museum (which is closed and barricaded at night). There is a viewing window for hotel patrons but only a private bar for folks staying on the highest floors. We had a choice of staying outside the city and commuting or being more centrally located. We are glad we decided to stay in the city!

title: Very good!
text: Very good hotel at a reasonable price. Nice and clean rooms with a beauiful harbor view. Some rooms facing Statue of Liberty. A bit far from main NYC attractions but for overnight is an excellent choice. Have no idea what happened to Marriot Rewards program but now you could receive only 1 000 points or a $10 coupon at a restaurant on site, no room upgrades, no Elite member amenities, nothing, rewards program becomes unuseful.Overall is hard 4, clean room for a reasonable price. Period. No service at all.

title: Nice hotel in good location near One World Center
text:
This is a nice Marriott property in Wall Street area next to One World Center/ 9-11 Memorial, Battery Park and ferry terminals for Staten Island Ferry and Statue of Liberty ferries.

Staff at checkin and checkout was very courteous and helpful - a pleasant surprise in NYC hotels;)

Hotel has a 15 per day allowance to offset some mandatory charges. Yes items may be costly in kiosk, but remember to use the money.

One negative is much higher valet parking rates $80 in spite of multiple commercial parkings next door.  This reduces value if you drive in compared to total cost in any midtown similar hotels. Suggest prepaid parking at half the cost in many parking spots on Albany street.

If you use public transport this is great for subway, NJ transit or ferries!

Overall a nice stay in a good location.

title: Vacanza a NewYork
text: Hotel in stile americano. Camere spaziose e pulite. Buon servizio. È posizionato in downtown NY. Comodo per una visita a ground zero e alla statua della libertà. Midtown (empire state building, moma, etc) deve essere raggiunta o con taxi o con metropolitana con una fermata lì vicino. Io comunque ho apprezzato la posizione, lontano dalla confusione dei turisti che assediano la broadway e time square. Si vive una NY più reale senza perdere la possibilità di vedere i punti di interesse.

title: Room not ready until 5.00pm
text:
We were on a tour with imagine cruising and left the Queen Mary ship at 9.00am , we arrived at this hotel by 10.00 and we were aware the room would not be available until 4.00pm. We went of sightseeing and returned to the hotel at 3.45, unfortunately we had a downpour and we got very wet, on arrival at the hotel we had nowhere to sit and were told the rooms were still not ready, we waited until  5.00 , by this time I was really chilled and as a result did get a cold for the rest of the tour. 
No apology was given which compared to another hotel we stayed at (embassy row ) in Washington DC , who gave us a compliment breakfast for delays of the luggage reaching the room , makes you realise the big chain hotels just let down guests and waiting for your room is just a too bad attitude, and of course what can you do at that time of an evening and being part of  a tour ..... Nothing ! Thanks for my cold Marriott !

title: Clean, modern with an excelent view
text: The view of the Hudson was excellent and the room was clean, tidy, spacious and in general the hotel amenities were very good. The staff were friendly and there was a $15 daily allowance which was a nice touch. The only real criticism was for the prices. The 15 dollars was barely enough for 2 beers at the hotel bar and the bottled water in the room was 5 - 7 dollars. Overall this was a high quality hotel which I would happily use again.

title: Just Okay
text: Stayed here for a Birthday trip to see the statue of liberty with my family. Upon arrival the front desk staff was very friendly and accommodating. They even sent up 2 bottles of Processa and chocolate covered strawberries with a note to say Happy Birthday to me.Once getting off the elevator it was clear that the hotel  needs updating the suites bathroom had wall paper on the walls and the couches, drapery looked like its seen better days. The bathroom looked somewhat updated minus the wallpaper. The shower had a shower curtain and liner which to me screams germs. I did inspect the curtain and it was clean to the eye but in my opinion shower doors are the way to go. The bed was comfy but the dust ruffle that covers under the bed was very dirty and should be washed. We had a city view and requested a high floor and it was AMAZING! I highly recommended a high floor. All and all our stay and the room was o.k. nothing special.

title: موقع الفندق ممتاز
text:
فندق ماريوت ماركيز تايم سكوير منهاتن ، نيويورك يتميز  الفندق في قلب التايم سكوير ويحتوي على العديد من المرافق من أهمها السوبر ماركت و ستاربكس و محل التي موبيل للهواتف من 

العيوب لايوجد بالغرف ثلاجة و ماكروويف

title: Excellent Hotel
text: Excellent hotel, clean and spacious, 2 queen size beds, large bathroom. Great location, close and handy to everyth8ng. Staff are very accommodating, nothing too much trouble. Nice bar area, good breakfast.

title: Average Marriott Stay
text: I stay in hotels 75-125 nights a year and mainly stay with Marriott/SPG properties. This was a very average stay for me. The hotel is in a good location but it is quite dated. The hotel staff also was not the friendliest and welcoming. Very stand offish from other Marriott properties that I stayed at in NYC. I would only stay here again for economical reasons.

title: Отлично
text: Отель понравился. Уютный номер, удобные кровати и... потрясающий вид из окон. Попался угловой номер, так что был вид и на водную гладь и на небоскребы. Рядом несколько станций метро и основные достопримечательности района (Бруклинский мост, музей 9/11, Уолл стрит, Всемирный торговый центр и т.д.).

title: Conveniently located
text: This hotel is conveniently located next to the WTC area. If you are planning on using the metro, there are multiple stations all around. The hotel is a little old and tired but the location makes it worth it.

title: Good views ... enjoyed it
text: I stayed here a couple of times when I first started visiting NYC about 11 years ago and have always had great experiences.  Excellent service, a little awkward to get around by subway if you're new to the area but I loved it.

title: If you like avoiding the hustle and bustle of NYC you will enjoy your stay here.
text: I have stayed in NYC on a number of occassions, and really like walking out of my hotel and not being in the hustle and bustle of NYC. The hotel is in a good location and the staff was awesome. The hotel has a Starbucks and just across the side street is Morton's Steak House. We did not enjoy the restaurant "Bills Bar and Burgers". Worst food ever! We tried twice, just to ensure the cook was not having a bad night. Still, worse food ever!

title: Marriott Downtown
text: Good location right off West Street, next to 9/11 memorial site. Even though it's right on a major road and in sight distance of the Brooklyn Battery Tunnel, you don't hear any traffic noise. If you're planning to take the subway from Penn/Grand Central, it's a little bit more of a walk, but Uber from Penn is quick and relatively cheap since you're on West Side Highway for majority of the time. If you're arriving in the early AM, West Side Highway is a parking lot going downtown, so take the subway. The concierge lounge is large and has the typical ammenities. The almost 360 degree view of downtown Manhattan and the river make it a very cool place to sit and eat breakfast. The restaurant in the lobby is good for drinks/burgers and is priced fairly for NYC. If you're coming to NYC to sight see in Times Square, go to Marriott Marquis or another hotel closer to Times Square. With a little effort, and since downtown Manhattan is only about 1/2 to 3/4 of a mile wide, you can walk to Gracie Mansion, Chinatown, Little Italy, etc.

title: Amazing view
text:
It was purely a work trip ,I stayed on the 9th floor and my window view was towards the hudson river, which was the best during sunrise and even looked beautiful at night.

Clean and big rooms, my room was with two twin beds although i stayed alone but i had extra space which worked out well for me. Also, very friendly and helpful staff

Bill's bar and burger has amazing food with good service and helpful staff

title: Such a nice place
text: It is NY so the rooms are small but it is a nice place to stay. We went around Christmas so the decorations were beautiful.  It snowed while the so I loved looking ot the window and watching kids play in the little park area.  Perfect distance to the 911 Museum and several other sites

title: Nice property in a Great Location!
text: We had a great corner room with a view out to Ellis Island.  Nice, comfortable hotel.  The only negative is full beds instead of queens if you have more than 2 people.  just a couple blocks from the 9/11 memorial and a few blocks to Battery Park.  2 different subways stops in easy walking distance.  We would definitely stay again when in the city.

title: Excellent hotel
text:
Our sincere appreciation and satisfaction to experience the Test of kind Hospitality together with family feeling at New York Marriott Downtown

We went as a guest and left as a family.

Comfortable stay, and Hotel excellent location. The hotel is near the 9/11 memorial and many other places good for tourists. It's a few minutes away from the whole foods supermarket. Also there's a mini market behind the hotel. It's surrounded by metro stations. 

Our room view of the river and liberty statue was nice.

Bill's Bar and Burger restaurant has a nice atmosphere.

Concierge lounge at the 38th floor is excellent with a nice view overlooking the river and the liberty statue and the food there is good. There's also a Starbucks inside the hotel where you could grab a drink whenever you want.

The general manager is very active, he's always around checking that everything is okay.

The senior rooms operations manager is very professional, helpful and he always has a warm smile on his face as well as the assistant rooms operations manager.

All the way convenient as for sure.

title: Honeymoon
text:
This is our third time visiting the hotel and it's still great to stay in.

We arrived tired from our flight and due to a small mixup with the destination charge which was easily sorted by the front desk check in was easy.  Also we where upgraded to a suite which was a nice surpirse.

The staff within the hotel and.i mean all staff are easily.approacable if you have a problem and the doorman always say hello and goodbye if your leaving or arriving, they also like to have a chat with you which I found enjoyable and puts you at ease.

The hotel itself is close.to a wide range of shops as well as having a Starbucks and a bill burgers on the premise both of which are handy to have around, with the Starbucks be wary it can get busy sometimes on the morning.

There is a wide range of subways near by that allow easy access to all of Manhattan as well as easy access to Coney island.when we visited, having a week's MTA subway pass is a must.

In all I would again stay in this hotel the staff are wonderful and the property makes you feel safe

title: Pretty hotel missing standard amenities
text:
It’s stunning to me when a Marriott in NYC doesn’t provide room service. Their only food option is a burger place in the lobby.  You can call and get your own brown bag dinner, or eat there, but being unable to get a tray of food when you’re exhausted from cancelled and delayed flights is not welcoming. 
Lately, in other locations,  Marriott has started offering your room service in a bag, with plastic utensils and plates. For the price of their rooms, they’re missing the boat. 
The room itself is well appointed, but again, Marriott now gives you one bar of soap, so remember to transfer it from sink to shower when you need it. This is just cheap.
I am at the hotel as a speaker for a conference. I wonder why the planning group chose this hotel. It’s convenient to the financial district, but it’s not the class act this company should expect. 
As a frequent business traveler I have started avoiding Marriotts. This reconfirms my perceptions.

title: Very Average
text: Overall, I would not recommend this hotel. It is very “tired” and the rooms are nothing special. Also, don’t expect any perks like a bottle of water if you are an elite member. On the good side, the room rates are reasonable by NYC standards and the room was generally clean (except for the hairs in the bathtub). The front desk staff are not as professional as they are at other properties. I had never stayed downtown before so wanted to give it a try.  The location was fine, although I like staying near Central Park better, which is what I would recommend for vacationers. Overall, not terrible, but not good either.

title: 隣の部屋の音が聞こえすぎてうるさい
text:
連日、隣の部屋の音楽のビートが、響いてうるさい。廊下での話し声も聞こえるし、ハズレの宿泊でした。
部屋から自由の女神がビルの間に見えたことはラッキーでした。
ロケーションもいいのに、騒音がなければよかったかも。フロントは日本語できる人いません。ちなみに他のツアー客は、シャワーが故障していて、真夜中に修理の人が来たらしい。ひどいね。

title: Clean and convenient
text: I stayed at this hotel one night when visiting the nyse. It is clean and conveniently located. It’s nothing special but also I had no complaints. My room was clean and the bed was comfortable. They have a Starbucks in the lobby which is convenient and a pretty good hamburger resteraunt in the lobby as well. If there was an ability to rank between 3 and 4 stars I would give it 3 and 1/2.

title: Good location but hotel is underwhelming
text:
We booked 2 rooms at this hotel before moving to Time Square for the last night.  The location was good for our outings at the world trade centre and statute of liberty.  The hotel upgraded us with a river view but this again didn't really feel like an upgrade as the real views were on the higher views.

As many have commented the hotel charges a $15 fee per night which is then available to spend on hotel services and Bill's.  This is where things seem to go wrong.  Bill's is centre of the hotel's food services and simply put a burger joint is not appropriate as the hotel's main restaurant service.  

We ordered some food there and got a medium rare burger.  My fault for not asking for well done but they didn't ask either.  Also they forgot the cheese on my cheesy fries.  My request for this was met with could you come down and we can give you some cheese before the person on the phone became self conscious of what she was saying and finally said that she would just give a fresh set done correctly.  

The breakfast is in Bills too and this is poor.  The food is limited and the server on the first day was literally clearing our plates while we were still eating. The 2nd day server was much better though.  The breakfast menu needs to be extended.

The staff at reception come across as but rude trying to be jokey but it doesn't work.  I expect full service Marriott hotel staff to be professional until they know their guests at which stage a less formal approach maybe welcome.  Exec lounge is closed on weekends which is annoying as it has the best views.  

Unfortunately I cannot recommend this hotel. The hotel staff are inconsistent in quality, the facilities are a little tired and the use of Bills via the forced payment of $15 adds insult to injury.  

The good news is that is didn't detract to much from our New York trip which was great

title: Employees named Homero yell at you
text: I'm a handicapped that was taking care of my sick service dog. I was out front and I was in the midst of cleaning up after my sick working dog and because I am handicapped, I can't do things fast nor that efficient. In the middle of cleaning up, the Porter, or whatever his title is, named Homero, decided he had to be unkind and chose to yell at me to clean up after my dog, yelling! He was over twenty feet away from me and his volume was so loud that it felt like he was standing right next to me. If he thought that I was walking away, that is one thing, he could have kindly said, please make sure you continue cleaning up. I wouldn't have mind that as he may not be that observant - obviously - that I am handicapped and need extra time to go to trash and come back to clean up. But no, this horrible human being decided to shout at me. He continued to yell at me, that I lost my cool and started to yell back at him for being so unkind to someone. I kept asking him that he could be nice, but he yelled again and told me he is nice. I don't think so. It went on and on like that and I am ashamed that I scooped to his level, however, I have absolutely 100% lost respect for Marriott, who I enjoyed staying with, for employing such a horrible human being that is so unkind to people. He told me other people weren't cleaning up so he had to make sure I was...BUT I was in the middle of cleaning so he can't punish me for what other people do. Especially when he was present as I was cleaning. I don't think I'll ever be returning to Marriot because of Homero. I told the manager, but he didn't seem to care whatsoever. He said he would talk to him, but as I left, I saw him roll his eyes and retreat back inside. That's how Marriot handles themselves. Thankfully, there are so many other hotels, that are far better equipped in service and not treat another human being so poorly.

title: Good location, nice hotel, but BEWARE OF THE EXTRA $15/NIGHT CHARGE
text: The hotel is a typical Marriott. Rooms are reasonably sized given it is in New York. For sights, it is right next to the 9/11 Memorial, across the street from Battery City (great walks along the Hudson), and close to the ferries and trips to Ellis Island and Statue of Liberty. So in every respect, it's a good hotel and I would give it 4 stars were I a tourist. BUT, my trip was a business trip. I arrived late in the evening and was checking out the next morning before 7am. The hotel charges every guest a $15 per day fee (over and above the room rate) for something (I never really understood) that the staff tried to explain (You apparently can use it for bottled water, or the restaurant, or for some other things I never figured out completely). But you pay it regardless of whether you use the money for anything and regardless of your status with Marriott. Now I was in the hotel for less than 10 hours total. This is not a resort hotel in any way. Nor does someone doing business have the time to avail themselves of whatever the fee pays for. When you complain, the hotel staff says it is mentioned on the Web site when you make a reservation. Who knows? I didn't see it probably because I never imagined there would be such a fee in business-oriented hotel on Wall Street. Check out the Courtyard one block away or the Millenium Hilton with great views of the 9/11 Memorial (stayed there the week before and there was no fee). Or the Conrad if you need to go to GS or the World Financial Center.

title: Great hotel in New York
text:
Great hotel in Lower Manhattan
Great hotel in New York City. Great location. Comfortable room. Great view of the Hudson. On the ground floor there is a grill bar. Free Internet is only on the 1st floor - it's frustrating. Near WTC 1 and Observatory. Unfortunately, I was in New York for a short time, as there was a snow storm these days.

title: Fuktige rom
text: Rimelig hotell med trivelig og hjelpsom betjening. Rommet var av grei størrelse. Uheldigvis var rommet konstant fuktig. Sengetøy og klær kjentes bløte ut.. Det var en heller ubehagelig opplevelse og ødela mye av ferien.

title: Busy busy busy
text: Let me start by saying the room and the location were great. I really love this neighborhood in New York and if it’s your first time or you’re a tourist I highly recommend. I also absolutely loved the bed and slept super hard so that’s a plus. That being said, the hotel felt overbooked (I understand this is probably just due to limited elevators and a small lobby) but it did feel chaotic every time I went downstairs. Also the staff at reception were often quite rude. The bellman staff on the other hand were so kind and phenomenal. The reception staff were dealing with lots of groups and huge numbers of guests and that’s probably why they were slightly rude but I wouldn’t expect that in this location and price point. Overall, ok. I’d book again if it was the cheapest in the area.

title: Excelente
text: Hotel bonito com funcionários gentis e fácil acesso. Há 4 estações de metrô proximas. O quarto é bem confortável e com excelente espaco e limpo diariamente. Há a cobrança de uma taxa de 15$/ dia que pode ser revertida em produtos da lojinha ou do Bill's burguer , que é uma das melhores hamburgueria de lá. O wi-fi ficou grátis TB por causa dessa taxa. O hotel não oferece café da manhã mas tem uma Starbucks no térreo. A localização do hotel é ótima para as atrações do sul de Manhattan...o centro financeiro, o World trade Center, o ferry p estátua da liberdade...tudo feito a pé. Para acessar Midtown,  acesse pela linha azul que fica no World trade Center. Gostei muito do atendimento da rede Marriot. Voltaria a me hospedar lá, sem dúvida.

title: Resort fee is ridiculous
text:
$15 resort fee for this hotel. However it is located in a city center. There is nothing "resort" about it. Pretty much just an excuse to pad the profits of the hotel.

Hotel itself is fairly dated. Needs renovations. The size of the rooms is relatively good.

title: Great Stay!
text: Have stayed here on numerous trips to NYC and always have a great room. Very nice sized rooms for NYC.  Love having Bill's and Starbucks downstairs. The beds are comfy, bathrooms are spacious, and the entire staff was friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Just okay
text: I am a Silver elite member of Marriott, so generally a fan.  This hotel is well located for business or fun downtown, but it had its problems.  The staff was friendly.  The room a typical Marriott sized room --BUT the ice machines were broken and most importantly, I could not get in through the Wifi all weekend.  Disaster!  And the breakfast was sub-par. Lots of good places to eat around the hotel so avoid the pricey fare in the hotel restaurant.  The price was right.....

title: Average hotel needing upgrades
text: My 7th trip to NYC and have stayed previously at the Park Hyatt, Marriott Times Square and the Waldorf. Was expecting a little more from this hotel. Had a car service drop us off in front of the hotel and no bellmen were around, lugged the suitcases in and went to check in. At the counter was told I was being upgraded to a vice presidential suite which was awesome but only had me staying for 1 night, I expained that was booked for 7 nights and had prepayed it. Clerk asked me to find my reservation on my app to prove it. After about 15 minutes I was told that the upgrade was not available. Got to my junior suite to find stains on the furniture and a basic lack of upkeep. Great downtown location.

title: Nice stay
text: Stayed here last night on business. Nice room, clean and good location for 9/11 museum and downtown. Some good bars in the area. Not too many restaurants nearby. A bit disappointed that I was not offered bottled water when I checked in.

title: Great location with great staff
text:
We stayed here during a weekend visit to the downtown area. We stayed in a corner suite that overlooked the Hudson River. All of the staff at this hotel were very helpful, friendly and professional. The location of this hotel is very convenient to the South Street Seaport, Brooklyn and the Wall Street area. Nice lounge with an awesome bartender Danny.
We will definitely return to this hotel.

title: good-enough hotel in downtown
text: Lovely view of Trade tower memorial. Room was good. Service was excellent. Dining left something to be desired.  But I will review the restaurant elsewhere.  Staff was very helpful and location is great.

title: 標準的なホテルです
text: 12名のツアーで利用しました。ワールドトレードセンターのすぐ南側にある落ち着いた雰囲気のホテルです。マンハッタン島ではかなり南です。早朝散歩をしました。ハドソン川沿いに歩くと清潔そうな公園、ヨット、対岸の高層ビルなどがきれいでした。街路樹にはリスがいました。ブルックリン橋、ウォール街へも歩けます。閑静な立地だと思います。ホテルそのものは、マリオットシリーズなので不便な固定式のシャワー、スリッパ・ウォシュレットなし、コーヒーマシーンありでまあアメリカの標準的なホテルなのでしょう。朝の食事は例によって、甘くて、脂っこくて、野菜が少なくて、健康的とは言えません。アメリカではお相撲さんみたく異常に太った人をたくさん見ました。こうした食生活をしてるとああなるのでしょう。

title: Great tourist or business location
text: I stayed there two weeks ago with the family and we had easy access to all of lower Manhattan and then jumped on the subway and saw all of central New York City. The staff was friendly and the upgraded room was large with a great view of Freedom Tower. I went back a week later for business in lower Manhattan and it was very easy walk to all of the customers I needed to see.

title: Bon emplacement
text:
L’hotel est à quelques minutes à pied de la Free Down Tower ce qui est très pratique.
Notre chambre était spacieuse, propre mais l’ensemble dépassé.
La machine à café à été très appréciée.
Le personnel de l’accueil est plutôt froid.
A l’arrivée comme au départ nous avons charrier nous mêmes nos lourdes valises. Pas de rampes d’acces mais des escaliers.
Le restaurant de l’hotel est  à déconseiller car très bruyant et la nourriture moyenne.

title: Great location, Great Rooms
text:
I thought the location was great. It was 4 blocks from Battery Park (Statue Cruises) and walking distance to the 9/11 museum and reflecting pools with ample public transportation options. (Make use of the subway, it's the quickest and most efficient option.) The room was much bigger than I had expected in Manhattan. The bed was comfortable and there were tons of charging options for our phones. I'm not sure you can get such a nice hotel for cheap in Manhattan anywhere else. 

This is why we didn't give a 5 star review. We were told that our $15 a day location fee could be used at the restaurant. So on our final day we ran up a $30 bill on breakfast takeout. The food was not good. We didn't think much of it as we were using our comps. However, when we checked out we learned that the location fee had to be used daily- it did not accumulate. So we wound up paying for half of our not so good breakfast. (Potatoes were cold, french toast was almost burned.) Do yourself a favor and use it on snacks and bottled water and find breakfast elsewhere. It's NYC and there are lots of great options nearby.

title: No complaints
text: Beautiful view from the 30th floor, comfortable room. Easy access to the subway, WTC, Battery Park, shopping and several good restaurants ( Clinton Hall, O’Haras). 3 blocks to Wall St, Trinity Church...Staff was friendly and helpful.

title: only thing going is the view
text: This hotel is located in an ok location.  The hotel is older,  there is no pool, lots of construction going around the hotel, the rooms are so so. Could use better cleaning.  The only thing amazing is the view from sitting in bed i could see lady liberty.  Other than that not worth what we paid a night.

title: Nice Property - Very Business Traveler Friendly!
text: I traveled in May 2018 and I frequent this property for Business. I must say that I am never disappointed. The Bill's Burger and Bar is great! The hotel staff is very friendly and professional. I also love the attendees in the Concierge Lounge.If you are in New York you will not be upset with this choice. WTC is directly across the street as well.

title: Good location , but thats all
text: Marriot is for me a guarantee of quality, but not in this case. Room was standard, maybe a little bit small for 4 people but still ok. But what was not good was that free internet was only in the lobby, not in the room! I think that in 21 century for this expensive hotel very bad ad. And same for breakfast, which was very limited and for foe strange reason only for 2 people even when we reserved the room for 4?  So good location on lower Manhattan ,but bad service

title: Bachlor Party
text:
Hotel is great. Bar is great. Bed is great. Customer service is great. Close to all you need. 

Stayed for a bachlor party weekend from Toronto. Got wasted. It was awesome.  What else do you need? Stay here.

title: Hotelazo
text:
No nos alojamos en el hotel pero estuvimos en su observatorio giratorio en la que puedes comer cenar o tomar algo mientras ves como giras a vuelta por hora y vas viendo toda la ciudad.
Para acceder a esta última planta debes coger un ascensor panorámico que te lleva directamente y a una alta velocidad a ese nivel mientras pasas por todas las plantas en las que ves desde el mismo las diferentes actividades que hay en ellas.

title: Good Hotel
text: Right on a water, always clean, quiet (and that is important), professional staff, there are rooms with a view. Hotel near the ferries, and not too far from busy Manhattan life. There are plenty of activities around, and Broadway St is just 10 minutes or less away.

title: Handled the 5 Boro Bike Tour VERY WELL
text:
My husband & I stayed at the New York Marriott Downtown for two nights so that we could enjoy doing the 5 Boro Bike Tour.

The review is so high because they handled the cyclists so well, otherwise it's a standard Marriott.

5 BORO BIKE TOUR ACCOMMODATIONS
When we pulled up our car with bikes, there were two staff willing to help us take the bike, bike rack, and luggage out of the car.  There were temporary crowd control barricades set up perpendicular to the hotel on the sidewalk where we could lock our bikes, if that was our preference.  We chose to bring our bikes to our room, which was not a problem (note: you are told that if you damage the room with your bike there is a $250 fee).  After we settled in our room we went out for dinner and noticed that they had posted a security guard out front to keep an eye on the bikes outside.  The morning of the ride, there were two staff members outside helping guests with their bikes, in addition, they put out a table with water bottles, granola bars, and bananas!  After the ride we had no problem getting back up to our room with our bikes.  Many guests checked out Sunday afternoon, after the ride and the staff was again helping people put bike racks on their cars and loading luggage.  We stayed until Monday morning when staff once again helped with loading cars.  The hotel handled a bunch of people with bikes VERY WELL.  Kudos to the management.

5 BORO TIP: my husband is a Marriott Rewards member and therefore has access to the higher floor/concierge rooms, you DO NOT WANT a higher floor for the ride.  The hotel staff warned us to give ourselves at least an hour to make it down from the 36th floor. We were in Wave 2 and brought our bikes down stairs at 5 AM, locked them up, and went to breakfast to ensure we had no issues with all of the other guests bringing bikes down.  After breakfast we went back to our room to get dressed and grab our stuff - we ended up taking the stairs down as the wait for elevators had started at 6:30 AM.

ROOM: we stayed in room 3612, which has a nice view of Jersey City (see pictures), you can see the Colgate clock, the Liberty Science Center, and the taller buildings in Exchange Place.  3612 is a king bed room with ample space for bike storage.  Room has king bed, two night stands, ONE charger on nightstands, desk, desk chair, fridge, small closet, chair, and ottoman.  We did not hear other guests through the walls (as always we heard loud people in hall - when will people learn?). The room was very clean.  The room safe was in a desk drawer.

COMMON AREAS: The lobby has very limited seating.  There is a Starbucks & a burger restaurant within the hotel.  The burger restaurant was terrible (never eat at the hotel in NYC - we know that and shouldn't have).  Concierge lounge is large enough, but does not have comfortable seating and is more of a cafe setting with tables and chairs (open Sunday night & Monday morning).

PARKING: Valet parking.  We were told to expect a wait time of 1 hour when we wanted to retrieve our car - I assume this was for Sunday checkout due to the high volume of riders.  We only waited 30 minutes for our car (standard for other NYC hotels - 30 minute wait for valet).

title: Is 0 stars an option?
text:
My friends and I booked here for the 5 borough bike Tour (4 of us for 2 nights.) We didn’t stay however, because we received the worst customer service of any hotel I’ve ever stayed at. 
Allow me to elaborate. 
One of the perks of booking through the 5 borough site, was that the hotels offered “perks” to bikers. We got no perks. We got a ruined weekend.
Upon arrival, we started to check in. We were told that the late departure on Tour day we were offered was based on availability and would be $60 additional. Ok. Annoying, but not deal breaking. Then they said our room wasn’t ready (we were early) but they wouldn’t let us store our bikes anywhere while we waited. They offered for us to pay $20 per bike to store them “across the street.” Ok. Thanks, but no thanks. So then they call us 4 hours later saying the room is ready. We get up to the room and it’s 1 bed for 4 people. I go back down to talk to the desk and they say their reservation said I had one person staying. Interesting, because mine says 4 people staying and lists all the names and that a double bed quad is requested. They told me that my reservation was based on availability and their solution was that we could purchase another room. Ha! We said that they should give us another room because we paid for a room for 4 people and they couldn’t provide that. We asked to speak to a manager. Our next mistake was expecting the management to actually take care of the problem. 
Casey Boyle, the “manager” came over blank faced and approved to other room. No apology, no smile, didn’t act like she cared, nothing. Fine. Don’t need the manager’s approval of me, just need what I paid for. So my friends take the new room and my guest and I go back up to the single bed room. The door doesn’t open. So I go back down again and tell them that the key doesn’t work. They reset the key, check my ID, and we go back up and open the door. Well, there was a man in the room, freshly checked in. At this point, it’s just ridiculous. He was upset too because he said the room was supposed to have a certain view he paid for. Probably even more upset now that he’s been walked in on random strangers with a key to his room haha. Obviously the hotel was having trouble keeping the reservation requests straight. 
So once AGAIN, I venture back down to the lovely Miss Boyle to let her know that she gave me someone else’s room. She then tells me that we weren’t supposed to keep that room, we were all supposed to move to the new room with DOUBLE BEDS. Wait, what? So they had a double bed room available even though they said they didn’t?? And we had to get approval to get the room we paid for?? Miss Boyle was again unapologetic, even though I had been up and down the elevator 4 times and wasted 5 hours of my day trying to check in. At this point, I didn’t want to stay. If she would have just faked like she cared even a tiny bit, I would not be here writing this review. I am a manager and I work with people to resolve issues. I am BESIDE MYSELF at how she handled the situation. A simple apology honestly would have sufficed. 
Let me help you out, Casey Boyle: “Ms. Young, I’m so sorry about this confusion. It’s been an extremely busy weekend, and we are trying to meet everyone’s requests the best we can. We’ll get this taken care of, I assure you. Can I offer you a drink on the house tonight at our downstairs burger restaurant?” Simple! That’s how you save customers, Casey Boyle. Now you try! ;-) 
We were extremely upset with the way we were treated and won’t be returning. Even further, I’ll be telling my experience to the world in hopes that no one else has their weekend ruined as well. I’ll also be contacting the Tour coordinators to let them know about the experience and suggest they not market the hotel on their site next year. 
When we said we were leaving, Casey Boyle issued my refund for the deposit and said, “you’re all set.” I looked at her and said, “That’s is? No apology or anything?” The woman BLANK STARED at me, I kid you not. 
Bravo, Marriott. 👎🏽

title: Great location, comfortable, furniture a little tired
text:
Had a lovely weekend here -- so close to the subway, near 9/11 sites, terrific views from the upper floors.

Very hospitable staff and kind front desk.

Thought the rooms furniture and bathroom need a refresh  -- especially for $400/night.

title: Fabulous service!
text: Loved everything about this hotel from beginning to end.  The service was top-notch.  The hotel was clean.   The room was great size-  larger than other hotels I have stayed at in the city.   It was convenient to get places and easy to get Lyft to pick us up.

title: Nice but looks tired
text: location, location, location.  too bad the room they gave me had no view other than the building next door. my travelling companion got much better view over looking the hudson.    overall a nice stay but weather didn't cooperate.  i would go back if they dropped the prices

title: ツアーで利用しました
text:
ベッドのの心地は良かったですし、アメニティがTHANNでやタオル類も充実していました。
コーヒーも多めに備えてあって良かったです。ただ、ドライヤーのフィルターは埃まみれでした…まあ海外あるあるですね。
バスタブがかなり低くかったのでびっくりしましたが、バスカーテンが2種類の素材を組み合わせてあり、とても機能的で水漏れを気にせず使えて良かったです。シャワーは固定式です。湯量も温度も良好でした。
朝食は意見が分かれると思いますが、トーストとベーコンorソーセージ、ポテトセットは美味しかったですし、作り置きなのかもしれませんが、すぐに提供されました。トーストはブラウンかホワイトか選べます。
2日目はパンケーキを選びましたが、提供まで時間はかかりましたが美味しかったです。
スタッフさんの英語が分からず謝ると気にしないでと言われましたし、楽しんでる？って聞いてくれたので気持ちよく過ごせました。ただコーヒーカップの茶渋は気になりましたし、早めに朝食時間に行けばいいかもしれませんが、他のお客さんが多いと日本人にとって時間はかかりそうでした。
グランドゼロに近く、手を合わせることもできましたし、10分程歩いた所にWhole Foods Maretもあり、証券取引所やWall StreetのBullもあり、落ち着いた雰囲気の街中にありました。

title: Nice stay
text: It is a Marriott, so they are all the same. The room is laid out very functionally. The staff was great. I left behind my iPad and they went above and beyond to look for it and get it to me. That is excellent customer service. I give 5 stars for customer service.

title: Not really worth the price or the standard of a Marriott chain hotel
text:
Location is good, it is 2 min walk to the World Trade Centre Memorial site and near several train stations.  Rooms are not very big but doesn't provide basic toiletries (toothbrush, amenity kids, room slippers).  The AC/Header is by the window and can get quite noisy at night when it sort of restart itself every other hour.  Opposite there is a mall which has some nice take away eateries.  Take a walk/jog down North Cove Yacht Harbour and Battery Park City Esplanade just opposite the hotel if the weather permits.  For shopping, there are Century 21 and World Trade Centre which are near by, otherwise cab to 5th Avenue is about USD20-30 depending on traffic/tips.
Overall, an average hotel with a luxury hotel chain price tag

title: Enjoyed the location
text: I am not sure what to expect of New York hotels, as I have only stayed in B & B before.  This was kind of an average hotel,neither annoying nor amazing.  On the downside, the room was stuffy and the bathroom dated with a tiny tub.  On the upside, the location was great.  I have not stayed downtown before and it was great to see that end of things.  Easy access to the Brooklyn Bridge, the Staten Island ferry and only half a block from the World Trade Centre.  The staff were friendly and helpful; no problems with check in or getting assistance, directions etc.  The restaurant is kind of a one trick pony but my hamburger was pretty delicious.  Starbucks on site as well.  Again, I cannot comment on value for the dollar as I am not a frequent hotel stayer but they did have lots of discounts, mine was from AAA and they didn't even ask to see my card on check in.

title: Tolle Lage
text:
Die Lage neben dem WTC ist sehr gut. Es ist nicht weit von der UBahn entfernt und man kann fußläufig Wall Street und WTC gut erreichen.

Wir hatten kein Frühstück im Hotel, es gibt aber eine Starbucks direkt im Hotel.

Zimmer waren sauber, etwas altbacken und mit Teppich.

title: Bel soggiorno
text:
Siamo stati 4 notti ad aprile per una vacanza a ny 
Personale cortese e disponibile 
Camera per tre con due letti forse un po’ piccoli per dormirci in due...
Pulita e sempre in ordine
Eravamo al 30mo piano con vista sulla statua della libertà si paga un supplemento per il piano alto
Il wi-fi in camera è a pagamento e gratuito nella hall
La colazione non è inclusa ma all interno senza dover uscire c è starbucks che noi portavano in camera
Palestra al 5 piano ben organizzata 
Insomma siamo stati molto bene

title: Good Hotel with Great Staff
text:
This is a good property in a great location - close enough but away from the noise of Manhattan. The staff of the property is excellent. Check-in was great, thanks to Adnan and Eric. Rooms are a decent size and well-equipped. The on-site 'Bill's Bar & Burger' is great.
Two issues. 
1. The hotel does not offer room service.
2. Executive Lounge is closed on the weekends.
My stay was very comfortable.

title: Great stay!
text:
We arrived at the hotel a few hours before check-in and they were able to get us rooms (3) with no hassle. The hotel is located right in the Financial District with lots to do during the day but keep in mind things aren't open as late as they would be in the Times Square area. Our room was spacious and clean, no complaints! The overall decor of the hotel is nice and the staff were very friendly. We would't hesitate to stay here again. 
*Wifi is only free in the lobby unless you're a rewards member!

title: Nice room, great location, wonderful staff!
text: My sister, mom and I stayed at the New York Marriott Downtown over the Easter long weekend. We arrived late at night and the only room left had only one bed. They quickly brought a cot up and set it up in the room. It was surprisingly comfy and we had no desire or need to change rooms the next day. The room was very clean and the bathroom was spotless (Gladys took care of our room and she was fabulous). We had a nice view and went to sleep with the blinds open each night, so that we could enjoy the lights of the city. The location is great! Literally a 1 minute walk to the 9-11 memorial, a 5 minute walk to great shopping at Century 21, 5 minutes to deeeelish NY pizza at Steve's around the corner, a short walk to all the financial district sights and another short walk to Battery park and the ferries to see the Statue of Liberty. There was an insanely massive line all around the park as people waited to board the Statue of Liberty boats. Save yourself the time and money and take the FREE Staten Island ferry. It passes by the Statue of Liberty for some great photos and you can also check out Staten Island. On the island, we checked out a farmer's market, did some geocaching and took some great pics of lower Manhattan. The NY Marriott Downtown also has a handy business centre where you can check-in for flights and print out your boarding passes. We were in New York to celebrate my mom's 70th birthday. I mentioned this to the Front Desk staff and they were so kind to send up a nice note and a gift box of treats for her! She was sooo appreciative and surprised!! Thank you, NY Marriott Downtown!! We look forward to our next visit to New York and another stay at the NY Marriott Downtown!

title: Great Location
text: Excellent Hotel, with a very friendly staff, located near many points of connection with the subway and the PATH, and a formidable view to the WTC, and a block away from the  century 21 store, my wife loves it.

title: Lovely hotel
text: Beautiful hotel, most comfortable bed I have ever slept on!! It was huge! (King deluxe) spotlessly and clean room and bathroom, massive TV too!! Food was really nice in (I think it's called) Billy's which is attached to the hotel, breakfast anywhere else we found was hard work to have a seat unless waited ages. So Billy's I'd recommend for breakfast! Location of hotel is at the bottom of NYC but tube station ain't far, but your almost right by the world trade center (ground zero)

title: okay
text: Good location, near all lower Manhattan sights.  Small rooms.  Few amenities.  Noisy neighbors in adjoining room. Cleanliness was minimal.  Fortunately, we got a good price over the weekend.  I would not recommend.

title: Good location
text: We stayed one night here on our back east trip to see the sights. This location is walking distance to battery park for the ferry going to Statue of Liberty and Ellis island. Also walking distance to the 911 memorial. We did not have much time for any other sites but these sites were a must. The hotel bell hop was extremely nice and the hotel was clean and had a great view of the Statue of Liberty.

title: great location and beds
text: We stayed here 2 nights and were happy with our stay. Location is great, we like the down town area. Our king size bed was very comfortable and the room was quiet and clean. Check in was very friendly. Would stay again.

title: Ótimo
text: Quarto espaçoso e limpo, camas confortáveis. Quando do check-in, informaram valor da internet, mas no meu pacote pela Expedia o uso estava incluído. Um hotel deste porte deveria possuir wi-fi gratuito, o que achei o único incoveniente. Boa localizaçao, perto do WTC, Westifield Mall, Wall Street. Starbucks no próprio hotel. Funcionários atenciosos. Com certeza me hospedarei novamente. Hotel muito bom!!!

title: Unbeatable location for tourist atrractions in FiDi
text: The hotel is centrally located for everything you want to see downtown (it is a stone's throw from the 9/11 Memorial and Trinity Church etc.) The bed wasn't the comfiest, the staff was friendly, but be sure to build in extra time to wait for your bags if you check them in with the bellhop after check-out. I waited for over 20 minutes at the bellhop desk and some guy who just walked up nabbed the bellhop as he came out of an employees only door got his luggage before I was helped. It's sort of an odd system. Also, late at night there's not much open and had to walk a ways to find someplace to buy some water/snacks etc. so my advice is to plan ahead.

title: Not impressed
text:
Arrived at the hotel after a very stressful drive from Washington DC. After a protracted check-in I was ignored by the the concierge until I sent my son to find a trolley for the bags, at which point he made a big deal of pointing out that "it was his job to do this". 

Pros
Handy to the 9/11 memorial and other downtown sites such as Wall Street, Liberty Island ferries, Brooklyn Bridge, Battery Park and several PATH stations.

Cons
No free internet in room ($14.95 per day is bit steep) Small beds (seem smaller than a normal double). The room was cramped and rather dated. 

Travelled December '16 / Jan '17 but tripadvisor won't let me enter that far back.

title: Location - Great; Beds - Not so Much
text: First the staff and location of this hotel are amazing.  Steps from shopping and the WTC memorial, along with Wall Street and Battery Park, make this an ideal location.  The staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful everytime that I had a question.  The only reason I can't give this a five-star rating is the quality of the beds.  The sheets seemed too small for the double bed and kept coming off at night.  The mattress has seen better days as well.  The room was comfortable and the cost was cheap for a downtown Manhattan hotel.  Easy subway rides north make getting to Times Square and Broadway shows really easy.

title: Not your average Marriott
text:
My girlfriend and I stayed at this Marriott this past weekend and just didn’t really enjoy it. First thing I noticed when we walked into the room that there was space from the bottom of our hotel door to the floor. It was seriously about two or three inches. They had some kind of a convention in the hotel that weekend and I could seriously hear other people’s conversations outside in the hallway and heard ppl getting off the elevator every time they got off of it. It wasn’t horrible but it was def not amazing hearing it through out the day and even at night thru the late hours. Second the employees there are real nice but some got on my nerves real fast. I was outside smoking and didn’t see their 4 inch tall sign saying you had to smoke twenty feet away from the property. So of course I’m outside smoking and didn’t hear the guy say “you have to smoke away from the building” and then he screams that I have to smoke away from the building. Now picture this there was another hotel quest next to me ( a very attractive girl) and after he told me to smoke away from the building he let her sit there and continue to smoke.... hmmm fair right?! Now there is the restaurant that is in the hotel. For one there is no room service and if you want food you have to go get it yourself. So I ended up getting a burger and she got a chicken sandwich. When I got the food and went up stairs my girlfriend notices that the bread had some kind of garlic onion in it and she is allergic to onions she ended up getting sick not much but no where in that menu does it say anything about that being in the bread and we really couldn’t do anything about it that night because the restaurant closed at 11 so I just kept the receipt. Went down to talk to the manger and he was very nice about it and told us we could get something to make up for it. So later that day I took him up for his word and she got some bacon cheese fries. We went back up to the room To eat and they gave her some cold fries and a little bit of cheese that couldn’t prob fit on a ritz Cracker. We were so fed
Up with the restaurant that we didn’t even bother to go back down. The best part
About the hotel is prob the location. It’s great for a family vacation I would say but I honestly doubt we will be staying in this Marriott again.

title: Convenient location
text:
I stayed here with relatives when they wanted to visit NYC. We picked this because it was central to most sites in downtown Manthattan. The 9/11 Memorial and WTC were just a 10-15 minute walk away, depending on how fast you walk. This hotel location was super convenient.

As for the hotel itself, the check-in at around 3 pm can take a while. There were 4 parties ahead of us. They will have mobile check-in soon. It was not available when we visited. Once it is available, I highly recommend you download the Marriott app and use this. 

The rooms were clean and comfortable. Room service was attentive and excellent. We left a tip for room service in the room, which I recommend given the excellent value.

The gym was large and spacious with modern and clean equipment.

Highly recommended.

title: Superisingly very good
text:
Downtown is not where we usually stay, but we had meaning to try a different location and the rate was too good to pass up (especially with an additional AAA discount) 

The room does come with a $15 resort fee, but it also came with a $15 credit, which we used in the bar.

The staff were excellent (Maria & Terrell at the front desk went out of their way) the room came with a free walking tour (1 pass per night) and the location actually exceeded expectations - close to 9/11 memorial, Wall Street & Battery Park. It was also a short walk to Tribeca.

title: Well maintained high quality with positive staff
text:
We stayed for 3 nights over the President's day weekend. We checked in a little early and were happy there was a room available. Our room also had a nice view of the statue of Liberty which was an added perk.
The checkin process by Mr. Fields was fast yet friendly. The room was an average+ size for a NY room seemed like it was refreshed. Unlike other review who complained about a run down hotel - This hotel was in no way run down and was well maintained.
One of my pet peeves in hotels are the stream regulating shower. The shower at the Marriott was OK - which is average+.
As part of our stay - there is a $15 per day destination charge. It wasn't very clear what you get and how to get it but we were able to get use of it and it was actually one of the destination charged that actually offers value and not only is used to bump up rates (like in Vegas).
The package offered a guided tour, $15 per day food and beverage credit and Internet. 

The hotel restaurant (not owned by hotel) was pretty bad (One of the worst I ever visited). I would recommend using the credit at the starbucks.

The tour was interesting and lasted 2h with a small group of people. The information was geared towards people w minimal knowledge of NYC. For us, most of it was redundant - but others seemed to enjoy.

Finally, the hotel staff throughout our stay was very friendly and welcoming in a true Marriott fashion.

I would definitely recommend this marriott for anyone who wants to stay in the area or in NYC in general. Having stayed with a few other properties including the Intercontinental and the Hilton around the corner - the Marriott is definitely better.

title: Natale a ny
text: Buon albergo, pulito, comodo, cameta con vista hudson, buona posizione buon rapporto qualita'/ prezzo, buoni servizi, comodo con la metro a 100mt dal memorial 11 settembre e da eatitaly, come da tutte le attrazione di downtown, compresi i battely x liberty statue ed ellis island, personale gentile e disponibile

title: Decent Hotel, Staff can’t seem to apply points
text:
Despite requesting online and at the desk, the staff cannot seem to apply my points to
my recent stay.  Needless to say this is a complete waste of my time.  

All in all the hotel was pretty nice.  It was clean and the staff was friendly!

title: Nella media Marriott
text:
Buon albergo, nella media del brand Marriott, con il solito eccellente servizio e attenzione per il cliente.
Bar e Grill disponibile, servizio Fedex, Starbuck nella hall, tutto molto comodo.
Camera grande ma con due difetti non all'altezza dello stile Marriott: nella mia camera il soffitto si sfogliava e l'aspetto quindi non era di buona conservazione, e proprio di fronte alla porta della mia camera la macchina del ghiaccio era molto rumorosa, con disturbo del mio riposo.

title: Lifetime platinum Marriott
text: Buyer beware.  This hotel has the amenities of a Springfield suites or residence inn.  No room service, bars close at 11 and the rooms are less than average for an Omaha Marriott.  This hotel is in the heart of the WTC district where revitalization has been so key.  Won’t ever stay at this property again.

title: Good stay but could be better
text:
