I stayed at this hotel for 1 night. Considering NYC, room sizes are pretty good on 31st floor. Did not try restaurant downstairs but there was no room service which is disappointing. Internet was too slow unless you pay $$ and I felt that is not good. Considering it is Marriott,my, everything is alacart and nothing is freebies like SPG or Hilton will do. 
  I will go to Westin which is just across to get better sleep and internet included. 
  Rest nothing special about hotel and room and I don’t think they had rooftop restaurant or swimming pool. It is hard to find these in NYC anyway. But room service ....come on

title: Just right!
text: This hotel was just right for our trip . It was in the area we needed it to be, it was handy for nice places to eat , close to the financial district and easy to get the subway uptown . It was super handy for the memorial and Freedom Tower. The room had a lovely view, not luxurious but it had everything we needed and as we had access to the lounge we had those facilities to use! Very helpful doormen too!!

title: Standard Marriott
text:
This property is like most Marriotts at which I have stayed.  It's corporate and faceless and with the exception of the Statue of Liberty from the concierge lounge, could be almost anywhere.  And that's pretty much why I like it -- everything was in working order, the room size was fine, the sleep quality was great, and the temperature controls worked well.  The wifi worked okay during my stay.  Convenient to most of the Financial District.

The concierge lounge was undersized, fairly crowded for breakfast.  It was a  standard Marriott concierge lounge breakfast  - eggs, bacon, pastries, oatmeal -- albeit with a line at the espresso machine.

title: Basic but adequate
text:
Let me get our main complaint right away: it does not have free wifi in the room. You have to go down to the lobby to connect to a free wifi and use your Viber or check your feeds. To us Asians who are spoiled with free internet in even the less-than-moderate class hotels, this is a disappointment.
Having said that, the hotel is in a good location, a stone’s throw from the 911 Memorial and the new shopping malls that developed around it. It’s neighborhood is a good blend of the old and new as there are nearby delis and diners that can approximate the New York culinary experience. The prices of these establishments are tourist prices but then so are most of Manhattan’s.
The facilities of the hotel are basic but adequate. The rooms are comfortable and eveything works. The staff is friendly (obliging all the selfies and photo oportunities) and knowledgeable (knows how to operate iPhone and Android cell phone cameras!). Just goes to show the additions to the usual skill sets of hotel lobby staff!
Just one more thing, it does not have room service. You have to go down and order to-go from one of the rather famous burger shop in-house. But in fairness, the burgers do not disappoint. 
The New York Marriott Downtown is a basic, no-frills, barebones business hotel. Even if the rates may make you expect something more.

title: Just 1 night but everything was EXCELLENT.
text: I have family that live in Brooklyn, New York and Manhattan, New York but we get together maybe once in 3 years as everyone is busy and has their own family now. Had stopped here for 1 night as had an international flight to catch. Hotel was pricey BUT PERFECT.

title: Navidades
text:
Muy agradecida a GERALDINE por su profesionalidad y amabilidad para gestionar la pérdida de mi equipaje.
Nos encantó el hotel y agradecemos que tengan profesionales de habla hispana.
Volveremos. Bien situado y el Burguer muy bueno. Lo peor: pagar por wifi en las habitaciones.

title: Needs better Wifi
text:
This was a nice hotel. 

The Goods - the rooms and beds are comfortable. The elevators are fast so there’s not a lot of standing around waiting for a lift. There is a burger joint and a Star Bucks inside the hotel so you don’t have to go far for food if you don’t want to. It’s next door to ground zero and just a couple minutes walk to the 9/11 Museum, Ground Zero, the new One World Trade Center, and Battery Park.  The staff is top notch. Deanna was very helpful when checking in and knowledgeable on the neighborhood when asked where else to go for good food, toiletries, and other things I needed.  When I checked in it was actually a mad house but the staff was booking people in as fast and as organized as possible. It was actually kind of impressive.

The Bads - they need to work on their WiFi. At the end of my day I tried to sit down and catch a movie on Netflix and it was having a hard time getting a good enough signal to stream without buffering and slowing down. That’s really about it for the bads.

All in all, probably one of the more convenient and comfortable hotels I’ve stayed in and I’d definitely recommend it to anybody.

title: Natale e Capodanno
text: Tutto perfetto .... non mi va di aggiungere altro .... meglio non poteva essere .... cosa chiedere di più  ?  Consigliatissimo per tutti. Posizione. Pulizia. Colazione. Staff. Organizzazione. Non potevo trovare di meglio.

title: Convenient location, but poor sleep quality
text:
Location/amenities: Easy access to the wall street area, the WTC/911 memorial, and Brook.  Ubers and Lyfts were easy to get and the connected Starbucks and Bill’s restaurant (average food, but at least has the Impossible Burger) added convenience to my stay.  

Sound/sleep quality- 6 out of 10.  My room had the following issues: it was next to an ice machine that seemed to be running/refilling constantly one morning, random bonks and cracks & creaks from act ducts or hallway, noise from housekeeping and guests closing doors and chatting in hall were easily heard.  These things may not be an issue for someone waking up for work/on a weekday, but I more likely that not noticed them because I was sleeping in and on vacation.  My 1st morning at the hotel, even though I had a privacy sign on the door, we were woken up twice by a phone call asking if we wanted housekeeping- sadly there’s no green option to refuse housekeeping at this hotel, so I asked the front desk to put a note on my room saying we won’t need any.

Wifi- fast speed and easy to reconnect with the access code they gave.

Customer service- very nice and accommodating.  On our 1st night at hotel, we came back from dinner around 11:30 and smelled smoke in our room from the air vents/a nearby smoker (even though the entire hotel is non smoking).  I called the front desk to complain and they said they could switch our room, which I took them up on.  We got moved to the top floor, which was a relief as the smoke got worse and worse by the time someone brought us our new room keys.

Marriott lounge- Unfortunately, this lounge is unimpressive compared to other Marriott hotels’ lounges I’ve used in the US and abroad.  It’s small in size, but does offer hors d’oeuvres and dessert Sun-Thurs. I would’ve liked for the lounge to be open as a place to sit and enjoy a soda or drink from their espresso/coffee machine on the weekends, but it’s completely off limits from Fri to Sun afternoon.  I sampled the hors d’oeuvres and cookies on a few nights and they were mediocre (green salad, vegetarian pasta, cheese and crackers + some fruit, plus 2 hot- typically meat- dishes).

Decor- The rooms felt a bit dated (in my 1st room, the wooden casing around the heater was falling apart at one end), but were functional.  The TV and mini fridge worked fine, but the bathroom felt older because of the fixtures and the thin bathroom towels.  The rest of the hotel is nicely decorated (lobby had lovely Christmas decorations and the elevators run well and look updated).

Gym- I got to the gym each day I was at the hotel and it was the most enjoyable part of the hotel for me.  There are several treadmills and ellipticals, along with a few recumbent bikes and several weight machines (+ free weights).  The water bottle refill machine is like the types you see in airports nationwide and they have towels to take along with a basket of apples.  Wifi signal worked well in gym and it’s open 24 hours.

title: Loved it.
text: Hotel has a great view and a convenient location. Right next to northbound artery to get anywhere in Manhattan. I loved the convenience of running to Battery Park to Brooklyn and back. All with few street crossings. Or run along the river with fewer.  Hotel has a nice concierge lounge. Glad I chose it for my stay and look forward to returning. A lot easier than some of the larger properties with bigger crowds.

title: Holiday trip to NYC
text: This property is an excellent spot if you are traveling to Lower Manhattan. It is an easy walk to Battery Park, Tribeca or any spots around Wall Street. You are close to the Holland Tunnel and the West Side Highway for ease of travel. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The hotel bar closed early, which was a bummer. The higher floors have amazing views.

title: Good but beware of WiFi policy
text:
I got a really good rate for this hotel (< $110 a night) on a travel site. I’m also a Marriott club member. But turns out as a club member, you have to book using the Marriott site before you get free WiFi. Otherwise, it’s $15 a day. Due to the frigid cold temperatures, their hotel site was offering last minute rate that’s the same or similar as mine. Keep this in mind if WiFi is important to you.

The hotel room is nice. We got a deluxe double on the 22nd floor. Not much of a view but the beds were comfortable and the heating system is quiet. Many travel sites categorized this hotel as luxury; I disagree. It’s a nice hotel with a good location but by no mean a luxury hotel. The room also comes with a fridge, a safe, and a 55” TV with limited channels. There is also a charging station on the night stand but the power cord was frustratingly short so you could not use your device comfortably while charging it at the same time.

There is a Starbucks on the hotel property which is nice since it’s wind chill -5F outside, being able to get good hot coffee & warm drinks without stepping outside is appreciated.

Subway stations are 2-3 blocks away. #1 train is 2-blocks away, less than 5 minutes walk. N / R trains are 3-blocks away, less than 7 minutes walk. On arrival day, we took the Lucky Star bus from Boston to NYC, had a yummy and affordable dinner, then Uber to the hotel from Bowery Street for $14. Worth it for us since it was -15F wind chill at the time. Subway would normally be less than $3 pp one-way, of course.

title: Stop Over
text:
Had just one evening to spend in NYC. Most convenient hotel available.
Good staff on the desk and out front. Bellmen were especially helpful finding a limo on a snowy evening. Adjacent to the new World Trade Center but we didn't have time to visit.

title: Sem Wi-Fi nos quartos
text: Hotel muito bom, café da manhã ótimo, estilo americano. Bem localizado, do lado do WTC, mall, varias lojas, metrô. Quarto amplo, limpo. O único problema foi o Wi-Fi, era pago e muito caro por dia, valia mais a pena pegar um chip pré pago do que usar o Wi-Fi no quarto. Não sei se voltaria, há muitos hotéis tão bom quanto esse com Wi-Fi incluso.

title: Camera con vista
text: Hotel molto bello, pulito e accogliente... con tutti i comfort.. nella hall, tra l’altro sempre super profumata vi sono un Pub e starbucks.. inoltre è presente anche una palestra. Le camere sono pulite e dotate di bagno in camera... cosa molto strana ma positiva... la presenza di un phon super veloce .. ma ci sono anche due NEI.. il primo che il bagno è sprovvisto di bidet e la doccia è con tenda e non con vetrata... la seconda il Wi-Fi libero solo nella hall..per poterlo utilizzare nelle stanze bisogna pagare!!!! In compenso dalla nostra stanza c era un bellissimo panorama.. si vedeva la statua della libertà

title: A beautiful hotel with a great room with a fabulous view.
text: Service was very good- friendly, courteous & informative. Hotel is beautiful especially with its Christmas trimmings- gorgeous tree in the lobby! Free chocolate chip cookies at check in! Marketplace available to purchase snacks & drinks.Bill's Bar & Burger is conveniently located in the hotel & food is very good- delish burgers & sweet potato waffle fries! Bill's West Side Bar offers great entertainment on a nightly basis. Short walk to the financial district so be sure to visit the 911 Memorial (6 min walk). Broadway is not too far & only about 4 miles from Madison Square & Penn Station. Room was spacious, clean & offered a great view of the Hudson, I understand you can choose a view of the Statue of Liberty instead, which is probably just as gorgeous. Free Wi Fi if you're a Marriott Rewards member. Will return for sure.

title: New Year‘s Eve
text: Super Lage zum erkunden von New York...alles in näherer Umgebung von Metro bis Food Courts über Einkaufsmöglichkeiten!World Trade 3min entfernt...Zimmer Inventar etwas älter ja,aber wir haben uns nicht unwohl gefühlt...Ausblick auf den Hudson!Internet nicht im Zimmer aber in der Lobby...Toller Service...Tolle Bar im Hotel...Preise NYC typisch :)...Wir sagen Danke ans Marriott und empfehlen das Hotel gerne weiter

title: Nice view, location, and service
text: Unlike other hotels that give you rooms based on availability on check-in, it actually secures a room for you the moment you reserve. So when I arrived there at 12:30 pm, they already had a room for us that was waiting to be cleaned. I only waited for 10minutes to get the key. I reserved two king rooms without any additional fee for view but they actually were on the 30th floor so we could see the river. The view was fantastic! Also the beds and pillows were so comfy, I've never slept so nicely! Their service (front desk, room service) are very good and thoughtful. I was afraid there might be street noise because it's facing a big road, but I couldn't hear much. (I'm very sensitive to noise) You can hear a bit of door slamming and people talking in the hall way but that was a very minor level of noise. The location is also good, close to subway stations to all lines (all of them are within 5-10min walk) and you can go to brookfields place to grab coffee and lunch, eataly is also within 5min walk. I will definitely stay here again.

title: Nice Stay
text: Our second stay here. We stayed here over Christmas and the customer service was outstanding.  Everyone was extremely nice and helpful. Although the Christmas tree was beautiful, My only wish is that there would have been a Santa or something in the lobby on Christmas morning for the kids!

title: Hotel bello, ma....
text:
Hotel molto carino e accogliente, nella hall troviamo un pub dove mangiare dei panini e bere delle buone birre; a lato hotel vi è uno starbucks con un’entrata diretta nella hall dove fare colazione: se volete croissant non vi presentate dopo le nove...
Le stanze sono grandi: L.A nostra aveva due letti alla francese ma con il mal di schiena assicurato; chi è abituato a dormire con un materasso ortopedico sono dolori.... molle e rete strausata.... bagno grande e pulizia nella norma.

title: Comfort and Convenience at Major Downtown Sites Easy Subway Access
text:
The room was modern and fresh.  The bathroom modern and clean.   Good WiFi, good Flat screen TV. 

Out room had a view of ground zero and WTC One. 

There is a nice accommodating lounge on the sixth floor.  Snacks, Water, Coffee, TV, plugin. WiFi. 

We left of bags with the valet on the last day. 

High rated Ohara's next door. 

Short walk to the Oculus and all transit.

title: Great hotel conveniently located
text:
Just spent 1 week at the Marriott Downtown and by and large it was a good experience.  Friendly helpful staff, large clean room, short walk to financial district without being in the middle of it.  This is reflected in a better price and I actually enjoy a short walk to get into the day.  Clears the head. Close to Rector Street subway station so easy to get uptown.

It has been mentioned in other reviews so I won’t bang on about it but the lack of room service and the in-house restaurant being a burger / pub establishment was the only negative.  As mentioned you can have breakfast at the conveniently located Starbucks and Bill’s Burgers isn’t bad for burgers and shakes and watching the sport on the big screen (it was great watching the Champions League on Fox Sports with a couple of like minded patrons).  But if you want something healthier or a different type of meal you have to get out and explore the city. Which isn’t a bad thing either.

If you are a Marriott member with access to the lounge it isn’t the best lounge I have been in but it was functional and again the staff were very friendly and welcoming.

title: Perfect Location to See the Freedom Tower
text: We came to this hotel to celebrate my teenager's birthday. We had a pretty small room with a great view of the Statue of Liberty. The receptionists were very helpful and friendly.   My sons found the gym to their liking.  We walked to the Freedom Tower & the Battery Park from the hotel.  A very historic area with the National September 11 Memorial & Museum nearby. The parking is not free. The overall experience was very good.

title: Only One Quirk
text: This is a fairly standard full-service Marriott with one quirk that may or may not matter to you. Unlike most Marriotts, this hotel does not offer room service and the attached restaurant is an odd choice for a Marriott. The restaurant is a burger/pub place. It is accessible directly from the hotel but doesn't deliver food to the rooms. I went down and ordered something to take back to my room and it wasn't a good experience. The food was bland and the bartenders (who handle the take out orders) neglected to provide any utensils. It was a challenge eating my cole slaw without a fork! Other than that, if you need/want to stay in lower Manhattan this is a good option. There is an attached Starbucks that opens at 6 am. The hotel staff was very good. The rooms were very nice and quiet. There are limited dining choices in the immediate area, which makes the lack of a better in-house restaurant a problem. Expect to take a walk or use a taxi/Uber/Lyft to find places to eat.

title: An Absolute Delight
text: I have been a fan of the Marriott Hotels for many years on my business travels which have given a consistent quality service at a very fair price. The NY Downtown Marriott is a joy and pleasure. The key differential factor in ranking Hotels ( bearing in mind that the infrastructure, the offering and adequacy of services are taken for granted at Hotels such as the Marriott Downtown ) is the Staff and personnel. The Marriott Downtown staff have never failed or disappointed my high expectation. At every turn the Staff were simply a delight and professional in carrying out their tasks. I have tested the Hotel competition in NYC on a number of occasions and I find myself returning to the Marriott Downtown. In reality good service is akin to describing an elephant. However when you are bowled over by good service you certainly know it. To me that is what my experiences with this Hotel have given.

title: Nice place
text: My friend and I stayed here for a weekend last month.  We enjoyed our stay, the room was clean.  We had an issue with the heat and I called downstairs and a maintenance man was there shortly and fixed the issue.  I would stay here again, loved our river view.

title: Incredible Hotel for the location and Price!
text:
Upon booking through Expedia with flights included (defo check there for some great deals) I was slightly apprehensive as to what I should expect on arrival - I thought the price of the flights and the hotel was too good a deal. 

I was wrong. 

Location

      The location is quieter than the thrills and spills of times square and the like - so you don't step into a mob of people when you leave the hotel. There are excellent transport links just round the corner into the city (Rector St is a 10 min subway to times square and the upper west side & Wall St is 10-15 minutes to grand central and the upper east).
      It is a 2 minute walk to the trade center memorial and to the Westfield shopping center for the retail addicts - with also the deli just round the corner (Americanos?) doing cheap, yet delicious food for breakfast (it'll save you paying $20 a head a the hotel).  

Service & Room

      Quick, polite and top notch. Checked in within 5 minutes late at night with friendly, helpful staff.

***TIP*** Ask to become a Marriot rewards member (its free) to avoid paying the $15 a day for the wifi in the room. 

      The room was sizeable, with a massive bed and television to match with a decent selection of channels. The room was cleaned immaculately everyday and after a long day seeing the sights it was perfect to chill out and go to rest up in.

Only gripe I had with the entire stay was the treatment I got from a member of security.
Upon sitting in the lobby waiting for my taxi back to the airport I nodded off for 5 minutes only to be awoken by a security man demanding I show him a room key ... (I had checked out in the morning). He then proceeded to tell me off for shutting my eyes for 5 minutes, however sitting there was fine? Bizarre. 

However, security is heightened at the minute due to recent events so it is understandable.

All in all, great trip, great price.

From one very happy young Brit

Can't recommend it highly enough.

title: Always a great stay
text: We have stayed at this Marriott multiple times over a 3 year time and it is always a great stay.    It has a great location close to the financial district and the 9/11 museum is only a few blocks away.   It is very quiet.

title: Lower Manhattan Top Hotel close to Freedom Tower
text: I stay at this hotel twice a year while attending board meetings in New York City.  Very close to excellent restaurants.  The 38 th floor has a concierge level for Platinum members. A nice touch for regular Marriott users.  Overall an excellent hotel.

title: Another enjoyable visit
text: We stayed in this hotel again Thanksgiving evening as we wanted to be near SoHo and Tribeca. Even though there is not much hustle and bustle in lower Manhattan, there still is a lot to do with subway stops so close to the hotel, and upscale shopping malls, Battery Park and the 9/11 memorial all withing walking distance.  It's a nice change from midtown, and Kristen at the front desk was so nice and upgraded us to a junior suite with beautiful views.  Stacey in the concierge lounge was very accommodating as well and made us feel welcome.

title: 원월드타워 바로 앞 호텔
text: 뉴욕 다운타운 원월드타워 바로 앞에 있다. 9/11 메모리얼 뮤지엄 도보3분거리가 관광하기에 좋고, 월스트리트도 도보권. 호텔객실은 5성급호텔답게 깔끔하지만 조식은 1층에 있는 햄버거 집에서 버거메뉴로 대체된다. 체크인시간도 정확히 4시전에는 해주지 않는 점 빼고는 위치 좋고 만족스럽다.

title: Weekend stay downtown - not a bad hotel but slightly inconvenient location
text:
I decided to stay in the city for a weekend versus making the trek home. Since it was the marathon, I opted to stay quite a bit further downtown than I normally do. This place is somewhat convenient for Wall Street and the like - but other than that, it isn't all that great a location.

That said - it is a pretty reasonable property - nothing particularly stands out regarding my stay there except that 

a) the counter staff was extremely nice when I arrived. A young lady there greeted me and was just terribly sweet. 
b) the "hotel bar" isn't actually part of the hotel and closed on Friday night very early considering which means one needs to wander outside.

Again, the neighborhood isn't very conducive to strolling - there are a few nearby bars and restaurants - but nothing like you would have in other areas. If you are here simply for work nearby then I would suggest this place. If you are here for sights and sounds - I would opt for a different spot.

title: Highly Recommended Downtown Hotel
text: I would highly recommend The New York Marriott Downtown Hotel due to the convenience of location to the World Trade Center, Trinity Church, Wall Street, Battery Park, and an nice stroll to Chinatown and Little Italy. I found the front desk staff to be extremely hospitable and the room views of the Statue of Liberty spectacular.

title: perfect downtown location / old tired rooms
text:
I expected more after reading the reviews.  Location was perfect - in the financial district and less than a block from the World Trade Center area.  Relatively quiet area on weekends. Our room on the 27th floor was clean, but old and dated with wrinkled curtains and soiled wallpaper.  Deluxe double was not “deluxe”, no extra seating besides desk chair with 2 double beds. Suitable for shorter people or children. 

Staff was friendly at check in/check out.  Internet access is not free unless you are Marriott Gold or Platinum, the premium WiFi ($19.95/day) worked well. 

Starbucks and Bill’s Burger Bar on first floor.  There are other better options for dining nearby - try the Augustine at the Beekman Hotel for brunch.

title: Nice hotel but service could be better.
text:
Great location in the financial district. A little far from many of the midtown sights but close to the 9/11 memorial and Wall St. 

I arrived early and left my luggage with the bellhop. I returned later to check in but forgot to grab my suitcase. On my way out I asked the bellhop if they could take it up to my room and he said no!  I don’t feel like that was an extraordinary request and most hotels I’ve stayed at would’ve already taken it up to my room when it became available.

title: Good hotel in downtown NYC
text: This is the second time we have stayed at the Marriott Downtown in NYC, having stayed in many other hotels in he city. In an expensive city, it offers fairly good value, and the location is away from much of the tourist traps of Midtown. The rooms are spacious and well furnished (however some are more modern than others), the staff are helpful, and the amenities are good. Reliable WiFi, and good local access to the subway, make it a really good all round spot for a stay in NYC. Avoid Bill’s burgers, which is below average, and instead head for some of the excellent restaurants a short walk away in TriBeCa..

title: Excellent hotel, excellent location
text:
great view, great service, excellent location
Beds are comfortable, overall I would definetely recommend this hotel
breakfast is very good, and friendly for families with little kids
staff is very helpful and friendly

title: Average hotel.
text: I have stayed the NY Downtown Marriott many times over the past few years, and my most recent stay on 11/4/17 was nothing more then average. I was disappointed when checking in I was not thanked for being a Marriott rewards member  which is something all Marriotts are suppose to do. I had a room on the 17th floor which did provide great views of the city however the ice machine was out of order and had to use the one on the 18th floor which was kind of inconvience. The rooms were clean but are showing their age as the hotel has not been renovated in sometime , also house keeping was cleaning the rooms near by at 1000pm when people are trying to rest.  Over all it's a clean safe place to stay in a great location but customer service is definitely lacking, and house keeping should not making noise during the late hours. For the amount of money this hotel charges it was not worth the price for  just being "average"

title: Ubicación ideal
text:
Hermoso y moderno hotel, ubicado en una zona privilegiada, ya que está a dos cuadras del one world observatory y el 9/11 memorial. Además a quien le gusta caminar tiene cerca el battery park, wall street, etc.
Si bien no tiene desayuno (se debe pagar aparte), en la habitación dejan cafeteras con sobres para tomar algún café.
El wifi es gratis sólo en el lobby. La atención es excelente.

title: グランドゼロのすぐ近く
text:
そつなく揃っている標準的なアメリカのホテルだと思います。
スリッパやガウンもありません。Wi-Fiはロビーのみ無料ですが、マリオットのメンバーになるとその日からゲスト扱いで無料になります。
ツアーで泊まりましたので、朝食はかなり残念なものでした。毎朝４種類の変わらないセットからの選択です。アメリカでよくあることですが、全く注文を聞いてくれなかったり、急かされたりなかなか日本人には馴染めないのではと思います。

title: I wouldn't stay anywhere else in NYC
text:
I've stayed here for many years and will continue to do so in future.

I walk into the lobby and I always feel like I've come home.  With only 15 rooms on each floor it has an intimate feel even though there are 38 floors. The lobby is a welcoming area and this is backed up by the wonderful front desk staff who I've always found extremely friendly and helpful. I must mention Karen Tobias who is the most amazing member of staff and always takes such great care of my room reservations, 

Lovely rooms and corner junior suites, snuggly comfy beds, and lovely bed linen. There's a small but rather wonderful concierge lounge on the 38th floor with a view of the Statue of Liberty (closed after breakfast on a Friday until Sunday evenings - though points or breakfast offered to Gold and Platinum MR members. Extremely good food offerings in the concierge lounge and good breakfasts. 

Great location Downtown, 2 minute walk to the huge Century 21 store and the Westfield shopping centre just by the WTC and i discovered Brookfield place shops and restaurants for the first time. Rector St subway a few blocks away with really easy access to central Manhattan on the 1 train.

title: An expensive and average hotel
text:
I have had several stays at the NY Marriott Downtown over the past several weeks and have mixed emotions about it. 

The hotel has a good location, and is a short walk to the financial district and the World Trade Center site. There are also some good dining options in the area if you don't want to eat in the restaurant connected to the hotel.  

The rooms are average and not very stylish. They are a decent size, and have comfortable beds, but are probably in need of an update in the not to distant future. 

The front desk staff are nice enough, and they have a decent but small Concierge Lounge.  

My biggest hangup is the price. Depending on the week, I paid anywhere from $425 a night to $646 a night. When you spend 3 nights at the hotel, and check out with a bill of $2,178 for room and taxes, you tend to scratch your head a bit. The hotel is definitely not worth $2,178 for a 3 night stay. 

Unfortunately the hotel options are a bit limited in that part of town, and Marriott knows that and charges you for it. If you want to stay in that part of town, you pay for it.

title: If you want to be way downtown...
text: Everything was fine - room nice, clean, service good. Location near 9/11 memorial and Battery Park is good. Nearby subway stop. Walkable area. Odd tip: If you want a senior citizen MetroCard good for several years, we got one on Stone St in about 20 minutes.

title: A first class hotel
text: Firs`t time in this property, in a neighborhood that I do not generally stay in. This is  a great hotel with a terrific staff. As is often the case with Marriott, I was upgraded, without asking to a very nice corner room where I could see the water. Food in the concierge was very good and again really nice staff. May have to reevaluate this area when visiting the city. Staying here again is a must.

title: OK hotel
text: 個人で予約しました。ダウンタウンの南に位置し、静かです。宿泊した7月には夜、窓から花火も見えました。ホテルに入っているハンバーガー屋さんでお持ち帰りをしたのですが、なかなか美味しかったです。ただ、ホテル近辺が少し雰囲気が悪いので、母子旅行の私たちは少し緊張しました。地下鉄からも少し歩くことになりますし。中心部からは離れているので、便利さという点において星を減らしました。

title: Will be back
text: Thank you for accommodating us during our anniversary! Staying in your hotel was a memorable experience. Close to downtown, all the associates are friendly and made our stay memorable. Will definitely be back.

title: Expected quality but concierge floor closed for weekend
text:
My wife and I went to NYC to visit with our daughter for the weekend. I booked this Marriott hotel which was convenient to her apartment in the Financial District. I was disappointed to learn that the concierge floor is closed for the weekend. I was offered either Marriott points or breakfast as compensation. However, I would probably have booked a different hotel if I had known at the time of booking (on Marriott's website as a Gold Elite member) about the concierge floor.

Our room, an upgrade (number 3215) had great views along West Street and towards Battery Park City. The hotel is also located near the 9/11 Memorial. The waterfront was only 2 blocks away. Subway lines 1,2, and 5 were a few blocks away.

The room was spacious with a sitting area. The bed was comfortable. The staff was friendly.

title: Lovely stay
text:
Recently stayed at this hotel with my daughter for a weekend break I had already checked in on the app so we were in our room within minutes of arriving, the room was a good size with two queen size beds they have to be the most comfiest beds I have slept in, we had a view of the Statue of Liberty & to be honest you would have to have exceptional vision to be able to see it, but it is there! The room was very clean, plenty of storage & a good size bathroom.
The staff were lovely & very helpful especially the doorman I didn't get his name but in conversation he did mention he was originally from Ghana.
We ate in the burger bar in the hotel the food was very good & the staff were lovely especially the Alexander even though he was very busy he still made time to chat & make sure we were ok.
The hotel is close to the 9/11 memorial & plenty of shopping also very easy to reach other attractions.
I would definitely stay at this hotel when I return to New York although it is a little more expensive than some other hotels it's well worth it for the size of the rooms & especially for the lovely staff

title: Beautiful hotel, excellent location
text: This Marriott did not disappoint.  The view of the water from our room was wonderful.  Tastefully appointed lobby and check in was a breeze.  Decent sized hotel room for New York.  Location was excellent for exploring the 9/11 memorial, Brooklyn and the financial district.  We did not rent a car so I cannot comment on the parking situation.  We are picky about hotels and I can say we would stay here again.

title: Great location for weekend fun
text:
Stayed here in October 2017 for two nights. Arrived just after 4pm, having checked in on the App my (Gold Elite member) room was ready but my colleague wasn't due to housekeeping delays. Not a problem as we went to the sports bar and had a burger. It is a very busy hotel in terms of turnover of people so I suspect this might be standard.

Once in the rooms - they're nice but it is a fairly standard Marriott property. The rooms are big for NY and there are some great views to be had - try to go for a high floor.

It is literally round the corner from the 9/11 memorial and the Freedom Tower, so a great location.

Certainly somewhere I'd stay again.

title: Great location.  Big room for NYC
text: Big room for NYC.  3 blocks to Freedom Tower and battery park.  Great views of the river and Jersey City from 36th floor room.  Easy walk from the PATH makes it so easy when taking the train into the city.

title: Enjoyed our Stay at the New York Marriott Downtown - Great Location &  Staff!!!
text:
My wife and I spent three days at the New York Marriott Downtown and we enjoyed our experience. Full disclosure, I'm a Platinum / Golde Marriott Member and  big fan of this hotel brand.

In short:

Great location near Freedom Tower , 9/11  Museum, Wall Street and gateway to Brooklyn.

The Staff were all very nice and helpful, especially the front desk, doorman and bellman crews.

Upgrade your self to a high corner room with a view of the Hudson River, well worth it.

I would stay at the  New York Marriott Downtown again.

title: Tight quarters.
text: I am used to a Marriott with accommodations that fit the description. In this case I was very disappointed. The decor is 1980s and has not been updated in sometime I understand that New York is expensive but this was outrageous for the room that I stayed in. I ate in the restaurant and it was also not good. All in all would not recommend.

title: Ah the marriott!
text: I haven't stayed in a marriott in a long time especially in NYC.  I checked in quickly and was welcomed by atypically large room in NYC.  It was two queen beds and it was really quiet.  The concierge level was good enough.  The requests app doesn't seem to work.  The items I request never seem to be in the room when I get there. Having said that I had a wonderful stay at the marriott.  It's in a great location and I had a wonderful view of the WTC when I woke.

title: Would Return!
text: We really liked this hotel.  However, if you are wanting to be in the middle of all the activity of NYC then this isn't for you.  The location is close to he World Trade Center museum and convenient to walking along the bay.  It's also a small hotel but the food and service was terrific.

title: awesome location wonderful services
text: This hotel is in lower Manhattan.  A wonderful location if you want to see the World Trade Center and the traditional banking district.  It's very close to Hudson river as well. The area near the river has been through great development and is very pleasant for a jog during the day, or a run. It's beautiful and a quiet hideaway from the business city. It's close to subway stations as well, so wouldn't be a big issue even if you want to head up to midtown and central park. The hotel staff, in particular those in the concierge lounge, are very polite and attentive. It doesn't have a pool, but the fitness center is quite good, although I always prefer to run by the river when it doesn't rain.

title: Super Hotel, if Only They Could Get Breakfast Right
text:
This is an attractive facility with excellent (hotel) service.  With a high Marriott status, I got a fantastic room upgrade with a view of the beautiful, historic West building's top floor framing One World Trade Center behind it.  Amazing view, with the Hudson River sparkling on the side.  

With the elite status, free breakfast is also included, and the "concierge" room was closed, so I got a voucher.  Still awed by the fine room and experience, walking into the breakfast room brought me back to reality.  There were several obviously empty tables, but the maitre d' told everyone it would be a 10-minute wait, and there were probably 10 people waiting around to be seated.  The wait was more than 10 minutes, and neither the maitre d' nor another woman walking up and down the aisle of the dining area with a walkie-talkie seemed to have any sense of urgency to seat people at already-set tables or to get empty tables cleared to reduce the backlog.  The wait staff was running and sweating, so I presume the problem was shortage of personnel, but it was hardly a surprise that guests would be wanting breakfast or that with the concierge room closed, there might be more traffic than usual.

title: 100% fantastic service
text:
I booked this hotel and was really looking forward to me and my family´s stay there. What happened was that a week before we were flying out of Copenhagen, I received an email from The Marriott telling me that the were looking forward to see me too.
But what was not so good was that it showed some incorrect dates for our stay - very bad as this stay was prepaid - non-refundable rate - so I was really miserable.
I called the hotel and they were so friendly and helpful. They agreed that they would refund my payment and so they did. THAT is what I call fantastic service. Thumbs up

title: Great Location for Business and Sightseeing!
text:
This was my first time back to the city post 9/11. The Marriott is located in a perfect spot downtown, great sightseeing right there, and close to public transportation options, and, of course, Uber. I was there for business and the room was excellent...great view of the city, comfy bed, quiet, all good. If you are interested in visiting the 9/11 Memorial, this is the closest spot, right across the street. The park is very peaceful, perfect for personal reflection.
You are also very close to luxury shopping, and dining, many choices.

title: Good location and consistent service
text: I spent four nights at this hotel but have stayed here several times in the past.  The service is consistent.  The property itself is clean but my room was a bit worn.  For the room rates charged, it would be nice to have complimentary coffee available in the  morning but instead there is a Starbucks on the property.  The hotel staff were pleasant and helpful.  The hotel also has a bar and a restaurant on property.  The location is convenient and is close to 9/11 Memorial.

title: Convenient location
text: I liked that they had blackout curtains.  I am light sensitive so the room was nice and dark.  I had to call for a/c and they came up and fixed right away and it was nice and cool once fixed.  They also had a refrigerator in room which is hard to find and great.  Great to walk around.  Wall street and walk to China town/Little Italy.

title: Conveniently Located
text: The south end of the island has undergone a major revival since 9/11 !  Many new buildings,  restaurants and activities. The Mariott is ideally located within walking distance of the 9/11 Memorial /Museum,  Battery Park and the ferries to Lady Liberty and Staten Island . Everyone at the Marriott  was very helpful and made our trip to NYC delightful

title: Love this place!!
text: We love the downtown/financial district area so this spot was perfect!! You have the most gorgeous view of the WTC right outside the hotel. It's very pretty great rooms smells awesome staff is very nice the list goes on!! Had an amazing stay would definitely recommend it and I would totally stay here again xoxo

title: One of the best hotel in NYC
text:
I  stayed here with my partners for two nights to celebrate our anniversary. Before my arrival, I got in touch with the hotel regarding our reservation at the hotel and if they can arrange something to celebrate our anniversary such as an upgrade via an email. The General Manager of the hotel, Terry Lewis replied the day after I sent an email and she said that she will try her best what she can do. The Executive Assistant, Marjorie Cadet helped us with the arrangement. I arrived at the hotel on Thursday at 8 AM (mobile check-in one day before) and the room was ready for us. Normally, it was impossible to check-in early especially in NYC. The receptionist, Cheryl and Lisa took care of us and welcome us to the hotel and thank us for being a platinum member.   The room was located in the 37th floor (total of 38 floors) and in the corner. When we entered the room, we were very surprised as the room was a vice presidential suite with a king bed, 1.5 bathroom, and a separate living rooms (see pictures for details). The views from the room was amazing. We could see Hudson River, Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, and much more. The room was very clean. We got 4 free water bottles daily. The receptionist forgot to give a guarantee platinum arrival gift but since they give us a very nice upgrade, I really do not mind nor request for the arrival gift.

The lounge is located at 38th Floor and open everyday except weekend. The breakfast at the lounge is great. On Saturday morning, we ate at the Bill's Bar & Burger restaurant at the 1st Floor. The choice at the club lounge is better as you can have unlimited various bread, various fruits, bacons, eggs, drink, etc. At the restaurant, we can only choose 1 entree from the special menu and 1 glass of juice. (Unlimited coffee and tea). However, the taste of the food at the restaurant is way better. Love the food that we order. 

Near the elevator, there is a window and you can directly see the One World Observatory Building and a church. The hotel location is very close to the 9/11 memorial, 9/11 museum, one world observatory building, and the new oculus and Westfield Mall. The subway and PATH also very close to the hotel. The subway located inside the Westfield Mall and has all subway lines. 

I really recommend people to stay here as the hotel's staffs are very nice and professional. I really would like to thank the General Manager, Terry Lewis and Executive assistant, Marjorie Cadet for the upgrade and made our anniversary special.

title: Perfect Stay
text: Stayed this past weekend and fell in love with the Downtown area.  This Marriott is super clean and has a very friendly staff. Nice that it has a Starbucks on site too.  Love the Bill's Burger downstairs as well. I'll definitely be back.

title: A Charm and Surprising Room Size for a NYC Hotel
text: This was my first time staying at this hotel and I have to say my staycation at this Marriott did not disappoint. Having stayed at other hotels in NYC, I was ready for a small room, but was pleasantly surprised to find a nice room size and I was staying with my cousin and we weren't on top of each other. The room was clean, the bathroom was modern and very clean. No complaints except that I wish they had their own kitchen. But no worries, Bills Burgers is in the hotel and there are plenty of great places to eat in the Battery Park City area.

title: Superb Customer Service and Well-Appointed with Good Location
text:
When we arrived at the hotel on September 1, 2017, it was already 10:30pm. We were greeted by Geraldine, a very courteous, caring and pleasant lady at the front desk to check us in. I asked her if there was any drugstores close by to buy Benadryl due to a skin allergy I'd. Geraldine was very kind and offered me a pack of Benadryl & a bottle of free water without having to step out the hotel. Thanks to Geraldine, I slept like a baby that night. 
The room was also well-appointed with comfortable beds. Excellent location in Lower Manhattan. It only takes 5 minutes to walk to the World Trade Centre and the 911 Memorial Museum and 10 minutes walk to the Battery Park to take the Statue of Liberty Cruise. Many restaurants closeby and very safe to walk around even when it was very late at night. 
We enjoyed our stay at this hotel and will stay here again if we ever come back to NYC in future.

title: Great Location...
text: We stayed here overnight whilst transiting to San Francisco, the hotel is situated in a great location, easy access to the underground station, plenty yellow taxis sitting outside the hotel, the room was a little on the smaller side, however, the beds were incredibly comfortable and the family had a great nights sleep, if you are like me and suffer from jet lag and need to go for a walk they have a 24hrs shop about 5 minutes from hotel. The only thing I disliked about our stay was there was a charge for the internet, which I thought could have been Free after splashing out around $300 for the one night.

title: A good place to stay if you are in the Financial district area
text: When i am booking hotels in the Financial District area this is the first hotel I am looking for.  The location is good and seems to offer a decent concierge club.  It is not the most updated hotel in the Marriott family of hotels but I am looking for a comfortable bed and a quiet room which they always deliver on.    I have stayed in this hotel many years ago and they continue to be m go to hotel in the Financial District area.

title: Ottima posizione buon servizio, wifi a pagamento
text: Il Wifi non è gratuito, tranne quello della Lobby. Colazione misera. La posizione però è buona, molto vicina a Ground Zero e ai traghetti per l'isola della statua della Libertà. Bello il panorama (io ero al 16esimo piano). L'alberto ha 36 piani circa. I Marriott in America sono in genere deludenti rispetto agli appartenenti alla stessa catena in aree asiatiche e africane.

title: Lovely stay
text:
We stayed here for three nights. 
Good location - almost next door to the National September 11 Memorial and museum and the nearby the One World Trade Centre. 
The hotel is traditional and comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful. 
We had a double room with two double beds. The room was double aspect. We didn't pay extra for a room with a view of the Statue of Liberty and glad we didn't as it is still quite a distance from the hotel.
There is coffee making facilities in the room and bottled water which you need to pay extra for. 
The bathroom is large and stocked with soap and shampoo etc. There is a hairdryer, fridge and iron with ironing board.
Wifi isn't free in the rooms which is disappointing given the standard of the hotel but there is free wifi in the lobby.

Close to the subway and close to Battery Park for easy access to boats to Liberty Island and Staten Island Ferry which is both free and a good way to see the Statue of Liberty.

title: Very old Marriott
text: This hotel is very old don't be fooled my the reviews. As a platinum elite I stay at a lot of Marriotts and this one is old and very outdated don't let the lobby or the bar fool you. You won't get upgraded at this hotel once you get to your room and feel how hard the beds are you can't leave your stuck, Don't rollover or move on the bed they have a cheap garage sale bed frame never seen anything like it at a Marriott. I would stay at the Fairfield or residents inn if you want to stay in this area both great hotels.... the only positive on this property very nice staff and a great location after that you have to sleep in these rooms good luck.

title: Good
text: It is very good hotel, you can found all you want. Very clean and with the service personnel excellent. I chosen this hotel for position. My chose was good. I suggest you to take this hotel for all client  services. Thank you for my excellent job day in your hotel. Thank you for your excellent support.

title: Great hotel
text: Been to this hotel a few times over the years and have always found it a good stay. The rooms are very comfortable and clean and have great views especially at the front of the hotel. One thing I found last time when our room was next to the ice machine it was very loud and made a constant noise. The reception were very helpful and allowed us to change room, so might be something you would like to request!

title: Best NYC Hotel
text: This is the best hotel that I have stayed at in NYC other than the Waldorf. The hotel is clean, modern and spacious. We had fantastic views of the river from our window. The financial district is a great place to stay. It is quiet, clean and not crowded. Just 2 blocks west to the esplanade where one can walk along the river, enjoy the views of lovely boats, eat drink and shop. This area of NYC is more like Chicago.

title: Great location for the price
text: For the price and quality it was nice! The location was perfect, wasn't too much chaos. Hotel room was clean and staff was helpful and courteous. Great for business and visiting the city. I would stay again.

title: Good location
text: Went there for 3 nights to visit Manhattan. Good location south of Manhattan. 5 minutes walk to 911 Memorial, 10 minutes from Battery Park, 30-40 minutes by Subway if you want to go to Central Park or Times Square for example.Westfield mall is close as well. Hotel is clean, rooms would need some renovations but still fine and are big if you consider you are in Manhattan. Bar is expensive for what they have and service not the friendliest..As a lot of hotels like these ones, you have to pay for Wifi if you want you in your room, I don't understand this, we are in 2017, they tell you there is wifi free access in the lobby, never works. Staff if friendly. Would recommend if you get a good deal on room price.

title: Nice property, nice room
text: I stayed at the Marriott Downtown for two nights on a business trip. It is downtown, as billed, directly beside the 9/11 Memorial and Museum and within easy walking distance of Battery Park etc. Overall, the property is clean and well-located if you have business downtown, or if you'd simply like to be convenient to downtown attractions or Brooklyn, or if you're interested in outdoor activities -- biking and running along the river(s) is easily accessible from here. If you're more interested in the midtown attractions, Central Park, etc., they are easy to get to (as every thing is) by public transit/taxi, but it would be quite (too) far to walk. Rooms at the hotel are a good size, the onsite dining was very good, and there is a Starbucks conveniently inside the hotel.

title: Great location
text:
Excellent buffet breakfast and helpful conceirge. Near Wall Street and world trade center memorial. 
Good place. Not far from Broadway and Central Park.  Would repeat the place. 
Happy memories... Tribeca is not far ...good pictures near Brooklyn bridge..

title: Centrally located with great staf
text: My wife and I have stayed at many Marriott properties throughout this country and abroad. This Marriott was the site of a business course and we had never been to this particular location. We are surprised how nicely appointed it was plus an exceptional and friendly staff throughout. It was literally around the corner from the 9/11 Memorial, the Freedom Tower and Wall St. We had a room with a view of the harbor and the Statue of Liberty. We will definitely come back for a pleasure or family trip.

title: New York City Visit - Marriott Downtown
text: A quick complement to the Marriott team for providing me with a great place to call home for a few days! Located in the heart of the city near everything either walking or by train.  If you need a great hotel in a great location with great service, this is the place for you.  Highly recommended!! Experience it for yourself!

title: Nicely Located near 911 Memorial, Clean, Comfortable
text:
Don't expect to be blown away by the hotel amenities even though it is branded as a Marriott hotel. It is a middle of the road hotel with fairly updated rooms, decently comfortable bedding and a clean small bathroom. Nothing really fancy even though the entrance hallways look quite nice. The rooms are typically sized but for New York, I guess it's pretty good for the price especially given that you are centrally located in downtown NYC. The nearest MTA subway station is Rector St - or - World Trade Center / Cortland St station which are about a 3-to-5min walk from the hotel.
There is no in-room service, but a restaurant located within the facilities which serve breakfast menu options, and burgers/beers/drinks.
The staff is somewhat friendly depending on who you talk to, if you are a Marriott Rewards Member, I recommend directly talking to the Marriott Rewards attendant who will be treating you better than otherwise and provide you with the free WiFi service.
Depending on whether you are lucky or not, you will be given a room on a higher floor with a view or not. We got a room on the 9th floor with no particular view bu the buildings adjacent to the hotel... which is fine.
Overall, this is a no frills hotel with comfortable/clean beds that is very decently located for New York, very close to the 911 WTC Memorial & Eataly Downtoan restaurant & the Oculus / Shopping Center, at a decent price. I would definitely recommend it for families or business people looking for a reasonably priced hotel when visiting NYC. However, don't expect all the extra amenities of higher priced Marriott branded hotels, this is more like a Holiday Inn / Fairfield Inn type of hotel branded as Marriott because it is located in Manhattan...

title: Good, comfortable hotel. Even with kids.
text:
Not expecting to need a night in the city, we chose a hotel in lower manhattan despite its proximity to the financial district and having kid with me. Turned out great, as we saved money and there was plenty to see. 

The staff were all fantastic, from the various doormen we met to the desk staff to housekeeping. NYers aren't always described as friendly and helpful, but all the staff were. I'd especially like to thsnk the doormen who helped ne deal with a greedy cabbie :-)

Thanks for a lovely stay!

title: Highly recommended !
text: I frequently visit NYC and have stayed all over the city,  but usually on the UWS.   This was a great change of scenery.   I did get a little turned around at. Ugh this getting odd the subway, but that's my own sense of bad direction.    Great staff and exceptional value.   Will defiantly stay again !!

title: Molto valido
text: Ho soggiornato in questo albergo per 5 notti. Ai miei bimbi alla reception hanno regalato un orsetto, gesto carino. La posizione dell'albergo è ottima a due passi da metropolitana, World Trade Centrel e dai vari Peir dove poter mangiare e passeggiare. Sotto l'albergo c'è una hamburgheria non male e la caffetteria più diffusa negli USA. Un po obsoleto il concetto della Wifi a pagamento. Camera carina, pulita.

title: Very good hotel and great location.
text:
My cousin and I stayed at the New York Marriott Downtown on Friday Aug 4.
Very good location. 10 min walk to Battery Park, 10 min walk to 911 Memorial.
Check in was smooth and the staff were very nice and helpful.
Room was nicely decorated and water pressure and bed were great!
This hotel is usually well priced and worth it. Had  a great view of the harbour and rthe Statue of Liberty-BONUS...

title: Lovely few days in NYC
text: Really enjoyed our stay at the Marriott. We were on the 26th floor with great Hudson river view. Loved the location near 9/11 memorial, battery park, Wall St etc. The beds were very comfortable (not very big but we didnt mind!) and I was happy to see a coffee maker and some Starbucks coffee. We tried Bills Burger bar on the premises ( enjoyed it) and there is also a Starbucks. Our room with two double beds was a good size for NYC. The staff were really friendly too. Its really quiet which is great for a good nights sleep and the area felt much calmer than uptown which was just a short subway ride away.

title: Schlechtes Hotelmanagment
text:
Absolut schlechtes und schmutziges Hotel. Die Toiletten in der Lobby wurden trotz mehrfacher Bitte nicht gereinigt. Überall verschmutzes Toilettenpapier (siehe Fotos). 

Schriftlich zugesagte Zimmerkategorien wurden nicht vergeben sondern viel einfachere Zimmer.

Falls sie sich ein Paket ins Hotel zuschicken lassen dann müssen sie dafür über 10 USD an das Hotel bezahlen. In jedem anderen Hotel ist das gratis. Hier wird man leider abgezockt.

Das Frühstück für Marriott Gold und Platin Gäste ist leider ein Witz. 
Keine Auswahl an Speisen und keine Sitzgelegenheit weil der Raum viel zu klein ist.

Die Mitarbeiter sind unzufrieden mit einem "kleinen Tirinkgeld" in Höhe von 15$ und schmeisen das Gepäck so aggressiv dann auf den Boden das der Inhalt Beschädigt wird.
 
Schaden 350 USD. Ein Claim wurde aufgenommen aber ohne Ergebnis

Keine Entschädigung oder Lösung wurde angeboten, nur ausreden. 

Achja. 
Als ich den Hoteldirektor sprechen wollte, wurde mir von einer Rezeptionisten gesagt sie sei der Hoteldirektor. So etwas grenzt an einer echten Unverschämtheit.

Kurz - nie wieder dieses Hotel !!!

title: Barkleys in NYC
text:
This is just a wonderful hotel.  We have stayed there several times since it opened in the 1980s.  Wonderful staff that does not seem to turnover.  They recognize us when we arrive as frequent guests.  

Near the Freedom Tower and 9/11 memorial .  Very accessible.  Good restaurants in the area.  Comfortable rooms.  Just a good experience - always!

title: Nice view of Hudson river
text:
As many other hotels in New York, this is a high price hotel, room is good, but not great. If you are Gold member of Marriott Rewards, you will have access to the club which has nice view of the Hudson river.
Walking distance to the ferry to Statue of Liberty. Less crowded street, comparing to the hotels in Time Square. Parking is $75.00 per night for a minivan. Valet parking only, as many other hotels in NY. You might want to give them notice early if you need your car.

title: Great location, Good Hotel
text: Nice hotel, great location. Wonderful front desk staff. Although I was disappointed to discover that this hotel does not have room service. If you order from the restaurant in the hotel, you must go down and get your food yourself. I would expect a hotel of this caliber to have room service. Other than that, I really enjoyed my stay.

title: Solid Hotel in Lower Manhattan
text: The location is great if you are spending time in Wall Street area of Manhattan.  The rooms are clean and comfortable and the room rates are very reasonable.  The main reason for 4 stars though would be that they are charging for internet access.   I think all major chains ceased this practice, and I know a lot of Marriott's have, I guess just not this one.

title: Dank, depressing room, tired mattresses
text:
Our room was dank and dingy and the beds were merely adequate -- we could feel the springs. Water stain on the ceiling and curtains coming apart at the hem didn't help the atmosphere. We asked about changing rooms, and the front desk was prepared to let us change rooms, but the person I talked to led me to believe that aside from the views, all the rooms are pretty much the same. If that is true and all the rooms at the hotel are like the one we stayed in, the New York Marriott Downtown is a three-star hotel or 3.5. 
I don't know why it was so humid in the room -- it wasn't that hot or humid outside -- but it was really unpleasant. If the bathroom had a fan, I couldn't hear it working, maybe that was the problem? I"m not saying don't stay here, but understand that it is somewhat over-rated, star-wise.
Also, I was told by the front desk that the hotel only has standard beds and king-size beds, no queen-size beds, which wasn't great because the mattresses in our room were  a bit worn, I think, and two people in the standard created that rolling-into-the-middle problem that happens with a not-so-great-mattress.

title: Perfect hotel in the Financial District
text:
This one is a lovely hotel in the Financial district and great for both business and casual stays equally ... I found the staff very helpful and friendly to your requests at all times ... 

Try and get a Junior suite instead of the classic rooms because they are lovely and come with great views of the river ... 

They have a great diner on site that serves great food ... A Starbucks attached to the hotel and plenty of places to drink, dine and hang out nearby around rector's and pearl's. 

Access to transportation is no hassle if you are staying here. The stations are minutes away on foot ! Plenty of cabs too ... 

Stayed there for about 4 days covering a weekend earlier this month, It was lovely and would surely return ! Highly recommended !!!

title: Nice location(depend on where you going)
text:
Service and cleanliness need a bit of work, found a stain on the bed sheet and ask them to change. Housekeeping did not bring what i asked for and i have to call again for it, and they still did not bring all i need, and coming back with the missing item later on.

Nice location, pretty close to subway. Close to financial district, statue of liberty if that's where you are going,

title: Subpar Marriott
text: As a Lifetime Platinum Elite status member of Marriott I have stayed at literally thousands of Marriott hotels around the world.  I come to expect a certain level of quality and service when staying at a Marriott hotel and I have not issue telling it like it is.  Unfortunate this Marriott does not live up to what I have expected from the Marriott chain.  I have stayed at his hotel a few times in the past and waited to make sure it just wasn't a bad day before reviewing.  The physical hotel is ok, tucked into a tight space and not a spacious hotel.  The rooms are ok, slightly aged even with the upgrading that was done.  My comforter had a hole in it and it was right in the middle of the bed, so no missing it.  They just ignored it and left it in the bed.  The bathroom is old and dreary.  The television reception on certain channels was awful and the mere fact that in this day and age that they don't offer HD tv is crazy.  The concierge lounge has a great view of the harbor and the Statue of Liberty, but otherwise a disappointment.  It's small and the food offerings were well below par.  They do not offer room service and the hotel restaurant, Bill's West Side Bar (reviewed separately) does not accept Hotel charges.  Not a huge deal but clearly an inconvenience.  There were more minor issues, but no reason to continue.  With all the good choices uptown, no need to venture down to this Marriott.

title: Amazing!
text: The NYC Downtown Marriott is a treasure!  My wife and loved our stay.  We had an awesome room with great views of the water & Freedom Tower.  The support staff from the doormen, bellman, and front desk were incredibly helpful and all working together - I think the really like each other (no kidding!).  We loved the Le District and working along the water into Wagner Park.........so peaceful with breathtaking views.  Who knew!  We can't wait to go back!

title: Great location.
text: This hotel is close to everything.  Subway is close too.   The rooms are clean but the beds are not queens but comfortable.     We were on the 30th floor so we did not hear road noise.   The view of the Hudson was great.

title: La mejor opción en New York
text: Sin lugar a dudas, este Marriott es la mayor opción para vacacionar en New York. A un paso del World Trade Center y paradas de subte. Tiene una ubicación privilegiada y de fácil acceso a las principales atracciones de la ciudad. Las habitaciones son hermosas y cómodas. En nuestro caso nos toco vista a la estatua de la Libertad. En el mismo hotel hay un Restaurant y un Starbucks:) . Espero volver pronto a visitarlos.

title: NY Quick Getaway
text: My kids and I as well as my mother visited New York to sight see as well as shop a little. We stayed Saturday night into Sunday evening. Upon arriving at the hotel and being greeted by the bellman was pleasant. He was really nice and informative as he reported working there for 20 years. The lobby was very cleaned. The elevators were confusing as the left side went up to the sixteenth floor as opposed to the right side that went up past the sixteenth floor. As we entered our room, it was very cleaned and organized but you could see a lot of wear and tear in the room.  The hotel didn't offer room service but it did have a restaurant inside the hotel. The hotel did not have a pool. The hotel was average but lacked the essentials for infants and toddlers. The hotel was in the center of downtown and a block away from the World Trade Center Memorial. Also a few blocks in the opposite direction was the Statue of Liberty. On the sixteenth floor, we could see the Statue of Liberty from our hotel window.

title: Amazing Views
text: I booked a double room for a weekend in NYC for vacation and I was not disappointed. We had an amazing view of Manhattan and was very close to train stations that easily took us around NYC. The staff was super friendly and helpful when looking for great spots to visit. The restaurant in the hotel was great for a quick beer at night & there was a Starbucks in the hotel to help start off your day. I definitely recommend staying at the NY Marriott Downtown!

title: Poorly trained front desk
text:
This was a business trip. My room was in the Executive floor. The view was quite nice. 
I was never told by the front desk staff that I have access to the executive lounge or that I could have Wi-Fi at no cost there. They never mentioned to me that breakfast was available at the executive lounge. The room was quite expensive. The staff should at least inform the guests on these benefits. That is why you pay an expensive room. The drapers were quite dirty. They should be replaced.  Staff is poorly trained and lacks of initiative. This is an old hotel in a good area. Bed was fine. Bathroom was basic. Essentials were not very special.

title: Tremendous view - Junior Suite
text: I booked a room for 3 days for a conference at the WTC, amazing view from my room.    Nice hotel, great location, 5 minutes from everything WTC.    I will look at this hotel again for business or pleasure.   Concierge was also very good!

title: Another average NYC hotel with a great location
text:
I go to NY a lot and have stayed at a good number of hotels. During this visit I decided to try this hotel. Last time I stayed at the W next door. I am a SPG platinum and after the Marriott Starwood merger I also became a platinum at Marriott. The rate was great for the time of the year. I paid an average of $170 per night. The hotel is on the main westside highway and cant be missed. The entrance is nothing grand and the lobby is also small, but this is NYC. 

They had upgraded me to a room with a view on the 36th floor and I also had comp access to the lounge on 38. The room is average to small. Room does look dated. They have an avg size window with views to NJ. I did not get a view of the Liberty Island :). They offered to upgrade to me to a larger king bed with a sofa but I declined. 

The hotel has 2 bars/restaurants, Bill's. I had some parcels delivered from Amazon to the hotel. Its important to know that the hotel does charge a parcel fee so better check on this before you get them shipped. 

The location is great as its 2 blocks to the WTC mall and 4 blocks to the new Brookfield place. Plus I like downtown more than midtown as its quieter. Overall this was a sterile experience. Nothing bad and nothing too fantastic. Would I repeat? If for a short stay, no. If for longer stay then price always triumphs and this hotel was a good deal.

title: Bare necessities
text: Great room and view.  Refrigerator in room and single serve coffee. NO ROOM SERVICE. NO BELL CAPTAIN or luggage assistance. No microwave available for guests in the hotel whatsoever!  Good location. Close to Financial district, 911 memorial and Occulous.  Only one restaurant/bar in the hotel.

title: Location is key!
text: Ideal area if you want to be situated away from the rush but only 15/20 mins subway ride from most major attractions. All staff we encountered were friendly and polite, Starbucks is attached and great for a quick breakfast, Bills Bar and Burger was ok, I would eat elsewhere if you can! rooms need a little update but we noticed work being carried out on our floor so they are on with it, the beds are small doubles, and weren't very comfortable and the shower wasn't powerful at all! Maids did a good turndown job and rooms were clean so no problem there. The walls are paper thin, at one point through the night I thought the people in the next room were actually in our room and they were only chatting! All in all, the position of the hotel was the highlight for us, just minutes away from the 9/11 museum and World one, the ferry to Statue of Liberty as well as a few malls and a lovely walk up the Hudson x

title: Super Lage
text:
Sind im Marriot an der Greenwich 133
Lage ist perfekt, ein Sprung neben dem WTC.
Zimmer sind eher klein, aber bequem und sauber.
Personal ist freundlich und hilfsbereit .
Preis/Leistung: gut ( ohne Frühstück )
Zum weiterempfehlen : unbedingt

title: Great Place, just make sure you review your bill before you leave
text: We stayed here and booked a package. The beds are double beds not queens. The hotel has a lot of nice views. People at the front are great, especially the Valet Parking staff. That being said, when we checked-in, we were told parking was included in the package and the valet would take care of it. When we got home, I looked and $65 was added for the valet service. I called for 3 days trying to contact 'accounting' and they never game me a call back. So needless to say, we were never stay there again because of the lack of transparency. If you can, avoid the headache and stay somewhere else.

title: Average Marriott, High Floors Have Great Views
text:
This Marriott is pretty standard as far as the rooms and decor. Nothing special or different, and to be honest it is starting to show its age. The rooms could use some refreshing. I have stayed a few times and if you are lucky enough to get a high floor you can get tremendous views, if you end up on a lower floor you end up looking into other buildings. The lounge has fabulous views as well. 

My only complaint is the rooms are poorly insulated so every time someone walks up and down the hallway you can hear their entire conversation. During my last stay they started construction outside my room at 8AM, which woke me up. I was surprised the hotel didn't inform me. I went to leave my room and couldn't get out the door because they had the hallway blocked. it just seemed odd that no one in the hotel had informed me of the inconvenience.

title: Excelente
text:
Como a rede, quarto bons e a qualidade dos lençóis continua maravilhosa. Gostei do atendimento da recepção, o Adrian ( não tenho certeza) um rapaz baixo, moreno, simpático e muito atencioso, nos auxiliou em tudo. Como estávamos para o 4 de Julho, então ele nos ajudou muito. O hotel tem. Boa estrutura, fica numa ótima localização, perto do Marco 0, também, perto do metro e da broadway, dá para ir andando para a Wallstreet.
Uma dica, faça o cadastro,na rede, assim tem internet gratis.

title: Great stay for a one day trip.
text: I brought my family to this hotel for the weekend. The hotel gave me everything I asked for which were to be on a high floor, a crib, and a great view. The room was a little small for me and my family. The space would been better if it was just me. The hotel had great location. The gym in the hotel was open 24 hours was great also. The only problems I had was the restaurant at the hotel was pretty bad.

title: ダウンタウンのモダンなホテル
text:
ツアーで利用しました。地下鉄1・A・R線のRector St駅から歩いて5分。グラウンドゼロは歩いて3分、ワン・ワールドトレードセンター展望台の向かいにできたショッピングモールにはモダンなフードコート、ブランドショップ、サックスフィフスアベニューなどが入っていてハドソン川の景色が見れます。ホテルから歩ける範囲なので不便ではありません。地下鉄駅側に行くとおみやげ物屋さん、コンビニ、デリ、パブなどがあります。
部屋は機能的で清潔、広さも十分です。部屋にはコーヒーメーカー、アイロン、アイロン台もあります。ロビーに隣接するレストランで朝食を食べましたが、バイキングではなくアラカルト。朝食込みのプランだと4種から選べて、ボリュームも十分。なお、このレストランはハンバーガーの有名店のようです。
ミッドタウンから離れていて、時間帯によっては渋滞してタクシーで30分以上かかりますが、夜遅く出歩くのでなければ問題ありません。また泊まりたいホテルでした。

title: Great location away from crowds
text:
The Marriott downtown is in a great location if you prefer to stay away from the crowds.  It's almost in the shadow of Freedom tower -an amazing view to see every time you walk out the door!  The water is just a block away, and it's awesome to walk along the promenade and see the sights, including the Statue of Liberty.  If you stay here, I recommend going across the street to Brookfield place and going outside to enjoy drinks by the harbor.... beautiful scenery. It's easy to access the various subway lines from the hotel.  If you can, request a high floor with a Hudson River view! 

The rooms were decent.  I think they could use a bit of updating, especially the bathrooms.  The staff were very friendly.  There didn't appear to be a concierge while we were there, so I wouldn't count on that type of assistance from this hotel.  Also, when you walk into the hotel you immediately have to go up a small set of steps.  There is a wheelchair elevator for those needing it, but most people will have to lift their luggage up the steps...unless the doormen are available to help.  I would hope the hotel would fix this situation.

Overall, I would recommend the hotel, it was nice but not luxurious. However, that is what we expected for the price.

title: Solid!
text: Excellent checkin experience. Excellent views.  Rooms are clean and beds are comfortable.  Quiet by NYC standards.  Lounge is fair, nothing spectacular.  location is easily accessible by subway.  Will definitely stay again...

title: Excellent Hotel all round!
text:
Was difficult to find a nice, reasonably priced hotel anywhere on Manhattan Island - eventually I decided on the New York Marriott Downtown as it wasn't rip off rates and looked nice on Expedia!

When my flight landed I got there 2 hours early. The lovely lady at reception checked me in no problem - told me how to get WiFi for free by signing up online instead of the $14/day charge. She also gave me some friendly tips on the local area and how to get around. There was someone waiting to take my luggage straight up to my room. 

Room was very clean! Had a view of the West Side highway, and being Manhattan I don't think any room has a bad view! Hotel is conveniently placed to reach Freedom Tower and Broadway by foot and about 10-15 mins to Times Sq. and Central Park via the subway. Nearest station is a few minutes walk away. Battery Park is also very close by to get some awesome views of the Statue Of Liberty!

Would certainly stay again, much recommended :)

title: Great stay in NYC
text: This is a great property, very clean, friendly staff who take the extra step (even when busy and unprompted). Great location. The rooms are comfortable. They have a 24hr gym and easy access to fantastic running routes.The views from the 37 floor are amazing and the surrounding neighborhood is quiet.

title: Ótima acomodação
text:
O hotel oferece ótimas acomodações e serviços.
Os aptos bem higienizados ,as roupas de cama e banho trocadas diariamente.
A localização do hotel excelente.
Os elevadores funcionam a contento,mesmo com o movimento intenso de hóspedes.

title: Excellent location and service
text: The location was excellent for our business meetings. The rooms were larger than expected and were clean. One disappointment was no room service. However, the restaurant was very good. The staff was experienced and accommodating.

title: Outdated and dirty :(
text: Had a trip with friends for the Father's Day weekend June 16-18, 2017.  It was a birthday celebration so we chose a hotel which is close to downtown.  We first check into the 17th floor.  Room was big, however seems pretty outdated.  We had a room with 2 beds and my girlfriend slept on a separate bed.  She woke up at 4am in the morning as she felt bites on her neck and face.  She usually sleeps with her hand under the pillow and she felt many bites on her hand.  She immediately jumped and reported the incident to the reception desk and we changed rooms at 5am to the 26th floor.  My friend was so worry that she checked under the mattress and saw black dots (maybe bed bugs eggs?!).  We then changed to the 31st floor and it was fine.  I am a frequent traveller and definitely wont recommend this hotel.  I should have stayed in W downtown or Aloft.  The receptionist just told us that they will investigate the issue and get back to us.  All we got was one day of free internet, they still want to charge us for a $5 umbrella lol

title: Great Stay - great hotel close to 9/11 museum - Freedom Tower
text: Went on a short trip and it was a great stay. We stayed on the concierge floor and the breakfast was great along with the staff. This hotel is within 1 block and easy walking distance of subways, trains and ferries.

title: Great Location
text:
Our cormer  room was beautiful with windows on both sides with views to die for!  Could see the Statue of Liberty, the Staten Is. ferry and much more.  Room 3303.

Mario, up on the club floor took extremely good care of us.  Always made sure we had what we needed with grace and humour.  Love him!

This hotel is perfectly located.  Near 3 subway stations.  And just around the corner from 9/11 Memorial.

title: Great Marriott Hotel in Lower Manhattan
text: The New York Marriott Downtown hotel is the perfect hotel for a quality, comfortable lodging for any visit in lower Manhattan and offers exceptional Marriott service.
