This hotel is one block from the 9/11 Memorial and One World Trade Center, and a few blocks from Wall Street, Trinity Church (built in 1696 and where Alexander Hamilton is buried), the Federal Hall (the first Capitol of the United States and George Washington's inauguration), and launch site to the Statue of Liberty. There are plenty of restaurants in the local area and easy access to the New York subway stations within a three block radius. This is a great hotel to use as a base for exploring New York.

title: Best Hotel in Downtown NYC
text: There's no comparison with any other hotel in downtown NYC.  This hotel is within close walking distance to the 9/11 Memorial Museum, One World Trade Center Observatory, and excellent restaurants!  The hotel has Bill's Burger Bar which is fantastic.  The concierge lounge is on the 38th (top) floor with a great view.  Only place to stay when visiting the up and coming NYC downtown area!

title: Great Location & Views
text: Just returned after a long weekend stay with the family. Our room, 3305, had such a fabulous view of the Statue of Liberty! It was an upgraded room since we were platinum. The location is also incredible. It is about a 10 min walk to Statue of Liberty and Battery Park. It is only about 5 min walk to 9/11 memorial and museum. It was about a $20 cab ride or20 min subway ride to Times Square/ Broadway but it is much quieter and calmer at the hotel. There are plenty of restaurants in the area. Overall a wonderful example of a Marriott - nice clean rooms, pleasant helpful staff. The one complaint would be the breakfast on the weekend for the elite members. The lounge was closed so we had very meager selection at the restaurant. The servers were nice but service was slow for bad bagels and yogurt with granola. The breakfast in the lounge on Monday was very nice and as I would have expected. That was my only complaint to a nice stay.

title: Hotel an großer Baustelle
text:
Vor dem Hotel befindet sich eine große Baustelle. Frühstück war inakzeptabel. Restaurant war nicht vorhanden. Lounge in der 6. Etage war um 22:00 Uhr geschlossen. Selbstbedienung! Zimmer extrem klein und eng. Der Kleiderschrank ist viel zu klein, keine Komoden oder Ablagen vorhanden.Keine Badeartikel. Personal ist ungeschult.
Ein sehr kühles Hotel was die gesamte Atmosphäre betrift.
Die Lage ist gut. Nähe World Trade Center und 9/11 Museum; Broocklyn Bridge etc.

title: Marriott Downtown - Spectacular Views - Great Location
text: I have stayed in many hotels and typically with another hotel brand, I stayed here for a conference and was thrilled with the room, location, and views.  A corner room on the 28th floor the views are great.  Close to subways and many restarurants

title: Basic hotel, nothing fancy
text:
Nothing fancy, your basic marriott.

Pros:

-  Starbucks on the 1st floor
-  Good location
-  Clean rooms

Negatives:

- Small rooms (okay for NYC)
- Poor service (we called ahead and requested connecting rooms and they messed up our room reservations)
- Very crowded 

Overall it is a safe, clean place to stay if you are looking for a basic hotel room.

title: Great location and staff!
text: Just completed a weekend stay here and I will definitely stay here again. The location is ideal for Lower Manhattan -steps away from the 911 Museum and close to Wall Street, Battery Park, and Trinity Church among other sites. The staff were very helpful and couldn't have been nicer. Our room had a great view of the Hudson River and was spacious by NYC standards. The attached restaurant, Bill's Burgers, serves some of the most delicious burgers I've tasted in a while. This hotel is definitely worth a stay!

title: Estoy como en casa
text: Después de 4 años consecutivos, me encuentro como en casa. Camas cómodas, habitaciones limpias, localización perfecta para mí. Este último año bien es cierto que me decepcionaron algunos detalles del personal. Que debería fidelizar a los clientes que repiten. Por lo demás, cada Navidad es mágica

title: Fabulous Views!
text: We had a one night stay here in a family room. I booked this hotel for the views over the river and it didn't disappoint! We'd booked a luxury double river room and were given a corner room that also had a fabulous view of the Statue of Liberty! There was plenty of space for four of us and the beds were very comfortable. The 9/11 Memorial and museum are five minutes easy stroll and the river is also close. Bill's Bar and Burger served really good food and was very convenient as it's situated off the hotel reception area. Would definitely recommend eating there. The hotel was really good value and we will stay here again when we return. Bring your own bottles of water to the room though as the ones in there cost $7.

title: Holiday Get-Away
text: In the midst of the busy city, I feel safe, comfortable and walking distance to all amenities preferred. I enjoyed staying at this hotel.  Parking cost $$ it is worthed, it is a valet service. I definitely recommend this place.

title: Great Location: SO SO Stay
text:
Lovely hotel in the right spot for a wedding we were attending.  Our room (502) was well appointed and newly renovated but smelled like hamburger grease.  We did have lights not working nor could we lower the thermostat to a comfortable temperature.  Called the front desk and a very nice person came to help us out very quickly.  Was woken up at 5:30 am by the overwhelming aroma of raw onion.  I am aware that our room was over the restaurant but it was on the 5th floor.....Very nice and modern bathroom but only two large towels.  Two for me, none for my husband? One each?  What about my hair???? Also one soap and no shower cap.

On another note regarding Marriott in general - you are not the Taj, which makes me wonder why  your rates are so high.  
We  travel quite a bit for business and many clients are often near Best Western Hotels.  Surprisingly, very nice: full free breakfast, free wifi, free water in our room.  $5. for a small bottle of water.  That does not say, 'Thank you for staying with us, please come back. Don't see any extra amenities in  your chain.

Would be reluctant to return.

title: Un bonito hotel.
text: Un gran hotel con una excelente tarifa en un excelente lugar al sur de Manhattan. El trato del personal es amable sin llegar a ser extraordinario, el internet tiene costo extra y las habitaciones están muy bien ambientadas.

title: Great stay
text:
We loved our stay at this great hotel & would definitely recommend it to anyone traveling to NYC. 
The staff are a huge credit to this hotel as they were all very welcoming & helpful so a great big Thank You to you all including reception concierge room maid & a special thanks to Aileen Galazin for helping with our room request 🙌🏻
Our room was spacious & spotless clean & we had a lovely view of the Hudson River & Freedom Tower
Location is perfect to & very handy to OWO 9/11 Museum SoL Wall Street & Brooklyn Bridge & several subway stations & Path

title: Convenient and Comfortable
text: Standard Marriott rooms, but excellent and helpful staff.  Well-located for visiting lower Manhattan sites. Basic amenities are onsite - Starbucks, gym, bar, business center and a restaurant. Ask for a room with a water view - it changes the whole experience.

title: GREAT LOCATION AND BIGGER THAN AVERAGE NYC HOTEL ROOM
text: We stayed here for the 5Borough Bike Ride.  The location was great.  Lots of cabs headed uptown.  Location is very nice for Wall Street, and theStaten Island Ferry.  The Statute of Liberty is right there and plenty of very safe places to walk and run.

title: good night of sleep
text: clean, well appointed and quiet. lobby is busy but there is plenty available in the neighborhood. Great location for seeing New York. we could walk or use Uber to museums, the theater, and great restaurants.

title: Great Location Wonderful Stay
text: Spent a long weekend here the end of April. Hotel is convenient to subway and lots of points of interest.  Room was very clean and the bed was oh so wonderful. All the staff was friendly and helpful.  The burger's at Bill's are plenty good, George's is a short walk and worth the steps.  The waterfront across West Ave makes a very nice evening stroll.  The September 11 Memorial and Museum, The Oculus and Liberty Park are literally a few steps away.

title: Recent stay at Marriott for class reunion
text: During a recent visit to NYC for a class reunion, the organizer of our reunion recommended this hotel. she had blocked off rooms for those that wanted to stay at this hotel because of the proximity of the venue. Unfortunately, when I called the hotel directly, they would not honor the blocked rate because I was a few days past the date to resrve the room. I went thru Booking.com. I got a decent but still pricey rate.  The hotel was clean, the staff friendly. The room was spacious for a NYC hotel and the view of the street below was not too bad. There's also a restaurant on site. The hotel is close to many points of interest and if you like to walk, much is very accessible on foot. All in all, I'd stay there again if the rates were more reasonable.

title: Marriott Let Me Down
text:
I've stayed in every Marriott, Renaissance, JW in the New York city area.  As well as several Courtyards, Fairfields, and Residence Inns...  This is my first stay in this Marriott, somehow.  Now I know why...  This Marriott is old, the rooms are very outdated, and I just can't feel comfortable here. 

Check-in was ok, I did the online check-in and said I'd be here earlier in the day but never got an alert saying my room was ready so I didn't come over until 5:30.  While I'm checking in, I get an alert that my room is ready...  I asked if I was getting an upgrade (not guaranteed for Platinum Premier but often successful) and the young man told me I was getting a very nice room with a Statue of Liberty view.  Get to my room and it's a plain queen room, I requested King, and I can barely see the statue for the tall building right in front of me.  Heard them telling others checking in around me they were getting club level rooms, and nice king rooms, but no go for me.  It's odd because I checked in online at 10am the day before arrival and still get the leftovers. 

Room is very tired.  Carpet is the old dirty yellow 1980's that Marriott had in many properties years ago.  Had...  Room is tiny compared even to Times Square properties.  It's the smallest Marriott hotel room I've ever stayed in outside of the Algonquin that Marriott bought up here a few years ago.  There is not even a place to put the luggage stand outside of squeezing it in the closet.  The TV is nothing special and mine didn't work when I arrived.  Remote didn't work nor did most of the channels.  They did send an engineer up to work on it within an hour.  No idea where I will plug the iron in, in the morning.  Only possible spot is to position it over/against the desk.  

The bathroom is equally dated.  Not too small.  Nothing special.  And of course, a tub shower...  It's a strange tub shower though.  It's about 20 inches deep.  But still a tub shower with a shower curtain.  When will business traveler hotels get rid of tub showers? I hold out hope that Marriott eliminates these before I depart this earth.  

Concierge lounge is again, nothing special.  Not very big and food offering night one was less than impressive.  The cheese cubes were the best part.  Went back for dessert at 9:02pm, desserts to start at 8pm.  All I found was one empty plate of crumbs.  Not sure what was on it, but looked like cookie crumbs.  And yep, no more to bring out. 1 hour left on dessert offering and it's nada, zilch, empty...  

Elevators.  Oh the elevators...  Think they are bad and slow at Marriott Marquis in TImes Square?  Wait until you try these.  They have 3 cars each for the two sets of 19 floors.  And they move slowly.  Twice here in day one I walked in the hotel to see the elevator lobby spilled out into the open area of the lobby.  I mean 30+ people waiting. If this was an anomaly and changes during the week, I'll update my post to reflect. 

Overall, wish I'd booked somewhere else.  Love the Brooklyn Bridge Marriott across in Brooklyn.  Stayed there the last 2 weeks while working here in the financial district. Will return there when I'm back in this part of town.  Won't return here. This property needs an overhaul/update asap.  If something changes with the lounge before the week is up, I'll update my post to reflect.  Otherwise, disappointing property. 

Of note, meant to add that lobby is fairly nice.  It's seen updating much more recent than the rooms.

title: Nice Marriott with Great Views
text:
As a Platinum member, I have stayed at a lot of Marriotts. I have stayed here twice for vacation in NYC and both times have really enjoyed it. This Marriott is in more of a business area and during the week has expensive business rates. On the weekend, however, it can be a really good deal. It is near:

- Battery Park
- 9-11 Memorial
- Wall Street
- Many Subways and PATH trains

The staff here have been ok. Some are impressive and others are hit-and-miss with their service.

They are renovating rooms from the lower floors up. One of the accessible rooms was already renovated and is a beautiful, corner room. It is incredibly practical for any kind of accessible / mobility needs.

The highlight of staying here is the executive lounge for breakfast Mon-Fri. The lounge has a great view towards the Statue of Liberty from the 38th floor. The food spread is impressive - it's a cut above standard lounge fare and includes items like bagels + lox and fresh fruit parfaits. All the food was really good. it is truly like eating breakfast in the clouds.

The elevators can be confusing since some only go to certain floors but the overall situation was fine and I thought the elevators operated perfectly.

title: Total Accommodation - The Perfect Location
text:
We just spent a night (wish it were longer) but upon check in, we were met with a smile, a room upgrade (Platinum Member) and a late check out.  Perfection.  Every staff member was friendly and helpful.  The property is very nicely maintained.  Hotel bar is super with elegantly styled drinks and a non-nonsense get it done attitude, but in a relaxing way.  The room (Jr. Suite) was beautifully appointed, very, very clean and restful with all the expected amenities.  The bed and linens were, well J.W.Marriott all the way.  Comfortable beyond belief.

If you are working down town, this would be a great location.  If you are visiting on the weekend and are intending on heading to the 911 Memorial, then this is the perfect location.  One block away is the north and south tower memorials and the 911 Memorial.  A few blocks to Wall Street and a few more to Battery Park.  Walk across the bridge to the waterfront and take the Hudson walkway path to just about anywhere.  You get the point.

Highly recommended.  Excellent stay.

title: Weekend visit
text:
This hotel does a great job of customer service even after you leave the hotel. Their rooms are spacious and have awesome views. I loved having a mini fridge in the room. I also love using the chat app Marriott has. They upgraded me as a Gold member at no charge. 

Bob's Burgers in the Lobby are great and very inexpensive. I will stay here again. Great location and very quiet in the evenings. Great value for the money.

title: I recommend!
text:
My husband had to be in Manhattan for business and booked Marriott Downtown near One World Trade Center and walking distance to bars, shops and restaurants. The staff and management were so nice and our room was very clean. 

I recommend staying at this hotel!

title: Clean Rooms but Lacking Overall Amenities
text: Great location relative to office and lovely staff, but no robes or slippers, no room service and a budget hotel quality in-room coffee service left me feeling like I was in a very low-cost hotel, not a Marriott. Next time, I'll bring my own flip flops. On the plus side, great gym.

title: Excelente ubicación
text: Battery Park me sorprendió.   Está lindísimo, súper seguro y MUY limpio.   El Hotel está muy bien, cerca de todo y del metro.   Es uno de los lugares más lindos ahora en New York, se ha desarrollado durante los últimos diez años y vale la pena quedarse aquí.

title: Pour un séjour professionnel c'est parfait
text:
Réception de l'hôtel assez froide! Nous sentons que c'est vraiment pour des affairistes de la finance très pressés et aussi très froid. Nous y étions en tant que touristes et là ce n'est pas idéal! L'emplacement est tout de même distant des endroits à voir à part Ground Zero!
La chambre était très bien rien à redire. Le personnel est distant. Pas de restaurant propre à l'hôtel et là le bas blesse! Pas terrible, service long tant pour les petits déjeuner que pour manger un simple hamburger tout ce qu'il y a de plus quelconque. Le bar est un peu plus sympathique.
Nous étions invités par ma famille donc je ne veux pas trop me plaindre mais je trouve tout de même, pour avoir vu le prix de la chambre, le rapport qualité/prix vraiment pas terrible.

title: Elevators Huge Problem STILL!!
text:
I like this hotel. They are friendly, it is in a great location, it has a decent but not great burger place downstairs.  The problem remains to be the Club Lounge on the 38th floor and the elevators.  The club lounge is WAY to small for the number of people trying to use it for breakfast. The set up is terrible no one can get by each other, there is often no place to sit and the newspapers are gone in about 15 minutes. The coffee area is too crowded for more than one person at a time. If you are going to let everyone and their brother have access to this lounge, then you need to make it bigger.

Second problem, and the bigger one in my mind because it will actually keep me from booking here again, is the elevator problem. There are three elevators servicing floors 15-38 and in the mornings you can often wait 10+ minutes (no exaggeration) for an elevator only to find it is packed solid and you need to start over. Also, it is going to stop on every single floor on the way down!  Takes forever!  I had a conference call at 8 am one morning. I was on floor 32. I decided to pop up to the lounge on 38 to grab a cup of coffee at 7:30. By the time I got up there, pushed my way through to the coffee area, and got an elevator back down to 32 (stopping at every floor on the way), I had not one minute to spare. That is ridiculous!  If I have to build that much time in to use the elevators, then I am going to find another place to stay. Marriott downtown used to be the only game in town but no longer. Several places opening right nearby.  If Marriott is smart that will fix the lounge problem and the elevator situation before all of their elite customers go elsewhere.

title: Our 40th Anniversary at the New York Marriott Downtown
text:
We really loved the New York Marriott Downtown!!!!  We had a corner Junior Suite on the 24th floor with beautiful views of the Hudson River.  The room was spotless!!!  We had stayed at the Ritz Carlton down the street, but we liked the Marriott so much better.  We will definitely go back.  

The Freedom Tower and 9/11 memorial are a block away.  It is also close to Battery Park and the Hudson River promenade.  The whole area has changed since 9/11.  When I worked on Wall St. it was mostly office space.  Now it is hip residential area.  We love it.   It is also a lot less noisy than midtown.

We give the New York Marriott Downtown top grades!!!!

title: Vist to NYC
text: During our recent visit to NYC, we stayed at the Marriott. Nice hotel but a bit expensive. The staff were all very helpful and pleasant. Good location within walking distance of a lot of attractions (ie: 9/11 Memorial, Battery Park Ciry, Wall St, restaurants etc) if you don't mind walking. The train stations are also within walking distance. There was an isolated incident where there were some teenagers running through the halls being loud and when I opened my door to investigate, they took off. Other than that, it was fairly quiet.

title: OK for business
text: I recently stayed at this hotel for business. The room itself is extremely dated and the AC didn't work properly. I am a gold member and was given a room with two double beds even though I had requested a king. On the plus side, it is a great location if you're looking to stay in battery park close to the memorial. Also, the club lounge had a nice breakfast spread (and the associate working there was very friendly). One tip: don't stay on a high floor unless you're getting a room with a view. The elevators are old and take forever to get up and down from a high floor.

title: Excellent location. Great service
text:
The hotel was built before manhattan hotel rooms became smaller in size. This hotel has decent sized rooms. Our room was clean with a very comfortable bed and forceful shower. The service was as expected at a full- service Marriott. 

Our only complaint -- they rely on a burger restaurant downstairs for on- site dining. The place as overpriced, noisy, and served mediocre food. There is also a Starbucks off the lobby -- a much better option.

title: Awesome in NYC!
text: My husband and I stayed here while visiting NYC over Labor Day weekend. The room was small (aren't they all in NYC?) but cozy. The staff was wonderful. The subway was a block from the property. Will put this on my favorites list!

title: Great Location
text: Loved being in the Financial District because it was quiet. Our room, 2609 had an awesome view! We could see the Hudson River, New Jersey, Ellis Island, Brookfield Place,Freedom Tower, Battery Park and cruise ships. The 9/11 memorial was just next door. We loved Bill's West End Bar located in the lobby overlooking the street. It was a great place to meet our friends after a busy day for a drink and some appetizers and make plans for the evening. Unfortunately, it only opened at 4:00pm. Bill's Bar and Grill,  where we had breakfast, was dark and the service was not very good. My suggestion to the hotel would be to open up the back section of this bar for breakfast because of all the windows. People need sunlight in the morning!! We would definitely,stay here again.

title: Excellanr stay in the Financial District
text:
I loved this hotel down in the Financial District.  Near the 9/11 memorial.  Staff friendly.  Room very roomy (considering it is new york) and hotel has great amenities.  Also quiet.  I strongly co spider 4 stars for 2 reasons.  .  The service at the bar was typical new youk gruff.  Also the restaurant was more of a burglar bar menu with few healthier choices.  As most know, good restaurants downare a bit hard to find in the FD.

2nd reason is the elevators did not have any type of security screening.  Usually  in a Metro hotel you need to insert your card key to get to your room.  

Don't get me wrong, hotel felt very safe.  I am so happy on the 32nd floor I am considering extending my stay for another day to shop and chill.  My complaints are more afterthought than issues.  I am staying on Points, but for published prices, this place is a deal!...

title: Quick Trip to the city
text: I just visited NYC on April 13th with my two girls and husband so we decided to stay here since they offered room views of the statue of liberty. We paid extra for this view which wasn't the best...the statue was further than I expected, however I could see it. The room was pretty clean and newer hardwood flooring. Bill's Burger restaurant downstairs was expensive but all in all the visit went well.

title: Good
text: Breakfast is served at a bar, with almost no lightning. I seriously recommend not including breakfast in your hotel fee and have it somewhere else (there's a Starbucks at the hotel). Room is pretty descent

title: Great hotel and location!
text: Recently stayed at the Marriott downtown NYC near the World Trade Center.   It was a GREAT hotel.   Staff was friendly and helpful.   Rooms were "normal" size, rare for New York City.   It was great to have a great room, great view and a comfy king bed in the city.   Its in a great location walking distance to many great restaurants and NYC shopping and sites.   Highly recommend!!!

title: Fantastic stay
text: This hotel is absolutely fantastic. We stayed over NYE and the staff were fantastic the whole time. We had one of the Hudson River view rooms and the view was spectacular, especially at night. Only a block away from Ground Zero and the WTC. Bills Burger downstairs was great and was available for room service. Can not recommend enough!

title: Customer service  was bad.
text: The hotel was OK. It was nothing to write home about. I booked through a third party and read excellent reviews but it didn't live up to the hype. My low rating is not due to the hotel itself but due to poor customer service. The gentleman at the front desk was rude. I work in customer service and I believe you show people dignity. I booked a room for 3 adults but he gave me a room with one bed. When I inquired as to why he basically told me "you booked through a 3rd party and there is nothing I can do if you don't want it I can cancel it"  If he couldn't help me I understand but his whole attitude was like I was beneath him. He talked down to me and it really got my stay off to a bad start. If the site I booked the room from would have refunded me I would have canceled.

title: Not as good as it should be
text: Great location, near the subway and ground zero, walking distance to the water but the worst beds to sleep in . Had two doubles in our room and both beds sunk in the middle.  Hardly slept and had a sore back every day. Air conditioner was too noisy so had to turn it off at night.

title: It's ok - but come prepared
text:
Stayed here for business as was in policy and close to meetings near Battery Park. Generally like Marriott hotels so made some assumptions about service and quality . . . Overall the hotel is ok - I found all of the staff to be helpful, professional and polite. Check-in was easy (important after a 7 hour flight from LHR, and 1 hour 45 minute transfer from JFK). However, desperate for a drink of water I found that my room came with no minibar (perhaps just my tight old company and the room agreement?!). So I thought at least I can have room service - except you can't! You can order food from the burger bar downstairs, but they won't deliver - you have to go collect and pay there and then. Not ideal when you arrive late and just want something light, and delivered so you don't have to show your face in public! To be fair the actual food was good. So just be prepared: bring your own water / juice etc. and don't expect room service (even for breakfast). 

The service in Bills was highly variable: one evening and at breakfast I found excellent service; another evening the waiter could barely be bothered to be there - yes it was busy, but having to ask 3 times for a cold glass with my first beer, and then having to specifically ask again when the second beer was plonked on the table was all a bit rubbish.

On the plus side: the room was very large by NY standards in my experience; was very clean; staff I interacted with were helpful; and the beds very comfortable. No free wi-fi which is strange as a business traveller, but was not particularly expensive. I found it reliable and reasonable speed. Location good for Downtown - esp, close to Battery Park and WTC.

On the debit side: no room service at all; the decor is perhaps politely called "vintage" . . . ; when my laundry was returned, housekeeping didn't actually close my door properly so it wasn't locked - a worry but thankfully nothing taken (when I called reception they were supportive); the air conditioning is old and noisy; and rooms with a view are noisy as you are right on a main road into Manhattan (I was on the 15th floor, but the noise of sirens, horns and trucks was quite disturbing).

Overall I would probably stay again - but now forewarned with what it's like. To be honest other members of my party stayed at the DoubleTree close by and it did sound a better proposition for similar money. So I suppose you pay your money and make your choice.

title: Great hotel! One of the best in NYC for a family!!
text: We travel to NYC several times a year and were lucky enough to get this hotel on Hotwire. For a little over $200 a night, we had a huge room with a king bed and sleeper sofa for my son. This size of room is not often found in NYC. Room was very nice. I would highly recommend and plan to stay here again. The view from the room was nice. Starbucks is located in the hotel and subway is very close. They do not have free wifi. You have to pay for it if you want it. I will definitely be back to stay at this hotel. We love the area.

title: Not the level I'd expect
text:
Full disclosure: I've moved from the NYC area (now in Dallas), but I lived here for 12 years and have stayed in my share of small, older NYC hotels. I have context.

The hotel did not meet my standards for a city Marriott.  The mid-week price was high - but the going rate for area hotels since they were all sold out.  And the service was good: front reception was courteous, efficient and pleasant. The bellhop was helpful and gracious. I respect and appreciate that. The problem was the property is old and in desperate need of a face lift. Old fixtures, popcorn ceiling, tiny bath tub, dated interior. It was clean; I also respect and appreciate that. But I couldn't fathom the justification of the price for the quality of the room -- even in NYC. 

To further drive the point, I changed hotels mid trip (business to personal) and transitioned to the Residence Inn downtown, another Marriott property. Delightful. Bright, cheerful, new interior! And less than half the price of the Marriott. It's an odd juxtaposition when the cheaper brand and price blows the standard Marriott out of the park.

You will have a fine stay at the Marriott - good beds, clean room and very good service. But book here if there is a good rate. If not, find a newer Marriott property. I hope the Marriott HQ will consider remodeling this hotel. The location is excellent and it would make an average experience extraordinary.

title: ソファーベッドが使えない
text:
3人で宿泊しました。
ジュニアスイーツということでしたが、やや広い部屋でした。
大きなダブルベッドとソファーが1つ。ソファーには寝具が準備されていませんでした。夜になって、2回電話しましたが、ハウスキーピングが部屋に来てくれることはありませんでした。
仕方なく、バスタオルをかけて寝ました。

title: Fantastic hotel in downtown New York
text: This hotel is in downtown NY on West Street, a couple of blocks up from Battery Park.  The rooms have spectacular views of the Hudson River and the lights of Manhattan at night.  The rooms are spotless and beautifully decorated and the lobby has a charming decor.   The hotel has a restaurant and a very comfortable and elegant bar.  The hotel rates are a steal considering the location,and the staff is professional, friendly and very helpful.   A few minute walk to Battery Park and the ferry to the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island, or to the 9/11 Memorial, as well as to Wall Street and many other area attractions.  Recommend the Merchant's River House for dinner, great food, on the river, can watch the sunset

title: Excellent Hotel
text: Recently I stayed here alone and found this hotel a very nice place to stay for business travelers. Room was very clean and comfortable. My room was on 35th floor and the view from my room was really beautiful. I could see the Statue of Liberty. Overall staff was helpful and burger at the bar restaurant was excellent at a very reasonable price.I will stay here again.

title: Great location, pleasant stay.
text: My husband and I stayed here with our kids. We requested early check in at 12pm through the Marriott android app and were happy that they were able to accommodate our request when we arrived. Front desk rep was friendly and polite. If you're a Marriott rewards member and booking directly with them on their app it allows you to have free wifi. We stayed on the 25th floor with a slight view of the Hudson. Comfy beds/pillows, and clean room. It was a "typical" Marriott stay for me which I prefer. Pleasant and familiar. Being this was our first time in NYC this was supposed to be our base and we would just come back in the evening to sleep. But it was freezing during our stay below 20 degrees, so my kids needed more down time in the afternoon. Coming back to the our comfy "home-tel" (as they called it) room midday to warm up and recharge was nice.  The downtown location for us was nice since we had tickets to see the Statue of Liberty and it's a very short walk to the Cruise Line.Within walking distance of 9/11 Museum, Freedom Tower, Trinity Church, Wall Street and easy subway ride to midtown. Location seemed very safe during the day and night. We enjoyed our stay.

title: Excellent location, excellent quality
text: I was staying for a few days as I was working at the NYSE and this was well-placed to walk to work and also to do some exploring of the city when I had time off. Not as ideal for those tourists wanting to visit sites such as Central Park etc. but very good for a slightly different experience of New York.

title: Great area to stay in for a visit to NYC!
text:
We very much enjoyed 4 nites at this hotel in January during the boat show. I was upgraded to a room with a view of the Statue of Liberty which was very nice. Breakfast in the hotel was just OK....not too crazy about that restaurant in the hotel for breakfast, but the concierge lounge is very nice.

 We walked over to the World Trade Center museum (5 minutes away) and enjoyed an escorted tour there. Just next door to WTC museum is the new Eataly where we had lunch and did some shopping. Another short walk brought us to the Native American museum and also to Fraunces Tavern where we enjoyed the small museum there. Finally. another short walk brought us to Delmonico's restaurant for a great dinner.
We had a great stay and enjoyed being in this part of the city.

title: 4th time, the hotel of choice
text:
Amazing. What can I say. Every time I have been to the city, except for once, I've stayed with Marriott. However, I keep coming back to this hotel for so many reasons. 

It is just far out to be as 'real' as you can get in Manhattan, less touristy.
It is in a perfect location to get to Wall St, Battery Park (for the statue of liberty/ Staten Island ferry)
It is right next to the new Trade Center
The service is AMAZING. The staff here are a credit to the company. 

The rooms are large, which you don't find, for the price you pay here. The rooms are exceptionally equipped, with safe/ tv/ coffee machine, full amenities in the bathroom. The beds are so comfortable. Rooms cleaned so well.

We had breakfast here too- this was in Bills restaurant and the menu looked quite limited. However, its american sized portions and we were so full when we left!

The hotel has links to the subway, numerous lines so easy to travel in to Manhattan and over in to Brooklyn/ Queens. And a short walk to the PATH station to get to NJ.

Will continue to stay here every time I come to NYC!

title: Downtown Marriott New York City larger rooms
text: I stayed two nights in March. This hotel does not offer room service. (Wahhhh!) I went to bed with no dinner my first night because I was just too tired to traipse back downstairs even for take out, which they offer from the Restaurant, but the next night, I did eat at the burger place in the lobby. I moved up to the Marriott Pulse for my final one night in the Big Apple, and the room was considerably smaller, plus they were remodeling so lots of noise. The bar scene up top had a great view of the Empire State Building however, with couples meeting for drinks etc.

title: Good location, well managed property
text: As 4 World Trade Center continues to add more - Eataly, Westfield Shopping Center, this hotel has more appeal. Well managed, nice rooms, good location, plus next to the 9/11 museum. Local restaurants across the street, views of NJ/Hudson, all make this a good choice if you need to be in this part of the city.

title: Nothing special
text:
Stayed here for one night on March 14th, as my flight was canceled due to the snow.
This place looks nice and the quality of the room was fine, however, I have the following issues with this place:

- The walls are extremely thin - poor soundproofing.
- The room above me obviously had a wooden floor, as I could hear someone in high heels walking around constantly.
- No room service.
- Poor selection of food items in the lounge, and the desserts consisted of rock-hard, stale cookies.
- There is an in-hotel restaurant, but that had a long line.
- Turned on my TV late in the evening and it said "No signal" on all channels.

For the price of the room, I would have expected a much higher quality of experience, with better facilities.  I had stayed at the brand new Courtyard just around the corner for the previous two nights, which was a much better experience, and the rate was half the price of this Marriott. I would have preferred to stay at the Courtyard, but they were fully booked for the extra night.

title: Tolle Lage, ansonsten durchschnittlich
text:
Das Hotel liegt nahe der PATH World Trade Center Station und somit ideal um Downtown Manhattan zu erkunden. 

Die etwas kleinen Zimmer bieten den gewohnten Marriott Standard. 

Etwas enttäuschend war dass der Türsteher uns mit dem Gepäck weder beim ein- noch auschecken geholfen hat (Treppe am Haupteingang) und dass die Executive Lounge am Wochenende geschlossen hat. 

Ein großer Minuspunkt ist das erdrückende,dunkle Hotelrestaurant mit schwerer Atmosphäre und verbesserungsfähigem Service.  

Zudem gibt es keine kostenlosen Heißgetränke in der Lobby was bei einem Hotel dieser Klasse zumindest morgens angebracht wäre.

title: Loved Our Hotel Apartment
text: My husband, our 2 adult sons and I went to NY for our Xmas present to see an exhibition.  We stayed at the downtown Marriott, 2 separate rooms.  My husband and I had a fabulous corner suite. It was so big I said I felt like it was a NY apartment.  It was equipped with a wet bar, including a fridge; 2 televisions and coat closet.  The most amazing features were the extra large windows with incredible views of the Hudson.  The staff was very pleasant at check-in.  There is a restaurant, Bill's Bar & Burger, in the hotel.  You can order take-out from there including breakfast, but there is no room service. My husband asked about this and was told that it has been difficult to get employees that want to work room service.  Our sons had a room with a view of the Statue of Liberty, room 3403, it was 2 double beds but a bit small.

title: Pour finir un road trip...
text: après une semaine de route dans des motels pas toujours recommandables, le confort, la propreté, la vue et l'espace offerts par cet hôtel situé dans le sud de NY, à deux pas du mémorial des twins towers était un véritable bonheur ! Pour résumé, le bel hôtel typique new-yorkais !

title: A Fantastic Base to Explore this Great City!
text:
I stayed at The Marriott Downtown for the Marathon weekend, November 2016.  From the moment of check in, the staff could not have been more friendly or helpful.  I was allocated an lovely room on 15th floor. 

The room was very spacious by NYC standards and well appointed throughout.   The bed was very comfortable and the linens were lovely. The bathroom was spotless. 

I had an issue one evening with some young American guests being VERY noisy along the corridor, running from rom to room, shouting, crashing into walls, you get the picture. It was late in the evening,around 10pm; and with a marathon to run the next day i was keen for them to be quiet.  I had a word myself, to no avail, so I contacted reception, who immediately sent security up. The problem was solved. 

I managed to carelessly leave an item of clothing behind on departure; and did not notice until I was back in the UK. No problem. I contacted the hotel, who informed me it had been found, photographed and labelled.  They offered to ship it to me - fortunately I had a friend collect it. Again, could not have been more helpful. 

Its in a great location too, perfect for WTC and SI Ferry.  Very well connected to the rest of Manhattan by several subway lines within an easy walk. 

Starbucks downstairs is also a great bonus.

In summary, i would not hesitate to recommend this well run, clean and comfortable hotel, with its friendly helpful staff; and I hope to be back soon.

title: A solid fine
text:
Like most hotels in New York, the hotel feels dated, the elevators are too slow and the rooms are small and need a refresh. Breakfast is the lounge was sub par and very overcrowded. Certainly nothing special or unique in the menu. Location kind of feels like it is on the highway and it is not really close to anything other than the Twin Tower site. Otherwise, no charm or energy in the immediate vicinity. 

On the other had, Marriott continues to do an exceptional job training their staff and they were exceptionally helpful, friendly and readily available.

title: Nothing to complain about!
text: For us it was the ideal hotel to discover Manhattan. Not far from Battery Park and the 9/11 Memorial. And only a few steps away from the banks of the Hudson River. And Bill's Burger are really excellent.

title: Perfect in every way (except the thin walls and noisy neighbors at 4am. . .)
text: Had a delightful corner room on the 27th floor, looking toward Ellis Island, Hoboken, and Jersey City Beautiful view.  Great king size bed, nice sheets, room not cramped at all, nice bathroom.  Cute little coffee maker worked like a charm.  Every thing was perfect (including price through Hotels.com) until about 4 in the morning when a woman started screaming at her partner, first in the hallway and then in the room next to ours.  Thin walls made it impossible not to be distracted by the noise or the emotions being expressed, although we couldn't understand what was being said.  Called the front desk to complain and someone was knocking on their door within a minute! Very impressive response.  So, overall a terrific stay, marred inly by a lack of sleep due to some inconsiderate inebriated neighbors.  Would go there again in a second.

title: Expedited service sets it apart!
text: Nothing exciting about the building. Old New York brownstone. Proximity to 9/11 Memorial and Museum is a plus. Helpful staff - even accommodated 10 am check- in. Standard room size for NYC. Ours had excellent view of Statue of Liberty. One downside is $25 cab fare to mid- town

title: Nothing special to warrant $400/night; keeping up with the Joneses
text: Right on West Ave and a block south of the Trade Center Plaza, the Marriott is well situated but not in "the fray" farther north and east, a mixed blessing.  It's nice but not nice enough for the price tag, reflecting the Manhattan effect, I guess.  The Brooklyn Marriott is nicer with a modern flair and a swimming pool.  The fitness center is well outfitted but has the usual 50-pound max weights.  Rooms do have coffee makers and small fridges, but wireless is still an add-on for all but the highest tier of club members, a real irritant.  Street noise was minimal on the 14th floor looking out on West Ave.  I also did not appreciate the doorman slamming the car door on my Lyft when all I had was a carry on bag and had to retrieve it from him when he tried to load it in the trunk; he was only making the pick-up unnecessarily complicated.  If I wanted help, I would ask for it.

title: Very disappointing
text: Half of the room had a wood floor. i had a women in high heels above me. heard every step she took and she took a lot of tehm.no room service. had to go downstairs to a restaurant but they would not let me take a glass of wine with me. they never mentioned they were giving me a handicapped room. Normally, i would be fine but just had a double hip replacement so not easy getting into or out of the shower.  would not return.

title: Would give 0 stars if it was an option
text: I arrived at the Hotel about 11 PM after a half half-day of travel. I was told there were no rooms available despite my pre paid reservation. They offered to put me up at a different downtown hotel. I told them that I preferred to stay here, given I was attending a conference at the hotel. They said there was nothing they could do, despite other travelers, who arrived after me, getting rooms. They put me in a cab without telling me or the driver the address of the other hotel. The $10 they provided didn't cover the cab fare. The situation was poorly handled and I hope other travelers don't receive the same treatment that I did.

title: Convenient location for World Trade Center
text: I recently spent the night at this hotel the night before an early breakfast meeting at 225 Liberty Place. I had a later meeting at 4 WTC. The hotel was perfectly situated. It would also be perfect for a tourist visiting the 9/11 museum. I arrived by car late at night. There is a 24 hour garage right around the corner on Albany Street, which was very convenient, and quick both to park, and pick my car up later.  Check in was smooth and quick.  My room was fairly generic, but comfortable. It had a shower but no tub, but had nice quality shampoo, etc.  There's a nice sized desk for working. The room was quiet, the bed comfortable, the price reasonable.

title: Heart of Downtown
text: Located in the heart of downtown the front desk staff are very courteous and accommodating.  The rooms are comfortable but could use updating.  I would recommend this hotel if you need a place downtown.  The restaurant was very good and room service was tasty (which is not always the case).

title: Perfect location!
text: A very good location in a revitalized downtown Manhattan. Very friendly and accommodating staff. Like much of Manhattan, it's a very walkable neighborhood. The hotel itself is clean, well priced, and convenient.

title: Downtown Manhattan weekend,
text:
Excellent stay over President holiday weekend. Really nice friendly check in with Maria who was super nice and made sure we had s nice room looking at the Statue of Liberty. Very nice room, very clean and excellent shower!
We live on Long Island and had a great weekend seeing all the sites and enjoying the Marriott Downtown.

title: Handy Locale! Immaculate! Professsional Staff!!
text: My wife and I stayed here and enjoyed every minute of our visit to the city! The hotel is very handy to Broadway shows and numerous fine eateries. We were able to take in Wicked and eat nearby all within minutes of the hotel proper.. The hotel iself has numerous offerings such as a workout room, massages, a cocktail lounge et. al. Minutes to Times Square if you like tom take a stroll.

title: Pleasant Downtown Oasis Centrally located
text: Have a weekend trip planned to NYC. Consider staying downtown at this Marriott. Great location near the 9/11 memorial and conveniently located by public transportation, this hotel is a good deal and a great location.

title: Bueno
text: El hotel está ubicado muy cerca de la estación de metro y del WTC, las habitaciones son muy cómodas y amplias para los estándares de la ciudad y aunque la estación de metro esta muy cerca queda un poco alejado del área de compras.

title: Fantastic prime location
text: Conveniently located within a walking distance to the financial district such as New York stock exchange and "freedom tower".  It is also a walking distance to the iconic Brooklyn bridge as well.  Most room come with a nice view of Hudson river or ocean view.  It will be a bonus if your room comes with access to the lounge.  What a fabulous and breathtaking view it is for a breakfast in the morning...words cannot describe it all.

title: View of NYC Statue of Liberty
text: very clean and modern room. Steps away from Battery Park and Statten Island Ferry terminal. My cousin and I were able to see the Statue of Liberty and then grab a quick cab ride uptown to enjoy the New York City attractions. We stayed 2 nights and valet parked our car for $60. I may stay there again in the future.  Very Southern end of Manhattan.

title: 内敛低调的万豪
text: 这是纽约市较老的万豪酒店，酒店位置在下城区，离华尔街，归零地，911纪念馆，炮台公园都很近，步行都可以到达。健身房够大，但是没有游泳池，酒店一层的汉堡店是家美式餐厅，酒店服务很好，建议从万豪的APP预定，很方便

title: Great service
text: This beautiful property is located next to World Trade Center and across from World Exchange Center, Service is great, Concierge very Knowledgeable, Hotel has a bar that serves food and also have a gift shop

title: Great place for a weekend night
text: We usually stay in mid-town since it's close to theaters, dining, shopping, etc. But this turned out to be a home run. The hotel is great, we had a corner room which was large, and had great views of the Hudson. It's a snap to get on the 1,2 or 3 train up to Times Square. Or you can always take a cab or a ride-share service. We had dinner at Morton's which is 1/2 block away. There is a mall across the street, Trinity Church, the Freedom Tower, etc. for sightseeing and if you walk over to the other side of Broadway there are more restaurants and night-life. To get a room this great for under $150 a night in NYC is amazing!

title: Excellent place that is close to business
text: I usually stay at a property more than once before submitting a review. I stayed here 3 times (total of 15 nights) in November and December 2016. The hotel is well maintained and fairly quiet. It was also very conveniently located to the financial sector of the city (about a 5 to minute walk to Wall street). The concierge lounge was well stocked but unfortunately there was a lot of kids running around and constantly getting in the way of business travelers just trying to get a quick bite before heading out each day.  The first stay I got a room on the 18th floor with fantastic views of the statue of liberty and parts of battery park. During another stay I had some noise coming from the adjoining room. Evidentially this guy liked blasting the TV at 5AM every day. I could hear a fair amount of noise coming from that room when the TV was not blasting as well. However, those are inconveniences were minor and overall I had no real complaints. I would definitely stay here again in the future.

title: Family 1st time in NY City
text: I traveled to NY with my 2 children, 14 and 9 years old from Jan 4th - Jan 8th.  It was our first time here. I was very happy with my choice in hotel.  Accommodations were clean and the staff was very friendly.  Since the hotel is located in the financial district, we were pretty far from big tourist areas like Central Park, Time Square and Hells Kitchen to name a few.  However we had no issue taking the train or an Uber to get there.  We were within walking distance from the 9/11 memorial and museum and from the loading dock for the Statue of Liberty cruise which was great.

title: Nice stay in NY
text: This Marriott was very nice, and away from all the craziness in Manhattan. It was very clean and the staff was very nice. I did not like the food in the restaurant in the lobby but that wasn't that a big deal. Ubers came very fast to this location as well.

title: Excellent views, friendly staff
text: From the moment we arrived we felt warm and welcomed from the front desk staff, they were all excellent. Our room was perfect as described- our Hudson River view room was perfect. We were 100% satisfied with our stay. The restaurant inside the hotel (Bull & Burger I think it's called) served an excellent breakfast. We HIGHLY RECOMMEND this hotel when staying in the financial district or when visiting the 9/11 Memorial.

title: A Disappointment
text:
Let me start by saying that I am a loyal Marriott patron. I've been Platinum status for over five years. In short, I go out of my way to stay at a Marriott property in any city that I visit, whether for business or pleasure. 

The Marriott Downtown property is in a great location, right on the edge of the Financial district and steps away from the World Trade Memorial. With location being so prime, I was so disappointed with the staff and with how outdated the rooms were. 

1. The staff was non-welcoming and, at times, flat-out rude. The front desk treated me like I was a burden when I checked in. On the second night, I called down for extra towels and it took three more calls (35 minutes in total) to receive them. I will give credit to the bellman, who were responsive and very cordial. 

2. The rooms were in dire need of a makeover. In NYC, you expect smaller than average rooms, but the decor was super outdated, ragged even. 

For the price, I would highly recommend avoiding this hotel.

title: Weekend getaway in NY
text: The Courtyard Marriott is an excellent value for the money!  In a great location one block from the WTC, we walked all over Lower Manhattan, even to a late night bar on Pearl Street.  The hotel is clean and the room was great...   wonderfully comfortable bed, up to date bathroom amenities, and a 6th floor café for a quick coffee/breakfast on the go. Couldn't ask for more..  will definitely come back to this hotel and will recommend to friends traveling to NY.  Staff was friendly and helpful too!

title: Great Short Stay
text: We booked our room through Expedia, and were very pleased when we checked in to note our room was on the top floor of the hotel overlooking the 9/11 memorial; fantastic view.  The room was clean, and the bed was comfortable.  The hotel cost was less than staying in Midtown or other areas of NYC, and with the subway so close, we could navigate around the city with ease.  There are also many things to see and do in this area of the city.  Would highly recommend for travelers looking for a peaceful stay, out of the hustle and bustle, but still close enough by quick subway ride that it is totally worth it.

title: Good downtown hotel
text: A nicely refurbished hotel (beaten up by hurricane Sandy) in a location with easy access to the 9/11 Memorial and other Financial District spots. Far less crowded than Times Square and midtown. Reasonably priced and with a bar/restaurant.

title: Top quality and amazing views
text: We recently stayed at the Downtown Marriott and loved it! It is about a block from ground zero, it is not in the middle of all the noise and chaos however it is close to restaurants, subway, mall, Battery Park, wall street, etc.  Although we only stayed for 3 days it was memorable. you have the convenience of a full service Starbucks in the property. Our room had a clear and beautiful view of the Statue of Liberty, comfortable and large considering NY hotels. We absolutely loved and will come back

title: Modern
text:
The hotel is located in a fantastic area of New York. Walking distance to the subway and many excellent tour locations. Our room was modern and a great size. However, staff had trouble understanding our Australian accent and over charged our credit card. We were also sold local only stamps for postcards we wanted to send back home. Upon confronting the staff member in regards to this issue we were told bad luck and just hope they make it. I don't think they understand how poor our dollars is compared to theirs. I think a trip to Wall Street is needed to understand foreign exchange rates It almost was $20 AUS to buy/send postcards home to family that will never be received very upsetting and disappointing.

Overall the value for money is great for New York. However, the staff need improvement in customer service.

title: Lovely nights sleep
text: Only stayed for 2 nights as travelling through but was lovely and comfortable. Food was OK but we ate out mostly. Have to mention some staff seemed a bit miserable but others very attentive and helpful. Would Def stay again for a night or 2 if needed.

title: Not awful
text:
This is an adequate hotel at best. Their rooms are in serious need of an update (stained furniture, poor bathroom lighting, outdated common areas). In addition, the fact that the hotel staff thought it would be fine to put me on a floor that cannot easily access the concierge lounge was a bit frustrating. If you do stay here and you're gold or platinum, ask to be on at least floor 17. 

The one saving grace at this hotel is the service in the concierge lounge. Mario deserves a lot of the credit for that. This was the first hotel in the US where lounge access was really a privilege and enjoyable. Again, this was largely Mario's doing, but it's with mentioning. 

Hopefully Marriott will realize what a fantastic location and staff they have here and upgrade the rest of the accommodations to match those attributes.

title: Excellent hotel, moderately-priced
text: What a find! Very convenient to lower Manhattan sights (911 Memorial, Statue of Liberty, etc.) – and with moderately priced taxi ride – convenient to Broadway shows. We’ve stayed in theatre district area before, and the nightly rates are outrageous. The Marriott Downtown was a great find. Loved the hotel – clean, quiet, great service. Lovely area to walk around as well. Several good restaurants in immediate area.

title: My favourite hotel in Manhattan. one word - Fabulous
text:
I've been staying here for many years and this hotel just gets better and better. This is down to the management and staff who really put themselves out to make sure you have a great stay. 

I emailed Karen a few days befor my stay, one of the AYS team and within 4 minutes I had a reply confirming my favourite type of room. This is just outstanding service, in fact I've never had better. 

Check in was taken care of by Amie Lau (she has been at this hotel for 18 years so that in itself says something- happy staff makes happy guests). Amie also allowed me a late checkout on my day of departure. She was extremely friendly and welcoming and thanked me for my Platinum loyalty. 

This hotel is 38 floors tall but with only 15 rooms per floor, it has the feel of a boutique hotel and this is why you get such personal service. It is in complete contrast to larger hotels such as the Marriott Marquis which feels like a train station in the lobby at times as its usually so busy. The Downtown Marriott is a truly special hotel in a great location and very easy to get into places like Times Square on the no 1 train from nearby Rector St subway station. In addition, the hotel is a 2 minute walk to the new Westfield shopping centre at the World Trade Centre. Downtown is no longer just a financial area, it is once again a destination hotspot for visitors. 

Bills Burgers in the hotel lobby serves up some of the best Burgers in town and can now be ordered and delivered on room service. There is a Starbucks in the lobby which I always use but on this occasion it was closed for refurbishment. 

The executive lounge on the 38th floor is one of the best I've ever used. Breakfast is excellent with smoked salmon, crispy bacon, scrambled eggs, oatmeal, fresh fruit, bagels, bread, pastries, etc. The food in the evening is far better than the tiny canapes you might get in  some hotels, and there were some delicious (and very large) meatballs and pasta on one evening plus salads, cakes etc. 

The young lady at check out was equally as friendly and continued the seamless excellent personal service that I have always had at this hotel.

title: Confortable y bien situado
text: Muy cercano a zona cero y Wall Street. También a estación ferry a Staten Island (gratuito), desde el que puede fotografiarse la estatua de la libertad y sky line. Metro cercano. Habitación confortable y excelentes vistas. Volvería a reservar en éste hitel, totalmente recomendable.

title: Nice Rooms & Good Location
text: Great room with nice views!  Our room was very spacious and clean including the bathroom.  Bed was very comfortable.  We had a nice view of the city from our room.  This hotel is close to the 9/11 Memorial.  Subway stops are within a couple of blocks.  Staff was helpful and friendly.  We would stay here again.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: My family was very happy with our stay in the Marriott Downtown.  The room was very clean and comfortable.  The service was excellent and very friendly.  The location is so covenient.  There are so many resturants and shops close by.  We will definitely stay in Marriott Downtown again next time we visit.

title: About a block away from the 9/11 memorial site. Really nice rooms, friendly staff
text: We loved this property! We loved the rooms, the staff, the restaurant, and the location. Beautifully appointed, spacious rooms. Very comfortable! Views of neighboring architecture were stunning. Our second room had a view of the Statue of Liberty too. The restaurant downstairs had good food and very nice breakfast. Behind the hotel you can get to Wall Street easily. About a block west of the hotel is the 9/11 memorial site. It is unbelievable to be "right there". The location is great, but if you stay on West St, wander out the back side and you'll find all kids of things! We were able to Uber and Lyft everywhere easily too. (we had mobility issues with a senior in our group). I highly recommend this property!

title: Almost very good
text: I'm not normally picky with hotels, all I ask for is clean and comfortable. The Marriott Downtown NYC is all that, the rooms are clean and quiet, the beds are comfy. The lobby is just like they say, spectacular. It was New Years Eve when we visited so the Christmas tree was there too. My only complain was the hotels wi-fi which wasn't free. I thought those days were long gone when they charged for that. Nope, these places still exist. The room rate was already ridiculous so paying for wi-fi seemed a little like a slap in the face. Thanks to T-Mobile data stash I wasn't completely dead in the water but still annoying.

title: Great Property and Staff!
text: My family and I had an excellent stay.  The room was comfortable and clean with a great view of the Hudson.  The staff in the concierge lounge was friendly, professional and helpful despite the crowds. The free rental umbrellas for Marriott members were extremely helpful during a very rainy tour of the Statue of Liberty.

title: Typisches Amerikanisches Hotel mit Big Apple Flair
text: wir haben das Hotel mittels eines extrem günstigen Angebotes inkl. Flug gebucht.Das Hotel ist gut situiert in direkter Nähe zum One World Trade Center. Die Lobby ist ausgesprochen schön, der Concierge war unglaublich freundlich.Alles ist sehr traditionell amerikanisch und pompös eingerichtet,das Frühstück gibt es traditionell amerikanisch im nebenanliegenden Burgerlokal.Auch ein kleiner Starbucks gehört zum Lokal. Das Zimmer war ebenfalls sehr schön eingerichtet und sauber. Einziges Problem war das WiFi das für unseren Geschmack extrem überteuert war (15$ pro Tag). Wir haben daher nur das kostenlose WiFi in der Lobby genutzt. Dies ist meiner Meinung nach heutzutage wirklich nicht mehr zeitgemäß.

title: Very close to freedom tower
text:
This is an excellent Marriott. 
It's typically clean, very well run comfortable and expensive. 
Of course all well located hotels in manhattan are pricy so just bight the bullet.  
It's within easy walking distance of the freedom tower and the September 11 museum. 
We had a good visit /used the valet parking ($50), / walked to the museum /and O 'haras pub ( highly recommend), and used cabs to go uptown although the subway is handy too. 
Good burgers and beer in the in house pub. Fast service too. 
We used room service for breakfast and it was not good enough for usually ok Marriott standards. Untoasted toast and cold gummy eggs were a slight negative but----
I would stay again and  still recommend this location highly but you'll have to open up your wallet. 
Convenience?- A+
Location?-A+ (for downtown).
Price?- C-
Value?-B+
Staff/clean/ comfortable?-A+
Bottom line? Solid A

title: Great Stay
text:
Stayed here 4 nights in a Statue of Liberty view room.  

Pros: In the heart of the financial district - short walk to many shops and restaurants. Around the corner from WTC and a few blocks from the NYSE.

Rooms are clean and beds are very comfortable. Adjustable thermostat kept the room at a perfect temperature. 

Service is excellent - front desk, housekeeping - everyone is friendly, professional and helpful!

On site restaurant is a great place for breakfast and never seemed crowded in the mornings. Service here is excellent too. 

Cons: Room service is slow so order early if you are on a schedule. 

We would definitely consider staying again if we are ever in New York!

title: 4 night pre Christmas break
text:
Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights, 2 adults and 2 children for a pre Christmas break to see the sights in NYC.

Our room had a fabulous view over the Hudson River, very close to the 911 memorial and in a much quieter part of the city, perfect to relax after a day sightseeing and shopping on 5th Avenue and Time Square.

The rooms were small but had everything we needed and the beds were really comfy to get a good night sleep.

We are in Bills a couple of times for breakfast and evening meal. The service was fantastic and prices were reasonable compared with other places we ate around New York!

If you're planning on visiting New York, the New York Marriott Downtown is the perfect location to get around see the sights but still be far enough away from the busy part of town to get a good night sleep.

When I return to NYC I would have no hesitation in booking this hotel!

title: Bonito hotel y buen servicio
text: El hotel está a dos cuadras del WTC, tiene a dos cuadras el Metro y a tres la parada del camión, yo preferí el camión que se va por toda la Sexta ave. Y de regreso es por la quinta ave. En el hotel me ayudaron para conseguir las paradas del camión, me cambiaron monedas cuesta 2.75, todo muy bien, el último día estaban regalando galletas de chocolate, a pesar de que había mucha gente, siempre nos trataron muy bien, a pesar de la época no sentí tanto frío, lo que sí es que NY es muy caro, recomiendo el restaurante Café Bravo que está a dos cuadras sobre la calle de rector, muy rico y hablan español, aproximadamente te gastas 13 dólares por comida.

title: Weekend in New York
text:
Stopped at Marriott for three nights great hotel. Just around the corner from the memorial for twin towers. Had a couple of meals at bills great food. Staff very friendly, really enjoyed our stay. 

Many thanks 
Steve & joy

title: Anniversary in NYC
text: Spacious and clean hotel rooms. Good location and easy to Uber around to different destinations in the city. Very short walk to World Trade Center memorial. Hotel staff is amazing and extremely helpful with any questions we had. Came back after a long day of sight seeing to an immaculately cleaned room and an anniversary gift from the front desk manager. Hands down best place to stay in NYC.

title: Good location, slightly dated now
text:
Only checked in here as other family members were ... 

The W next door had offers and was the same price, so maybe I'm comparing the two as same price ... 

No healthy breakfast options.. 

Elevators very slow also.. seemed to take for ever to arrive -

Very expensive for a bottle of water ..

On the plus side, the maids were very polite /

On a whole, not for me, and don't think value for money

Location was good, right next to ground zero ..

title: Wonderful view of the bay and city
text: Stayed at the 11th floor and had a lovely time seeing the views around the corner room. it had wonderful views too of heritage buildings from the elevator doors. Good restaurant for breakfast. Room lacks electrical outlets for phone and gadgets charging. Centrally located and near subway.

title: Bien mais américain
text:
Pas de Resto ou bar de L hôtel 
Tout est délégué a une chaîne de Resto " burger" et a jn " Starbucks "
Lobby un peu petit 
Chambres grandes et sympa 
Personnel charmant et accueillant  
 situé près du nouveau world tarde  center et donc de " century 21" ce n'est cependant pas un quartier très animé ..LE soir les resto ne sont pas a côté ( surtout Qd il fait froid et que L on sature un peu des burgers ) pour les petits déjeuners il y a 2 restos le café bravo ( classique sans âme particulière) ou chez Georges typique pour un breakfast américain ( sortir de L hôtel par le Starbucks à droite 2 blocs plus moins à gauche ... 5 mn)

title: Quase maravilhoso.
text:
Eu gostei do hotel, o quarto era bom, era novo, com chuveiro (box), sem aquela banheira e cortina de pano. 
Ficamos no quarto 504, que fica ao lado da área de manutenção, que faz barulho direto, sem parar. A janela tinha vista para essa área. Um dia de manhã vi um rapaz andando do lado de fora. Ainda bem que tinha a cortina.
Atrapalhou um pouco na primeira noite. Nas demais, estávamos tão cansados de andar o dia todo, que nem ouvíamos o barulho, mas quem tem o sono leve pode sofrer um pouco.
Tentamos mudar de quarto por duas vezes, mas não nos atenderam, disseram que o hotel estava lotado.
Gostei muito da região. É um pouco afastado do Central Park, mas há metrô e isso não atrapalha, ainda mais se o hotel for só para dormir mesmo.
Fica ao lado do Memorial, pertinho da saída para a Estátua da Liberdade, de Wall Street, da Century 21 e etc.
Se não fosse o barulho, teria sido ideal.

title: new york short break
text: Hotel close to 911 memorial, and ferry to Statue of Liberty. Hotel was very nice and reception staff were helpful. We arrived a couple of days before thanksgiving and were given information on the Macys parade etc.

title: Sehr gutes Hotel mitten im Financial District
text:
Super Lage im Financial District. Top Ausstattung- sehr gute Anbindung nach Uptown und Brooklyn- tolles Hotel mit Blick auf das One WTC. Dieses New Yorker Hotel liegt 5 Gehminuten vom World Trade Center entfernt. Freuen Sie sich in diesem Hotel auf ein hochmodernes Fitnesscenter. Das 9/11 Memorial befindet sich auf der gegenüberliegenden Straßenseite. Also Top Lage in New York. 5min vom Hotel gibt es eine Subway Station. 
Das Restaurant im Hotel Bill's Bar & Burger serviert verschiedene Burger, Pommes und Milchshakes. Das hoteleigene Restaurant ist zum Frühstück, Mittag- und Abendessen geöffnet.
Die Fähre am Battery Park, die Sie zur Freiheitsstatue bringt, befindet sich 8 Gehminuten vom Hotel entfernt. Die Wall Street erreichen Sie nach 6 Gehminuten.

title: amplio y buena relación calidad-precio
text:
Hotel muy grande para el que busque algo práctico a precios moderados para ser NY, supongo que debido a la ubicación en la zona de Wall Street , muy lejos de la zona de compras del midtown y el parque, pero mas  cerca del SOHO y chinatown .

Parece el típico hotel de negocios pero también tiene mucho éxito entre turistas . Las habitaciones son muy amplias , algo poco frecuente en la ciudad . La zona era bastante ruidosa por las muchas obras que se están haciendo alrededor ( está a 50 metros de la Zona Cero, todavía con continuas obras )

title: 4 star hotel
text:
ok, its new york city but too expensive for what this is .
It lacks cosyness 
Rooms not very big too but again its new york city .
Its really downtown , directly at battery park but somewhat away from the middle of manhattan 
rooms are typically marriott style , bathroom was very small 
carpets and elevators are outdated 
but ok 
i stayed in nyc once in the carlton in 2014> better location and better price/ quality 
staff not very exceptional, and i can compare, i was in more then 70 hotels in 33 counties 
this hotel was booked through a travel agency , i would not recommend it sorry  

not far from newark airport by the way

title: Poor customer service
text: Poor customer service. ROBERT FINN at the front desk told us that there was nothing the hotel could do about the crying  baby. Comp us a free breakfast, cheap Marriott for waking up at 5a due to a crying  baby! Babies cry but customer service is poor.

title: Convenient location
text: The hotel is near Battery Park, 911 Memorial, financial center and not very far from Chinatown, Broadway. Very good location. Nearest stop of Big Bus is Battery Park. The red Big Bus will take you to see beautiful landmarks in Manhattan.

title: Great Value for Money
text:
I was across in New York to run the marathon. The hotel was on the list of options available and not having stayed 'downtown' before I thought I'd give it a go.

The hotel was clean, and I had a good size room with a comfortable bed - I got plenty of sleep before and after the marathon!

Room views were across the Hudson.

I had one breakfast in the room and a number of meals in the restaurant - as well as a few trips to the in-house Starbucks.

Staff were unfailingly helpful and the whole experience was great.

The only niggle,  and it's a marathon runner's specific one, is that as we had to set off for the Staten Island ferry at 5.45am on race day there was no hotel breakfast option available. The staff directed me to a local 24hour cafe and I did manage to get some carbs. Perhaps they could provide a one-off porridge and toast option around 5am in future!

I'd use the hotel again without hesitation.

title: Manager blunder, but otherwise a nice hotel
text: Robin Christian, it was so unfortunate I did not get to meet you during my stay at this hotel. While the Marriott was very nice and everyone I DID have the opportunity to meet was very friendly, helpful, and went above and beyond, this manager, in my opinion, was unacceptable. One day before my arrival I received an email saying my reservation had been cancelled. The cause of the cancelation and something to do with my credit card company not being able to validate the purchase since this was a large amount and it was out of state. While I did confirm this purchase immediate with my credit card company something fell through the cracks. I was unable to confirm if the cancellation was due to something wrong on the hotel side of things or on my credit companies side of things, but I can assure you this; while the front desk clerk had no authority to give me my room at the same price of my original booking the manager sure as hell did. He did not help in anyway and even went so far as to tell my husband to "look online". So we did look online using our Marriott app and we were able to get the hotel for only a $5 price increase. Why couldn't the manager have saved me loads of time, anxiety, and stress on this last minute cancellation? I am not sure, but I am extremely disappointed that this is the way we were treated. No one should be left in the dark and if being an elite Marriott rewards member means nothing then we will go back to the Hilton honors.

title: Great hotel, beautiful views and outstanding staff
text: We spent three days at this hotel and had an outstanding experience. Staff is professional and helpful at every level. The views from upper floors are incredible. Our room was clean and well appointed.

title: Felt at home here
text: I am a platinum rewards member and fortunate to enjoy the concierge lounge.  Mario is the best concierge ever!  He is friendly to all and a wonderful warm person.  He is energetic and personable.  His assistant Karen was filling in but it was like she always worked there, and she was also fantastic!  The food is superb and so much nicer than most Marriotts that I have been to.  I love this place!

title: Good choice if you want to be in NYC financial district
text:
This hotel is within walking distance of World Trade Center memorials and the new mall with outstanding modern architecture.  The hotel lobby is quite small for a major hotel and so not much room for many to linger.  There are two lobby bars.  The Happy Hour menu price for beer is slightly more than their menu states.  Not that big of deal, but a discrepancy which remained uncorrected.
The major negative in our experience was that we had booked a room with a king bed and a pull out sofa for our teenaged son.  The reservation clerk offered to change us to  "two beds," which sounded better and presumably was better.  The two beds were not even queens, but the smaller doubles, which made for uncomfortable sleeping.  If we knew that, we wouldn't have agreed.  We had a busy schedule and didn't have time to change rooms and our belongings.  It was close to a bait and switch.  We assumed that any unsolicited offer from the hotel would be an improvement over what we already had.  'Taint necessarily so.  Always be skeptical.

title: Beautiful hotel at Ground Zero
text:
Beautiful, comfortable rooms with excellent linens and bathroom.  Located a half-block from Ground Zero, it is an easy walk to the Reflecting Pools, 911 Museum and the Freedom Tower. Powerfully emotional experience.

We spent one night here prior to our departure on a cruise.  The cruise terminal is conveniently located just a short can ride away.

title: Excellent Location Downtown NYC
text:
The Marriott Downtown offered a good location for our stay in NYC to visit the 9/11 Memorial and Museum.  The Museum, Memorial Park and new One World Observatory are a short walk.  South Ferry area is several blocks away.

Took AMTRAK Acela from Boston to Penn Station, which is excellent!  Easy access to Subway 1 toward South Ferry is within Penn Station.  Get off at Rector Street Station...with a short 2 block walk to hotel. Get a Metro Card (2.75 per ride).  Taxi from Penn could run as hight as $60 depending on time of day.  Did notice if you drive, parking is $60 a day near hotel.

Two dining locations are within the hotel.  Be sure to take the correct elevator when getting to your floor.  All in all, an EXCELLENT Hotel to stay at

title: Excellent Hotel with Fantastic Staff
text: We wanted to visit the 9/11 Memorial sites prior to departing on a cruise and the downtown Marriott is an outstanding location for this visit.  I hesitated a bit because of the high price of the rooms, but when I looked at  other NYC hotels they were all expensive so I went with the Marriott because of its location.  I'm glad I did!  The welcome at the hotel was very friendly and helpful.  Each of the staff we encountered was cheerful and cordial - not what I expected at a busy hotel in downtown New York.  Jay the bellman who delivered our bags to our room was especially helpful with orientation and dining suggestions that proved outstanding.  The concierge lounge was one of the best I have visited in my many Marriott stays.  The food was good and the attendants were exceptional.  I happened to ride down on an elevator with a very nice young man and commented to him how pleasant and happy all the employees are and that indicates great management.  He then introduced himself - Joseph Dembek, the general manager.  I think he deserves much credit for the exceptional staff as they seem to reflect his friendly helpful attitude.

title: 絕佳地理位置~景緻佳
text:
交通方便~飯店步行10分鐘內抵達地鐵站,不論是往上城區還是下城區!
環境佳~靠近砲台公園,清晨沿著公園慢跑,眺望Jersey City的天際線,夜晚環境寧靜
白天可步行至華爾金融商業區.臨近world trade center,911紀念碑參觀~
適合商旅及遊客居住絕佳的飯店!

title: Wonderful area to stay
text: My daughter and I stayed in this great hotel.  Very comfortable beds.  We stayed on the 24th floor with a view of the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island.  It was within a short walking distance to so many places including the 911 museum.  We had great subway connections to the theater district, dinner and shopping.  We would stay there again in a heartbeat.

title: Gruppetur 2016
