text: Svært bra hotell. Vi bodde i 16 etg. med utsikt mot Hudson river. Bra beliggenhet kort vei til Ground Zero, ferje til Ellis Island mm. Frokost ikke inkludert, restaurant i hotell er ganske dyr. Rimeligere frokostservering ikke langt unna. Hyggelig betjening.

title: Great Hotel for Events!!!!
text: We blocked rooms with The New York Marriott Downtown for our wedding and it was seriously one of the easiest parts of our wedding planning process (as it should be). We worked with Breann and she was AMAZING. She always got back to us in a timely manner, their prices were incredibly reasonable, and it was a pleasure use them for our wedding. They were consistent when it came to setting up more rooms, they gave us a link for our guests to use, they extended our room block when we needed it extended a bit longer -- it was just such an easy, seamless process. The rooms were clean, the staff was nice, the food was good -- all of our guests were happy and we couldn't be happier with the service we received. It's rare that I leave comments or reviews on service, but this is a well deserved review -- use them for your wedding in NYC if you can -- you will be thankful you did!!!

title: Clean hotel, good location
text: I stayed here for a conference. The bed was very comfortable, the room was clean. The walls are a litle thin. Good restaurant options in the hotel plus they have a Starbucks on prem. The only problem I had was my phone went dead during my stay.  I couldn't make any calls including the front desk, it felt very isolating. Besides that everything was great!

title: как всегда отличные кровати :)
text:
мне попался угловой номер как на картинке, так что и вид, и освещение были прекрасными! хотя номер староват и ванная тоже. 
кровати в мариотте всегда превосходные! короче, типичный бизнес отель, в отпуске в таком бы не останавливалась.

title: Nice downtown hotel w/ excellent gym and staff
text: Stayed overnight for the MIchigan vs. Rutgers football game.  Nice property.  Nice staff (including check in who found a room that was ready), outstanding fitness center which is state of the art and free.  For being in a "city that doesn't sleep" the bar and restaurant closes pretty early for a weekend night.  The bellmen are outstanding including getting my car for valet service.  Good location for downtown and if you have to get to New Jersey like we did.

title: Amazing Location
text: This is an amazing location. Just a few steps from the World Trade Center, 9/11 Memorial, Eataly, and amazing shopping. The ferry is also a 10 minute subway ride or  20 minute walk. The hotel is very clean and very nice. I read many reviews that the hotel was old and need d remodeling. My room had new carpet and hard wood floors. I also reserved the Statue of Liberty view room. It is worth the extra money to watch the sun rise and set with the great statue behind it. The restaurant inside is horrible. Horrible food and horrible service. We only ate breakfast there because it was free. I'd rather pay to eat something enjoyable.

title: Great Location for 9/11 Memorial, Liberty and Ellis Islands
text:
We stayed at this hotel specifically for its location.  It was a short walk to go to the 9/11 Memorial Museum and to get the boat to the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island.

The hotel public areas are very attractive and clean.  Our room was clean.  All the personnel we came in contact with were friendly.

title: Great location -- near 9-11 Memorial and the park
text: I stayed here for business but enjoyed being close to everything.  Room was great with a great view -- great burger place for delivery.  The desk employees were great -- printed out our tickets to the Federal Reserve so we didn't have to pay at the FedEx printing office.

title: A friendly New York City Hotel
text: I've encountered unfriendly New York City hotels, but the Marriott Downtown bend over backwards to be helpful, answer questions, and give directions.  I keep going back there because of the service and the great location.

title: Really Nice Property
text: Lobby is well designed, spacious by New York standards. We upgraded to a Jr Suite, which gave us a roomy corner room with great views. We looked at the regular rooms, which were also a good size for New York. They appeared to me to be the same as Marriotts in other cities. Views are better from higher floors.

title: Good Stay
text:
I had a wedding in Brooklyn to go to and needed a place to stay for one night.  It's close to the 4-5-6 trains which is nice, even though I ended up taking an Uber.

I had requested a high floor and they gave it to me.  I requested a late check-out and they gave me 'til 1:00pm.  The gym looked really nice and updated.

Room was good enough for one night.  Only issue was it was next to the ice machine and I could hear it whenever somebody used it.

For the price I paid and for a short trip, i'd stay here again.  Service was good.

title: classe
text: bel hotel bien situe et bien entretenu. pres de beaucoup d attrais. les gens de ny sont sympatique et amical. a y a beaucoup de chiens mais ils sont discrets. beaucoup de policiers et de klasons. le soir, on voient des rats. les prix des restos sont exageres

title: Just okay
text: Stayed here for a work trip, otherwise I probably would have stayed someplace else.  The rooms are small and the beds are tiny.  The walls are also paper thin, so you can hear everything in the next room.  I'm told that the rooms with the Statue of Liberty views are much better, so you may want to give those a try.

title: This is an older Marriott and you see and feel it
text: In general it is a Marriott and has all the expected services. But it is just an older one and you can see and feel it. The rooms a slight mold smell and you can't open the window. The rooms a also a bit outdated and you can see that they are used since a long time. Besides that the hotel service was good.

title: Friendly service and comfortable room
text:
I stayed at NY Marriott Downtown during my business trip to NY 6 months ago. It was still winter and the temperature was just above 0 degree Celsius. After I checked in, I decided to order room service for dinner as it was too cold to go outside. I ordered a Caesar salad and a burger with fries. The burger was ok but the fries were cold! 
The hotel is located near the World Trade Center Memorial, but it is relatively close to a subway station. The staff was friendly and the room was reasonably large. It would be an ideal hotel for business traveler.

title: Conference visit - difficult location
text:
I spent a day at this hotel at a business conference. The meeting room was overcrowded but I blame the conference organizer for not reservations rooms large enough for the attendees. The lunch was 1 floor below the level the conference was held on which was a little awkward. The lunch was a sit down affair with no choices, the food was delicious.

The worst part of the experience was the challenging location on West Street. This is a very busy highway and there is no driveway in the front of the hotel. The taxi driver had to make a detour to arrive along the side of the hotel since we were coming from midtown and the hotel is located on the northbound side of the highway.

title: Fabulous location!
text: We stayed here for a Tribeca wedding in August. The location if wonderful, steps away from the World Trade Cwenter and memorial, Battery Park, gorgeous views of the Statue of Liberty and typical Marriott quality and service.

title: A welcome change from the tight hotel accomodations
text: I was erroneously booked in another hotel a cab's ride from a hearing I was a panelist on that was being held at 200 liberty Street. I was moved to the Marriott on my 3rd day and was overwhelmed with the change in atmosphere and service. First, I could walk to my destination, not having to catch a cab at Wall St., second, after leaving a room smaller than my grandchildren's, I was greeted by a large, handicap accessible room with a view, Third, the view of the new World trade center and the short walk to Ground Zero from the hotel is amazing, Fourth, I had continual trouble hooking up to limited Wi-Fi at the first hotel, but no such problem at the Marriott, and Fifth, there was so much more food and beverage providers within walking distance. Overall, a great experience with great service and attention to my needs

title: Convenient Financial District location; great gym
text:
Very nice property, recently updated. Rooms are clean and "typical Marriott" experience. Gym is quite nice. Close to subway and the PATH. Better service than Hyatt or Hilton nearby, but Concierge
Desk is not helpful with restaurant recommendations. They sent me to a terrible Chinese "cafeteria" when I said I wanted a nice Asian restaurant... As well as a really greasy breakfast spot. This is NY!! They should be able to make decent restaurant/entertainment recommendations.

title: 5 Day Get Away
text: Location is in the financial district. The World Trade Center 1 is only 2 blocks away. Subway is right around the corner. Out of our window we saw The Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island. Had a wonderful dinner along the east river. Quite a few nice restaurants in the area. Historic Wall Street. Short ride to Times Square, Lincoln center, Soho, upper east side and upper west side. Transportation to Laguardia was short and reasonable. It was a wonderful location.

title: Touring
text: We stayed here Thursday through Saturday. It's very convenient to 911 museum & ferry to Statue of Liberty (both walkable). The staff was very nice as far as directions, taxis, and restaurants suggestions. There is a Starbucks and restaurants in the lobby. We ate in the restaurant for breakfast (good). We took the subway to American girl doll store. No pool which the kids missed. We were a bike to get a roll away and 2 double beds which worked for our family. Overall, a quiet hotel in a perfection location. I would recommend.

title: Reliable business Marriott with nice gym
text:
I frequently stay at this Marriott when traveling to NY for work.  

As a platinum member, this hotel often upgrades me to a nice corner room which is very large and spacious with a full living room and separate bedroom.

They have a very nice new modern gym which is rarely crowded.  It has all new equipment and is a very open space with plenty of room to work out.

The concierge lounge isn't very large, but you can get a quick breakfast in the am and some food (not good at all, but something) in the evening.  

I am always so perplexed as to why the lounges in Europe are SO SO much better than in the U.S., but I won't hold that against this particular Marriott as it is all of them across the board in the states.

I love having a Starbucks in the lobby of this hotel and quite honestly it does influence my decision when booking.  Overall, it is a good and reliable business hotel.

Cons:  

elevators can be very slow because        there are so many floors/guests.

Restaurant in the lobby is not good at all.

Depending on your neighbors in the floor, it can be noisy at times.

title: Great week end stay
text:
The hotel is well located near the Metro. It is in the Wall St area and very close to Battery Park.
Rooms are big and spacious, clean and tidy. We got a very deal for the week end which included upgrading our room.
Breakfast is a little bit pricy in the hotel but there are plenty of places nearby where we got breakfast at a convenient price.

title: Excellnt Stay at Traveler Friendly Hotel
text:
We used the Downtown Marriott as our base for a day of meetings on Wall Street, followed by a day and a half of playing tourist in Nieuw Yawk.

Hotel has spectacular views of New York Harbor and Hudson River and is very near WTC historic sites and the Battery.  Subway service is two blocks away.  (Always disconcerting to have Weather Channel doing remote broadcasts from your neighborhood.)

We took both a hop on/hop off bus tour and a boat tour-both available within easy walking distance of the hotel.  (Ask directions to same)

An unplanned post midnight fire alarm (attributed to annual deep cleaning in a restaurant) was well management.  Hotel staff was appropriately apologetic.

Hotel staff was generally attentive and responsive.

title: Excellent Stay
text:
I went to New York on business and stayed at the Marriott which is in an excellent location. The employees there went out of their way to be helpful, they helped with anything. There is a Starbucks in the building, and they also have a concierge level as well. The room were the same size as any other Marriott which I did not expect being in New York.

I would not hesitate recommending it to anyone.

title: Easy Access to City Centre, Close to Subway
text: Got here early and were kind enough to check us in. Comfortable room, large bathroom, pleasant staff. Walking distance to 9/11 Memorial and Liberty Island ferry. Near two subway lines 1 and R (we bought weekly passes best value to get around, $31+$1 for the card) Breakfast available from in-house restaurant or Starbucks but chose nearby Dunkin Donuts on the way to subway allowed us to eat on the run. Major sites very busy need to get there early. Free WIFI for Marriot club members (reservations made directly through them, $14.95/day otherwise, double check at front desk) Business centre available to print boarding passes for trip home. If you're crazy enough to drive down here there is a parking lot across the street too. Overall, enjoyable stay in New York.

title: Great hotel
text: Our hotel stay was great.  Location was perfect. There was so many things to do in the area. Right next to the Twin Tower memorial. You're able to walk to the Hudson River and get on the ferry to see the statue of liberty. I recommend this hotel. You'll love it.

title: Great location
text: Great location, I had a awesome view of the World Trade and the river. I was upgraded to a junior suite. This hotel is ideal for business travel because it downtown and easy to get around. Great concierge lounge, breakfast and dinner was decent. Only cons is the elevators and daily rates. The elevators are slow and the room rates are bananas. It's difficult to get a decent room rate.

title: Great location and outstanding service!
text: Walking distance to Freedom Tower and 911 Memorial this Marriott property is a great value for pleasure or business. The staff here is great and both housekeeping and the concierge were willing to respond to any request. Nice bar of lobby and an even nicer one in much more expensive "W" , around the block. Stay here , have drinks at W.

title: Un lugar tranquilo
text: El hotel está ubicado a dos cuadras de la estación del path de WTC pero se puede acceder al metro en Cortland desde ahí. La ubicación está bien para ir caminando a la Bolsa de valores y a Battery park. No hay muchos restaurantes ni bares en la zona lo que lo convierte en un lugar tranquilo y silencioso para un viaje de negocios. También se puede viajar en familia ya que el vecindario se siente tranquilo y tiene varios parques muy cerca. Obviamente el desayuno NO está incluido en la tarifa y para desayunar solamente estan, cerca al hotel, el restaurante/bar del hotel o un Burguer King. NO tiene WIFI gratis.

title: 房間舒適，地點方便
text: 是一個不錯的酒店，位置在市中心區，在那裡你感到安全和方便。房間很寬敞，安靜，很乾淨。員工很有禮貌和樂於助人。酒店很近地鐵站。雖然它不完全在旅遊點，離某些熱門地方例如時代廣場、中央公園較遠。然而，使用地鐵，這些旅遊點可以很容易到達。這裏非常接近911紀念博物館。周圍不是很多餐館。認為這將是出差​​一個很好的選擇，因為它是靠近許多商業中心。房間沒有免費無線網路。

title: Perfect!
text: We were there to site see, perfect location next too the twin towers location. Extremely welcoming and helpful staff! Clean rooms. Valet parking made getting in and out of the hotel very easy. We would definitely go there again when we visit NYC!

title: Excellent place for a short stay in New york
text: It was my first time in NY, and I found the Hotel staff very friendsly. They even offered me an loyalty card and I got free internet. The room was big and very close to the 9/11 memorial. I liked everything except the breakfast in the dinner that is inside the Hotel.

title: Standard Marriott
text: The hotel is a standard Marriott hotel. I'm a Marriott Gold member and only stayed one out of two nights booked. I moved across the street to the World Center hotel. The lobby there isn't as impressive as the Marriott's but the hotel had more soul and I got a room with a direct view of the World Trade Center memorial. Very impressive.

title: Great Hotel!!
text:
Love this Marriott. Got to City at noon but Maria at front registration desk immediately got me a beautiful room. She was lovely during my entire stay and made me feel most welcome. 

Food in Bill's, restaurant right inside hotel, is reasonably price and very high quality. Service was great and we are there several times. 

Beds were very comfortable, towels nice and big and every Marriott staff member was friendly , knowledgeable and dedicated to client satisfaction.  Since our daughter is moving to the neighborhood, we will be returning often.

title: Great Lower Manhattan Location
text: The relatively new Marriott Downtown is in a great Lower Manhattan location - close to 9/11 Memorial, Battery Park, Wall Street, multiple subway lines, Staten Island Ferry and great restaurants.  If you get a higher floor you might be able to get a view of the Statue of Liberty.  You can see it from the concierge lounge, so for Gold and Platinum members, great place for some food and views.  Deluxe rooms are good size, so would recommend the upgrade if you want a larger than typical NYC sized room.

title: Ridiculous Corner Suite View of Freedom Tower and Hudson River (check out the time from the NJ-side Colgate Clock)!)
text: To start, the view was probably the best I have experienced for the many years of traveling everywhere.  35th Floor.  Stayed here for 4 weeks.  Staff was excellent, attentive, food in the club lounge was requested specifically by our kids they wanted to go eat "lounge pasta" as their special dinner (over the local multicultural restaurants in Battery Park/Wall Street area... seriously?!).  We did lots of internet searching and ultimately went to this Marriott, hands down and didn't disappoint.  Lots to do nearby, including jogging up the running paths along the Hudson River and seeing the beauty of the Freedom Tower.  Enjoy.

title: Nice hotel and nice location
text: Room was nice and clean. Staff was friendly and helpful. It's on the southwest side of Manhattan so the higher floors have good views. Good food in the neighborhood and Bill's Bar is downstairs. Just SW about 5 blocks from the WTC complex and not far from Lady Liberty.

title: Comfortable and clean — everyday.
text:
We spent several days in this hotel. We especially appreciated the cleanliness day after day ( so far, and in other hotels of the same rank, our room was clean on day one, but then, cleanliness became relative ).
The location is a marvel in itself, far from the madding crowd of NYC, and yet within walking distance of it.
The staff is very helpful.
I do recommend it.

title: Clean, nice stay near the World Trade Center
text:
Do you want just several minutes walk to Wall St., the World Trade Center and Battery Park, among other local attractions from your hotel?  Across the street, there's an upscale mall, several restaurants along the Hudson River shore in a nice park setting and a running/walking/biking path.  Do you want a nice, clean room in a safe, full-service hotel?  This is the place.  IT also has a much-better-than-average fitness center, if that is important to you (it is to me).

I got a room for two nights as part of a travel package for a near-last minute trip to see my son's band perform on the lower East Side.  It was reasonably priced, especially considering that I booked it within two weeks of travel.

The restaurant attached to the Hotel (Bill's Burgers) is pretty good.  The staff was friendly.

I'm a Hilton Diamond Club member but I'd stay here again.

title: Great Hotel in a great location!
text: We usually stay at the Marriott Marquis at  Times Square but decided on this trip to get away from all the noise of times square.  We stayed at the Marriott Downtown while on a trip to the city and couldn't have been happier with the location, staff and the room.  We had a wonderful view of the city and water on the 36th floor.  Room was clean and front desk clerk Cheryl was so helpful.  We will stay at this location again. Easy access to all sites either walking, subway or cab.

title: Marriott back on track
text:
This hotel and staff restored my faith in the Marriott brand after real difficulties with other Marriotts on the east coast of the USA. 
Lovely welcome from Kirsten on check in - great spacious room with amazing views towards the Statue of Liberty. Great service in the lounge from all staff - sorry the only name I remember is Stacy but they were all great. Really comfy rooms - right next to 9/11 memorial , near the Statue of Liberty ferry line so away from main areas but lots to do in the immediate area and great transport links to other Manhattan sites - would recommend

title: Above-average hotel fine for a business trip.
text:
This seems like an older hotel that Marriott retro-fitted. It just doesn't have the crisp, fresh look and feel that I expect at Marriotts.

My king room was spacy enough, but the closet was very small--even having two suits hanging in there was almost too much. The safe in the closet is small as well and wasn't large enough for my Macbook Pro to fit. 

The bathroom was a good size, but the space was oddly used. The counter space was very small for the size of the bathroom. The shower is a tub with a curtain, and this is my biggest complaint. The showerhead is a detachable one that you can use as a sprayer. However, it's location on the wall was so low that I had to bend down to try and stand under it (I'm 6'1") or else it literally hit me in my neck.

But the bed was comfortable, and the room was quiet for being in downtown Manhattan. The staff was friendly as they always are at Marriotts. The location is great if you need to walk to the financial district or Brookfield Place. 

I'll likely stay here again.

title: Nice hotel for families and job
text:
This hotel has the right price/Quality rate, very clean, top personnel and reception.
It is served by a good burger restaurant and nice bar services 
Rooms have a great view on Hudson River and downtown skyline.
There is also a Starbucks coffee bar if you want a quick breakfasts 
Only strange thing they still ask for 4$ a day for a wifi in the room while in the hall at 1st floor this is for free... I am sure they will not fail if they make it free in all rooms

title: Five star Hotel at 4 star price
text: Located on West street with easy access to Statue of Liberty and subway.  World trade center memorial is just a block away. Cheaper parking across west street  on little west street. Very helpful staff.

title: Girls Trip
text: The hotel was very nice and clean. I loved the decor inside the lobby and the room. The beds were comfortable. The hotel is in a perfect location! The only fault I have is that there was no bathroom vent. The bathroom was hot and steamy after a shower. It made it hard for three women to get ready and use a mirror that's steamed up. I think there needs to be a plug receptacle in the entry of the room so someone could use a curling iron or whatever since there was a mirror on the back of the door we could use.

title: GREAT downtown location and LARGE rooms
text:
The downtown Marriott is in a very convenient location just a block or so from the World Trade Center.  Convenient to the subway, and all of downtown's attractions.  If you like shopping, you should also check out Century 21 which is just a couple of blocks away.  The service was friendly and welcoming.  The lobby is small and crowded if you want to have a conversation, however, if you take the stairs to the second level, it is quiet and much more seating areas.  The rooms are very large for New York and quite comfortable.  It was a great stay.

THANKS!

title: Ask hotel for precise directions if on foot.
text:
Please understand that the World Trade Center site is currently undergoing a lot of building redevelopment due to the tragedy of September 11 2001, so your GPS may be having issues. Also the directional signs are not exactly clear at the site and to reach the hotel itself on West Street does involve somewhat of a detour if you arrive by a tour bus in the Wall Street/World Trade Center area.

However, if you use the Rector Street Subway station it is almost behind the hotel. Also if you walk up from Battery Park it is a straight shot on West Street. 

The hotel itself does have a little shop for sundry items, and with public transport close by and a Subway (Public Transport) and a Subway (Sandwich Shop) there are cheaper options for you to eat.

Being next to the World Trade Center site, within public transport walkability and just up the road from Battery Park, location is a great advertisement for the hotel.

title: Great Location, Average Hotel
text:
When we looked for a hotel near the 911 Memorial and Museum and other lower Manhattan attractions this hotel seemed to be perfect. When we arrived the location seemed even better, with easy access to great food, attractions, subway and the harbor. 

The rooms were adequate, although the views were nonexistent. The beds were comfortable and the problem with our thermostat, which sent the overnight temperature in the room to 78 degrees, was repaired promptly the next morning. The engineer was polite and professional.

The difference between an acceptable stay and an exceptional one lies in the details. Here the air vents were dirty, the carpet was spotted and stained. Used glasses were not changed each day and the floor we were on appeared somewhat tired.

The restaurant was decent. It wasn't fine dining - and that was just fine. The food was good and the servers were attentive.

The bright spot was Carlos the bellman. Every evening he welcomed us back to the hotel. We were greeted warmly and always with a smile.

title: No pleasure to relieve the Business trip @ this place
text:
As is often to be expected in NY, hotel rooms are dated, cramped and expensive.  However, staff @ the front of house, in the restaurants, etc. usually soften the grind of a NY trip.  Unfortunately, after a week here, I feel I was in a pit of sour faced, slack-jawed, money grabbing vipers.

Housekeeping was superficial and failed to replenish the meagre tea/coffee supplies.  Towels had that off-grey colour and tired smell.

Breakfast is served in Bill's Burger Bar where you'll find stodgy tasteless fayre best suited to a late night binge after too many beers.

To top off my time here, my flight home was being delayed by bad weather, however, there was no sympathy from the front desk who wanted to charge me a couple of hundred bucks for a late check out.  Having taken eight grand off of my two colleague and I for our mediocre stay, I am motivated to take my business elsewhere.

I'd be pleasantly surprised if the management's inner response was anything other than meh, plenty more fish in this sea.

title: Good value
text: Very nice hotel, but there was only one bellman outside to handle luggage and valet services.  There were 3 people waiting for assistance.  The room was very nice, but after a hot shower there was water dripping from the ceiling,  A better exhaust is needed in the bathroom.  The hotel is close to Battery Park and 3 blocks from the 911 memorial.  No breakfast is included, but there is a mini frig and safe in the room.  $60 for parking unless you use the parking garage next door which is still $55 a night.  $20 cab ride for 4 to Times Square

title: Was Very Pleased :)
text: Never been to New York, I'm a Texas girl. So booking online for a room to a city I've never visited gave me a bit of anxiety. Especially bringing my 2 daughters along. Well, they brought me. Hotel is very nice and in a safe part of the city. Hotel staff was fantastic, except for one gentleman I spoke to on the phone about our flight being delayed and we would be arriving the following day. Our room on the 27th floor was nice, best part was seeing the Statue of Liberty right out our room window :) Great location for visiting WTC.

title: Decent hotel
text: In all, this place is decent.  It was renovated in the last decade and may need to be updated again fairly soon.    Many of the front desk staff are nice and helpful.  Mario in the concierge lounge is great; he is there at night.  On the other hand, the senior woman in the morning is not happy to be there which makes the lounge feel very different in the morning, even among other staff.  The food in the lounge in the morning seems pretty good. I think it comes from down in the restaurant below.

title: A Bunch of Sweethearts Work Here
text: The staff at this location is superb. The front desk staff had us in our room within 15 minutes of checking (I highly recommend the Marriot app, for easy check in and check out.)  Since we arrived so late, we were very hungry, so the security staff directed us to a late night store within walking distance so we could get a quick sandwich.  The housekeeping kept our room extremely clean, and were prompt with any requests.  If we needed a taxi, the bell hops were quick to get us a ride!  Such excellent service. The Marriot downtown is different in that it is a quieter area during the evening.  However, there is still plenty of activities you can walk to. There are many excellent restaurants, The Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, a very pretty waterfront within walking distance, subway, Wall Street, and some beautiful churches.  It is much less congested than Times Square area.  The only con, is you will need to get a taxi or take the subway to Uptown if you want to see a Broadway show, Empire State building, etc.  All in all we are glad we stayed at this hotel, and we highly recommend Marriot downtown for an enjoyable New York stay.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: I had to book at the last minute... literally, an hour out of the city as my original hotel was having a political convention and was impossible to get near.  I wanted to get far away from the chaos so chose the downtown area.  I booked effortlessly, arrived at the hotel to get surprised with an early check in, walked into my very refreshingly cool, CLEAN, top floor room, and had a fantastic stay.  The staff was quick, attentive, professional, and so accommodating.  We needed to request a different roll away bed for my daughter and they had an amazing alternative in under 10 minutes.  Great size room and bathroom for three people.  Great restaurant and a Starbucks in the hotel.  Fantastic, quiet location that is steps away from the 9/11 Memorial and within walking distance of Metro stations and great shopping and restaurants.  Thank you Marriott for saving our weekend!!

title: Great location
text: We checked in here for a short trip to NYC. It is a nice location, convenient to the WTC Memorial, Ellis Island and anything lower Manhattan. Great staff who were attentive to our needs. I suggest if you drive, go ahead and valet it here rather than searching round. We had a good view of the river from our room. The restaurant downstairs wasn't great for breakfast, so I suggest visiting any other place.

title: Fantastic Location!
text:
I really have no complaints about this hotel except the elevators are creaky and there was no pool! The check in service was great. Super quick. We had booked on Priceline and requested 2 double beds upon arrival which was no issue and easily accommodated.

The room was a large corner room with views of the Hudson. It was clean. The fire sprinklers were insanely dusty but everything was fine other than that.

The location and price really can't be beat. You are near subway stations, Battery Park, WTC memorial, a nice walk to the West Village or East Village, and there is also Staten Island Ferry access. The Priceline price was great for a 4 star in NYC. If we had more plans in this area of the city, we'd definitely stay here again. It was a MASSIVE (almost 40 floors, I think) hotel but it was surprisingly quiet. We didn't hear people banging around or slamming doors. You could hear the occasional emergency vehicle but nothing unexpected for the middle of a huge city!

Valet parking was $60 so we just opted to park at Icon around the corner. We found a Groupon that was about $40 instead. The guys there were great.

title: Nice room
text: Very good location downtown, the hotel is very charming and modern. Our room view was breathtaking. I will definitely go back. There wasn't a very good offer of restaurants on weekend, but we walked to the Battery Park and there were lots of restaurants and bars.

title: Excellent for the price
text:
I've only ever stayed in Midtown hotels but ended up here because the price was really good for a July weekend. I don't know if I will ever go back to Midtown because this was a great stay, especially considering the price. You can barely get a 3-star property in midtown at this price at any time of year. 

The hotel is a 3-minute walk to the 1 or the R trains at Rector St station (use the back door by the in-house Starbucks.) It takes 18-19 minutes to arrive at the 42nd St/Times Square station. 

Staff were super helpful and warm (staff in Midtown not so friendly) and the rooms were spacious and had a nice view, even if you were on one of the lower floors. If you insist on one of the really stunning views of the water, you'll want one of the highest floors. If you're more practical and want to be able to access the elevator at any time and not wait, ask for any floor below 10. Those floors have their own elevators. I never had to wait! 

Sign up for (free) Marriott Rewards at check-in to get wi-fi in your room. 

Room service however is shockingly overpriced - one of the pricier room service menus out there. 

The walls are very thin too. There was a drawn out shouting match in the room next to mine and there was no way I could go back to sleep after that noise woke me.

title: Amazing Views and Great location lower Manhattan/Jersey City
text:
The Marriott Downtown was just a couple blocks from the Path, the 9-11 Memorial.   It is also very convenient for meetings in the Financial District/Wall St and Jersey City.

My room (2814) had an amazing view of the Hudson and Ellis Island.  The room was a good size with ample seating options.   The bathroom was a bit small.

The fitness center was well equipped.  The natural light coming into the fitness center through the glass brick wall was a nice touch.  (I've seen too many dark/closed off fitness cars).

If you are considering the Marriott vs the Andaz, I've stayed in both, and recommend the Marriott Downtown as a better option.

title: Perfect spot in Battery Park
text: We had a great room with a wonderful military rate. It's literally 1 block from the 9/11 Memorial and only a few blocks to the water taxis. There is a Starbucks in lobby and a couple great restaurants in hotel and across the street. Valet is $60 a day, but this is the norm in NYC. All the staff was super nice and Wifi was comp since I'm a Elite Member. Can't wait to return!

title: Nice Hotel-Transportation limited
text: This was a very nice hotel, if you are there only on the weekdays. Although 4 subway trains service the area only one runs on the weekends and that one stops just before midnight and has waits of 20-30 minutes when it is running. We wound up taking a cab multiple times because there was just no other safe way back. If you decide to chance it, just plan on paying for a cab or making hefty hikes and waiting.

title: Muy correcto.
text:
Hotel muy bien situado en la zona financiera. Muy bien comunicado, tiene muy cerca la parada de metro Rector (100 m). 
El hotel aunque clásico, esta muy bien. Nosotros no reservamos el desayuno porque nos pareció caro 20€ x pax, a menos de 100 m por detrás del hotel hay varios sitios donde desayunar de forma más económica.

title: Perfect location
text:
Perfect location right next to world one and Wall Street. We had perfect view of Statue of Liberty and Hudson River from the room even though we didn't pay extra for Hudson view. 
Clean rooms, good beds. 
Only con is wifi which cost $15 per day. That's crazy in 2016.

title: !UN GRAN HOTEL, CON MUCHA COMIDAD EN EL CENTRO DE MANHATTAN!
text:
Estuve en este hotel 5 noches y la verdad toda la estancia fue espectacular. Desde el momento del check - in el personal es muy amable y paciente, son serviciales en todo momento. Las habitaciones son bastante comodas y amplias, las amenidades del hotel son de primera categoria. Algo que me gusto mucho fue su gran gimnasio 24 horas que ofrece fruta y agua todo el tiempo. La ubicación del hotel es perfecta pues esta a unos minutos de battery park y a una cuadra del museo del 9/11,existen comercios de todo tipo muy cercanos, la zona alrededor es bastante segura. Y si quieres ir más lejos la estación de metro más cercana se encuentra a solo 3 minutos caminandi (rector station).
LO RECOMIENDO AMPLIAMENTE.

title: Great Location and Hotel !!!
text: We stay at this hotel on the last weekend of May/2016 and we love the hotel a lot....first of all it's the location very near of Battery Park, Wall Street Bull, 9/11 Memorial and Museum, Hudson River Park, you can get the Staten Island Ferry and see the Statue of Liberty. They have restaurant, Starbucks, FedEx,Valet Parking and They sell on the front desk some snacks, drinks and etc...very expensive, I would recommend you if you like to grab a snack in the night, buy some from a Grocery Store or Pharmacy better.

title: Excelente ubicación y servicio
text: El servicio de limpieza bastante bueno, en realidad por la ubicación del hotel cualquiera pensaría que hay mucho ruido y no es así, se descansa bastante bien, y la ubicación excelente, se encuentra a solo dos calles del metro linea R y 1, por lo que te mueves perfecto a todos lados.

title: Excellent Weekend Getaway
text:
Just returned from a weekend stay at the Marriott Downtown.    It was an absolutely perfect mini vacation.  Checking in with Pamela was quick and efficient.   We were given early check in (12:15) and when we requested 4:00 pm checkout she just smiled and said "certainly".   That gave us just about another full day to do things.  We were upgraded to  a beautiful room on the 34th floor with river and Statue of Liberty views!

Marriott Members recommended  the East Side Marriott because of the activities available but this location gives you just as much to do!  If you've already visited NY and seen the Empire State Building, Rockefeller Center, St. Patrick's, et al, you will get a whole new perspective of NYC downtown!

A visit to the observation deck and restaurant at One World is alone a reason to stay here, There are fabulous restaurants and shops and entertainment at Brookfield Place at the World Financial Center.   Walking or  biking the Battery Park City promendae - day or night - is a great experience.   Take the (free) Staten Island Ferry round trip for a fantastic water tour of New York harbor.  Or take the tour and see Ellis Island as well.  There is a complimentary Downtown Shuttle with 27 stops that takes you from the World Trade Center Memorial to the South Street Seaport with historical sites along the route.  Visit lots of downtown museums. See Alexander Hamilton's and Robert Fulton's burial sites at Trinity Church.   All of these are within walking distance of the hotel.

Less than 2  miles away ($7.50 by taxi) is The Highline and the new Whitney Museum, Chelsea Market  & Arts & Craft Center (where the Food Channel Shows are taped).   Also the Highline Ballroom for great concerts and shows.

A plus -- at this NYC Marriott on weekends when the CL is closed they still give you complimentary breakfast in the restaurant.  We had our first day lunch at Bills Burger & Bar at the hotel and it was very good.

Overall an A+ experience.   We'll be back!

title: Very good value for money
text: Good, clean, nice hotel, very close to WTC. Room is not large, but very convenient. Coffee machine in the room. Sheets are nice and soft, so are the towels. Great modern gym. Friendly and most helpful staff at the front desk. No free Wifi in the room, only in the lobby.

title: Meh !
text:
As someone who stays at Marriott properties several times a year, I'll say this was one of the more underwhelming hotels. 
The location is fantastic -- right next to WTC memorial, battery park and the business district. The front desk staff was nice and courteous -- but otherwise, nothing special whatsoever !
The location was great -- apart from that the rest of the stay was very Meh... Nothing special.
They have a 4pm -- it is by far the latest check in time I have known ! and yes they managed to get us in at about 3pm but we landed in the morning after a red-eye from the west coast so would have been nice to been able to freshen up and relax a little before heading out. 
We were on level 21 and I don't know if it was specific to that level but the air con in the foyer was set to 40 degrees -- you couldn't get to the elevators or come out to get ice without freezing ! Speaking of temperature issues we set our room's thermostat at a pleasant 70 and everyday after cleaning up our room the staff kept dialing this back to sixties -- why ???
We also had no complimentary water, robes or slippers in our rooms -- something I have always taken for granted through all my other Marriott stays. 
We also had no complimentary in-room wifi -- which again as a Marriott rewards member, this is a first ! I was told I had to have booked though the Marriott app -- then maybe the prices there should match prices on other 3rd party site -- if not I am just paying for the wifi then right ? --  so overall the experience was super average -- Especially because I've stayed at similarly rated properties in NY before that have checked all of these boxes.

title: South Manhattan close to the One World Observatory
text: Lovely lobby and restaurant downstairs ---big room with decent furnishing and set up ---lotsa curtain which could be pulled aside for amazing views ----not much help in terms of service ---difficult to park etc but side lane has parking ---

title: Fantastic location - great service - stay here!!
text:
As other reviews state, the hotel is in an amazing location, very close to the 9/11 memorial, Wall Street, Trinity Church, and near multiple subway stations.  There is a Starbucks in the lobby - super convenient - and a restaurant (that we didn't try, but it looked good).

The service was wonderful.  We checked in very early, and asked for a nice room.  We do that everywhere, and it usually gets us nothing much.  In this case, however, Nicole gave us a room on the 36th floor with an amazing view of the Statue of Liberty.  

The room was clean, great bathroom and shower too.  The only very minor complaint is that the beds are a little small.  But, no big deal at all.

We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

title: Convenient location, great service
text:
We chose this hotel for a ladies weekend mainly because of its location and the rate we got. The hotel was simple to get to as it's on the west-side highway, meaning you don't have to drive through the congested city streets when coming from the north. Valet parking ($60) wasn't cheap, but it was hassle-free.
We arrived at about 1 p.m. on a Saturday and were able to get into our room (we had requested early check-in on our reservation through the Marriott site). We were a party of four women, and the front desk did a great job of locating a big corner room with two double beds that gave us plenty of space. The room (#908) had three big windows on two sides, and while the view wasn't as great as it would have been on a higher floor, it was fine given the size of the room. The beds were very comfortable, and there was also a nice club chair with an ottoman. The bathroom was fairly roomy, especially for NYC. Housekeeping quickly sent us a extra towels when requested. The room also had a safe and a refrigerator, which was big enough to hold a 2-liter bottle laying down front-to-back. Overall the room was very clean, and we are somewhat picky in that department when it comes to hotels.
We chose the location mainly because of its proximity to the Twin Towers reflecting pools (a block away), Battery Park and the Brooklyn Bridge. All were in very easy walking distance. We also wanted to walk the High Line, which was a couple miles north. We took a cab there (just $10), and walked back. The concierge was very helpful with directions, and gave us maps and coupons (Century 21 store). 
We had dinner in the hotel at Bill's Burger Bar; the service was excellent and the food was average at best. We walked to the Loopy Doopy rooftop bar, which offered nice views but was very small and obscenely priced ($20/drink). We liked the nearby O'Hara's bar much better (Deann the bartender was great), as well as the Living Room in the W Hotel. 
As for wifi, it was complementary as we are Marriott Rewards members; otherwise you pay. It was fast and offered a solid connection.
We booked a couple months in advance and were able to get a very good rate, making the overall value excellent.

title: Great hotel, very comfortable beds, AC worked well
text:
We were in Manhattan to celebrate our 26th wedding anniversary.  We were greeted by a very friendly front desk.  We were very happy with the room size.  Anyone who has stayed in Manhattan knows that small rooms are the norm.  This room has a king size bed plus a padded chair and  ottomon/footstool. 

The bathroom allowed for both of us to be in there at the same time, although tightly.  Again, anyone who has stayed in Manhattan knows that some hotel bathrooms do not have enough room to permit this. 

The bed was comfortable (padded top).  I am not a fan of padded tops as they are sometimes used to hide the fact that the mattress is failing.  However, that was not the case.  Very good mattress and pad.

The AC worked very well.  The room was kept at 69 degrees with no problem. 

The elevators were responsive as well.  We were on the 36th floor?, and we never had to wait longer than a 1-2 minutes.  Again, some hotels in Manhattan, this is not normal. 5 minute waits can occur in some of the taller hotels.

If we go back to visit and stay in the Financial District, we will stay here again. The only knock you can give the hotel is that it is located 20 minutes via subway from Times Square and Central Park.  If you do alot of things in the Financial District (Statue of Liberty, Stanton Island, Brooklyn Bridge, Stock Exchange, World Trade Center) this is an outstanding location.

title: Financial District
text:
I have just returned from a four night stay at this location.  
The hotel is very clean and located very close to the subway line convenient for getting around the city.  The room is spacious for New York.  We had a room on the 28th floor facing the  Statue of Liberty which allowed a great view of the Fourth of July fireworks.
The location is very quiet at night for sleeping.  There is free internet in the lobby but found it to be spotty.  In this area surprised there was not free internet, having stayed at many other hotels and always having access for free.
The lobby has a Bills Burger which was great for happy hour after being out all day.
I encountered two issues on the last day, first I had forgotten something in the closet after we checked out.  When I realized I asked at the front desk if there was any way to retrieve them.  They spoke with housekeeping and the room had not yet been cleaned.  I was informed that the only way to get in was with security, which I understand, but there was nobody in the building.  Having a flight to catch had to leave.
When exiting we were asked by a bellman if we needed a cab, which we did.  He said he would get us one.  After a couple of empty cabs passed by he was making no attempt to hail them.  But I did notice he was on his phone.  A couple of minutes later a black SUV pulled up, he told us he could take us to the airport for $50 flat rate.  We got in and left the hotel, on the ride we were enquiring if he was a limo or an Uber but never did get a straight answer.  Don't know if this a common practice but we were a little uncomfortable being two women alone!  Other than these issues was a great time!

title: Absolutely spectacular in every way!
text: Our stay at the New York Marriot Downtown was simply perfect from start to finish!  I went with my daughter and my sister for a first ever girls' getaway to the Big Apple! I can honestly say we were treated like royalty at this hotel.  Everyone from the doormen to the front desk workers were professional, helpful and courteous.  They went above and beyond to make sure we were taken care of. They greeted us with a smile and did everything possible to accommodate us with our extremely early check in. The general manager, Joe Dembeck, is a manger extraordinaire!  The New York Marriot is very lucky to have him.  They don't make general managers like that anymore.  Because of his special touch and personal attention, I will never, ever, stay anywhere else when I am in NYC.  I recommend this hotel to anyone, without any reservation!  Merci beaucoup, Joe!!  You made three Canadian girls very happy!

title: Comfortable Stay
text: I have visited New York several times, and this was by far the best hotel that I have stayed in. The beds were very comfortable with the softest sheets that I have ever slept on. The shower was also nice. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Proximity to the 9/11 memorial and Battery Park were also a plus. The subway station to uptown is also within a 5 minute walk.

title: 4th of July weekend
text: I wanted to take my son on a nice trip before he started his senior year of school. We had a wonderful time and this Marriott did not disappoint. From an early check into the perfect view from room 3401 . Bed was comfortable and the halls where quiet . I will definitely stay here again as it was very convenient to the Subway and George 's. Thank You Marriott for our Outstanding stay.

title: Nickels and dimes you to death
text:
Nice Hotel, but nothing terribly special. Unfortunately, nickels and dimes you to death. Want wifi? Charge for that if you're not a rewards member. Need to print something? Charge for that at FedEx Office. Want breakfast? Not included. 

Bills Burger is a pretty good restaurant. Again, nothing terribly special. 

I do have to say though, the front desk staff was absolutely fantastic, and helped solve a couple of big problems that had nothing to do with our stay. And the cookies they gave out were pretty great too.

title: Great relaxed location
text: We got a family room for 4 of us and there was no floor space left, but we did have a view of the statue of liberty. Hotel was just a short walk from Battery Park and was so much more peaceful than being up in Time Square. Not a great hotel if you are looking for fine dining to go with it. Breakfast was ok and the kids loved the burgers but that was about it.

title: Simply Outstanding
text:
Fabulous property, location and staff!  Room was impeccably maintained, spacious and offered spectacular views of the Hudson River.  A special thank you to Aileen Galazin for securing such a lovely room for me.  Also, a special thank you to Mario, "King of the Concierge Lounge" who was most gracious and welcoming.

Look forward to visiting again while on business.

title: Great location
text: Near subway lines; next to battery park; easy access to the ferries to liberty and Ellis islands; very close to wall at and nyse buildings; and most importantly walking distance to the 9/11 memorial. The staff is very friendly.  Starbucks in the facility.

title: Does the job
text: Stayed for two weeks for a mixture of work and holiday.  I would probably ask for a higher floor if I was going back but the view wasn't bad from the 14th.  Everywhere was clean, light, well maintained, although the bathroom could have done with a refurb as the paint was peeling and the air con was great.  The staff were fantastic and ever so welcoming and helpful throughout.  Service in the restaurant was pretty slow and some of the food wasn't brilliant.  The gym would have benefitted from showers so you don't have to wander around the hotel sweaty.  It would benefit from something to make it a little more distinctive such as a pool or a nice place to sit and have coffee or a bar on the top floor but if you need somewhere close to the financial district then I would recommend it but I would definitely get breakfast elsewhere.

title: Razoavel
text: O hotel eh bom, perto do marco 0 da cidade e perto do porto..... O atendimento dos recepcionistas deixa um pouco a desejar.... Eu prefiro ficar um pouco mais perto da Broadway, pois fica meio distante.... Os quartos são bons e o wifi funciona bem!!!

title: Really nice hotel, great location
text:
We stayed here on the 32nd floor
 This place is really nice.. they were very helpful with directions and helping us to get anywhere we wanted to go. There is a restaurant in the hotel Bills,.... Make sure you try the chocolate cake!! They room was very clean and was fully stocked with coffee and toilitries... it is literally within walking distance to 9/11 memorial.. and has a Starbucks on first floor...

title: Muy bueno
text:
El hotel está a 1 cuadra de donde estaban las torres gemelas.
A mano de todo. Subte cerca.
El hotel en sí muy bien. Tiene desayuno.
Las habitaciones son cómodas amplias y limpias. Cama cómoda.
El desayuno no es all you can eat. Te lo sirven en la mesa y te dan a elegir un par de opciones. La porción es más que suficiente. Y la atención no es tan buena.
El staff de front desk muy bien, atento.
En recepción NO hay café te agua.
Lo recomiendo.

title: Very poor customer service
text: Room was great, but the customer service was really bad.  The front desk person was so rude when we asked for help, not once but twice.  When we asked for help to get a taxi from the hotel to the airport, we were told that was our problem and were given the number for the taxi service.  The two people that I am referring to should not be in the hotel customer service industry.  We finally avoided the lady at the front desk and asked someone to help us.

title: Great location and concierge lounge
text: I have stayed here over 20 times this year. Great location in downtown NY. If you are a platinum member the lounge offers some of the best views in lower Manhattan. The staff are very helpful. Close to the 1,2 and 3 lines. Also close to the 911 memorial.

title: Chef reception on June 21, 2016
text: Executive Chef Edward Paschall is an amazing Chef.  He sponsored an Asian Fusion Chef's reception on June 21 in the concierge lounge and it was AMAZING.   As he personally explained what he had prepared my mouth was watering and when I loaded my plate to maximum capasity it did not let me down.  Everything as sooo flavorful  I wish every night was Chef's reception night.  Thank you Chef Pasch.

title: Loved it!
text: Harbor view room, Statue of Liberty, great restaurant and pub on site. Walking distance to Battery Park, 1/2 block from WTC. Helpful and friendly staff. Bring comfortable walking shoes, plenty to see and do.

title: NYC downtown
text:
Wonderful location to explore south area of Manhattan e.g little Italy, soho...

Very close to Brooklyn bridge, 9/11 museum, Brookfield place (it has great architecture, wonderful sea view, nice restaurant & fashion brands).

Not very crowded comparing to time square area.

Room was clean, employees were very friendly, Internet is free in lobby for everyone & in room only for Marriott members (fast internet cost approx 14$ per day), no complementary water in the room.

Didn't try their restaurant, there is Starbucks shop in the hotel & a lot of restaurants besides it.

Overall I like it and would love to stay there again.

title: Good location and nice hotel
text: I stayed here while on a bus trip with a group.  We stayed 2 nights and we were pleased.  The hotel was in a good location for walking and for getting to public transportation.  We had 4 women in our room so we always need more space but we did fine.  We also ate at Billy's in the hotel for dinner and for breakfast and were pleased there also.

title: Great Service
text: I sent my son here because he wanted to propose to his girlfriend.  They treated both of them great.  I was able to use my points too which is always a plus.  Walking distance to everywhere - fun city to be in and wonderful hotel to relax in.

title: Once again a great hotel!
text: This hotel is so close to everything everyone this so kind from the bell boy to the maids, great location close to a mall subway stations, sighseeing, giftshops its the best experience of Downtown New York

title: True disappointment
text:
I don't know why people vote 5 star for this place? Haven't you seen a 5 star rated hotel before?

- Mini fridge was totally empty 
- Not enough supply of shampoo, conditioner etc in bathroom
- No ramp access to lobby for a stroller or wheelchair
- Mini elevator in lobby was always occupied with luggage carts (come on!)
- And best of all valley took 45 min to bring my car. 

These are the first 5 things I remember about this place. True disappointment for the money I paid. 

I gave 2 star for staff only. They were really polite and helpful, except valley!

title: グラウンドゼロ、ウォール街のすぐ近く
text:
ロウアーマンハッタンの好立地。WTC、ウォール街のどちらへも徒歩５分以内。ハドソン川も窓から見える。複数の地下鉄駅が近くにあり、ミッドタウンに出るのもとっても便利。夜遅くにエンパイアステートビルからタクシーを使いましたが、メーター料金は２０ドルでした。
ホテル内のレストランBill's（bill'sではありません）は味、サービスともイマイチでした。
地下鉄駅へ行く途中に、中国系の小さな食料品店、トリニティ教会の向かいにスーパーがあり、買い物には不自由しません。

title: Great Location
text:
The hotel is very clean with great view looking at the Hudson River. Walking distant to Wall Street, Financial District, 9/11 Memorial and Museum and World Trade Center. Hotel staffs are friendly and polite. 

The food at Bill's Bar and Burger located at the hotel is good and convenient after long hours of working without having to think where to go for dinner!

title: Muy bueno
text: Estuve para pasar 3 días en nyc! Y debo reconocer que al principio no quería alojarme ahí pero la verdad excelente ubicación tiene líneas de metro cerca, y es un marriot con todos los servicios necesarios me encanto! Se aleja un poco de lo que el ruido de times square.

title: Great location, clean and helpful friendly staff.
text: Stayed here for 4days, great location, Wall Street behind, Hudson River two blocks in front, ground zero a block away and battery park 3blocks down.  Hotel very comfortable and restaurant good. Very helpful staff.

title: Another great visit to the Big Apple!
text: I don't really care to be right in the center of things ... staying here is a bit quieter, easier to access and just a slice of NYC living when I walk to catch the subway. Nice location, pleasant and helpful staff. I will stay here again.

title: Around the corner from the 911 Memorial and 2 blocks from the subway
text: Great hotel in the downtown of NYC.  Close to the 911 Memorial, Financial District, and wharf.  2 blocks from the subway and good neighborhood for markets and places to grab a bit.  George's Deli is 2 blocks and great for any meal or just a snack.  Staff very helpful and rooms large and comfortable.  Great value for this hotel in NYC.  Chocolate chip cookies are offered in the afternoon which are killers.

title: Great hotel choice in NYC!
text: Stayed at this hotel on business weekly for almost 8 months and cannot say enough about the staff and amenities. The location is great (close to many subway lines, Wall Street, any of the ferries), it's within a short walking distance of everything in the Financial District, and the views from the rooms are amazing. Skip staying in the crowded Times Square area and stay at the NY Marriott Downtown for an amazing experience!

title: Great location - near One World Trade Center
text: We had a great weekend stay here and loved the location!  Short walk to the 911 Memorial area and also to Battery Park.  Overall the hotel was well kept, good size rooms and friendly staff. Having stayed in many Marriotts before, we did find the beds not to be the quality we are used to ... seems they should be due for a update.  We accessed the Concierge Club during the week and found the ladies working there to be friendly and personable

title: Large rooms, beautiful views for many rooms and accommodating staff.
text:
Great location next to WTC site, Battery Park City, bike trail, and ferries to Statue of Liberty and Staten Island and subway lines to Brooklyn and Uptown Manhattan.
Oversized rooms for Manhattan but only one chair to share...also,  wear sunglasses in elevators...garish photos of taxis hurt the eyes...newly innovated fitness center with new equipment.  Very accommodating staff.
Room costs vary according to season from under $200 to over $300...avoid high season rates if you are on a budget.

title: NYC financial district hotel
text: This hotel is terrific - rooms are plenty big for 3. The gym was excellent! Clean, well equipped with new machines and treadmills.  Convenient for financial district, Battery Park, food, etc. Clean, comfortable, excellent service. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Aside from very thin walls, a great hotel in NYC.
text: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights while we toured NYC.  The room was bright, clean, very spacious for New York, and the shower was amazing (great water pressure).  We also upgraded to the Statue of Liberty room, which was really cool!  The bed was very comfortable - probably the best sleep we have both had on our travels, which is so important when you're out exploring all day on your feet.  Unfortunately, the walls are insanely thin and you can hear everything in the adjacent rooms.  After a sleepless night with multiple calls to security re: the loud teenagers next-door, we switched rooms and the front desk staff were very helpful.  It didn't help though - we found ourselves next to another loud group the following night.  Either way, we'd probably take our chances and stay here again.  Good location and the comfortable room made all the difference.

title: Downtown hotel delivers the expected Marriott stay which is a good thing
text:
I typically stay at Marriott when I travel for business. This hotel delivered what I expect when I stay: clean, updated, fast and courteous service. I will stay at this hotel whenever I have business in downtown. 

This is not a five star experience. It is however a reliable place to use a base of operations in downtown. Right next to WTC. Plenty of food options nearby (it is NYC).

The rate isn't the most important thing to me, but in this case the rate was pretty reasonable for NYC.

title: Comfortable Room in Downtown
text:
I had a nice room on the 32nd floor and as a Marriott Rewards Gold Member had access to the Concierge Lounge.  It was nice to have full hot breakfast before heading out for the day and appetizers before heading out for dinner.  Service in the lounge was friendly.

My room overlooked the 9-11 Memorial.  If you are on the other side of the building, you'll have water views.  The room was comfortable, but showing it age.  I always appreciate having a refrigerator in the room, a nice iron and plenty of hangers to hang up my dress shirts and jackets.  

I usually request a room on a high floor away from the elevators.  My room was next to the elevators.  I never head the elevators and the room was very quiet.

The hotel is an easy walk to Battery Park, 9-11 Memorial, Staten Island Ferry and other downtown attractions.

title: Manhattan comme on l'aime !
text:
séjour à la hauteur de nos esperances, chambre super confortable, propreté indiscutable, service de chambre top et personnel de l'hotel très accueillant. 
Notre chambre était au 16 étages, la vue sublime et le lit kingsize très appréciable. bien situé, il offre pas mal de magasin et activités. le soir en taxi, direction Soho et little italie pour faire la fête

title: NYC Wedding
text: Arrived at Hotel mid-afternoon for an evening wedding.  Hotel is a bit difficult to reach since it is on the North side of West Street, which is part of the West Side Highway.  I arrived in the city through the Holland which is North of the Hotel.  If you plan on seeing the  9/11 Museum from out town this is the hotel you want to stay at.  We had a king bed room on the 36 floor.  View out the window was partially obstructed.  We could see the  Statue of Liberty before the sun went down.  The room was very nice. Bed was very comfortable and elevators were very fast.  Breakfast buffet at the hotel was very good.  Price was fixed for us because of the wedding we were attending. Valet parking was expensive for over night parking. Parking cost $60.00, but it was not much cheaper across the street at the Icon garage.  There you had to handle your own luggage.  A very nice hotel to stay in NYC if you are seeing the sights downtown including Wall Street.

title: Room with a view
text: This Marriott is located on the border of the Financial District and Battery Park City. We were given a room on the 32nd floor with a breathtaking view of the river. I could have stayed in the room just to enjoy the view but there is so much to do around the hotel you need to explore. There is a great bagel place across from the hotel for breakfast. Brookfield Center is also very close and offers a variety of activities and shopping options. The room was nicely decorated with comfortable linens and pillows. Also the rates are very competitive compared to midtown hotels. You have subway access to other parts of the city. We would definitely return.

title: Great location for Statue of Liberty
text: The hotel was very clean comfortable beds and great location ! The Star Bucks that is in the hotel has great coffee! Walking distance to charging bull and stock market building. Also walking distance to the ferry for Lady Liberty  and Ellis island. Battery park is a great place for picture taking and just taking a nice walk. Would recommend this hotel and might return soon in the Fall! 😄

title: Very nice!
text: We stayed at the Marriott New York Down Town for five nights while we toured the sights, tried new foods, visited with friends and reconnected as a couple. The staff was very nice, the hotel was clean and pleasant and we felt a good deal for the price. We had a beautiful view of the Statue of Liberty from our window. Every employee was helpful and answered our many questions about the subways, buses, and directions and recommendations. The location was central to many good subway routes and we will definitely stay here again!

title: Room was clean
text: In the city for just one night attending a wedding nearby. Please note you need to call several times ahead of arrival if you need an early check in. Did not dine at the hotel. Our room was clean and comfortable. Plan on paying for parking. Our room  did not have a good view, but overall was good for our needs. A clean place to stay and Checked out in the morning. Stayed here due to bride had rooms blocked off for bridal guests.

title: Second time is the charm
text:
So, my first visit was mixed.  I have to really give the management (or my awareness) a shout since everything has changed.  From my seamless and personal check-in with Kristen to a great nightcap with Steven at Bill's, this visit has been great!

Pros:  location, prices, and this time SERVICE!!!

Cons:  none this trip.

If you were swayed by my previous review, read this one and think of choosing the NY Marriott Downtown for your next trip to NYC.  You'll be glad you did.

title: Good view
text: Went for Americas cup trials .requested a water view which was very good. Restaurant was bills burgers. Would have preferred a different type of restaurant.service at bills was not that good. Hotel staff good

title: Good.
text: Location next to 911 Memorial might give You a little eerie feeling when You lay down in the bed and begin to visualize what did happen here. Close to lower Manhattan attractions, nice promenade on the side of the river.Rooms all right, experienced personnel. Noisy neighborhood - welcome to NYC.

title: Not Going Back
text: I suppose I should be lenient because we arrived at 2pm on a busy Friday but I was incredibly frustrated with the long wait to get a room. Especially because there was a 4:45 engagement in mid town I had to get ready for. And as I tried to raise the urgency with front desk they treated me like an inconvenience. When we finally gor in the room around 3:20 it took another 30 minutes for the bellman to get our bags there, only after two calls of complaint. The first impression really soured the whole experience. I'll skip this hotel next time.

title: Great location and great view
text: My daughter and I stayed here for nine nights while we were in town for a ballet competition.  Our room was on the 30th floor and had a view of the Statue of Liberty -- what a great welcome to New York!  The location is fantastic.  We had events at NYU and in Brooklyn, and we were able to get to both places quickly by subway.  We were just a few blocks away from the 1, 4/5 and R trains.  Also just a couple of blocks from the 9/11 Memorial, the Freedom Tower, and the Battery.  Our housekeeper was very pleasant and helpful.  We spilled some rice on the carpet, and she came quickly to vacuum it up when we called.  My only complaints are that the beds were a little soft, and there was no fan in the bathroom, so the room stayed stuffy after showers.  Also, WiFi is not free in the room unless you have preferred status with Marriott.

title: The best hotel I've ever stayed at in NYC!
text: I usually stay in Times Square but this time I wanted to be closer to Brooklyn since that was the purpose of my trip. I booked a junior corner suite for myself and one also for my parents. Check in was super easy since I did it on my mobile app and just had to pick up my keys. Very friendly front desk gal who helped switch my room with my parents since they didn't want such a high floor - and I did. I had room 3315 and let me tell you, I almost gasped when I looked out of the window for the first time and saw that the Freedom Tower was RIGHT THERE. My other window (corner suites have two walls of windows) had was a full view of the Hudson River. Seriously impressive views! I actually slept with the curtains open all night because I could stare at the Freedom tower the whole time. I don't care if anyone saw me - ha! My dad has a hard time walking but he was able to handle the 5 minute walk to the 9/11 Memorial/reflection pools and museum. It's literally around the corner from this hotel and it's a must-see. The restaurant inside of the hotel is also good/casual fare (burgers, etc) and good for catching a drink in the evening. I had to go to the front desk for a couple of things I needed and everyone was always very nice and professional and one even asked me if I wanted a cookie as I walked away. Why yes I do! Check out was easy too, they slipped a receipt under my door before 5am. It would be really hard to get me to stay anywhere else next time. This is my absolute new fave for NYC.

title: Boa oportunidade
text: Como nos dias próximos ao Natal e final de ano os negócios acalmam no centro financeiro de NY, o valor da diária fica bem mais barato e o hotel tem excelentes quartos e fica a duas quadras de estação de metrô e da loja 21st Century e também logo ao lado do memorial do 11 de setembro.

title: Perfect location, clean room, incredible staff
text: This review would have been 5 stars however the dining in the hotel was pretty horrible. We actually did not even eat our breakfast it was so terrible. The hotel itself is right next to the bike path, world trade center, and central walking to numerous restaurants. The staff is exceptional and helped us with booking our statue of liberty tour and tour of Ellis Island. The room was exceptional and quite large for a NYC hotel. We had a river view and stayed on the 22nd floor and it was beautiful.  We would absolutely stay at this Marriott again.

title: Good quality and location
text: This hotel provides very good service. It's location is very convenient for almost all activities. Room ammenities are good and the bed quality is great.  Definitely recommend, unless you are looking for budget accommodation.

title: Overall good
text: Great location, this hotel is not glamorous like other hotels in NY. It's clean, practical and affordable. The staff was friendly, the bedding was very comfortable, and the amenities a good quality. Perfect for a business hotel (which my stay was). Very much like all other Marriott properties, I thought it was worth the money and would stay here again. The location to the One World Observatory, 9/11 Memorial, Wall Street, and Brookfield Place was terrific.

title: Nice location in Financial District
text:
I travel here regularly for work and I've consistently had a good experience with this Marriott property. The rooms and beds are comfortable and typical Marriott if you're familiar with the comforts of the brand. The lounge at the top floor for elite members is a little small compared to other lounges but it meets the need and it's generally well-appointed.

Overall I'd definitely recommend this hotel, particularly if you face the water/Statue of Liberty.

title: Good deal
text: This hotel is a good price for NYC. Close to West Side Highway running path and WTC. Lots of group trips in the hotel so always lots going on (not good for a quiet weekend!) but great for the price/location

title: Great business hotel.
text: location was excellent. A walking distance to World Trade Center, Wall Street, and metro stations. Staffs were welcoming, accommodating, and efficient.  The junior suite with a king size sofa bed was very spacious and decorated elegantly.

title: Disappointed
text:
We arrived on a Friday night and stayed for a weekend.  The room was good.  We had a corner room with a river view and a street view.  We also had an area with a sofa and chairs.  The bathroom was decent but I've been to other Marriott's with nicer accommodations. What I was more disappointed in was the price for what you got.  I also wasn't crazy about the service.  I felt like I was imposing.  The lobby of this Marriott has very few chairs so when we were waiting for our friends, we had to stand most of the time. Also the free Wifi.....we couldn't connect to it and when we asked at the front desk, we were told we had to go to the Marriott site, check in then do something else, etc.......My friend tried what they suggested and that didn't work either.  

Another problem we had with this hotel was their breakfast.  We paid to have breakfast as part of our room bill.  When we went to have breakfast there were only certain things you could have.  Other Marriott's give you a buffet breakfast.  There was no buffet at this hotel. 

The hotel is within walking distance of the World Trade Center, which we did walk to.  Everywhere else we went, we took a cab.   

This is the first time that I've been to a Marriott and was so disappointed.  I don't know if it's because this one is located in New York that you just get less but I know that I won't be staying at this particular Marriott in the future.

title: New York City weekend
text: Spent the weekend in NYC with girlfriends. Hotel was very nice. Spacious rooms with great amenities available. Located downtown away from a lot of the noise of sirens and such. Still located near attractions and tourist activities, especially the 9/11 memorial. The staff was very nice and even brought us more towels when we asked. The only thing I would suggest is that the mini-fridge be colder.

title: Nice location
text: Nice hotel in a nice location. World trade centre memorial very close. Staff is very accommodating and Bills Burger and Starbucks is onsite.  The gym is better then average for a hotel gym. Will visit this hotel again on my next visit to New York City.

title: Lady Liberty visible from my room!
text:
Had a very good stay at this Marriott. I travel to NYC and have never stayed in this area, downtown. My room was on the 35th floor and was elated to open my curtains and see the Statue of Liberty. The location is a skip away from battery park and also the meat packing district. There is also a bike an walking path across the street along the West Side Highway. 

I ate a cool little spot a half block away, the St George Tavern. It is a historic bar in a church built in 1812 and also has tasty food. 

There is a Starbucks in the hotel and a restaurant called Bill's Bar. 

The staff and room were very good as well. I would recommend this hotel.

title: Comfort, convenient and clean
text: We stayed here on a tour bus trip.  Loved the hotel. Just a block from One World Trade Center. Lots of places to eat. 0.2 miles from Rector St. subway station.  The hotel employees are helpful with directions. There is not a free complimentary breakfast,  it who needs that with all the food trucks and delis close by.  We saw Elliot Gould in the lobby! How cool! The rooms are larger than most in NYC....high recommend.

title: Trip to New York
text:
We were visiting the city for my goddaughter's performance in YGP for formal and contemporary ballet. The conference recommended this hotel. The hotel was very accommodating. Though we didn't have a great view, they put us in one of the newly renovated rooms.  There was a mishap with cleanliness(someone left a hairbrush in the room on the floor). That told me that the housekeeping staff did not do a thorough job. But overall, the staff was pleasant and gave me 5000 points for their error. 

So did a good job.

title: Very nice room and location
text:
My husband and I spent 6 night at this hotel sometime ago. I particularly liked the room. The bed was very comfortable and clean. Great job to housekeeping department.
The location was good too close to some famous sites, right across from the World trade center and close to the Brooklyn bridge.
Loved the view from the executive lounge even though it was a very small lounge. I particularly liked how organised the hostess station in the lounge was. The executive lounge staffs even had business cards.
The Bill's burger restaurant downstairs in the lobby area was a disappointment. We had breakfast there one morning and wasn't impressed.
Overall an ok experience so I would recommend the hotel to friends.

title: Comfortable in the Concrete Jungle
text: The hotel is walking distance to One World Center, as well as to Battery Park where we picked up the ferry to tour Liberty Island and Ellis Island. Took advantage of the Member Rates and upgraded our room to the Junior Suite; great idea, it worked perfectly for my family.  We were comfortable, had space, and the corner room was a nice touch.  The staff from the valet, to the front desk, to the housekeeper were warm and friendly, quick to offer a helping hand.  Having never hailed a cab before, they were quick to assist (that's an experience in itself!).  The only negative I have for this particular hotel is the restaurant within, Bill's Bar & Burgers.  A very discouraging experience, with disorganized staff.  I'll spend my food $$$ elsewhere next time I visit, but I will definitely stay in this facility again.
