title: Laid Back Marriott with Nice Staff
text: I was there over a weekend and the place wasn't too busy - which is nice. When checking in the, staff was very friendly and it was a great welcome. I was a little disappointed about the room - the rooms need an upgrade. The bathrooms are actually nicer and newer looking than the bedroom , which is good. All the fixtures etc... must have been recently updated. The breakfast on weekends is kinda odd. It is a burger place in the back, which is connected to the hotel. This is a good quality breakfast - but Motel style with bare bone continental breakfast included. The service at the burger place is ok - but it is bare bone as well - has nothing to do with a luxurious hotel The hotel bar is a little better..but still the kitchen is the same burger place as in the back. I noticed that other hotels in the immediate vicinity are using the same concept. A standalone bar/restaurant is accessible from inside the hotel and used for breakfast etc... Interesting. I just think that a burger place is not a good fit for a full service Marriott..which is supposed to be a little bit more sophisticated and luxurious. Other than that no complaints..

title: Convenient, Clean, Efficient and Friendly
text: Stayed here for business and once again found it to be a decent deal, nice rooms, some with view of Statue of Liberty. Really nice access to Battery Park for walking and Running. Restaurants nearby.  Rooms are clean and front desk was well organized even though very busy. The whole experience was really the way you want to see a busy business hotel run. The executive lounge on the 38th floor has incredible views of Lady Liberty but is a bit small for the number of people who can access it. Otherwise, this is a pleasant place to stay when I have business in NYC.

title: Marriott in the Financial District Good Hotel by 911 Site
text:
Hotel was booked for me by business team.  Good location for business in the FI DI.  Rates very reasonable for weekends as this hotel is mainly M-F for business travelers.

Subway 2 block walk behind hotel.  Also, grocery store near subway entrance has anything you need including fresh fruit.

Ordered room service a couple of times and was pleased with service and quality of food.  Also visited top floor executive lounge for rewards members.  Complementary food but cash bar for wine, beer and drinks.

Hotel is 1/2 Block from 911 site and new WTC tower.  Area is quite at night as the FI DI becomes void of workers after 6pm.  There are some places to eat by the shopping mall 2 blocks north and west at Vessy and West.

title: jamais déçu dans un Marriot
text: hôtel propre, "carré", standard, bien situé; service rapide, standards américains; room service excellent.  Restaurant correct; executive suite relativement grande, pratique, excellente isolation sonore (vous ne subirez pas les voisins fêtards); parfait pour se reposer entre deux réunions.

title: Downtown NYC Hotel
text:
Hotel is 5 min walk from Ground Zero and ideally situated to explore the south of the city.  Had a king size room, which was a good size for NYC.  Busy hotel for business and holiday-makers alike but very clean and a lovely comfy bed too.  Our room-maid and the doormen were always friendly.  Room had a safe.

They have a Starbucks on the ground floor and a Bills Burger Bar restaurant and separate bar as well.  I have always loved Bills and whilst we ate in the restaurant, the night we ate in the bar, not all the food arrived hot and we both ended up with an upset stomach.  The barman that night was more interested in dealing with the businessmen sitting at the bar and whilst I would normally complain, we were both very hungry after being out all day - there can be no excuse for food arriving cold.

If you use the wi-if in the lobby, it's is free, but use it in your room And it is $14.99 a day.  In this day and age, this should be free of charge but it is obviously a big money earner for the hotel.  I think if the daily cost was lower, more people would go for it.

title: Great room let down by staff at breakfast
text: As a platinum member living in a 5 Starr Marriott for well over a year, I really was looking forward to a break in New York and decided to stay in downtown Marriott for a week from Friday 8th April. The room was great as expected but what really surprised me was the breakfast experience. As it was the weekend the lounge was closed so I was given a voucher for the breakfast. I went for breakfast early Saturday and once I produced the voucher, I felt second class... I asked for tea to warm up and was brought hot water in a cup, 7 minutes later the tea bag arrived. The cereal came and when I asked for a spoon I was told to use the tea spoon I had. When I suggested that a teaspoon was not appropriate the lady who served me marched off...5 minutes later I asked again for milk for the tea and cereal...I really am disappointed. Not what I expect from a Marriott. I can't wait for the lounge to open.

title: Very nice staff but mediocre Marriott
text:
This property is just ok and not up to Marriott standards. The hotel itself could use updating. It is traditional Marriott circa 2000. 

This stay was more disappointing due to the hairs on the bed. Nasty. 

Restaurant is beer and burger joint which seems a bit awkward for a Marriott. 

The fitness center however is new and excellent.

title: Business Trip
text: I stayed there  a couple of nights for business meetings; it is an older property and the room reflects that.  On 17th floor, but could still hear sirens/cars at night.  Nice but not modern.  The staff was pleasant and helpful.  The restaurant is a sports bar but there are plenty of good, higher priced places within walking distance.

title: Great location!
text:
First time staying here...got a really great deal while a friend was visiting from overseas and we did a staycation. Ideal location - near touristy & non-touristy stuff. Easy to get to Tribeca, Meatpacking and Brooklyn. 

Pros 
- decent size rooms (for NY standards)
- quick check-in
- easy access to trains
- amazing chocolate chip cookies in the afternoon/evening (made in-house)
- access to Starbucks and Bill's Bar & Burger from the lobby 
- Morton's located across the street (HH weekdays 4-6:30pm)

Cons
- Lobby area isn't huge and seating area gets filled up quickly 
- When we checked in only ADA room was available - the shower was not great for anyone over 5'8" (and not truly ADA friendly since it also has a bathtub)
- Staff is very efficient but not friendly compared to some other hotels in the city

Great experience overall. I would stay here again based on the location and size of the rooms. Free wifi if you book a room through Marriott.com!

title: Good for where it was.
text: I enjoyed the hotel. It was the first time I stayed in the Financial District. I liked being in that part of the City. The hotel rooms were fine, but the hotel itself seems a little dated. But, not a deal breaker. The service was phenomenal. Everyone was great.

title: Great Marriott Hotel
text: One of my favourite hotel in NY - great service and great location! Fairly good executive lounge - lacking some smiles from the staff, but the breakfast, food and drinks are nice. The room was great - with a view towards Hudson river! The concierge was very helpful with booking of restaurants and to get us a limo to the airport when we left. Great - and next time I'll be there

title: Great, Comfortable Hotel
text: Great stay at the Marriott Downtown in lower Manhattan.  Very nice rooms, great service.  The concierge lounge is on the smaller side, but very friendly and well provisioned.  Thanks to Mario for being a wonderful host.

title: Lækkert hotel med perfekt beliggenhed
text: Hotellet ligger lige ved finansdistriktet og Ground Zero. Der er masser af muligheder for offentlig transport lige i nærheden. Fem minutters gang til Battery Park, hvorfra man kan sejle til Frihedsgudinden og Ellis Island. Værelset var super fint, gode senge, god plads, fantastisk udsigt ud over Hudson River (skal tilvælges og koster ekstra). Gratis WiFi i lobbyen. Internet på værelset koster ekstra, til gengæld er det stabilt og godt. Ved ankomst blev vi sendt til Marriott ved Times Square den første nat pga. vandskade. Personalet var meget søde og venlige og gratis internet på værelset resten af vores ophold som kompensation for ulejligheden.

title: Great hotel for good sleep after busy night on a town
text: We got a room with the view of the Statue of Liberty (see picture) on 35th floor. We didn't interact with the hotel staff during our stay besides checking in, and that went well. The lounge for Marriott Elite members was closed on the weekend, and they offer breakfast vouchers for continental breakfast instead. Overall, clean room, and comfortable bed. No issues of any kind.

title: 3/26/2016-Pleasant Stay
text: I found this Marriott to be awesome for my stay.  The rooms are a really decent size, and still among the lower end of the cost spectrum.  The view of the Hudson was fantastic.  Everything looked newly updated-bathroom, decor, It was overall a great stay.  The staff was very friendly.  The location is close to everything we were seeing as well, Ground Zero is one block away, Wall street a few blocks, Battery Park, great location, pleasant stay, spacious-I would definitely stay here again.

title: More than I expected
text: Everyone was so kind and helpful.The hotel was clean and comfortable.I was surprised how comfortable the bed was.Great location..Ground Zero was walking distance. It is hard to put into words what a beautiful job they did building this memorial. I had free wi fi which was a plus. We went downstairs to the adjacent lounge. Great bartender so friendly.

title: Very good!
text: Very nice hotel. Near to ground zero. Easy and near access to three underground lines, so it is in a very good position to visit the city. It has Starbucks coffee and a restaurant inside. Rooms are clean and the staff is very polite. It's a good place to stay.

title: A Typical Hotel Stay
text:
I cannot say this stay was "bad" what-so-ever, but I can't say it was THE BEST place I've ever been. It's definitely dated-- at least the room I stayed in anyway. I will say however that it is one of the few hotels that offers two-double beds because a room was decent enough size to fit them! (Notice I did not say big-- but definitely bigger than others in NYC.) 

If you are not looking for two beds, I would recommend checking out the W Downtown which is directly across the street. It is slightly more updated. The Marriott does offer better pricing most times and therefore if you want to be cost effective, this hotel works just fine.

title: Good, but not what I usually expect from Marriott
text:
We stayed in a double deluxe-sized bedroom on the 14th (out of 38) fl.  Our room faced the Main Street, so we could hear a lot of car traffic into the late hours of the evening.  For the light sleepers, the walls are in-between: not super thin that you hear everything, but not sound proof either because occasionally I heard the phone ring from neighboring rooms or doors opening/closing.  One of the beds in our room was horribly old and uncomfortable; you could feel the springs and it actually sank in when you sat down.  

The staff are friendly, the place is clean and up kept well, but you can see the age of the overall hotel in little things in the room and especially in the bathroom, like cracked paint/plaster, chipped/older fixtures appliances, dirty HVAC duct outlets, etc.  This typically doesn't bother me, but for the price you pay, I did expect a tad better up-keep.

*Wifi is approx. $15/day I believe
*24-7 Fitness room (no pool).
*A Starbucks & Grill place right on the 1st floor (there aren't a ton of foodie, affordable options around this hotel)
*Right elevators go to floors 17-37, Left elevators go 1-16 (this was such a pain since the upper floor elevators went faster)
*No (pretty) views, despite what's advertised.

Overall, it was a decent stay 3.5-Star hotel stay (def not 4-Star worthy).

title: Great hotel near several good attractions
text: This hotel exceeded my expectations in service, the rooms, and cleanliness. They were fixing the sign directly above the door, so they had some crew on the way. The lobby is very nice, and has seating places where we were enjoying ourselves with some drinks. Staff were very courteous and attentive. Location is excellent because you have the Battery Park (where you get the ferry to the Statue of Liberty) so close, about a 5-10 nice walk. You are also close to the 9/11 memorial. I didn't see too many restaurant, I think several were also closed. We did find the Southwest NY restaurant, right in front of the hotel across the street (well, 1 block ahead). The margaritas are the best! It is actually a quiet area, but very enjoyable. I will definitely stay here again on my next trip to NYC and highly recommend to friends and family Marriott Marquis Times Square was a huge disappointment, so getting here made it a lot better and very pleasant after that chaos.

title: Average Marriott level at typical New York prices
text: I had to stay at this hotel due to a seminar held here.  The hotel takes up the entire block so there is a Starbucks on site and other amenities but the prices are a little high considering there are other independent options nearby for higher quality or for cheaper.  With all the construction in the area, walking around here can be difficult and may not be convenient to your destination.  The service at the front desk is pleasant and helpful.  The rooms are slightly smaller than average due to its location.  With public transit, taxis, and other transportation, I would stay elsewhere rather than around here.

title: Fantastic Doorman
text:
After being in Tucson the night before, this seemed a very sterile environment. We arrived late to a hotel with no atmosphere, the staff on the desk were friendly enough but it seemed corporate.

The hotel is well positioned for the 911 memorial area, Wall Street and battery Park. 

The room was nice and spacious with a view of the Statue of Liberty.

It’s a shame but we can’t remember the Doorman’s name, what a great bloke.

title: Convenient Location
text: First time staying here, and I was more than pleased. Stayed with my fiance and her two teenage daughters. Had adjoining rooms with a partial view of the Hudson. Rooms were clean, staff was great. Restaurant on site with Bar.  Great location! Walking distance to Trade Center monument, Battery Park, and the Metro system. Great Manhattan bar (Ohara's) also within walking distance. Liquor store, and convience store also with a few blocks. Was nice after being out and about all day to come back to Lower Manhattan and be outta the busier area. If your thinking of visiting...you will not be disappointed with staying here.

title: A Change of Pace in the Big Apple
text: We often go to New York City because we have one son living in the city and one just outside the city. We have stayed in midtown, Brooklyn, NJ, and this time returned to the Downtown Marriott. About four years ago we had been here but the area was under a lot of construction ( there always seems to be some construction in the city). This proved to be a perfect spot for us. The hotel was very clean and any staff we met were extremely friendly. We met three different shifts of doorman and they could not have been friendlier or more helpful. Being there on a weekend it was not as busy or hectic as I am sure it could be on a weekday. While you are in a big city there will always be some noise at night but it was the quietest two nights we have ever had in the city. Our room was midway up in the hotel and anytime we pressed for the elevator it seemed to appear within seconds. From our window we looked down on the bike/running path which was between the sidewalk and the street. Our only displeasure was to learn that the hotel did not have bike storage available. It would make an ideal spot to go off on a bike through Battery Park and up along either of the rivers. There are many dining options in the area from fancy and pricy to a great Irish pub to Le District located a short walk away where there is something for everyone. You also are within walking distance to the ferries to Ellis Island, Lady Liberty, Staten Island and in season Governors Island. All in all a great spot, and a welcome change of pace in New York City.

title: Шикарный отель в сердце Downtown
text: Очень приличный отель в сердце Downtown NYC. Находится в 5 минутах ходьбы от знаменитого Battery Park и мемориала башням близнецам. Подойдет для путешественников и бизнес поездок. Из номеров открывается панорама на пролив.

title: Business Trip
text: I spent a week in this hotel while in NYC on business.  It is what you would expect from a Marriott property.  Very well kept, room was clean.  Level of finish was excellent.  Does not include Wi-Fi (though I was able to get this comp'd) or continental breakfast which can be a tad frustrating for business travelers.  There is a restaurant/bar on the first floor that serves burgers/bar food.  The food is good, if somewhat expensive.  There is a fitness center open 24/7.  Right next to the World Trade Center complex and easy walking distance to Wall St., restaurants, and other local attractions.  Staff was professional and courteous.

title: Outstanding hotel!
text: I came to New York City for a business trip and stayed at the Marriott downtown. I was not disappointed. It is a beautiful hotel. The staff are very helpful. The rooms are extremely clean. As well as this is extremely well located right next to the 911 museum. This is the place to stay.

title: Thanksgiving in NYC
text: On our first visit to the city, myself and my uncle felt this this would be a great base for exploring... And we were not disappointed. The entire experience was delightful - from check in, to sampling Prosecco in the hotel bar, to my amazing room with a view of the water and to check out on our last day. The hotel is ideally situated to the 9/11 memorial with a subway station round the corner to explore further afield. The rooms and in fact the whole hotel was clean, the staff friendly and the Christmassy atmosphere ever present with the gigantic Christmas tree in the hotel foyer. Really couldn't have asked for a better hotel to spend those few days in and I would definitely recommend to anyone wanting a hotel for a mini break in the city that never sleeps!

title: Wouldn't choose this hotel again
text: I travel to this area of NY frequently and have previously stayed at the W and the Conrad. Co-workers and I had heard that the Marriott had recently remodeled rooms. My guess is that room 707 where I stayed this week was not one of them. Drab view, drab interior color (golden) the room looked worn and areas where it was stained and dirty. The days I stayed, I did not have a hot shower. It fluctuated by barely like warm to frigid cold. I called the front desk and was told that was how the hotel was and I should let the water warm up for 20 min. What???!!!  That evening I said something again to the front desk and they told me they had not received any other water complaints. Next morning, cold shower.

title: Valentines weekend in NYC
text: From the moment we arrived, we felt at home. The doorman welcomed us, the front desk staff were wonderful. Even though we were super early they found us a room that was ready for us after an early morning flight from Canada. Room was very comfortable, could have used more coffee but Starbucks are on site. Bottled water VERY expensive at $7.00. Bed very luxurious, great nights sleep. Stayed for 3 nights, front desk made great suggestions for sightseeing, dining etc. Great place to stay and come back to after a days sightseeing. Only downside was Bills restaurant, service very slow, some guests walked out without so much as an acknowledgement from wait staff.

title: Great stay!
text: My family and I had a great visit to New York City. Downtown Marriott this friendly clean and comfortable. It's the little things that were aggravating at times. The menu for room service  had incorrect prices, there was limited amount of coffee available  in the room (one caffeinated and 3 decaf),and a bottle of water was seven dollars.  With that said we would definitely return to downtown Marriott New York City if we visit the city again.

title: Wedding
text: Very expensive for New Year's Eve.... Hallways so outdated ... Gym very nice ! Bed not like a normal Marriott at all... Fridge in room was good ... Starbucks great inside. Not worth the 1300 for two nights but overall nice. Valet people super nice !

title: Good hotel stay in heart of financial district
text: In NYC for a short business trip for a meeting in the financial district.  This is a rather standard, full-service Marriott, and that's not a bad thing.  The hotel was very clean and the staff was friendly and helpful from the doorman to the front desk to housekeeping and security.  The rates were reasonable, and I found them to be rather favorable for BYC hotels.  I would certainly stay here again.

title: Perfect
text:
This Marriott had me at hello.  The front desk personnel were professional, accommodating  and friendly.   The room was typical size Marriott,l. It was clean, feather free as requested with a beautiful Hudson River Sunset view.  The gym is one of the best I've ever seen in a Marriott hotel. 

Near the 9/11 Memorial and museum and Freedom Tower. 10 min walk to Whole Foods.  There's a Starbucks and restaurant on site.

Simply perfect.

title: Wonderful visit with the family
text:
Visiting NYC for Valentine's Day and college visit.  Used points for the Marriott Downtown.    Great location wonderful staff.   Hotel was full so they couldn't upgrade us but gave us a wonderful view of the Statue of Liberty.  Susan from Customer Service sent us a bottle of wine and some nuts.      

Great location, Could walk to 9-11 Museum, Battery Park.   Easy Uber ride up to Tribeca and Soho.

title: Great red coat service
text: We were here for a work event and had great service from the banquets staff. Especially Ron. He was very helpful and checked in on us constantly to make sure our event was going well. We had to do some major last minute changes do to a change in our expected attendees. He was on the spot. I really appreciated his help! The ballrooms are very large and nice.

title: Nice hotel, very close to 9/11 museum and memorial
text: We wanted to stay in a different part of NYC, close to the 9/11 musuem as we wanted to finally visit.  The Marriott is quaint and within walking distance to the museum and memorial, and Kristen at the front desk was extremely accommodating and put us on a high floor with a beautiful view.  She could not have been nicer on a very cold evening.  The room was clean and the beds were very comfortable, and although the financial district in much quieter on a Friday evening, it was a nice break from the hustle and bustle of Times Square.  Bill's Burger was a great spot for lunch and the Starbuck's off the lobby makes the hotel a home run.  I would absolutely return to this Marriott if we choose another stay in lower Manhattan.

title: Close to 911 memorial
text: Our family had a wonderful time here.  We were lucky to get an upgrade because we are Platinum Members and it helped with 3kids. They have a floor for Marriott Members which has a little buffet for breakfast and they set up snacks during dinner time. The employees are fantastic!!!! We also love how it is so close to the Statue of Liberty and 911 Memorial!

title: Solid Marriott with great customer service
text: Marriott in financial district is a basic full service Marriott. Very helpful staff. Good location if you are going to be in financial district. Starbucks is in the lobby! There are some restaurants within walking distance they are pretty good. You get lucky and get an unbelievable view of World Trade Center and midtown from your room.

title: Lovely hotel
text: We stayed here on a Contiki trip around New Years. I was very surprised that Contiki could get us such a nice hotel at this time. It is great for visiting sites Downtown but you do have a bit of a Subway ride fro Times Square and beyond, although there are quite a few lines very close by to get you in many directions. The room was nice, not that we were in there very much. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom clean. They had a Starbucks in the building which my partner loved, however the buffet breakfast offered to Contiki consisted of eggs, potatoes and coffee not even any juice or toast… this might be different if you aren't doing Contiki but if you are it's not worth getting up early for. I would recommend staying here if you are looking for something Downtown.

title: Nice hotel with limited amenties in the area
text: As others have said, this is a very standard Marriott hotel but a little dated.  The concierge lounge is smaller but has great views. The location is convenient to  downtown/Wall Street area.  This was my first time staying in this area of New York and compared to other areas (Mid Town etc) there are fewer restaurant options in the immediate area.  Nonetheless, if I had business in this area, I would definitely stay here again.  The onsite restaurant was good for basic breakfast and lunch

title: A very nice hotel and reasonably priced for New York
text: Booked this hotel via hotels.com and picked it because of the price but also the reviews I read. This hotel is very nice, the staff are helpful and friendly and the rooms are clean and well equipped. The bed was nice and comfortable and made for a good night sleep. If you are looking for a nice, clean hotel with a good standard so you can explore New York City then this hotel should definitely be in your top10.

title: Fifth floor room very noisy heating/cooling system.
text:
At the check-in time i was told it was a nice renovated room. But no warning that you hear a non-stop significant noise all the time. 

The blind/curtain at the window were closed so tightly because it had simply no view. 

so dissapointing Marriott room.

title: Straight Up Marriott - Right Down the Middle.
text:
Always predictable, the Marriott here does its Marriott duty by being Marriott through and through. Nice location for doing work downtown and the burgers in the adjacent restaurant are good good good. They won't let you take a beer to your room, though. Room service is good and the coffee they delivered was good. The Marriott in-room coffee tastes like death decayed- stay away.

I'll come back here - predictable and well placed place. Friendly folk.

title: Great First Stay
text:
Took 2 rooms on a Sat night to visit WTC memorial and dine in lower Manhattan w/o having to return to NJ.  Recognized Platinum status upon arrival and upgraded us to two Hudson River View rooms on top floor; while the lounge was closed over the WE they offered us comp breakfast and snacks in addition to the points I selected. When they learned it was my daughters 18th Bday, they gave both her and my wife little teddy bears as well.  

Front desk staff was exceptionally friendly and accommodating. Hotel is well-sited and the rooms were very clean and up-to-date.  Really enjoyed our stay and glad we stayed here rather than our typical mid-town options.

title: 24 Hours in NY
text: We booked this hotel at 7:00 PM on a Friday night and checked in at 11:15 AM on Saturday.  Everyone that worked at this hotel was very nice and helpful.  We booked the Junior Suite and liked the room.  It was quiet, clean, and spacious.

title: A block away from the new Trade center and the 9/11 memorials...which are both a must see if you're in the city!
text: Great place to stay if you don't want to be right in the middle of downtown.  You actually feel like you're in a smaller city.  Our view was overlooking the Hudson River.  Beds were wonderful and there is NO noise...very quiet!  Would definitely return on future visits.

title: Great Place to Stay at a Great Price!
text: Downtown next to the statue of Liberty and the 911 memorial. Nice Clean rooms, friendly staff and great food! 3 blocks to the subway and several places to eat in walking distance! If you plan on staying close to times square and more tourism this is not your place as taxi fares started taking over.

title: Friendly staff, large rooms, inexpensive weekend rates...are we sure this is NYC?
text:
Joe Dembek is my hero...he's the GM at the Marriott Downtown NYC and he has assembled, trained and manages the finest hotel staff in the city! From top to bottom they are knowledgeable, professional and helpful. Friendly, engaging and always ready to help, the entire staff deserves kudos.

My wife and I will not stay anywhere else on our visits to NYC. Normally a bustling area of town, on weekends the Financial District becomes calm and laid back. Hotel rates fall on weekends and make visiting much more affordable.

The rooms here are enormous by NYC standards. Bathrooms are great and water pressure (and temperature) are consistent and appropriate. Common areas are clean and comfortable. Three subway stations within three blocks of the hotel giving you access to at least seven subway lines.

Do yourself a favor and check this hotel out. You will not regret it!

title: Great concierge lounge and gym
text:
I frequently work in NYC on business, and have stayed at this property a few times. I'm a 5-year platinum Marriott member and have stayed over 500 nights at Marriotts throughout the world and this is right at the top of the full service Marriotts I've visited. I'm pretty no-frills when it comes to business travel, have a friendly front-desk staff, a good lounge and gym and I'm set.
The property is very conveniently located to the World Financial Center where my client is located (5 minute walk). However, there isn't a ton else in the area as far as restaurants/nightlife...though downtown certainly has improved in the last few years.
The front desk staff is warm and inviting, though one time my rewards number wasn't on the reservation and I definitely noticed a more dismissive treatment.
The room service is from the downstairs burger bar, which isn't ideal, but I did appreciate that they have a couple healthier options, with salads, turkey or shrimp burgers. I have not yet ordered room service but thought the options were pretty good.
The concierge lounge is wonderful. Great view of the statue of liberty and ALMOST fully stocked at breakfast and dinner time. I've noticed Marriotts tend to not carry Greek yogurt which is the one downfall I noticed here as well. 
The gym is by far the best hotel gym I've ever used. They did a renovation recently and it shows. It's on the 5th floor, and spacious with plenty of machines, towels, water and did I mention SPACE. I love not feeling claustrophobic in the gym, which is rare when traveling.
Overall, I'd be happy to return, specifically for the gym and lounge.

title: Wonderful hotel and location in lower Manhattan
text: This is a wonderful hotel located near the Financial District, World Trade Center and Battery Park City. The rooms are comfortable and spacious. The staff is excellent. The views are spectacular. It is very convenient to the subway lines. There are many historical sites within an easy walking distance and you can walk along the promenade that surrounds the island. If you want to avoid the large crowds near hotels in Times Square where we used to stay, this is a great choice.

title: Padrao Marriott de hospedagem
text: Nao tem como errar ao escolher um hotel da familia Marriott. Esse esta localizado proximo a Grand Station e apesar de um pouco distante, da pra ir caminhando ate Times Square e Central Park. O quarto é amplo e muito limpo. A cama é espetacular. O unico senao do hotel é o valor cobrado do cafe da manha que na minha opiniao é muito caro.

title: Good Marriott in NYC
text: We spent 3 nights at the New York Marriott Downtown.  It's a great location for the 9/11 Museum, Battery Park, Chelsea and the Village.  Rooms are a good size.  The concierge could have used some back up.  Marciela was helpful but seemed to have a long line.  She set up our tickets for the 9/11 museum but we never received them via email so we had a snafu at the entrance.  Her recommendations for restaurants were only okay.   Our TV did not work in our room and technical help came immediately.  This hotel is a wonderful option in a quieter location.

title: Mario Headcoak, Concierge at the NYC Marriott Downtown
text: I am so enjoting my stay at the NYC Marriott Downtown. Mario is the best Concierge I have ever met. I am a lifetime Platinum member in the Marriott program so have stay at Marriott Properties all around the world. Mario treats the guest in the lounge like they are family. He is warm, friendly, and helpful. Mario always ask me how was day and is willing to listen to you. Mario helps me to find restaurants and events that are going on in the city.  I will definitely stay at this property again because of the wonderful service that I receive from Mario.

title: Wonderful layover visit
text: We recently stayed here due to a layover flight. We were within walking distance from Wall Street, the National Museum of the American Indian, and the station for the Staten Island ferry. It's also within walking distance of the 911 Memorial but we had not time to explore it. 2 blocks up the road is the Red #1 subway which will take your to Madison Square Garden and Central Park. Our stay was very pleasant and the staff was courteous. I will highly recommend it.

title: Close to the 9/11 Memorial
text: The Marriott is a great spot to set down with a large room at a reasonable price, just a few minutes walking distance to the 9/11 Memorial and Museum and the Freedom Tower. Convenient to Battery Park, as well. The room was generic business hotel that could have been in any large city.

title: pessima esperienza
text:
bagno  senza  riscaldamento , camere  senza  wifi se non a pagamento  , nessuna colazione possibile offferta dall'albergo  , zona spacciata per centrale  in realta' è' a wall street dove alla sera non c'e' nulla , caro  in rapporto a  quanto  ricevuto  .
alla reception personale molto gentile  e disponibile.

title: Very good hotel in a very good downtown location
text:
Stayed there for 4 days between Christmas and New Years Eve and got a great, spacious room overlooking the Hudson River. Front desk staff is top notch. Only drawback: The Concierge lounge is way too small and overcrowded at breakfast time.
Location: Very close to the World Trade Center, the 9/11 memorial, Wall Street, the Financial District and Battery Park (ferries to Statue of Liberty). Plenty of restaurants and shopping within walking distance. Several subway lines close by as well.
Overall a very good place to stay.

title: Ottima soluzione
text:
Questo hotel si trova nel distretto finanziario di Manatthan, la zona è tranquilla ma allo stesso tempo permette di raggiungere in pochi minuti la parte più viva e caotica di NY.
Lo consigliamo quindi come soluzione per visitare la città, le camere sono pulite e spaziose, la ns. era una double matrimonial e anche se i letti erano un pò piccoli rispetto ai ns. standard, permetteva di ospitare comodamente una famiglia di 4 persone, inoltre la vista della statua della libertà, è sicuramente impagabile.
Dall'uscita principale dell' hotel girando a sx in cicra 10 minuti a piedi è possibile raggiungere la zona imbarchi per la statua della libertà e per Ellis island. Girando invece sulla dx in meno di 5 minuti si raggiunge il 9/11 Memorial National Museum.
Per la colazione sull'uscita posteriore dell'hotel c'è Starbucks, il locale è piuttosto piccolo e quasi tutti i clienti dell'hotel si riversano lì, consumando poi la colazione nella hall dell'hotel, che è anche l'unico luogo in cui è disponibile un accesso WiFi gratuito. Se invece preferite uscendo appunto dalla porta posteriore, girando a dx e percorrendo circa 200mt si incontra sulla sx Rector st. percorrendola in salita si trovano vari localini che servono colazioni tipo Cafe Bravo o George's.
Sulla stessa strada si trovano anche le fermate delle tre linee metropolitane tutte raggiungibili in meno di 5 minuti dall'hotel, e che permettono di raggiungere il centro di NY, la prima che si incontra, venendo dall'hotel e percorrendo appunto Rector St. è la Linea Rossa (1) in corrispondenza dei due locali di cui sopra, poi la Linea Gialla (R) in corrispondenza della Broadway e infine la Verde (4&5) in corrispondenza di Wall St.

title: Concerigne lounge
text: The professionalism and personal treatment exhibited by Mario Headcock is second to none!   I travel frequently and I am a lifetime platinum member at Marriott.  My experiences here at the NY downtown Marriott have been wonderful!  Mario makes you feel right at home and is such a pleasant person, I will always keep coming back!!  Five star rating from me!

title: Excellent Xmas Experience
text:
This hotel is a great option for a NYC trip. Though is located in downtown Manhattan (literally across world trade center) it's close to subway and with good options for quick cafe/meal and it's close to south ferry station/battery park where the ferry to Statue of Liberty departs.
Rooms are spacious (either king size or double bed works fine). Price is also attractive and staff if on the TOP of Marriott brand!

title: Great FiDi Hotel!
text: We stayed here while visiting some family in Brooklyn and really enjoyed this hotel. The burger restaurant is pretty good and having Starbucks in the hotel was a major plus. Definitely not a boutique hotel but we really enjoyed the location and our room was very clean and nice.

title: Wonderful stay
text: We stayed here from Dec 21 to Dec 25. The employees of this hotel made our stay wonderful. They were very pleasant, professional and helpful. We had a beautiful room overlooking the Hudson River. The room was clean and fully equipped at all times. Thank you for making our Christmas week in NYC magical!  Oh, and the nightly cookies were delicious!

title: Great hotel in the perfect location!
text: Wow! First impression was that the room was bigger than we expected in New York City. Then we looked out the window. Perfect view of the freedom tower! Also great view of the top of the west building next door. Beautiful! Room was exceptionally clean. Short couple blocks to 911 memorial. Go in the evening when not as crowded. Short couple blocks the other direction to battery park. Nearby enjoyed Picasso pizza and Olives (in Hudson eats) for breakfast bagels.

title: Excellent
text: Very clean rooms!...housekeeping staff is VERY thorough. The staff at the fromt desk were very helpful. The bellhop even saved us from getting ripped off by a cab driver. The view from our room was beautiful. If you don't want to deal with the crowd in Times Square, try this place! The subway is very close to the hotel if you don't want to take a cab. The 9/11 museum is very close to the hotel..it is a must see! It was breathtaking at night.

title: Fantastisk beliggenhed
text:
Vi boede her 4 nætter i Thanksgiving week-enden. Hotellet er rigtig fint og rent. Personalet i lobbyen er ekstremt hjælpsomme! Værelserne er fine og rene. Beliggenheden er fremragende. En blok fra 9/11 og 5 minutters gang til turbåde til Frihedsgudinden. Det er et minus, som mange andre også har skrevet, er at der ikke er udsugning på badeværelset. Det i kombination med at vinduerne på værelset ikke kan åbnes går at værelserne kan blive indelukkede og fugtige. En dum fejl på værelserne!
Det største minus er dog at der ikke er gratis wi-fi på værelserne. Det SKAL være standard med gratis wi-fi på et hotelværelse i 2015!!

title: Great location, decent price, wished food service stayed open longer...
text: Beautiful & festive lobby, need more valets outside or on the ready in the foyer, friendly & helpful front desk, clean attractive rooms, great hairdryer, but wished bar was open later, especially on the weekend & wished shower head had more pressure for those of us with thick long hair!

title: Great Hotel
text: It was a great hotel love it so much And im  coming back on june 16 to see the rest of the city. Its a great experience to with the family and enjoy the best atracttion in NYC. I personally enjoy the restaurant and walking in the street because everything is so close to the hotel

title: Great Staff at a Great Hotel
text: I've always enjoyed staying at this hotel not only because of the location.  It's also because of the staff who works there.  I especially enjoyed chatting with Mario at the Concierge lounge.  He's a great host and I'm also amazed of his sense of humor.  He manages to keep his guests entertained and would always go above and beyond to keep all of the guests happy.  As for the front desk staff, I've only experienced their professionalisms and quick to resolve any issues that are mentioned to them.  This hotel has been my go to hotel each time I visit NYC.

title: Clean, friendly and a great view!
text:
The staff were extremely friendly and the room was clean.  The views were nice to see the hudson and downtown.  Disappointed there was no continental breakfast available but they do have a restaurant on site.   (see review of Bill's Bar and Burger's Downtown).  

Beds are very comfortable and loved the tree in the lobby (Christmas Tree!).

title: Loved the location!!!!
text: Had an amazing one night stay over the weekend! This was my first time visiting the property and I was blown away. The front desk agents were very kind. We were placed on the 25th floor facing the Hudson River. Our room was very spacious and clean. The location of the hotel is perfect,  not far away from the freedom towers and the 9/11 memorial. I highly recommend to go visit both sites! My overall experience was great! I'd visit again hands down.

title: Definitely Recommended
text:
My second favorite hotel to stay when visiting NYC. Great hotel and staff that go out of their way to deliver outstanding service.

We've stayed there the last three years in our annual December trip to NYC. This time around we were given the Hudson River View room on a higher floor, which was great.

title: 다소 저렴한 호텔
text:
프라이스라인의 비딩으로 선택된 맨하탄 남부 호텔.
타임스퀘어의 매리어트 마퀴스보다는 저렴한 편이다. 로비는 다소 소박하고, 방시설은 딱 있을것만 있는 수준.
911 사이트와 바로 길건너편이다.

title: decent stay close to Wall Street subway line
text: Close to World Trade Center memorial which meant tourists, but it was not as crazy as mid-town in December. Decent sized room on the 16th floor. Great view of the Hudson river. Good shower pressure. Standard Marriott amenities in the room (toiletries and blow dryer). Near Battery Park and Trinity Church, 9/11 Memorial reflection pools. All nice FREE things to do.

title: Why do I come back here?
text: I visit this hotel a pretty often - at least eight to ten times a year for 3-5 nights each time.  I'm also Platinum rewards at Marriott.  I have never, ever had anything but a small standard room - tonight I'm in an absolutely miniscule room - from the door you can climb onto the bed or look out of the window - right next door to the ice machines and on a low floor. Come on Marriott - you really start to at least pretending to give a damn about your regular guests - particularly when they are paying over $400/night.  Poor.  Really very poor.  At check-in the receptionist made a comment - we're really busy but of course in The New Year it will be really quiet.  Perhaps you should take care of the people who come to stay here in the quiet times too then??

title: Thank you Lost and Found dept!
text:
Traveled to NYC this May with my family. Frankly speaking, this hotel looks like a courtyard rather than a Marriott. Maybe courtyard in NYC is even smaller. It's NYC, isn't it?! I purchased valet parking when booking the hotel at Marriott website. The door keeper was very nice and helpful after I tipped him in the beginning. The reason why I said that is on the next day he just ignored us when my wife needed a help to lift a heavy double stroller. 

The front desk was very nice and gave my son two teddy bears.  Got complimentary wifi as a silver elite Marriott member, and a minor upgrade - a little bit better view for my parents' room. Two rooms I reserved were clean and the size were good.

Last but not least, I would say thank you to the housekeeper and the lost and found dept. I left my wedding ring in the washroom, and called them the day after. They couldn't mail it to me in Canada, but mailed it to my friend living in New Jersey. Really appreciate it!!!!!!

title: This is more like a Courtyard than a Marriott
text: I arrived late after my flight was delayed 3 hours and was disappointed to learn there was no room service. There were delivery options and there is room service breakfast available from the restaurant in hotel lobby. Carpet had a couple stains. Bed was too soft.

title: Great two night stay!
text:
My family and I stayed at the Downtown Marriott for two nights around Thanksgiving.  From the moment we arrived, every single staff member we encountered was friendly, professional and most courteous.  It was a pleasure to speak with them all, and our questions were politely answered and we were very nicely greeted each and every time we came back to the hotel.

Our room was a very nice double with a view of the River.  So nice!  It was clean and nicely kept, and housekeeping did a nice job, even leaving a Happy Thanksgiving note for us.  The water pressure was fantastic in the shower.  Two queen beds would have made it perfect, but it was fine for us.

We ate at Bill's Burger one night while we were there.  Once again, the service we received was wonderful, and it was a tasty meal, super convenient since it was right in the hotel.  

This was the perfect hotel to spend our Thanksgiving trip to NYC and to celebrate our daughter's birthday.  I would love to stay here again.  The Subway is close by. We went Uptown several times during our stay. The 9-11 Memorial is also steps away, as is Battery Park, and lots of great offerings downtown.  Great stay!

title: Perfect weekend
text: We were one weekend at the Marriot with the family and all was perfect. All the employees were very nice and the room with Hudson view is just amazing. Also we were there with my son (13 months) and they were waiting us with a cute softbear for him, really nice gesture!

title: Weekend in NYC
text:
My wife, son and I spent a long weekend in NYC on 11/13/15 visiting our daughter. We stayed at the Marriott Downtown hotel. It is located right next to the Freedom Tower and areas we didn't visit in the past trips. It also close to the river. Weather on Sunday and the proximity to the river invited us to a nice walk along the coast.
The concierge lounge was closed during the weekend which was not made very clear in the website when I made the reservation. If you have reward points, keep that in mind. The location is a little far from the main and touristic areas, but some times that is a plus, as you get to know nice and different parts the city has to offer. Price was right!. At the end, it was a good choice.

title: Sure a re-furb will bring it back to 5 Star status
text:
Fantastic position allowing easy access to all parts of Manhattan and all other attractions. Bill's Bar have great staff with sincere warmth and hospitality - well worth a tip.

Fortunate to have Concierge Lounge access, the staff are also great, especially at breakfast.

Oh, for those international business travellers like me who are used to the fabulous Marriott facilities worldwide, please note, this hotel closes its Elite membership facilities from 11am Friday morning and does not offer them again until Sunday at 5pm. Also be prepared to pay for wine and beer virtually twice the price as available to everyone in Bill's Bar during Happy Hour - 4pm - 7pm.
   
Regarding the rooms? Oh well, not the usual fantastic, comfortable beds Marriott are infamous for as it appears the mattresses are well slept in having a one sided dip, plus, the sheets were also found to be worn.

Décor is also in need of updating in both bedroom and bathroom.

All this said, none of these are issues which cannot be resolved and on bringing them to the attention of the management, with apologies,  it appears changes will be made accordingly. I look forward to returning to experience the difference.

title: Freundliches Hotel in Top-Lage
text: Schönes Stadthotel in Top Lage in Downtown Manhattan in unmittelbarer Nähe zum Ground Zero, Freedom Tower, Financial District und zur Freiheitsstatue. Zimmer ausreichend gross und sauber. Teilweise mit Aussicht auf die Freiheitsstatue. Einrichtung etwas in die Jahre gekommen. Sportsbar und amerikanisches Restaurant direkt im Hotel. U-Bahn Stationen in der Nähe. Insgesamt empfehlenswert.

title: Family pre Thanksgiving
text: Took my parents and family away for a pre Thanksgiving getaway and had a wonderful stay. The staff here is remarkable; they put us in adjoining rooms, greeted my two daughters with a Statue of Liberty hat and little teddy bear and made us feel incredibly welcome. Would definitely recommend.

title: 911 Visit
text:
This hotel is a great find in downtown Manhattan.  Approx 3 minute walk to the 911 Memorial.  Happy hour at Bill's Bar and Burger was an added bonus.  Although the rooms are small (typical for NYC). It was clean and decorated nicely.  We arrived early and was able to get in our room right away.  The staff was friendly and helpful.
Would stay there again when I visit the downtown area.

title: Great Hotel in the Heart of the Finacial District
text: Walking distance from so much in the heart of the financial district.  Two blocks from the 9/11 Museum and the World Trade Center.  This whole area is under a revitalization with great new restaurants and shopping to rival any where else in the city.  Just a few blocks from Battery PArk and wall street.  The rooms are spacious and comfortable.  Had a great view of the Statue of Liberty.  You cant go wrong with this hotel.

title: Buon hotel 4*
text:
Buon hotel in una buona posizione: si trova a 2 passi da Ground Zero e vicino Wall Street ed i traghetti per Ellis Island.
È lontano da Midtown e da molte principali attrazioni di NYC, ma si possono facilmente raggiungere tramite Subway (stazione vicina).
È vicinissimo ai famosi magazzini Century21 (da non perdere).
Hotel decisamente sopra la media di NYC (non particolarmente buona), le camere sono nuove e ben arredate.
Consigliato (specialmente per chi prevede attività in Downtown).

title: La calidad del Marriott
text: Las habitaciones son espaciosas y la cama super comoda. Cuenta con cafetera en la habitación, caja de seguridad y frio bar. Hay distintas estaciones del metro a corta distancia (1 o 2 cuadras) por lo que su ubicación es conveniente, sobre todo si tienes que moverte en el downtown y el distrito financiero. Muy cerca del WTC y el 9/11 Memorial. Hay un restaurante adyacente al hotel que tiene muchas opciones para el desayuno, almuerzo o cena. También hay otros restaurantes y bares en los alrededores.

title: Could be better
text:
Great location. Nice sized rooms. Helpful staff. Bill's Burgers is a solid burger place with quality meat and fresh French fries.

I'll get to the stuff that needs improvement. First the rooms are tired-the beds are good and the sheets and pillows are newer but they are full Sized beds- why? Get the right sized double beds. The bathrooms don't have fans or night lights- why? The wallpapered bathrooms are tired and peeling-why? There isn't a mirror in the room only the bathroom-why? All minor investments for this hotel.

The staff was helpful and they don't nickel and dime you for the incidentals other than the wifi.

title: 高層階からはニューヨークの摩天楼が見える
text: あのグランドゼロのすぐそば（ホテル裏口から出て左１分）でバッテリーパークにも近いロケーションです。ホテルの周りにはフリーダムタワーをはじめいくつも高層ビルがあり、高層階に泊まると夜景が特にきれいです。ハドソン川が見える部屋もあるようなので、チェックインするときに聞いてみるといいと思います。ただミッドタウンから渋滞がひどいと１時間かかってしまうことも。（市内移動は荷物が少なければ、地下鉄利用が便利です）

title: Un tres bel hotel avec un excellent service
text:
Contrairement à l'ensemble des immeubles modernes qui l'entoure, cet hôtel parait un peu âges, cependant des que l'on rentre dans le hall, on se sent comme dans un cocon ou tout le monde est prêt a vous accueillir avec le sourire! Les chambres sont spacieuse, propre et en très bon état. J’ai eu la chance d’avoir une chambre dans un étage élevé avec une vue imprenable sur la statue de la liberté. De son cote, le petit déjeuner est très bon et complet, et l’ensemble de la nourriture servie dans cet hôtel est, en général de bonne qualité. 
Un hôtel a recommandé les yeux fermes si vous aller dans le sud de Manhattan.

title: Good hotel in business district
text: Stayed at Marriott as this was the hotel for conference attended. The property could be refreshed but it met needs. Had a corner room with adequate work space. Bathroom didn't have all the amenities I was use to getting in other hotels but inquired at front desk and they were provided promptly. Street noise was heard throughout night so if that bothers your sleep suggest requesting a high floor. The staff I interacted with at front desk and bellmen were helpful and professional. Okay for business in area but wouldn't recommend for leisure stay as not much around to do.

title: Best place and close to 9/11 Memorial
text: Convenient, quality accommodations, and top notch service.  Great workout facility with all the amenities, no extra charge and no crowds. Concierge service was great too with recommendations for my plans.

title: Ideal downtown location
text: The hotel was convenient to the 9/11 Memorial and St.Paul's Church.The room was very nice,updated, clean and comfortable. In comparison to other Downtown Manhattan hotels the rate was decent in that it also included taxes and fees before checking out. There were two nice restaurants in the hotel. If I could afford  to everytime I went to New York I would stay here.

title: Wasn't in my room much but everything was good during my stay
text: I checked in and went out immediately after placing my bag in the hotel room. I was out for most of the night and went to bed immediately and left pretty well. The room was comfortable and clean (king bed) and the bathroom was fine. I did not pay full rate as I got the room through Hotwire.com. Front desk staff was efficient and friendly and tried to be helpful in answering some questions I had about the location of the closest gas station and tried to charge my iPhone (unfortunately when I picked it up, it hadn't charged at all!). My room was quiet, although it was just off the elevator lobby and the view was ok. It's just around the corner from the WTC site and a short walk from public transportation. I'd recommend.

title: Che delusione
text: Abituato ad altri Marriott sono rimasto fortemente deluso da questo albergo.camere minuscole buie le suite con secondo letto che in realtà è un divano. Wi Fi a pagamento in camera, dopo proteste l'ho però avuta free dal desktop dove per la verità il personale è molto gentile.pulizia sommaria climatizzazione rumorosa insomma sproporzionato il prezzo e le 4 stelle. Non ci tornerei

title: sehr zentral gelegenes Hotel, das sich gut für eine Unterkunft auf einer ersten Schnuppertour handelt
text:
Allerdings würde ich das nächste Mal in einem Restaurant frühstücken, das nicht im Gebäudeteil des Hotels liegt!
Im Frühstücksraum befinden sich mehrere laufende Fernseher mit verschiedenen Programmen.

title: Small rather tatty rooms, but friendly staff.
text: The hotel is rather dated with small rooms that could do with freshening up.  I stayed 4 days at a conference, it was adequate but expensive for what it was.  The staff were great, especially the night concierge.  The best bit is O'Hara's pub out the back.  Good views of the bay & Statue of Liberty from my room on 29th floor.

title: Wonderful location in lower Manhattan close to the 1 and R subway lines
text:
Literally 1 building away from the Ground Zero Memorial Pools to the north and just a couple of blocks from Battery Park to the south. The Hudson River waterfront is only a couple of blocks west. There is shopping very nearby at the new Brookfield center across West Street and lots of dining and drinking options immediately proximate. The Concierge Lounge on the 38th floor was really good for both breakfast and the evening service with a view of the Statue of Liberty.
I was initially given the wrong room (my usual room preference as a Platinum Elite member) but was quickly moved to the room type that I had reserved on the corner of Carlisle and West which meant that I had great views.
Pier A, Stone Street, Chinatown, Trinity Church, the East River are also all walkable and the subway proximity makes the rest of Manhattan accessible too.

title: Nice Hotel
text:
The hotel is adjacent to the World Trade Center and an easy walk to Wall Street and Battery Park where you can get a ferry to the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island.
The rooms were clean.  The only disappointment was there was not breakfast buffet.

title: Great location, worst bed ever!
text: My husband and I didn't sleep comfortably for two nights thanks to every bed spring creaking every time we wanted to move or breathe. The room is over-due for a remodel. The view was great out of our 32nd floor room but other than that- worst Marriott experience I've ever had. The shower was small with missing grout, the bed was the least comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept on. We had come from a wedding in NJ the night before and stayed at a Hampton Inn...wish we would have continued that trend in NY. I'm generally a Marriott fan staying one month earlier in a Marriott in NOLA and loving it. This location needs a lot of work and new beds!!!! The restaurant there, Bills, has a great breakfast sandwich! If there are newer, remodeled rooms, I'm sure this would be a nice stay. Can't ask for a better location if you are looking to see the: 9/11 museum, one world trade, Statue of Liberty, or NYSE. Maria at the reception desk is very nice too.

title: Good Location Near Battery Park
text:
Attended a conference and stayed for one night in a suite on the 23rd floor. The location is great, close to the 9/11 Memorial and a short walk to Battery Park and Wall Street. There is a terrific walking path along the harbour close to the hotel. Easily accessible to several subway lines, a short distance from the hotel.

The lobby of the hotel is not exceptional, but the staff is welcoming and pleasant. The suite was clean and spacious by New York standards. We had a corner room which gave us a view of Ellis Island, but not the Statue of Liberty as there was a skyscraper in the way. Lots of windows & light in this room, natural & artificial light.
There was a refrigerator, safe and coffee-making materials. Comfortable bed & it was very quiet on this floor. 

Shocking that you get free WiFi in the lobby, but have to pay a minimum of $14.95 per day for your room. For the price you pay for a room it should be included in the cost. They also wanted $5 for a 500 ml bottle of water.
There is a small Starbucks on the premises as well as a Bill's Bar & Burger.

title: One night from an excellent review.
text: Wonderful staff, very nice hotel, great rooms. When I made the reservation with Marriott I stated that we needed an accessible room for 3 with a roll in shower. This is very important for my wife and I, our 23 yr. old daughter is in a wheelchair, so I had a supervisor confirm that we had a 2 beds and no tub in the bathroom. Upon check-in we were told our room was a king room with a roll in shower. To make a long story short, the first two nights we were in a beautiful room that had lots of space, an awesome view of the city and river and 2 beds. The third and final night we had to move to the king room. The friendly staff provided a roll away. Everything about the king room was fine except for the space. There was not enough room my daughter to get around in her chair. Otherwise, the Marriott Downtown is very nice. It's just a couple blocks from the 9 11 Memorial and just across the street from the Hudson River. The staff is very nice and helpful. The corner room with the big windows was one of the nicest we've ever stayed in, too bad we had to move out of it.

title: Lovely place to stay near ground zero.
text: Stayed here for a weekend. We had a lovely room with two double beds and a view of the Hudson River. Ground Zero and Battery Park are within walking distance. There is a Starbucks and a sports bar in the hotel. My only complaint is the free internet is only in the lobby. I select hotels by free room internet so I may not be returning here. Rates were competitive with other NYC hotels. That might be different during the week. Room was very comfortable and a decent size for a NYC hotel room. NYC hotel rooms are small.

title: Excellent Location, Interior & catering service
text: Though we had too many crowded into a Ballroom, overall my experience at this Marriott for a business summit was positive. Their ability to accommodate us with good meals was amazing. The rooms are spacious & clean... The views (from 26th floor) are stunning. This hotel is located in the Wall Street area... Easy walk to 9/11 Memorial & Museum, Wall Street, NYSE & other historic spots.

title: Nice staff, but terrible room...
text: I don't actually know if it was an error made by my office or by their receptionists, but I was supposed to be booked for two nights for a conference on premises, but they only had me down for one night. I am sure this is what led to the unfortunate location of my room. I was on floor 18 right next to the elevator control room. All night all I heard was the banging of the elevator as it moved up and down the building. It resulted in a pretty miserable nights sleep. The food from room service was pretty miserable too, I ordered lasagna and it was very odd...the texture, the cheese....Their staff was very nice however and the rooms are clean. Hopefully I will be more lucky with my room location if I find myself back there.

title: Great Location, Great Hotel
text: This hotel ticked all the boxes for us- location (near the sites we wanted to see this visit), cleanliness (10/10) room size (we were upgraded-a big thank you Marriott- but information indicated regular rooms were well sized) price (we booked some time ago) wifi ( free for members). All staff, from the desk to housekeeping, were friendly and helpful. The hotel has a Starbucks and a Bills Burgers on the premises and there is a supermarket a few minutes walk from the hotel. The Financial District has lots to offer and there is a good choice of bars, cafes and shops. Fulton St Station allows access to all areas of the city and is 5 minutes walk away. The hotel is also close to the Hudson River and Battery Park.

title: Wonderful
text: Excelente ubicación. Cerca de todo Madison square garden, la estación de metro, la 5ta avenida hay  muchos lugares accesibles para comer. La atención del personal no es la más cálida, podría mejorar. Las habitaciones son pequeñas y cómodas. Los baños son amplios con Tina.

title: Gutes Hotel in hervorragender Lage
text:
Wir hatten ein Zimmer mit Blick auf die Freiheitsstatue - sehr nett. 

Zimmer war klein, sauber, gute Betten. Die Lage ist zum Erkunden von Südmanhattan perfekt, alles zu Fuß erreichbar (ground zero, Wallstreet, Fährhafen). Subway für entferntere Ziel direkt um die Ecke.

title: Its Okay - 100 Nights
text:
Typical Marriott.  I have spent at least 100 nights in this hotel and always for the location.  The location is perfect for business but if you are in town for leisure, then you should look to somewhere in mid-town.

This property is average is almost every way, but really needs to improve the restaurant.  It is below average for this part of the city.

title: NEVER AGAIN! Not worth of money!
text:
Me and my boyfriend are from Europe and here we book Mariott hotels quite often and we are very satisfied with service. Therefore, we were 100% sure that in New York great service will be provided but, unfortunately, we were mega-disappointed. Our last day in NY was exactly in Mariott Downtown. From first second they showed very low service. As we paid more than 400$ per night we expected at least helpful and friendly people. We had 3 suitcases and nobody helped us with them. At least they could help me, female. Instead of that, doorman was just looking, so probably for him was quite interesting if I am going to manage to bring one suitcase over steps. As we came too early, we left our luggage in a storage room where we brought them by ourselves and doorman just opened the room and pushed them and after that he asked for tipps! FOR WHAT?? For just opening door and pushing luggage? Seriously?
Regarding room - it is ok. Quite big but in our room was door to another one and at 3 a.m. some ladies started laughing very loud, slamming doors every 5 mins and talking about what should they wear, what pyjamas,underwear etc. It was like an hour at least...
At the whole hotel there is no free internet, they even dont have business room. You have to pay. But in our reservation was written that in public area there is free wifi. When I asked on the reception the lady lied me, telling that in NY you dont have free wifi at all. OMG...our first days we stayed at MILLENIUM HILTON where they have business room with 3 PC and have internet free of charge! If price for Mariott is 100, max 150 per night then its ok but when you pay 400 -expectations are high.

title: Good hotel, good locatiom
text:
The hotel is one of the more older Marriott hotels (I suspect), but overall the experience was very good.

Very attentive staff, quite big rooms, nice bathroom and the bed was very comfortable. The gym was also one of the better hotel gyms I have used; treadmills and a variety of weights.

The key thing for me when choosing a hotel is that it is quite, which this one was as they were kind to give me a room on the 36th floor.

Location is good and you have downtown Manhattan within walking distance.

The only negative point is that it is quite pricy, but I suppose all hotels in Manhattan are.

I would stay here again and recommend to others!

title: Close to where I needed to be!
text: The hotel is an older one so it isn't a bells and whistles place.  However it is minutes from the 9/11 monument which makes it an ideal location.  The lobby bar/lunch menu is great and adequate for those of us on the run.

title: Great location for downtown area
text:
We stayed here for the first three nights of our visit to NYC as my wife had to travel to Jersey City each day on business.  

This hotel is what it is, a good business hotel ideally located for the Financial District and the ferry over to Jersey City.  Our room was large and comfortable though we felt it was beginning to look a bit dated and in need of refurbishment.  There is no free wi-fi service which I found strange for a business hotel.  However, as with the room, if someone else is paying the bill then these details are unimportant.

Staff were friendly and helpful.  The Ghanaian chap on the door is one of the nicest and friendliest people I have ever met.

The restaurant attached to the hotel is more of a sports bar.  The burgers and cooked breakfast were pretty good.

The local area is what makes staying here really worthwhile.  There are plenty of restaurants and bars.  It's close to the 9/11 memorial and Battery Park City.  Walking around after dark is a truly memorable (and safe) experience, particularly along the Hudson.

Finally, would I stay here as a leisure traveller.  Probably not.  There are better deals up in Midtown and the distance to many NYC attractions is just that bit too great on a daily basis.

title: Nice hotel, could use updating
text: This hotel met it's needs. It has a beautiful lobby and entrance area. The rooms were clean and well-furnished. Staff was friendly and helpful. The only noticeable drawback is that the room furnishings were rather outdated. The lobby made you feel like you were walking into a new, modern hotel, while the rooms looked like they were furnished in 1999.  The floors were a very ugly carpet and the TV was small. Nothing major, but when paying for a hotel that I found to be more expensive than many nearby, I'd prefer skipping the 4-star services and getting a modernized room.

title: Lacking in customer service in all areas
text: Upon arriving at the hotel we were hopeful that everything would be smooth and simple. After a quick check in process lacking any interaction from the guest service agent other the name, credit and and ID, that is all she said to us. Seeing that the room we were given was on a high floor we assumed are usual requests and requirements would be met fine. After stepping off the elevator we found our room directly off the elevator strike one. After opening the door we found two double beds. When I made the reservation I specifically made the reservation for 1 king bed. In the hundreds of Marriott reservations we have made we have never had anything other than 1 king bed. So I called down to the front desk to ask what had happened to our room. The agent I first spoke with just argued with me back and forth finally asking if I wanted to speak to a manager, to which I said yes. The manager again offered me no solution to the problem just simply saying they were sold out. After two whole days of traveling with no sleep and no other hotels available in the city we were stuck. After going to dinner we came back to try and sleep only to find the beds being completely uncomfortable. After tossing and turning all night we found ourselves completely sleepless in lower Manhattan. We requested our car in the morning to change out some luggage and then repark the car for the day. We cleared out the room carrying everything down since we had collected alot more during our day in the city than we came in with. The problem with this was there is a small staircase at the exit of the hotel making it impossible to carry our items down any other way than one by one. While hotel staff looked on not one person offered to help us with our items. In a nutshell this hotel just hopes you dont speak English and wont know how to complain about their lack of service or care for anything about their customers. So much for being able to enjoy the rest of our trip to New York due to the lack of sleep.

title: Very Nice
text: Stayed her for a business trip. The room was excellent and very spacious. Front desk, bellman and doorman were some of the friendliest in the city. My view from the 35th floor facing the new One World Trade Center was amazing. You definitely want to get an upper floor as some of my coworkers were on the 10th floor and the traffic was noisy. It was also a bit pricey but it is New York and the pope was in town.

title: Good hotel near 911 Memorial
text: This was a nice hotel that was within walking distance of the 911 Memorial and Museum. The rooms were well appointed and clean. The bellhops were not terribly helpful when we arrived in the rain - they were inside and didn't approach us until after we'd already brought our own bags in through the rain and carried them up the entry steps.  The lobby restaurant had tasty burgers.

title: Pleasantly Surprised - Great Location - Great Service - Perfect Stay!!!
text:
First time at this Marriott location in New York. Was expecting a dark, tiny room. Not the case. We had a perfect size room with amazing views of the water at Battery Park. The location of this hotel was nothing less than perfect. Easy access to everything we needed. Right around the corner from the 911 Memorial, which was overwhelming to say the least.

The hotel has Starbucks attached and a perfect restaurant with good food.

WiFi - free in public areas and good amount of seating in the lobby.

Will stay here again. Thank you for a wonderful vacation!

Rooms - well don't expect quite in NY!

title: Good Hotel, good service
text: The Mariott is a good hotel, especially for business people. The employees are friendly and helpful, so we had a good stay. Sadly, internet was only free in the hotel lobby, so we needed to purchase "premium internet" to have access from our room.

title: You can count on it!
text: Every time I stay here, it's a consistent experience.  The rooms are clean, the beds comfortable, the linens good, the rooms are a good size for NYC and the staff is lovely.    That's more than you can say for most hotels!  Good location if you're visiting the WTC site or the financial district.  Easy walk to Little Italy.

title: Visión panorámica new york
text:
Dispone. En la azotea del restaurante  giratorio, pero la hora en la que fuimos ya era de noche y se aprecia poco la monstruosidad de Ny. Tomamos cervezas y punto.
Hay servicio de bufette de quesos. Por 30 dolares

title: Front Desk Staff is Great and Extra Helpful
text:
There was wonderful young lady who checked us in with blond hair, I regret I did not get names, who gave us a map and helped with everything we needed. The hotel acknowledged the high floor request and a change from a king to two doubles which was GREAT. They really strive to make the guest happy. I also had help from a gentleman who worked the night shift, older gentleman who called around to find a place that had 24 hour western union. He went above and beyond. Everyone from bell staff to front desk was amazing. Great team you have here and I will be coming again soon! 
The décor was amazing as well as the rooms. 
Thank You all.

title: A great place close to a sacred place
text: We stayed in the hotel late in September. It is located by ground zero in Manhattan.  It was rather busy, yet we were so impressed with the service. I was a bit concerned about the noise level, but surprisingly that was not a problem. The staff, from the front desk service to the bellmen and others, was extremely helpful and pleasant to interact. We had some issue with room temp control and other issues. They were so very apologetic and worked hard to fix the problem. The price was steep, but that is not unusual for New York and this area of Manhattan. So, all in all, great job Marriot Downtown NY.

title: Friendly service and great amenities
text: I was greeted by Geraldine with a beautiful smile and everything was fantastic from there on out.  They have one of the best fitness centers I have ever encountered.  The staff is very pleasant about answering questions. It has the look and feel of a new hotel.

title: ハドソン川が見える
text: ベットの寝心地が良かった。フリーwifiはロビーのみのはずだが、部屋でも普通につながった。1階のスタバの手前にPCルームがあり手前のPCが航空会社のwebチェックイン用になっているようで印刷も無料で使えて事前にチェックインできて便利だった。

title: Just couldn't wait to go!
text:
This dreary, in need of refurbishment hotel offered very little flexibility. The room was relatively small but bearable. TV didn't work. Restaurant and bar are subcontracted out and the food is awful. Service for breakfast is a joke and usual to be given cold coffee and of course you pay for everything.

Can't open any windows so reliant on hazardous aircon that malfunctions.

The only redeeming aspect of this over priced and depressing place was the hard working reception staff and concierge who resolved every stupid problem that this country throws at you.

This town has a serious taxi problem. You can get there but you can't get back without unofficial payments in cash to the licensed taxi drivers. That assumes you can find a taxi to go back.

If you smoke then it's outside but nevertheless fun watching the over weight Traffic Police mess up the whole traffic flow whilst searching through a hand bag trying to find something. Even better was a patrol car that stopped just to have a chat to two other colleagues. Laughing and joking whilst a nice queue built up behind them. In the UK they would have their back sides roasted.

Generally, New York is a dump though everyone should visit once for the experience then never again unless you have to.

title: WTCの跡地
text:
《アクセス》WTCの跡地のすぐ近く。911メモリアルや博物館を見るのに便利です。地下鉄のアクセスも良好です。ハドソン川やバッテリー公園へも歩いていけます。自由の女神へも行きやすいです。ミッドタウンへは距離がありますが、地下鉄やタクシーを使えばすぐです。

《チェックイン》ロビーエリアはあまり広くありません。

《部屋》高層階からは、マンハッタンの高層ビルのすばらしい景色が見れます。古い建物ですが、部屋は清潔です。アメリカらしいクラシックな中にもビジネスライクな雰囲気です。広さはそこそこありました。大きいテレビでNHKが見られます。

《施設》フィットネスはありますが、利用しませんでした。

《レストラン》朝食は広く、気持ちよく食べられます。テレビがあちこちにあるのがニューヨークらしい。働いている人たちは感じが良いです。夕食には近くにレストランがたくさんあります。

title: AWESOME HOTEL, AWESOME LOCATION
text:
I would highly recommend this hotel, the location is 5 minutes walk from the Hudson River, if you enjoy an early morning walk or run this is ideal. Also the location is away from the hussle and bussle of times square, yet times square is only a couple of metro stops away. closest metro is also +/- 5 minute walk.
the rooms are spacious quite huge actually even the bathroom.
the gym has state of the art equipment.
we stayed at the hotel for 4 nights , the service was amazing staff were friendly and helpful, we will definitely stay here again when next we visit the Big Apple

title: Buen Hotel y Buena ubicación
text:
Magnifico hotel, buenas habitaciones y buenas vistas a la Estatua de la Libertad o al Nuevo World Trade Center. Os recomiendo contratar directamente con el hotel. Yo lo hice con HOTELES.COM Y ME SALIO FATAL pagué una triple y me dieron una doble, paguë el desayuno tipo buffet y este hotel no tiene este desayuno, pague el wifi y tampoco me lo dieron, asi que despues de pagar casi 3000 dolares tuve que volver a  pagar aparte el resto de servicios contratados y pagados previamente a HOTELES .COM.
No obstante el trato perfecto, hotel impecable y muy aconsejable.

title: Location is great
text:
I like to stay at this Marriott when in Manhattan because of the location.  The staff are always helpful and the rooms are nice.

I do have to say it's not the best Marriott! The concierge lounge is closed on weekends and you cannot even grab a soda...those doors are locked and no one can get in.  
Finally I am not overly impressed with the restaurant attached to the hotel...I would strongly recommend you find one of a gazillion restaurants nearby.

title: Terrible system and customer service
text: I arrived at 3:10am and was told that they didn't have my room ready and they couldn't give me one because "the system was changing over dates."  I can understand having antiquated IT, but it is baffling to me why the hotel doesn't have a few rooms and keys ready for people who arrive during this window.  At 3am, when I have meetings the next morning, every minute I spend waiting on their technology is personal pain for me.  I had called ahead and spoken with Susan at the front desk to let her know my plane was delayed and I was arriving late, so this was entirely preventable.  (And I have to imagine this location of hotel has a fair bit of business travel, so they should be used to people coming in on the redeye.)  Moreover, the people behind the counter took a "sir there's nothing we can do about it" posture, which came across as "tough luck, suck it up."

title: Convenient & Clean
text:
I stayed at the NY Marriott Downtown this past weekend while on a Bachelorette weekend in NYC.  The hotel was located in a very convenient & beautiful part of town - right near the 9/11 Memorial. It was so easy to get around Manhattan from the hotel & we had a great weekend heading around town to see and experience NYC.
