In addition to the great location, the hotel rooms were large, spacious and clean.  The hotel staff was also very accommodating and helpful with questions about things nearby.  

I'd definitely recommend this hotel to others & stay here again when I'm in town next.

title: Renovierungsbedürftige Zimmer
text: Die Zimmer sind in die Jahre gekommen und sind mit muffigen , feuchten Teppich ausgelegt. Die Bäder sind ziemlich alt und müssten mal neu gemacht werden.  Die Lage des Hotels ist super, Ground Zero , Wallstreet und anderes sind gleich um die Ecke ! Allerdings reichen zwei Nächte, da es nicht so viel zu sehen gibt . Wir würden lieber dann ein Hotel am Time Square empfehlen!

title: New, Nice, Good Views
text: Rooms are "standard Marriott," but this place appears to be in good shape.  The views (at least from my room on the top 38th floor) were very nice all around.  Front desk people were conscientious, helpful, friendly.  The sports bar food was average, but they've got plenty of TV screens which is what you really come for anyway.  There's construction on the streets around the hotel; if you're driving, the last quarter-mile of your trip may take you half an hour or more.  Easy couple-block walk over to the Hudson and there are several restaurants within a few blocks outside the hotel.

title: Respectable hotel
text: Stayed here for a business meeting. The rooms are comfortable and reasonably sized. Breakfast in the restaurant on the first floor is very cheap by any standard, particularly New York.  The TV system is terrible like many hotels that have digital server systems these days. Almost impossible to watch with all the pixelation and distortion. Location is very close to Ground Zero and the Freedom Tower.

title: Platinum Concierge Service for Platinum Elite Members
text: Hotel has a great concierge lounge with splendid views of New York City Harbor. The food and beverage offerings are nice compared to other properties in NYC. However, they pale in comparison to the hotels' concierge evening manager, Mario H. I stay at this property frequently and from the first day I arrived Mario made me feel like royalty. When I have guests that come to visit NYC Mario is listed among the highlights! Mario sets a standard that should be duplicated across all Marriott properties. There are many choices for lodging when I'm traveling to NYC for business, but Mario's excellent guest service makes it hard to stay anywhere else.

title: Great location, excellent view
text: Room on the 34st floor with a great view over NYC harbor and statue of liberty. Room was clean and spacious. Hotel staff was friendly. Location near Freedom tower with all subway lines within 2 blocks to uptown. Definitely consider this hotel for my next stay.

title: Hotel Concierge for Gold and Platinum Elite Members
text: Hotel has a wonderful and quaint concierge lounge on the 38th floor, with stunning views of New York City Harbor.   However, the most distinguishing characteristic of this hotels' concierge is it's evening manager Mario Headcock who treats all guests like they personally belong to his Marriott Family.  Mario sets a standard in hospitality that surpasses any concierge lounge I have visited.  He uniquely balances professional excellence with personal hospitality in ways that are rarely seen in the hospitality industry. I specifically choose this hotel over any other hotel in Manhattan, for no other reason than Mario's excellent service. Mario is a tribute to excellence of the Marriott Corporation and Marriott Downtown.

title: Great location
text: hotel overall was very good. Two bars helped. However one of them closed at 11pm. food was good. Location was the the best for going to the Wall street area and 9/11 Memorial. Rooms could have used some TLC. Did see they were replacing toilets when we left. That was a good sign

title: Perfect Location
text: This is a great hotel located one block from Tower One and 9/11 Memorial Site.  The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Room was clean and comfortable. Walking distance to many area attractions; i.e. Battery Park. Also, they have a Starbucks on site. Which made me extremely happy in the morning. I definitely will stay here again!!

title: Good downtown location for sightseeing lower Manhattan
text:
The New York Marriott Downtown is an older hotel that Marriott has refurbished since 9-11-2001. The facility is on West and Albany Streets, just one block from the 9-11 Memorial. It is also around five blocks from Battery Park where you can take ferries to the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island. The location also puts you close by Tribeca,

There are also a lot of good eateries in the area, including a Morton's Steakhouse just around the corner on Albany. This is a good thing because the hotel restaurant, Bill's Bar and Burger is basically a sports bar with cuisine of that quality. It also serves breakfast which was OK.

On the other hand, Bill's Westside Bar is very good. It is on the ground facing West Street and has an extensive wine and beer menu. Note that on weekdays it will tend to crowd up after.

I suggest you pay a little more and get a room with a view of the river. From our room we could see - the Colgate Clock  the old Erie Lackawanna Railroad Terminal, Ellis Island, the Statue of Liberty and the Verrazano Narrows Bridge.

title: Efficient and pleasant
text: This is a good hotel and we have been treated very well. It is more practical than luxurious, but you'll find everything you need. The room was spacious with a beautiful view. The staff was always helpful. There is a restaurant inside and apart from the unbereable cold (we hate AC!!!), we had breakfast and it was good. We know New York very well and we and any time we like to change hotel and the location in order to see all the different parts of the city. This hotel is right next to the World Trade Center and of course to go Uptown you have to expect a lot of traffic or a long trip with the Subaway, but it would be the same if you were on the opposite side. The traffic in Manhattan is crazy and there is no escape!!

title: ottimo hotel
text: Perchè non mettere wi-fi gratis? Per il resto nulla da dire. Vista mozzafiato e camera spaziosa per gli standard di New York. Consiglierei un piano alto, noi eravamo al 36esimo. A due passi dal MEmorial Center e dal ferry per la statua della Libertà.

title: Incompetent Front Desk Giving Away Confirmed Rooms
text:
Horrible experience flying from California and arriving here after midnight to find out that they gave my room away and wanted to move me 1 hour away. What's the purpose of a reservation and a cancellation penalty if they give away your room after a long cross country flight.

Clearly not well managed or organized. Front desk was not helpful. My guess is that this is a franchise property and not Marriott operated. They should take the brand down as they don't deserve it.

title: Convenient Location
text: My husband and I took a spur-of-the-moment weekend trip to New York, and this hotel was such a great choice. Really convenient location to the subway, gorgeous view of the Statue of Liberty from our room, and the staff went out of their way to be both gracious and accommodating. Great experience.

title: 3 1/2 stars for me... and mostly a business hotel
text:
Obviously, you would expect it to be a business hotel if it's in NYC's Financial district. But you'd be amazed at the amount of tourists staying there. If you're on vacation not the best location, hence the price.

Older building but super well kept. Clean, greeeeaaaat Marriott beds. Way larger rooms than average in the city. Great views to the water.

The problems we encountered: 

-Wifi NOT free and super expensive- Marriott people most of the competition offers some kind of free wifi nowadays. 
-Front desk personnel weren't the most cooperative. 
-Location is a bummer at night, not much to do around the area. 
-Food at the hotel is ridiculously expensive and since there are not many options in the area you may not have the chance to avoid it depending on the time of day.

So if on business for a couple of days, this is a fine option. Otherwise... not so much.

title: City View, City Lights
text: I stayed at this hotel for a business trip.  The staff was very friendly but in order to maximize your stay, you should be a Mariott rewards member.  Internet is not free unless you are a rewards member.   There is a great restaurant/bar at in the lobby level which hosts a great happy hour.  This was in a prime location for me as it was close to the financial district which has great restaurants and shopping in the area.  This is also not far from catching a water taxi to the Statute of Liberty.  I highly recommend especially during the spring/summer.

title: Long Weekend in New York
text:
I have visited New York a number of times. However this time was a pure leisure and truism.
New York Marriott Down Town is not a typical tourist hotel. One would argue it may be more business centric?
However we have found it very, very good.  Friendly porter at the door steps directs you to the reception where Kevin looked after us exceptionally well and professionally. Smart, cool guy with a nice approach calming us down after unpleasant taxi ride from JFK Airport. Thank you for that.
Room with exceptionally comfortable bed, nice view, clean and fresh. Advisable to have a room on the highest floors. Hotel has a gym on the fifth floor (bigger than expected with modern cardio equipment).
For Gold and Platinum Members, Executive Lounge (closed on Saturday until Sunday evening) is located on the 38th floor. Couple of ladies work very hard to make sure adequate breakfast is served every morning. Lounge gets very busy and it is really an effort to keep all under control and both ladies are well organised and they manage to have a smile on their faces. It helps to start a good day.
Alternatively breakfast is served downstairs in the Bill’s Restaurant (recommend to take continental breakfast only), otherwise one need a doggy bag!
During evenings lounge serves some snacks, soft drinks and spirits (chargeable at reasonable prices).
The Host – Mario is a legend in his own time!! Exceptionally friendly, entertaining, approachable and full of stories. One evening thanks to Mario’s company we have stayed there for over two hours forgetting what time it was.
The only thing I would change in the lounge is the coffee machine. It is either broken or outdated. No matter what button is pushed coffee comes out the same. 
Hotel is located just on the edge of Ground Zero (Down Town Manhattan or as it was previously known “Mannhatta” – island of many hills). Some five minutes’ walk from Rectory tube station and 10 minutes from Wall Street Broadway). Twenty minutes later one is at Times Square. I recommend 20 dollar travel card, purchased from ticket office and being able to top it up when money runs out. It can be used/shared by multiple users. In the other direction 10 minutes’ walk gets one to Battery Park and Statue of Liberty cruises (apparently in order to explore the inside of the Statue tickets have to be bought on line some three months ahead of the trip). 
Hotel offers calm location and environment after hustling and bustling all day in Up Town.
All in all a very pleasant break, big thank you to all the staff in the hotel (champagne glasses too).
Now I know all about New York and can apply to be a concierge in the hotel. I reckon they need one.
Cheers

title: Average hotel not up to the best Marriott standards
text: We stay in Marriott occasional and have Marriott rewards. Most Marriotts have great beds. The first room had a broken down bed with bad springs and squeaks. Also defective door lock. They moved us to another room with slightly better bed but the toilet in the room next door overflowed during the night and maintenance keep us up from 1-3 AM.  Also there was a noisy convention in hotel and soundproofing is very poor. After complaining they moved us to a nicer room on upper floor, but still mediocre bed and poor soundproofing.  Hotel restaurant mediocre. Location is convenient BUT there is major street construction in area around world trade center site.

title: Top für Städtetrip
text:
Wir waren in diesem Hotel für einige Nächte um New York zu erkunden. Freundliche Mitarbeiter, gut ausgestattete Zimmer,  nette und gute Restaurants in unmittelbarer Nähe und in Laufnähe viele Dinge die man als New York Besucher sehen will. Frühstück weiß ich nicht, da wir immer woanders zum Frühstück waren.
Preis /Leistung passt auf jeden Fall, wir könnens nur empfehlen. WLAN im Zimmer sehr teuer 14 US-Dollar/Nacht in der Lobby frei.
Wallstreet, Ground Zero und Fähre zur Freiheitsstatue in wenigen Minuten und auch Brooklyn Bridge mit netten Geschäften zu Fuß erreichbar

title: Only if you want to be a tourist...
text:
I usually stay in Wall Street area to avoid tourist and crowds, but this time decided to stay in Marriott to be close to Tribeca. I stayed in many Marriotts so I figured it can't be that bad, hotel itself is old but not that bad, however due to its location it feels like a budget hotel not a full service Marriott. It is jam packed, people coming and going, talking and banging the doors, noise everywhere at all times. I happened to stay on top floor which had the least commotion but still you can hear everyone. Room itself was nice enough, large for NYC and beautiful views, just lovely. Room has coffee maker and fridge. It is standard Marriott room, no complaints. 

I will not stay here again solely based on the fact that it is best suited for tourists. If you want peace and quiet you will not find it. However if you are a tourist, you will enjoy this hotel.

title: Convenient location but ...
text: This hotel is steps from the WTC and convenient to Wall St., Statute of Liberty, Battery Park, Brooklyn Bridge so in many respects is very convenient. It is not necessarily  "convenient" to Times Square, Central Park, Soho etc. unless you are familiar with the subway lines.  Not all lines go to this end of Manhattan and especially later at night there may be fewer subway options.  Having said that, as long as you are familiar with the subway lines then I would describe this area as very convenient.  What is nice about this location is that across West St. is Battery Park City which is residential, office mix and has an excellent sea wall.  As is the case in NYC there are many local eateries but not as many restaurant options, although Morton's Steak House is across the street.  Staff were excellent. Starbucks downstairs.

title: Far from everywhere (except for Battery Park and WTC)
text: Overall it was a 3 start experience. Old hotel, far from everything (Except for Battery Park and WTC memorial). The room service and restaurant food are not particularly good but not bad either. They charge you for internet unless you are in Marriott rewards program. Had to stay there as a part of a wedding party otherwise it wouldn't be my first choice.

title: Incredible views!
text:
Our family came to USA from overseas. We live in DC. We decided to take them to New York for a vacation. This is the second time in 2 months. We initially stayed in Times Square, in the Marriott marquis, and we didn't like it. We canceled our second night there, and decided to stay downtown, within proximity of the World Trade Center. We found this hotel. We requested a Hudson River view.
They got us a room on the 33rd floor, and the view was breathtaking and spectacular! Spot on. We also had the amenities we needed. We easily walked on to the World Trade Center plaza within five minutes (if it weren't for the financial center's construction). From the elevator bank, you could look up at the new World Trade Center tower 1. From the room, you could see the Hudson River and jersey city, as well as the Goldman Sachs tower. Awesome overlook!
My only complaint is in the lobby, the restaurant (I can't recall its name) was extremely cold. We all got sick, and we came upstairs and had room service within five minutes.
Overall, I would totally recommend this hotel (that is, if you bring a jacket or if you have room service!

title: El New York Marriott Downtown es un hotel para hombres y mujeres de negocios.
text:
El Hotel New York Marriott Downtown es un hotel para hombres y mujeres de negocios que requieren de un hotel cómodo y cercano a las zonas de oficinas y centros de negocios.
Las habitaciones son agradables y tienen conexión para Ipod, minibar y todas las mañanas se sirve un desayuno completo a solo diez minutos de Wall Street, la Bolsa de Valores de NY y  la zona CERO.

title: Perfect location and staff-
text: This location is great for people who don't prefer to drive into the city but have a need to like I did! Avoid city traffic with this hotel utilizing FDR drive to the Tunnel (I believe it was the Brooklyn/Battery) And you will find the most helpful valet EVER waiting on the sidewalk to park your car. Whew! Sure made this a whole lot easier. Statue of Liberty easy walk- Subway - easy walk. I will add - there are fountains at Battery Park - my daughter enjoyed cooling off after the Statue/ made a few quick friends - wished she had her bathing suit - it was an improtu event - and a highlight. Hotel food service was fast and very good. Staff is accommodating and professional in every aspect. Well done! Rooms are a little small - but you really don't spend much time there anyway. I paid for an upgraded room but my view of the Statue was blocked by a building. I'd probably tell others just to ask for a higher room at check in.

title: Adorei!!!
text: O localização é ótima!! O metrô é próximo.  É bem tranquilo a noite.  O Hotel não oferece café da manhã mas existem vários lugares bem próximos e também podemos contar com uma loja do Starbucks no térreo. O serviço de quarto é muito bom.

title: Nice place
text: Walking distance to loads of lower Manhattan attractions. Common areas are bright and clean but rooms  are compact and a bit over crowded but typical of NYC hotels. Our bathroom was in need of some repair work from a leaky ceiling and some sloppy wallpaper work. Not a fault of the hotel but there was alot of construction on many nearby streets with no sidewalks and very limited weekend subway service which made sightseeing quite a challenge. Google maps was not very helpful as it didn't account for closed streets.  Wi-fi was very, very slow.

title: Good location for Battery Park
text: Family trip to New York, meant looking for somewhere reasonably priced. This hotel fitted the bill. The hotel was clean and the rooms were of a good size for New York, staff were helpful and friendly enough however this Marriott just didn't quite match up to the Marriott brand. We had a fridge in the room which we found very useful. We asked for water view rooms and that is what we got, however there is some construction around which partially obscures the view and the water views are no where near as good as the views from the Ritz Carlton Battery Park.

title: Great location
text: The hotel is clean, room was clean, fridge include.  We had an awesome view of the area.  Good view of the statue of Liberty out of my window.  Only a few blocks to Ground Zero musume.   Lots of resturants, near grocery store, beautiful sights, great walking experience.

title: So good we stayed there twice.
text:
Our second visit to the NY Downtown Marriott, the second being 2 years ago, but this was more of family trip and this time with my daughter on the outside so she can claim to have been to NY twice now.  
We were given a double room overlooking the Statue of Liberty which was more the we asked for and the requested cot, (crib for the Yanks) which, as seems to be usual where ever we go, was provided promptly with an apology for not being there in the first place.  And it was an actual cot, not one of the fold up travel ones which my little rat-bag takes exception to and enjoys running her nails down the mesh in protest.
Cant fault the staff and the room was clean and comfortable the two Housekeepers we had (who both had the ability to be cleaning the room whenever we returned from the morning excursion) were friendly and appreciative that we were more than happy to let them crack on while we amused horrible daughter by chasing her up and down the corridor outside.

Wall St, Rector and Fulton subway stations are all within a stones throw of the hotel so you can get anywhere you want with ease (except at weekends when the planned work occurs and replacement buses have been put on but New Yorkers don't know what's going on then either and its simpler to find another route).

9/11 memorial is also nearby and for parents, Battery Park over the bridge has a play area that was ideal for a water obsessed 18 month year old and would suit kids up to junior school age and maybe beyond.

Wifi is free to Marriott rewards members so make sure that you're a member and at $14 a day if you've points from some other rewards scheme sat around doing nothing its worth checking out one of the websites (the pointsguy etc )that takes you through one of the routes to transfer them to bump up your membership level.

We'd happily stay there again if we return to New York.

title: Disappointing Service
text: I'm quite disappointed by the level of customer service here. I booked my room (statue of liberty view) months ago directly from the marriott website. We just had a long day of traveling for a quick 2 day trip in NYC. I had stated all my requests through their website about a King room, the late check-in and the statue view room and as I'm a marriott rewards member wifi should be free. We get 10pm after a long day (and here to celebrate our 4 year anniversary), reception staff seems nice enough but when I checked in she tells me I have to pay for wifi to which I told her I'm a member (can't this be checked in the system) so she had to check before validating. We get to our room on the 33rd floor and the room are twin beds with no statue of liberty view. We take all our bags back down to find out what's going on only to be told this room is not available. Since this is what was paid for why was it not told when we arrived? And why was it not available in the first place if we booked it months ago? No one checked our information before we arrived? I never write reviews especially disappointing ones like this but the fact that the room managers downstairs - after the fact we were disappointed didn't even apologize and just said they would give us back the difference and we could get our room tomorrow and as of right now downgraded. This is not the level of service I thought of the Marriott since it's always been amazing every where else we've stayed. We have another two days to go here and I'm already not looking forward which is sad because everything else seems to amazing. I do not see the point in being a marriott rewards member if the treatment and service lacks in every way.

title: Outstanding customer service, best location in NY
text: All personnel were very professional and service excellent. I was running very late one time (past midnight) so I called the hotel and at the arrival time I waited for a few minutes, I was told that the hotel was sold out but my room was guaranteed--and yes minutes later I was on my way to my room. Later I asked about wireless they informed me that since I was a Marriott Rewards member I had free wireless.

title: Anonimo
text: camere piccole per essere un 4 stelle, posizione non eccellente perchè di sera non c'è praticamente nulla da fare. Incredibile soggiornare in un 4 stelle e dover pagare x avere il wifii. Nel complesso abbastanza anonimo

title: Best hotel I have ever visisted
text:
I went to NEw York Marriott Downtown hotel and spent an awesome night there, and slept, from far, on the best pillow I have ever slept on

Maybe the view from my windows was not that nice, but the clerc, the place, and the comfort was just what I was expecting from such a hotel

Thanks

title: Sehr sehr schönes und geräumiges Hotel
text:
Das Hotel ist sehr modern ausgestattet. 
Der Service war bis auf eine kleine Ausnahme großartig! 
Unser Flieger landete um 6:00 am und das einchecken wurde uns schon um 9:00 Uhr möglich gemacht (glücklicherweise waren Zimmer frei). 

Das Hotel ist nicht weit vom World-Trade-Center entfernt. (U-Bahn Haltestelle)
Weitere U-Bahn Haltestelle wäre direkt die Wallstreet. 

Im Hotel befindet sich auch ein Starbucks und ein Restaurant ( welches auch den Zimmerservice beliefert). 

Hatte das Hotel über booking.com gebucht und schon im Voraus bezahlt. Leider wurde der volle Betrag erneut von meiner Kreditkarte belastet. Hoffe allerdings, dass sich dieser Fehler noch klärt. 

Nachdem auschecken war es auch möglich unsere Koffer im Hotel zu lassen und sie später vor unserem Nachtflug zurück nach Frankfurt wieder abzuholen! (ohne Aufpreis) 

WLAN ist für eine Nacht auch gratis nutzbar. 

Absolute Empfehlung für dieses Hotel!

title: Excellent Concierge at Marriott Downtown New York
text: Excellent concierge (Mario) at the concierge’s lounge on the 38th floor.  For a Marriott the service Mario provides is that of luxury 5 star hotels.  I travel over 200+ days a year and not all concierge lounges are the same.  It is the concierge that makes the lounge a welcome home after a long day and can refresh the traveler with customer service and that is what Mario does!  He knows New York City and helps the out of town traveler with the best transportation routes in addition to assisting regular guests with new trendy hot spots. If looking for a hotel concierge’s lounge with spectacular service then ask for Mario at the Marriott Downtown.

title: Very nice hotel.
text: Everyone was very nice. I got in really early and had requested early check in. My room was ready. Room was very adequate but could use an update. Bed very comfortable. Great location to be near downtown. I got turned around getting off subway and called the hotel. Denise very patiently guided me back.

title: Excellent accomodations in Lower Manhattan.
text: Very easy check-in with Marriott's mobile smartphone check-in app. Room, on the 32nd floor, was perfect in every way, except the TV reception, via satellite I believe, was a bit fuzzy. Large group meeting in their banquet facilities did not seem to faze them. Hotel has an on-site Starbucks and a FedEx Office Center. Their restaurants and bar were very good.  Their banquet food was, well, banquet food.

title: Grande deception
text:
Un vetement perdu par la bagagerie, un wifi payant, un accueil limite , vraiment pas au niveau du prix de la chambre
La chambre reste petite, le petit dejeuner est en plus, bref un rapport qualite prix desastreux que ne compense pas la situation geographique pres de ground zero

title: ♡♥Warm welcome
text: Excellent reception! Mr. M.Lyerto, op.mgr., is very nice and welcome me very very good. (pls. apologize if I write his name wrong.) And very much appreciate Ms.Andrea's hospitality at first sight. Fortunately your hotel has got these 2 valuable staff who make your hotel impressed me.

title: Trip to 9/11 museum
text: Very expensive. No free internet in rooms only in lobby. Driving directions to hotel very complicated and unclear. Got my own directions from map, no problem.  Room ok but drapes were falling off rods. Concierge never showed up in 3 days. Front desk not helpful.   It was clean and a great location for 9/11 museum. Also close to Hudson River and great restaurants. The restaurant in hotel not great.The doorman  and bellmen were wonderful and knew more about the area than the staff that checked us in.

title: Average hotel with above average staff
text: The rooms date from Marriott's rather bland design era and are large but nothing special. The hotel restaurant is a burger bar with a pedestrian menu--one night closing time was at 1030 (so much for the "city that never sleeps"). The lobby bar was closed more often than not during our stay. That said, the staff is excellent. The doorman is witty and helpful and the bellmen were excellent--one even walked us outdoors to point the way to our destination. If you have business around Wall Street or want to see the 9/11 Memorial, it's worth a look if you can get a good rate. Finally, the hotel follows Marriott's policy wherein Wi Fi is free in their cheaper brands but costs $14.95 per day in the supposedly, more luxurious, Marriott brand. Luckily, we'd booked on the Marriott site so we were comped.

title: Poor onsite dinner experience
text:
I had a nice 22nd floor corner room, slightly larger than the average Manhattan hotel room.  Front desk service was good and chocolate cookies inidividually wrapped was a nice touch.  Concierge was someone you had to wait on from the front desk staff.

What turned me down was somewhat overpriced mediocre food available on premise.  Menu limited to burgers, in a financial district for dinner, its a shame.

title: Perfect to attractions
text: Great hotel for the 9/11 Museum and other southern attractions.  Not far from China town or Little Italy.  Had a great dinner at the recommended Bobby Vans.  Room was nice size, bed very comfortable.  Room in pristine condition!  Fitness center was spectacular and my run along the Hudson River was fantastic!!

title: Solid business hotel for convention
text: I was here for a legal conference this month. The rooms were nice ... We upgraded to a higher room for a Hudson River view for $20 more on the 36th floor, which was worth it. Service in the rooms was good, and the hotel was well maintained and tasteful. My only complaint was poor banquet food. I ate two catered lunches here, and of the two, only the spinach and tomato salad one of the days was decent. This is a convenient place for a downtown stay.

title: Excellent!
text: The service at the hotel was great starting with the doorman and continuing with the check in process. The concierge was also helpful. Maid service was nice and helpful. The room was clean and very comfortable. I will stay here again when I am in NYC.

title: Just great.
text: There are Amazon views of anything in just about any room. From WTC which is only a few blocks away, to lady liberty, to the Empire State Building. The room was very clean and SPACIOUS room for New York City. I would definitely stay here again and highl recommend it to anyone, especially Marriott elite members.

title: It's just OK...Needs some TLC
text:
This is NOT a "premier" property with "style and sophistication" as stated in the hotel overview. The hotel is in need of upgrades and I believe the general manager has said in response to other reviews that they are scheduled in early 2016. That being said...Here are the Pro's and Con's:

Pro's: Location Location Location..Battery Park, South Street Seaport and of course the 9/11 Memorial....and the staff is very attentive. Jay at the Bell Hop station is great, very helpful. 

Con's:  Rooms are basic, TV froze and pixelated when changing channels. No full length mirror in room. The only mirror was in bathroom and there's no ventilation in bathroom so mirror fogs, etc. the concierge lounge is very basic...the food was OK and the staff is chatty and friendly but they don't pay a lot of attention to the basics like restocking the fridge or food items. During the evening reception, I felt like I was being stalked...they hover around your table and especially the honor bar...I was looking at the selection and suddenly a staff person was beside me asking me what I preferred and that they would get it for me...told them I was just looking and they said to let them know if I wanted something...I found that very odd...it's an honor bar...if they don't trust folks will honor it, then they should have a bar with bartender instead. I had to ask for Diet Pepsi on several occasions coffee cup lids, crackers for the cheese plater, and the snacks area is hard candy, yogurt covered raisins and a mixed nut jar that was usually empty. Also, it's not a 24 hour lounge. I went up at noon to grab some water and it was locked. So I went to the front desk to get a Pepsi...it was $4.00...Ridiculous. 

Bills Burger place is a joke and the one in the front of the hotel picks and chooses their hours. Closed at 9  one night....The dining and drinking establishments close by certainly benefit from the poor service and odd hours.  If it's in your budget, go to Morton's and sit at the bar, George is great or try the W hotel, great outside deck bar. 

I am not too familiar with NYC and wanted to see the 9/11 Memorial so I though being close was important and as convenient as the location is, I would recommend staying at a different Marriott property like The Marquis and cab it to your points of interest.  

Hopefully this place gets some much needed attention, it has great potential and Marriott is doing itself a disservice by not making this hotel a priority in its property portfolio.

title: Great place
text: I try to stay at a Marriott hotel when I'm away. Thus one was on the good list. Great staff,very friendly. Idris (doorman/bellman) might be my new favorite person. He knows where everything is in the city! The room was very nice. I requested early check in and it was available. I was given a room with an amazing view of the Freedom Tower. I didn't ask for it. What a pleasant surprise. The restaurant in the hotel was really good. We were in walking distance or a short UBER ride of everything we wanted to see. My Birthday in the city 2as fantastic. Thank you Marriott.

title: Not my best Marriott experience
text: I was here for one week and was not really wowed.  There were a couple of logistical issues while I was here But the manager was very understanding and really took care of the issues.  Hats off to him.  It was a comfortable stay but overall average.  The staff were really nice and welcoming to guests who obviously were regulars but I as a newcomer felt less than welcome.  I got this feeling at both the front desk and concierge lounge morning staff.  The Concierge evening staff were great however.  They were pleasant and welcoming and remembered me each evening.  They were the bright spot in my stay.

title: Perfect Proximity to Lady Liberty
text:
I stayed at this hotel with 3 other couples, in 4 separate rooms. We drove right up to the front door, approaching South to North on the FDR, where the valet immediately whisked out car off to the parking garage.  The Lobby was lovely: clean, white, and modern.  Hotel staff was knowledgeable, responsive, and well-mannered.  An attached burger restaurant served a delicious lunch, and had a chic 'casual vibe', without being pretentious.

My husband and I stayed in a queen room on the 9th floor. The room was very clean, smelled absolutely neutral, contained new furnishings, and was quite roomy. The bathroom was very large, and even included a make-up station and plenty of outlets for hairdryer, etc.  The bathroom was so clean, I actually had the confidence to take an actual soak in the tub, without seeing ANY residual grossness anywhere make a cameo appearance to creep me out!

The bed was very comfortable, high quality sheets, cozy comforter and blanket, and a plethora of pillows of different types, for our sleeping comfort. There was a good 8 feet between the foot of the bed and the edge of the desk across from it- enough space for morning yoga if one was so inclined.  I appreciated the bedside lamps with outlets in base for phone charging, and more outlets on the desk! This hotel got the memo that folks with many devices need many outlets! 

While it didn't have a spectacular view, I know many rooms on the upper floors have Statue of Liberty views. Our view faced east, and while simply including views of other buildings, it wasn't a horrifying air-shaft or back-alley garbage dock.  The windows had the usual chiffon glide-backs, it also had very efficient black-out curtains that kept the AC nice and cold in the room, and blocked out every speck of light.

At one point, when we went to actually 'go' for our reservation to see the Statue of Liberty on a harbor cruise, I realized that I needed to physically print out my confirmation form, and the front desk was more than happy to oblige, gave us directions to the dock, and an estimated walking time to our destination.  The only drawback we experienced was that we had requested our rooms be on the same floor and booked well in advance, however, the hotel was unable to accommodate this request. This was somewhat disappointing, but in the end didn't make a huge difference to the quality of our stay. 

Overall, we were delighted with our stay at the Marriot Downtown NYC, and we'd absolutely stay there again.

title: Amazing location.  2 blocks to World Trade Center
text: This is a great location in Lower Manhattan.  Located only 2 blocks from the World Trade Center Complex.  The views are spectacular.  It's not cheap, but the hotel is an excellent Marriott Property. Its short walk along the dedicated walking/biking path to Battery Park.  You will have easy access to all the subway lines.   Parking is expensive at either the hotel garage or any other local garage.

title: Very Good Location
text: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights. It is conveniently located in the south end of Manhattan. It is a short walk to the subway and a short 10 minute walk to Battery Park. Also, the Freedom Tower is only two blocks away. The hotel is clean and well maintained. The room is a bit small, but it is expected in NYC. Across the main row (West Street) are blocks of apartments and further is a very nice walkway next to the Hudson River. It is great place to take a walk in the evening.

title: Great location downtown
text:
Stayed at the Marriott for 4 nights in August. It is very close to 3 metro lines, a number of markets and shops, and right next to the 9/11 memorial museum and reflecting pools.
Other than a few hitches with arranging the pull out bed and the appropriate linens which were unnecessary and should have been taken care of - the stay was great and I'll stay again. 
The location of the Starbucks right off the lobby is also a must for this this coffee lover!

title: Great location for Lady Liberty, Ellis Island, 9/11 Memorial & Museum
text: I was visiting NYC to do the tourist sights, Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, 9/11 Memorial and wanted a location that was convenient to these locations. Didn't want to spend a lot of time commuting from an uptown hotel. The New York Marriott Downtown fit the bill. While the rooms on higher floors might have a slightly better view, I still had a view that included the water and I spent less time in the elevator going to & from my room. Winner! One oddity about the elevators at the hotel - not all elevators go to all floors. The elevators on the right side go to different floors than the left side. Once you have it figured out which elevators to use, it's not a big deal. I had a very large room on the 6th floor. Love the Marriott bed - always get a good night's sleep. Really liked that the room had a mini refrigerator in it. The weather was very warn in NYC when I visited so being able to have a nice cold beverage waiting for me when I got back to my room was great. The hotel is located in a very central area for public transportation (subway is 2 blocks away, several different bus lines within 3 blocks) so it was so easy to get anywhere I wanted to go. Battery Park was an easy couple of blocks away, so that made it ultra convenient for visiting Lady Liberty & Ellis Island. The ferry leaves from Battery Park. The hotel is within spitting distance of the 9/11 Memorial & Museum. There is also a small grocery store about a 2 block walk away from the hotel so you can easily grab whatever drinks & snacks you want during your stay. Would stay here again. Didn't eat at the hotel's restaurant or bar so can't give you any info on them. My housekeeper - Connie - was amazing. I had gotten a late start one day (due to not felling well) and had told her I did not need my room serviced, so I expected to come back to my room the way I had left it - in a bit of a mess. She had noticed that I had left my room and tidied it up anyway. In addition she left me a bottle of water so I could stay hydrated. Stellar service! I also used the Marriott Service app to request some additional coffee & coffee condiments. They were delivered in a very short time. It was so convenient - I could just text my request, I didn't have to call anyone and wait for the phone to be answered. Can't wait for this service to be rolled to to more Marriotts. It's in a test phase right now. I give it Two thumbs up.

title: A confortable hotel in downtown
text: Close to 9/11 memorial and subway station is a good option for staying in downtown. There are many restaurants and mini markets around. Would be perfect if would have Wi Fi at the room. Free internet is able only Lobby and you pay US$ 14,95 per day in case of using at the room.

title: Best Location!
text: This hotel is in prime spot, only 5 minutes from World Trade Center Memorial & 15 minute walk to Battery Park.  Starbucks is located right behind hotel just walk through hotel restaurant & take a right.  We stayed on 26th floor & had great view of the Hudson River !!

title: Great property in NYC
text: The New York Marriott Downtown is an excellent full service Marriott. The location as you can imagine is downtown, which for my visit was perfect. I wanted to avoid the crowds and noise of midtown and this property is perfect for that. Located steps from the 9/11 Memorial and Wall St, and subway, you can get to anything you want in minutes. The room I received was a 1BR Executive Suite which was awesome. Huge living room, separate bedroom, large bathroom, and wet bar. The A/C worked very well and the room was definitely soundproofed as noise was not an issue at all. Check-in was quick, the elite breakfast at the restaurant was decent, and the property overall was very clean. I would absolutely stay here again.

title: Getting old...
text: Been there before, maybe 3 years ago.  Hotel is clean, showers okay (most important to me), towels getting threadbare.  Good sleeping, though. The whole place is getting old and could use a good going through.  Disappointing, overall.

title: Great location, comfortable sleep
text: My husband and I stayed at the Marriott Downtown for one night prior to our cruise.  The location is great, just a block from the 9/11 Memorial and a few blocks from the Battery.  The closest subway station was temporarily closed.  The walk to another was about 5 blocks.  We were given a 32nd floor room overlooking the Hudson.   Very nice view.  Unfortunately, the view of the Statue of Liberty was blocked by a tall building.  There is a restaurant and a Starbucks on the ground floor.  With my Marriott Rewards membership, we got free WiFi.

title: Great hotel downtown
text: Great hotel for business trips downtown. Nice sized rooms. Clean. Pretty good burger place in the lobby with a large beer selection. Small Starbucks outside lobby. Right next to world trade. My go-to hotel these days when I have meetings in New York.

title: Great hotel
text: I was in the city for a conference,but when I lived in Manhattan I hung out at the bar in this hotel. Room was great and clean, so close to the 911 memorial and I like the location because it's downtown and not where EVERYBODY is.

title: Very good hotel, great location
text:
We spent two nights at Marriott Downtown Manhattan. Location of the hotel is great. It is right next to the World Trade Centre Memorial and within walking distance to subway, Wall Street and the ferry to Statute of Liberty. Room is very spacious as well with everything we need within finger tips.

Bed is very comfortable and hotel is very quiet. We will definitely come back again.

title: Great stay at the Marriott Downtown
text:
I stayed here for a wedding.  I didn't use many amenities since we were busy for the wedding, but it was great for what we needed.  

When we checked in we were given the incorrect room type - we had booked a two bed room and received a single.  One call downstairs and they moved us to the correct room within a few minutes.  

The rooms were clean and well appointed.  Since I was in the bridal party I also got a look at the bridal suite, which was gorgeous.  Huge living room and dining room area with a separate bedroom, and great views of the city.

This was a beautiful hotel and I would not hesitate to stay here again.

title: La qualità Marriott
text: Ottimo hotel con camere ampie e dotate di ogni comfort. Durante il nostro periodo di soggiorno il foyer era in fase di restauro ma nessun disagio percepito. Punti in più grazie al bar all'ultimo piano! Non metto la quinta stella solo per obbiettività in quanto frequentando la catena può vantare hotel migliori in contesti simili

title: Central to everything with a great restaurant!
text: This hotel is close to everything downtown- walking distance to battery and 911 memorial! Rooms a bit tight but we'll accommodating with comfortable bedding and nicely sound proof. The hotel restaurant and bar are actually reasonable with good quality food ! I was not disappointed - great service during my whole stay!

title: Customer service - not
text:
Functional business hotel during the week, with lots of tourists at the weekend. Room overlooked the Hudson river was well cleaned every day. Stayed over three weekends. On the middle weekend we were given a room on 27 floor, but most of the floor had been subject to a serious flood and was full of humidifiers, pipes and towels on the floor at the entrance to all rooms.  I asked reception if the humidifiers would be running all night and I was advised they would be.  A requested a change of floor, which was done immediately - not really the point though as they should not have put guests in any of those rooms. By chance the day after the flooding, the General Manager was in the lift, so I tackled him about the issue.  He explained that there had been a flood, which I kind of guessed!!, but was hardly apologetic about putting customers in rooms on that floor.  An apology and some recompense might have been a more appropriate response.
Never mind, on the third visit, the check in staff gave a me an envelope as 'guest of the day'.  Something good I thought, but it turned out to be a voucher for one cup of Starbucks coffee from the in-house cafe. When I went to redeem it, all I could get was a cup of filter coffee, with an extra charge if you wanted a cappuccino or latte - the voucher must have cost Marriott at least 'a quarter'!  Something more meaning full might have been more appropriate.

title: Fine rooms but service and recognition of loyalty in need of improvement
text:
To a certain extent, expectations for business travel are pretty simple - comfortable room, hot water, TV, and a gym.  This property certain meets those hygiene factors.  However, it really needs to step up its game to set itself apart in terms of service or recognition of loyalty to the brand.  

So far on this stay my team and I have experience the following: a complete lack of recognition of platinum and gold status with Marriott and a failure to upgrade or even thank any of us for our loyalty, charging for wine in the concierge lounge, mistakenly checking out a guest early, being terse when a key card no longer works.  The common thread here is that these are problems easily fixed by having the staff simply do their job and recognize that they are brand ambassadors for the entire Marriott family of brands.  It's a really disappointing miss.

Pros: location, fantastic gym, comfortable and well appointed rooms

Cons: service, recognition for loyalty

If you're seeing a place to go to sleep, this hotel will do fine.  If you're looking for service, check out another of the Marriott brands in the area.  You'll be glad you did.

title: Great stay at NY Downtown Marriott!
text: We booked a double room at the hotel from 7/17-7/20. We had an early flight and arrived at the hotel around 11 am, much earlier than the 4 pm check-in time. Since our room was ready, they gave us the keys right away, which typically isn't the norm in NYC unless you'd like to pay an early check-in fee. Our room was on the 12th floor in the corner, so we had windows on two walls. The room was spotless and pretty large for NYC. The beds were also very comfortable and there were lots of outlets and USB chargers. We had the privacy sign on the door the entire time, but the cleaning staff was happy to give us new towels and take our used ones whenever we saw them in the hallway. The location was also great, just a couple of minutes walking distance from the World Trade Center and from Battery Park, as well as close to the subway. This is a great hotel with great staff and we will be happy to come back soon!

title: Convenient Location
text: This hotel is a very central hotel and within walking distance of The World Trade Centre, Battery Park and plenty of walking areas by the Hudson River. We did walk the whole way to Times Square by the river when possible but we availed of public transport coming back to the hotel. Rooms in this hotel were very clean and comfortable and the staff were very pleasant.

title: schickes Hotel nahe am Broadway
text:
Das Hotel War sehr gut. Die Zimmer sind groß und sauber. Dazu gibt es noch ein Fitnessraum wo man auch mal sich auspowern kann.
Lage: Top Lage in Manhattan und nur 5 Minuten von Wallstreet und ground zero entfernt 
Service: sehr netter Service an der Rezeption. Leider gibt es kein Frühstück und (wie in amerikanischen großen Hotels üblich) soll man im Hotel bei Starbucks frühstücken aber es gibt in der Nähe einen Supermarkt über den man sich verpflegen kann.

title: Visit July 7, 2015
text:
Excellent location wonderful staff. Executive chef Edward l. Pasch had a wonderful spread in the concierge. The cocktail shrimp and the beef were delicious.  Looking forward to my next visit.

Hotel located steps from 911 museum and Hudson River park

title: Convenient location
text: This is a nice hotel very conveniently located and close to the subway. It's also very close to the World Trade Center, Battery Park, Wall Street and not too far from Brooklyn Bridge. One can also find decent restaurants nearby for lunch. We had a spacious room on the 15th floor, away from the noise of the city. If one can get a good deal, like we did, by paying in advance, it is certainly worth it. We discovered (by chance) that there is free Wi-Fi in the hall: so do not pay to have it in the room!

title: Confortable, well run
text: This is a very handy location if you have business around Wall Street or, like us, want to do things downtown over the weekend for a change.  Hand for the World Trade Center tower and the Memorial; easy to reach by subway or bus.  The rooms are good-sized with usual Marriott comforts.  Some of the rooms have views of the Statue of Liberty, which our out-of-town guest rightly thought wonderful.  The staff here seem at the top of their game - very professional and on-the-ball.  If you order the continental breakfast in the restaurant, the bakery basket will defeat you.  A very comfortable stay.  Shirts are $10.

title: liberty view room
text:
Stayed there for 3 nights in a liberty view room. I think the statue is too small when look from the room, it's not worth the extra price. Maybe a city view room is better.
The location is good, walking distance to train station, wall station, WTC center. 
Services are excellent, although some front desk can be more courteous (like answering question with a smile instead of a stone face)

title: HOTEL MUY BIEN UBICADO
text:
Lo mejor es su ubicación está cerca del parque donde se toma el ferry para ir a la estatua de la libertad, y cerca del World Trade Center, en el bajo Manhattan, 

Lo malo, que no respetaron la reserva que ya estaba paga con antelación, y la primera noche nos ubicaron en otro hotel de la misma cadena.
Los colchones ya deben cambiarlos , pues se al acostarse quedan hundidos.
el aseo bueno
El personal de la Recepción muy cordial

title: Good location
text: Great location to be for the Wtc museum, one World Trade Center tower battery park Wall Street Brooklyn bridge. The service is good had one of the rooms with a view of the Statue of Liberty.. My only gripe with this place is they want $14.95 a day for wifi. In this day and age that is a joke. Hey Marriott join the 21st century.

title: ロウアー・マンハッタンの観光拠点に良い
text:
独立記念日の7月4日に家族で滞在。
歩いていける範囲にワンワールドセンター、バッテリーパーク、トリニティ教会、ウォール街、ブルックリンブリッジがありますし、レストランも豊富にあるので朝でも夜でも食事の場所には困りませんでした。ホテル１ＦにはスターバックスとBill’ｓというダイナーがありますのでホテル内でも食事は一応可能です。
23階ツインダブルに滞在、部屋からはハドソンリバーが望めます。広さはマンハッタン内としては広めで、リバービューですので解放感があります。下層階でも川側の部屋はホテル前の大通りに面してますので、圧迫感はないと思いますが。そうは言ってもマンハッタン内のホテルですので広いという訳ではありませんが。ホテル自体は古いのですが、部屋、廊下などは清潔に保たれています。Wifiは有料です。

title: Horrible experience-esp bad for families
text:
I stayed here back in October 2014 for a wedding and would not recommend this to anyone, especially families with young children.

Let's begin with entering--there is no ramp to push up a stroller.  Instead, there is a flight of marble esque stairs.  This is this really slow wheelchair elevator to the right as you enter, but its so slow and not consistent in function, it simply isnt practical to get in and out of the hotel with kids and a stroller.

Secondly, on the day of check out, i called to tell the front desk we would be checking out later after breakfast.  They told me they made note of this.  As I was walking back to our room with our 3 small children, i saw that our room door was ajar.  I was immediately frightened and concerned about my children and my safety.  I pushed open the door and saw no one.  I called out and a woman emerged from the bathroom!  I demanded to know who she was, what her role was and what she was doing in our room.  She kept pointing to her name tag and said she was the manager.  I found that hard to believe as her English was unintelligible.  She never once said sorry, excuse me, or any type of apology. Just kept saying she was the manager and was checking rooms.  I asked why?  I havent even checked out yet,  she huffed away, swearing under her breath but loud enough for me to hear.  The bellman arrived at that moment to witness the end of this interaction.

I immediately looked through all belongings and it appeared secure.  I contacted the front desk manager who took down all information and through the bellman, was able to get the name of the woman (a Victoria, of housekeeping--not a manager).  A few days later a main manager did call me, but never offered a credit for a future stay or anything.  Just a "sorry".  

We have returned to new york 2 more times since, refuse to go back to this marriott, but found the upper east side marriott one much better for families and our needs with superior service and management.

title: nice hotel, good location
text: Location good, walking distance to PATH train. Near World Trade Center. Maybe I was just more tired, but I feel like this bed was more comfy than most hotels (even most Marriotts? maybe my imagination?). Marriott always has nice soaps/amenities. Check-in was very slow, but otherwise no problems. If you go to the Starbucks in the lobby, allow extra time in the morning--slowest Starbucks ever. We had drinks at the restaurant attached to the hotel, and I was amazed at how reasonably they were priced, especially for NYC! Our waitress at that restaurant was very nice as well.

title: New York City Tour
text:
Das Hotel hat uns sehr gut gefallen
Der Service war hervorragend
WiFi nur im Lobbybereich sonst sehr teuer im Zimmer
Das Hotel ist etwas in die Jahre gekommen
Lage sehr gut, auch der Ausblick auf Freiheitsstatue war nur bedingt da zwischen 2 Hochhäuser

title: Great location for downtown visit
text: I stayed here because it was convenient to a meeting I was attending and I would certainly come back for any other downtown overnights.  It was close to subways and easy walk to the 9/11 site, South Street Seaport, and the Wall Street area.  The room was great, nice view and staff were very helpful.

title: Good for Business in Financial District
text:
Enjoyed the 2 night stay. Hotel was clean, bed slept well. Reasonable walk to Battery Park.  If staying in NYC, D
download Uber app....it's a great way to book car service. Much nicer cars than yellow cab and very efficient and fast. You book car when you need it....no reservations accepted.

title: Great for Wall Street Visit
text:
Great Location for visiting Wall Street, Battery Park, 9/11 Memorial site, New Observatory and catching the Ferries to Statue of Liberty etc but a long way from Times Square, Nightlife, Central Park and other tourist attractions in NYC.
Rooms are OK, Elevators a bit slow, seems like a bit of an older hotel. Currently lots of Construction in the area. Easy access to running path along the water

title: amazing stay
text: i recently stayed there last weekend for 4th of July and the place was nice and the bed was comfortable! will stay there again. the location was good it near the new world trade center one observatory and the 9/11 tribute center.  everything is walking distance to subway and bus.

title: Why is internet not free ????
text: I stayed 4 nights in this rather expensive hotel and I was really surprised that I had to pay for using WIfi in the hotelroom ! This is so last-century , Wifi is a commodity , like towels and soap. Pleas include it in the roomrate and be competative with a lot of other hotel who provide free internet in the whole building and not only in the lobby.

title: Decent for one night
text: I stayed here before my cruise and this hotel was just pretty decent. The rooms were very dull although the lobby was very nice. Good location of staying downtown but that's about it. The hotel room service was also mediocre, we ordered dinner and also breakfast.

title: Fabulous Location
text: Great location near Ground Zero. Had a fabulous view of 1 World Trade Center and the Hudson River. Easy walking distance to many downtown locations and the subway. Be warned - driving down here is a real challenge.

title: Friendly Hotel
text: Hotel has offered excellent service, especially the people in the Front Desk and their Bell-Captains.  They all were very friendly.  View at the Battery Park which is within walking distance was breathtaking.  In room dining was great. Kids liked their menu.

title: Not as good as I expected, but good for one night stay.
text: I got a good price for this hotel, compared to New York standards. My family and I stayed for one night and the room was clean and nice but the bed wasn't comfortable enough. Maybe because I was tired and we reached the hotel after midnight and after several hours of travel. The location is very convenient to visit the brand new ONE Tower, the 9/11 Memorial and everything around Battery Park and Financial District. The overall experience was good.

title: Totally satisfying one night stay
text:
There are so many good things to say about this Marriot hotel.  It came with everything that I would expect at a Marriot, such as clean and spacious rooms with comfortable beds, a mini fridge, a fitness center, free WiFi, superb amenities and first class staff.  Our room on the 24th floor had a "river view" from which we could see the Statue of Liberty.  As for the price, it is less than what you would find at the mid town Marriot.  It is also close to the 9/11 Memorial and the Financial District, but not much else that I wanted to see.

As for the not so good things, the location isn't my first choice of where to stay in Manhattan.  It is quiet in the area during the evenings, but that might be something others would prefer.  Also parking (concierge) is $55, but I figure that is on par for the area.

title: Great Place To Sleep
text: This  hotel was extremely clean and nice.  Very safe..The staff was very helpful ..close to 9/11. the subway, statue of liberty as well as taxi stands. Very quiet. Their restaurant was close and the food was good.

title: Wonderful Weekend Visit
text: Great location, we were visiting the New World Trade Center, and we were within walking distance to that send the 9/11 museum. We asked the concierge where we could get something to eat. She suggested Hudson Eats. Wonderful place to grabs bite to eat. Also, the burgers at the restaurant are wonderful. If you are going to visit the Statue of Liberty, this is the place to stay. We walked to the ferry.

title: Fabulous view
text:
We were fortunate enough to stay in a junior suite on a higher floor and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. My daughter and I were only in town for 24 hours so we only were here for a night. What a night. The view was incredible. I feel as though pictures do not do it justice. 

The bed was quite comfortable, the front desk staff were very helpful and polite, and the bell services held our bags while we walked around part of the city before our room was ready. 

Would love to stay here again.

title: Personal
text: Friendly staffers, clean. Close to 911, Century21, subway, taxi stand.    Quiet rooms in urban local. Some 24 hour venues but generally business area with quiet weekends. Safe location adequate police presence and hotel security.  Bills restaurant is tasty and energetic staff.

title: great experience
text: The staff at the hotel were very helpful. The rooms were clean and well decorated. Tge restaurant wasalso conveniently located and good food. We had a great view. The beds were comfortable. We would definitely stay there again!

title: Great Stay!
text: We had a great stay at Downtown Marriott. We wanted to be close to 9/11 museum, Century 21 shopping, and cruise ship terminal. This was perfect for all three! I have always stayed either close to Central Park or right in Times Sq. But, since we were only there for one night to catch a cruise, this was perfect for what we were looking for.

title: Great trip!
text: We had the unexpectedly great experience of having a spacious corner room that had a view of One World Trade from one side and the Hudson River from the other side. For NYC, the room was massive. At check-in they had giant chocolate chip cookies to welcome the guests. The room was clean, the staff is friendly and we will be back again. The TV situation could stand an upgrade but we weren't there to watch TV.  In fact, I am actually hesitant to share the positive review because we don't want to have to compete for a room in the future. The area is away from the chaos of Midtown and Times Square but it's easy enough to get up there when you want.

title: Let's face it there the best
text: I've been staying there for years from the check in to all the staff your right at the top here,fun close to the water and great restaurants and of course battery park.the hotel is over looking the Hudson River and you can stroll along looking at the city skyline and statue of liberty and Ellis Island ,And don't worrying if you need to ask any marriott doorman or front desk person or bell hop a question there are there for you,and will make you feel like family.From egress at the front door to luis laboy in purchasing for any special occasion they are a great team each and everyone really cares about your stay great job MARRIOTT  DOWNTOWN  NYC THANKS AGIAN LOU AND FAMILY

title: Great location, great hotel
text: Loved our corner suite (although the water view is a little exaggerated). Perfect base for visiting all the sites we had planned for our trip. Easy walking distance to 9/11, one World Trade Center, Statue of Liberty, and a little further but doable walk to the Brooklyn Bridge. Easy access via subway to other parts of Manhattan, too. Great for families - they gave my boys teddy bears when we arrived, and there is a really cool public play area just across West St a couple of blocks south. I don't second the recommendation from some other posts for nearby George's for breakfast though. They were surly to us, and the food was mediocre. We did like the attached Bill's burgers for dinner and dessert. We walked a little further to a wonderful little deli (with seating upstairs) Cucina Liberta the next day for a much better breakfast.

title: Best in class
text: I spend 100 nights per year in Marriott properties and have found this hotel with it's location, new fitness facility, and above average concierge lounge to be one of the best I have stayed in. I was also pleasantly surprised when the executive chef prepared a feast for the guests in the lounge. Well worth the price for what you receive.

title: Great Location & Price
text:
Great hotel with a great location.  The prices is lower and the subway station is right around the corner.  Rooms nice but small.  Location is across from the waterfront and about 2 blocks from 911 museum.  

The rooms across the hall from us had very noisy people in them and they kept us up half the night.  I think they finally went to bed around 4 am.  Opening and closing the doors and running between the rooms.  So the hotel walls are definitely not sound proof and you can hear wall way noise.

title: Great downtown hotel!
text: If you choose to visit downtown Manhattan, this is a great base for your visit.  It is near the 9/11 Museum and Battery Park (where you can take a tour of the Statue of Liberty or Ellis Island).  The hotel staff was terrific, and our room was huge (particularly by NYC standards) and well-appointed.  A real find downtown!

title: Great Location for visiting lower Manhattan
text:
Stayed several times over the last couple years including May 2015. Good location for seeing 9/11 memorial, Battery Park, access to Ellis Island & Statue of Liberty as well as ferries. Be sure to ride the Staten Island ferry for free for the great views of NYC harbor.

Staff was very accommodating and helpfull and room was ready when we arrived allowing early check-in.  Bill's Bar & Burger in hotel is a good place for a drink and burger or salad. Decent access to Subway (don't be hesitant to ride it) with #1 train ~ 2 blocks away. Room rates were a little lower than comparable hotels in Times Square area,

title: Good location
text:
Good hotel 
However if check in say "we can check u in if u take the room by the elevator" DO NOT TAKE IT its literally on top of the elevator doors and tiny 
Luckily we swapped rooms as there was space to our original room which was twice the size and much better yea the view wasn't what we paid for but we didn't care too much about that 
Location wise it is great walking distance to most tourist attractions and great diners all around it staff are welcoming and friendly which is a rare thing in such a busy city 
All in all a good stay

title: New York Marriott Downtown - Great Concierge Lounge
text: Stayed several times March - May 2015 on business.  Great selection for breakfast and snacks Mon - Fri.  Hotel rooms were spacious compared to some other business hotels in the Financial district.  Bill's Burgers were was also very good for a sandwich at lunchtime.  My only complaint was that when I wanted to print tickets on a Friday night, the only place I could do so was the Fed Ex store (on site) for a charge of a couple of dollars.  I could have printed the tickets in the Concierge Lounge, BUT it was closed on a Friday night.  A minor inconvenience, I admit, but it did irritate me.

title: Location, Location
text: Family and I stayed here for hubbies Birthday weekend, great location, friendly staff, very nice rooms and decor. Very convenient to 9-11 memorial, battery park, and statue of liberty ferry.  $12 cab ride to Times Square for 4 people, can't beat that! Subway system was too confusing for me :) overall great experience in NYC

title: Handy for Jersey and mid town
text:
When I visit New York, I'm often spending half my time in Newport and the rest of the time in mid town. This Marriott is close to wall st the path, it's present and clean, food is ok and a nice bar downstairs, 

The gym is ok a bit small,if you want a swimming pool and a better view then I would stay at the millennium Hilton which is just round the corner.

title: Gutes Cityhotel
text:
Im Rahmen einer Busrundreise des Eastern Triangles staretete die Reise im Marriott Downtown. 
Das Hotel an sich ist sehr gut. Zimmer sind groß und sauber. Das Badezimmer ebenfalls gut. Gute Lage um Downtown zu erkunden wobei auch alles fußläufig erreichbar ist. Groudn Zero ist direkt um's Eck.
Personal ist nett und hilfsbereit.

Unten in der Lobby gibt es freies Wifi (was für mich ausreichte, da ich überwiegend draußen unterwegs war), einen ATM, Starbucks und Bill's Bar & Burger.

Das einzig negative ist, dass die Eismaschinen auf den Fluren einen unheimlichen Krach machen, welcher mich auch 1-2 in der Nacht haben wach werden lassen. Mein Zimmer hatte direkt einen vor der Tür.
Für jemanden der sehr geräuschempflndlich ist, sollte darauf auf jeden Fall achten.

Alles weitere war super und ist empehlenswert.

title: NYC half Marathon
text: Perfektes Hotel für diese Veranstaltung weil in unmittelbarer Nähe zum Zieleinlauf an der Wall Street. WLAN leider nur in Lobby free of Charge. Hotel top sauber , gute Ausstattung.  Restaurants im Hotel: Burger und co. und Starbucks im Hause.Fazit: Das war eine gute Wahl

title: Typical Marriott
text: Nothing stellar about this hotel...typical businessman Marriott. Conveniently located near the World Trade Center memorial but not near any of NYC's main attractions if you are there for leisure. Short walk to the Battery Park and the Hudson. Does not have its own restaurant but does have one you can access thru the lobby. Food so-so.

title: Great location with a fab view!
text: We have just returned from a trip to the USA which involved two nights at this hotel. This was a great choice for us. The location is superb, right next to the 9/11 memorial. Great burger restaurant in the hotel which was not overpriced. Walked in the mornings to Georges restaurant which is two blocks away for a great breakfast. Easy walk to City Hall and to Century 21 for shopping. The rooms are very nice and clean with everything you need.  We had a super view of the Statue of Liberty. The other plus is that this hotel is much cheaper than anything uptown so you get the Marriott quality and brand for less money. Would definitely recommend to anyone whodoes not want to be in the busy tourist areas!

title: Spitzenlage
text:
Die Lage des Hotels ist super, wenn man beabsichtigt, fussläufig die Topattraktionen zu besichtigen. Battery Park, Liberty Island, Wallstreet und sogar noch die Brooklyn Bridge sind mit kruzen Spaziergängen zu erreichen.
Das muss jedoch auch bezahlt werden. 
In Finance District gelegen sind Frühstücksmöglichkeiten noch seltener als sonst.
Wir haben das George`s gewählt und waren zurfrieden. Das Restaurant am/im Hotel nutzten wir wegen des Preisniveaus nicht.
Wir hatten ein Zimmer mit zwei Queenbetten. Für zwei Erwachsene und zwei Kinder war es gut. Das Zimmer war recht geräumig. Das Bad war so gross, dass zwei Personen durchaus gleichzeitig sich darin aufhalten konnten.
Im 21. Stock war der Ausblick nicht ganz so doll, aber wir waren auch tagsüber nicht im Zimmer.
Das Zimmer war sauber, gepflegt und sinnvoll ausgestattet.
Was eindeutig fehlt ist ein freeWiFi. In der Kostenkategorie eigentlich eine Selbstverständlichkeit.

title: Wonderful location!
text: I grew up outside NYC in the suburbs and have visited many spots in the city but I have to say this is my favorite location! It's in Battery Park near mainly residential buildings and a great walkway to tour the really clean neighborhood. It's about 2 blocks or less to the 9/11 memorial, esplanade on the river, and the ferry to Statue of Liberty/Ellis Island. The hotel was updated throughout, very clean, very friendly staff, and helpful bellman that flagged a taxi and stored our bags. If you want to experience a little bit of the residential feel/less touristy side of NYC totally check out this hotel! There's a small Italian restaurant south of the hotel that was very good but overall not tons of restaurants to choose from here. We didn't have a good experience with Bills Burgers restaurant in the hotel.  But overall, I would stay here again and recommend it!

title: Impressed!
text: Nice-sized rooms for NYC. Clean and comfortable. Excellent location. Starbucks and FedEx in the building, ideal for business travel.  Close to the beautiful Brookfield Place and Hudson Eats.  I'd highly recommend this hotel.

title: great location near Battery Park and the Freedom Center
text: Great place to stay if you're visiting the Financial District, want to see or visit the area around the World Trade Center, Battery Park, Brooklyn Bridge or the South Street Seaport area. Lots of restaurants, close to Chinatown and Little Italy, too.

title: Great place very comfortable beds
text: This hotel was great.  Some friends and were on a bus trip and stayed memorial day weekend.  The staff was very nice and helpful.  The beds are comfortable.  You have great views of the 9/11 memorial and close to battery park.

title: Convenient for both tourists and business people
text: Located at the foot of the 9/11 Memorial, close to Wall Street, the hotel is conveniently placed. There is a Starbucks in the building (but lines are long in the morning), and an excellent burger pub for relaxed dinner and drinks. There is also an affordable department store (Century 21) a few blocks away. The neighborhood is financial center, so it is not the most scenic, funky place to be. If you want a taste of trendy, residential Manhattan, you must go north, and do it by subway if you don't want to spend the day in a cab. Staff were efficient if not particularly warm. If I need a go-to downtown location, I might well stay here again.

title: Comfortable Hotel for a Conference
text:
I spent 4 nights at this hotel for the purpose of attending a conference there.  My stay was enjoyable, and the service met my expectations.  While the rooms (guest rooms and ballrooms) were pretty standard for a Marriott, the hotel's catering department is what pushed the rating from average to very good.  They were in charge of breakfast, lunch, and a cocktail reception for our group for 3 of the 4 nights.  The pasta penne served one afternoon for lunch was one of the highlights of the trip.  It also didn't hurt that there is a Starbucks and FedEx Kinkos onsite.

On the whole, I would be more than happy to stay at that hotel again should my travels take me back to that part of Manhattan.

title: war ok, aber hätte ich es aussuchen können, besser ein anderes
text:
- WLAN nur in der Lobby kostenlos
- kein Internetkiosk
- TV-Sender unterbrechen ständig (NO SIGNAL?!)
- sehr schmutzige Fenster
- Duschkopf lässt sich nur eingeschränkt bewegen (li./re.)
- Duschvorhang: ich hasse Duschvorhänge einfach, ich finde es eklig, wenn sie meine Haut berühren, auch wenn sie wie dieser hier wohl neu oder zumindest sehr sauber sind
- keine (leere) Minibar
+ Armaturen (Wasserhähne, Duschkopf, Abstellkorb) sehr sauber
+ Zimmer ansonsten auch sauber
+ kostenlose Cookies zur Begrüßung beim Checkin
+ kostenloser Zimmersafe

title: Best Marriott property in downtown Manhattan
text:
Just spent two consecutive work weeks at this hotel (went home in the middle).  The rooms are a little bigger than those at other NYC Marriott's and both of my rooms had great views (one south, one north).  The location is really great - right on the west side of lower Manhattan, near the WTC site and Battery Park.  Everything in downtown Manhattan is walkable from this location.  

The concierge lounge was small, but high quality.  For some reason there were very few guests using it each morning.  The Statue of Liberty is visible from the lounge as well - alone is worth checking out.  I did not have the evening appetizers, but ate breakfast each morning.  The lounge is well stocked with eggs, sausage, bacon, pastries, and cereals.  

The hotel has a restaurant on-site and a Starbucks.  Restaurant has $3 beers from 5-7, but avoid the food...I tried 3 items and they were all poor.  I did not get the sense that the restaurant is affiliated with the hotel though. 

Hotel service was friendly and helpful.  The hotel appeared to be very clean.

title: lo mejor de lo mejor :))
text: Fui hace dos años, el mejor hotel al que e ido en toda mi vida; aparte de tener un reproductor de musica que puede hacer que te duermas el ambiente esta genial; puedes salir por la noche y darte una vuelta por el centro de nueva york y las habitaciones son super grandes se lo recomiendo a todos.

title: Location is good depending on where in NYC you want to be
text: Stayed for just one day , the room was comfortable and the room service was pretty quick and  good. There is no restaurant in the hotel directly but a bar/restaurant that supplies the food. Breakfast was decent but ran over $25-30 for one person. I was able to do a pretty late check out at about half the cost which was very convenient for me. You can walk to wall street etc. The staff was friendly and helpful. It is pretty basic hotel but meets your business needs.

title: Très clairement en-dessous du standard "Marriott"
text:
J'ai passé 2 nuits dans cet hôtel, dont le standard laisse clairement à désirer.
Alors que l'endroit est idéalement situé, et les prix ceux correspondant à la "location", l'offre de restauration de l'hôtel est vraiment en-dessous de tout, et les chambres ont un aspect négligé - les draps à peine repassés, sdb équipée avec le strict minimum (pas de bonnet de bain, p.ex.)

Point positif : extrême gentillesse du personnel du room service

title: Good location but kind of basic….
text: The hotel is very well located, close from 9/11 memorial and Wall Street. staff is friendly and helpful. Rooms are kind of small, but understandable for NYC. Friendly staff. Good value for money. But again I still cant understand a 14 USD wifi charge for that kind of hotel with this level of price.

title: Not quite excellent
text: We stayed there for the convenience to the 5 Borough Bike Tour.  While they did arrange for bike storage, it was at a local parking garage for $ 20 per night per bike.  And for $ 60 you could have a late checkout until 6:00 (which was barely enough as we waited over 2 hours to get onboard the Staten Island Ferry at the end of the ride).  The staff was uniformly friendly and helpful, even suggesting out-of-property locations for breakfast.  The views of the Hudson River were nice, though the windows were dirty (there was a lot of construction in the lower West Side, including the 9/11 memorial, etc.)  The rooms were large, especially for New York.  They supposedly had a newly renovated fitness room, but we were there to ride outdoors, and the weather was great, so we never saw it.  The elevators were very efficient.  I'd say more, but we didn't spend much time indoors.  We did sleep really well; the bed was comfortable, the bathroom clean and well-light.  Nice showerhead.

title: Very very nice hotel
text: Was a lovely place to stay for the weekend. Very clean, nice view and staff were lovely. Definitely going to go back. Very good price also. Location is not too bad either. Very close to 9/11 memorial and Wall Street. Would strongly recommend this hotel.

title: fraude criminals
text: Stay away, they charge your credit card with amounts you have never seen on your final bill, if booking.com cannot settle this, I am going to report this criminal practices to the District Attorney's Office.
