title: Absolutely Worth It
text:
In New York, it's hard to find a hotel that's not overcrowded, cramped, and loud. Though the NY Marriott Downtown is somtimes a little pricier than the competition, it's in a great location with wonderful rooms and better service. 

I stayed here over an early April weekend,travelling primarily on business but with two friends for the weekend--one that had never been to the Big Apple, in fact. After relating this to hotel staff, they were fantastic enough to upgrade us to a larger room with ample room for everyone. Though I had to settle for a lower floor (really, a mid floor), I had no problem with noise and a good view of the Hudson. The staff at check-in were the epitome of great service, and many hotels could do well to learn from this one. Linens for the sofabed were brought up within minutes, and room service even offered to make the sofabed (though we turned down since wanted to use the sofa during the day). Housekeeping was also fantastic.

The room itself was a corner room, with two great views (great for NY, anyway). The King bed was excellent, and the sofa bed was surprisingly comfortable as well. My only concern with the hotel was that the thermostat was located between windows; this caused the room to get very hot as the heater overcompensated. Fortunately, I was able to move the wireless thermostat to a nightstand and had no further issues.

The hotel is seconds from the world trade center, but is a moderate walk from any subway station if you're relying on public transportation. I will probably stay here again on business travel, and though it's further out from some of the tourism scene, it's  near the statue of liberty and wouldn't be a bad choice for leisure trips.

title: Decent downtown hotel
text:
We spent a couple of nights in the hotel earlier this year. The room was modern, clean and nicely designed. By New York standards it was a decent size but bear in mind that's still small compared to everywhere else. The lack of free wifi (~$10 per person per day) is a little frustrating in a hotel that is already quite expensive. We enquired about the possibility of getting an extra roll-away bed in the room but were told this was $30 a night and I'm not sure how it would have fitted in the room. The staff were friendly and accommodating when we had different bookings for each night we were here and wanted to stay in the same room for both.

Location wise the hotel is good for the Statue of Liberty and 9/11 Memorial. You're close to the subway but bear in mind getting to mid-town will take you 25-30mins. If you do stay here I recommend George's diner round the corner, the breakfast is great.

title: Great Hotel in Great Location
text:
My wife and I stayed here last week when we were in the city on business. It is a beautiful very well kept hotel in a great location. Very friendly staff in both the hotel and restaurant. We ate several times there and went for happy hour which is great from 4pm - 7pm. 

Hotel is within walking distance of many places including Battery Park, Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island, and the new World Trade Center and the 911 memorial.

I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay here again in the future.

title: A hotel with all the comforts of home
text: Just spent a weekend at the New York Marriott Downtown and loved every moment of it. The room had everything we needed and the location was great. As someone looking to get some relaxation while in New York for the weekend the location was great. It was close to multiple tourist locations, however was extremely quiet in the mornings allowing us to sleep in. The beds were very comfortable and we found ourselves staying in bed later than usual on vacation and foregoing sightseeing to enjoy the comforts of the room. The restaurant in the hotel (Bill's Bar & Burger) has good food and the prices are reasonable. There is also a Starbucks whose lines aren't too long in the morning. It's within walking distance to the 9-11 memorial and the Statue of Liberty as well as one of the larger Century 21 department stores. Also close to the Rector subway station and only a 20 minute ride to midtown. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in New York for business or pleasure.

title: Nice hotel in lower Manhattan -- near Statue of Liberty and 9/11 museum
text:
We usually stay uptown when we have a weekend visit. There is a lot more going on with better eateries and shopping. However, we got a good deal on this hotel (their prices are reasonable, especially for NYC) and I am glad we stayed here because it fit our To-Do List: Battery Park, Statue of Liberty and the Brooklyn Bridge. It is also near the 9/11 museum. If we were planning to do a lot in uptown, I would have been disappointed because it is about a >30 minute subway ride to midtown and points north. But, if you are seeing the sites in lower Manhattan, this is your place! 

It is nice and quiet which creates a good sleeping environment. The rooms are spacious and clean. Plus, the hotel staff is incredibly kind and helpful. They let us into our rooms early and went the extra mile to help us when we left two jackets in the hotel closet! 

One more thing: beware their room service fees. They automatically add gratuity and a $6 service fee. This on top of already steep food prices. The food is good but you have been warned! 

We would stay here again if we are visiting more lower Manhattan sites!
